Title: One of the highlights of our holiday
Review: Being discouraged by many reviews of several Mekong Delta tours we decided to organize our own tour. We contacted Vinh who offered us a nice deal including one night, dinner, breakfast, and also a visit to the Cai Be floating market. Getting there wasn't hard but understanding how to do it was tricky, so I was glad a previous reviewer on TA had explained it. You need to go to 826 võ văn kiệt in HCMC, where you'll find a tiny local bus station. Vinh went out of his way to call the bus station to be sure we made it to the bus and then picked us up at the final stop. The bungalows were lovely, everything is really new but also very charming. All around it's houses and gardens and fruit trees everywhere. Vinh took us for a bike ride and then in the evening we had a cooking demo / class with his family, and then we were served dinner outside. Dinner was truly delicious. My husband doesn't usually like fish but he loved the fish they served to us there. The day after we had a private boat trip, with the usual visits to a candy factory (yes, a bit touristy). When we got to the floating market it was pretty late, so maybe you want to arrange to go there first thing on the tour. After the tour two motor taxis (also arranged by Vinh) drove us to the bus station to go back to HCMC. This was probably the only negative part, the motorbike ride on the highway was pretty scary. Vinh can be a bit shy with his English but he made sure we were comfortable and that the whole experience was unforgettable. His place is a true garden, and a night (or more) there is a great way to experience life on the Mekong delta.

Title: Fantastic find off the beaten track!
Review: We stayed 4 days and 3 nights in this beautiful remote setting. Vinh took excellent care of us. The cottage was very comfortable. The gardens were lovely. The food was gourmet quality. Even in this location though, there is good internet access. Vinh will arrange motorbike or boat tours, if you are interested. But we enjoyed our walks just around the neighborhood. About a 30-40 minute walk away is a market town which we found to be a very pleasant change from the tourist markets of Ho Chi Minh City. All in all, our time here was one of the best experiences in our 7 weeks in Vietnam. There is no nightlife, no "entertainment", but if you are looking for something away far from the standard tourist experience, this will find this your perfect hideaway. Highly recommended.

Title: Lovely bungalows in a real rural setting
Review: We stayed 2 nights in a double bungalow in the lovely garden setting where bananas, pineapples and chillies were all growing and animals roaming around which was nice to see. We arrived by local bus from Saigon and were met by Vinh who had someone take our bags on for us. Vinh's family were lovely and the cooking lesson on the first night was a really good, making pork and shrimp rice pancakes from scratch - so much better than the generic spring roll lesson you usually get! Breakfast and dinner included and there were a lot of courses at dinner! We were only supplied with two small bottles of water in the room on arrival, but there was no fridge and we were not given any on the second day, so make sure you buy lots from the market or bring some with you. We asked Vinh if we could put them in his fridge. On the second day we cycled with Vinh to the local market and he then took us, unexpectedly, to a family party! We turned up to a house in the middle of nowhere, where a group of around 30 men were sat outside eating and drinking. Being the only female I thought it might be a bit awkward but they invited us in with open arms and we continued to eat and drink with them for the morning (this was 10am!). A fantastic way to meet real people and a unique experience we won't forget! All in all we enjoyed our stay but we were there in hot season which made sleeping in the bungalow almost impossible as the heat was unbearable. Perhaps some more strategically placed fans would help and definitely a fridge in the rooms, as the lack of cold water provided turned out to be our main issue.

Title: This is the way to experience the Mekong
Review: I stayed for 2 nights with a group of friends over a Vietnamese holiday. We couldn't have been happier with our experience at Jardin du Mekong. We arrived by local bus, via the guesthouse's main man Vinh's instructions. It wasn't the most luxurious ride, but it was a unique experience nonetheless, and totally bearable (bring headphones and pack light). Talk with Vinh, he may be able to suggest other transport methods. The vast majority of foreign visitors to the Mekong come with a 1-2 day tour from Saigon. They are carted around like cattle, stopping at all the same tourist traps along with all the other suckers from other tour agencies. I could be wrong, but with this route you're sure to miss Delta's most charming parts. The Best Parts: -THE FOOD!! Holy moly. Vinh's mom is the cook, and wow is she a good one. The multi-course meals will not leave you hungry or unsatisfied. The cooking demonstration on our first night was a lovely touch too. -The lush garden landscape and quiet setting -The adorable and comfortable bungalows -The free bicycles -The absolutely magical setting; beautifully quant rural neighborhoods with stunning flowers and fruit trees. The roads around the guesthouse are a bit bigger than a footpath (motobike road), totally flat, and ideal for the most enjoyable early morning or pre-sunset walks and explorative bike rides. -Service. Vinh is great. Friendly people all over. Everything ran smoothly. Can't complain. -The puppies! Advice: -Insects can get nasty. Bring repellent! -Rain...bring a poncho if you're visiting during rainy season -We booked a tour to the floating market..this was pleasant and enjoyable but would fit into the "cattle herding" style as explained above. The best part about it was the long, scenic boat ride to and from the town.

Title: Great place to relax and get away from the tourist trail.
Review: This is a lovely place and Vinh (the man of the house) is a really nice guy who goes out of his way to help you in any way he can. Shortly after our arrival, he took us on a bicycle tour of the area, and the next day we took another bicycle tour to visit the local market. The food is fantastic - breakfast and dinner included! If you want to buy something for lunch while you're at the market, they are happy to cook it for you back at the homestay. The rooms are nice and the overall ambiance of the place is one of peace and relaxation. Getting there from Ho Chi Minh CIty is actually very easy but was a little confusing at first. Vinh sent us the address of the bus station which we couldn't find on google and - being western travelers - instantly panicked. The hotel in HCMC also couldn't help us. The reality is, it's a tiny private bus station with regular minibuses heading into the Mekong. The people are friendly and they charge you the same prices as the locals (about 90,000VND for a 3 hour trip). The address of the bus station is 826 võ văn kiệt, and any taxi driver will find it easily enough. Just expect to share the bus with plenty of chickens in bags.

Title: Experience the real Mekong Delta
Review: This charming homestay is close to Saigon (3 hours by local bus), but a world away, located in a rural area hardly visited by tourists. It’s a fantastic place to get a sense of the real Mekong Delta. We stayed here for three nights with our two small children and thoroughly enjoyed cycling around the local villages together with our host Vinh, who took us along on his daily shopping round to the local market and gave us a local boat tour (our blond 2 and 5 year olds were quite the attraction). He also organized a great tour to the Cai Be floating market two hours away (leave as early as possible!). The rooms are spacious, clean and tastefully decorated, and are situated in the middle of a lush garden behind the family’s house. Vinh’s mother does the cooking (wonderful and fun to watch) and breakfast and dinner are served in the garden. The biggest challenge is finding the place as most houses in this area are located along the dykes and are only reachable by scooter. The best way to get to the homestay is to take a bus to Ben Tre and then to Cho Lach, and then to call Vinh and have him pick you up by scooter (yes, our 2 year old even enjoyed that experience).

Title: Un havre de paix dans le tourbillon des villes vietnamiennes
Review: Le jardin du Mekong, ouvert il y a 1 an par un jeune vietnamien dynamique de 35 ans est un petit havre de paix en pleine campagne vietnamienne sur les abords du Mékong, sans autre bruit que celui des coqs, des crapeaux et des gekos. Kanh a fait des etudes de langues a Saigon pour devenir guide touristique francophone et anglophone. Il manie tres bien les deux langues. Il a fait construire ses petits bungalows (sur le terrain de sa grand mère) tres bien aménagés, avec petite terrasse balcon doté d'un hamac et d'un petit banc. Toute la famille travaille pour sa petite entreprise. Son accueil est hyper chaleureux, il est parfaitement disponible pendant tout le séjour pour ses hôtes. Le prix peut sembler elevé de prime abord mais il inclut la chambre, petit déjeuner + dîner (hors boissons), les deux etant de vrais festins et qui, pour le coup, sort un peu de ce qui est servi dans les restaurants que nous avons pu essayer pendant notre voyage. Nous avons même eu droit pour le même prix a un encas de nouilles sautées le midi! On participe a la confection du repas avec la famille de Kanh. Il met a disposition gracieusement des vélos en libre service, voire même son scooter! il peut aussi organiser pour un prix tres raisonnable, une sortie en bateau sur le Mekong et totalement hors des circuits touristiques, ce qui est fort appréciable (surtout pour avoir fait une autre sortie ailleurs dans la région le lendemain, beaucoup plus "tourisme de masse"). Il propose aussi une balade a vélo avec son cousin qui vaut vraiment le coup! On a regretté que ce ne soit pas un plus long! Pour arriver chez lui, il se charge de tout organiser depuis HCMV si vous l'appelez avant (réservation du bus, adresse ou le prendre, appel au chauffeur pour une dépose juste a cote de chez lui) a noter : c'est a 3 heures de bus de HCMV, par le bus local (90 000 VND) et surement moins en taxi mais dans les 90 US dollars. C'est aussi a 1 heure de Ben Tre en bus local. Bref, si vous voulez fuir la ville, le bruit, la pollution : c'est LE lieu sur les bords du Mékong.

Title: Dit is absoluut geen 4-sterren hotel - eerder 2 sterren, misschien 3
Review: Dit hotel is niet covid safe - nergens was handgel te zien. Niet op de kamer en nergens in de openbare ruimtes; Wij kozen voor de ‘non smoking’ room, maar dat klopt niet; er hing immers nog een pertinente rooklucht afkomstig van de vorige klanten (zie foto asbak - waarom zou deze anders aanwezig zijn?); wanneer wij om een andere kamer vroegen werd ons eerst medegedeeld dat er geen andere kamer was, na enig aandringen werd ons een kamer aangeboden zonder zicht op de rivier (wij hadden daar wel voor betaald); Uiteindelijk beslisten we dan maar om te blijven; Om 23u30 bonkte er iemand op ons deur met de mededeling dat onze nieuwe kamer klaar was - kennelijk was onze keuze niet goed doorgegeven; De service in dit hotel vonden wij in het algemeen onvoldoende; Aan het onthaal spreekt men onvoldoende tot geen Engels; Slechte communicatie; wanneer je iets vraagt dan vlucht men als het ware weg op zoek naar iemand die Engels spreekt; Vanaf 7 AM is het lawaaierig aan het zwembad + luide muziek; Tot laat in de avond geluid van de karaokebar (verbonden aan het hotel); De gym is werkelijk goor: de handvaten van de fiets zijn vuil, er is geen airco, noch handdoeken of extra water; de toestellen zijn bovendien stokoud. In principe is het niet toegelaten om eigen eten in de kamer te brengen, bij straffe van een boete (zijn wij kleine kinderen misschien?!), maar bij het alternatief (roomservice) begrijpt men zoals eerder aangegeven toch niets van wat je probeert te bestellen… óf het is eenvoudigweg niet beschikbaar; Restaurant: eerder trage bediening; we moesten tot drie keer naar rijst vragen; Wel een ruime kaart met diverse soorten vis (positief); de vegetariër kan echter wel op z'n kin kloppen; Ontbijt: alleen hartig ontbijt, doch zonder kaas; geen granola of andere granen; Besluit: het positieve aan dit hotel is het magnifieke uitzicht op de rivier (als je een kamer met uitzicht hebt tenminste, de stank van de kamer niet na gelaten); Wanneer je als westerling iets zou tegenkomen -een ongeluk ofzo- dan ben je in dit hotel een vogel voor de kat, want men begrijpt niets van wat je dan tracht te zeggen; Er is heel veel lawaai, zowel ‘s morgens als ‘s avonds; Als je kinderen hebt, dan is dit hotel mogelijks ok, want alle accomodatie is voorhanden. Als je echter de rust opzoekt dan absoluut niet; Dit was vroeger misschien een 4-sterren hotel, maar momenteel op z’n best een magere 3; Annex: we betaalden 80 dollar extra voor een airport transfer naar Saigon Airport; op weg daar naartoe werden we tegen gehouden door de politie - de boorddocumenten bleken niet in orde- we verloren hierdoor 30min en misten onze (gelukkig binnenlandse) vlucht; Besluit 2: wanneer je als hotel 2 miljoen dong aanrekent voor een wagen met chauffeur, dan verwacht je dat alles in orde is. Dit vind ik niet zo professioneel. Ik verlaag hierdoor van 3 naar 2 sterren. Eigenlijk ben ik door het toekennen van 2 sterren nog pragmatisch vind ik - andere klanten zouden misschien 1 ster gegeven hebben; Misschien dat de service beter is in het hoogseizoen? Laat ons hopen :-)

Title: Paradise get-a-way from the pandemic
Review: Spent a few days and nights here over Christmas. Checked in the day before Christmas and headed straight to the cafe which is right on the river's edge. We booked in for the special Christmas meal which was only on Christmas Eve and also on Christmas Day night. While the food was good, I think the chef had quite a bit of sweet tooth. The staff were very polite and helpful. There weren't a lot of guests staying at the hotel, however the coffee shop was bustling on Saturday and Sunday. While this would have normally made me quite nervous, everyone appeared to be quite respectful of other tables/patrons and the atmosphere wasn't alarming in any way. The rooms were very large and well appointed, and while the balcony was small, there was enough room for a table and two chairs and of course an ashtray. The breakfast buffet wasn't huge, but certainly not lacking anything either. The egg station was of course the first thing I visited and the omelette with chilli and spring onions was cooked perfectly. I hadn't travelled since the pandemic started so wasn't sure what to expect. There were hand sanitising stations and QR check-in at Reception. There were minimal guests staying in the hotel and they were allocated at various places throughout the hotel. We never had to share the lift with other guests, and there were many reminders about keeping a safe distance and wearing masks and the 5K too. I had a thoroughly relaxing time. We were so happy staying within the confines of the resort that we didn't get a chance to even explore the river or the city. I'm definitely looking forward to my next visit! I'm definitely looking forward to my next visit!

Title: Slechte service
Review: Hotel ziet er over het algemeen prima uit. Nette kamer en badkamer. Door reisleider gezegd dat eten in het hotel mogelijk is vanwege weinig eetgelegenheden in de buurt. De bediening zijn jongens die van de straat zijn geplukt zonder ervaring. Nog erger is dat de manager ze niet stuurt. Ze ziet ze fouten maken en lacht er om en stuurt ze niet bij. De jongens weten niet bij wie ze welk gerecht moeten neer zetten. Ze halen de menu kaarten niet op, leggen niet bij iedereen bestek neer en nemen niet bij iedereen een gerecht op. Ze spreken geen woord Engels. Als eerste komen de hoofdgerechten, terwijl er ook soep is besteld. Dit wordt goed opgelost. Een soep is echter nooit gekomen, terwijl deze wel is opgeschreven. Manager beweerd dat we liegen en dat deze nooit besteld is. Dat in het midden gelaten. Het eten was koud en taai. Je betaald veel geld voor een klein, koud, taai stukje vlees en 10 frietjes. Wanneer je er iets van zegt tegen de manager lacht ze en zegt ze sorry, maar ze doet er niets mee. Wanneer eten terug gestuurd wordt omdat het koud is, lijkt het in de magnetron opgewarmd te zijn. Het vlees is hierna taai en de sla is lauw. Al met al is het hotel zelf prima, maar het restaurant en de service zijn waardeloos. Ze spreken weinig Engels en doen geen moeite voor de klant.

Review: Tôi đã ở lại đây nhiều lần và đó là khách sạn tốt nhất mà tôi đã tìm thấy trong số những người khác trong quá khứ. Dưới đây là những ưu điểm, đội ngũ nhân viên rất đặc biệt, các phòng và giường sạch sẽ và thoải mái, hồ bơi là nơi tuyệt vời của bungalow gia đình thật đẹp, vị trí yên tĩnh và dễ dàng đến gần nhưng cũng đủ gần với mọi hành động nếu đó là điều của bạn. Người quản lý rất dễ thương lượng để đảm bảo rằng kỳ nghỉ của bạn vui vẻ. Bây giờ các khuyết điểm, không quá nhiều khuyết điểm như nơi họ có thể cải thiện chỉ một chút, giờ ăn sáng tự chọn cần phải được mở rộng qua 9 giờ sáng cho những người muốn ngủ trong một ít 6-9 giờ là ngắn một cửa sổ một số ngày và chúng tôi cảm thấy vội vã. Việc lựa chọn thực phẩm có thể sử dụng một số cảm hứng và đa dạng hơn. Hồ bơi cần có vòi sen cửa và thay đổi quầy hàng cũng như nhà vệ sinh. Và cuối cùng họ cần phải ngừng phun những bông hoa và thực vật xinh đẹp với những gì tôi cho là một số loại hóa chất. Tôi yêu thích địa điểm và muốn họ thực hiện các bước bổ sung được đề cập, Cảm ơn Hank

Title: Good hotel in lovely lication
Review: We enjoyed our three night stay here. It is a charming hotel with some good features but room for improvement nonetheless. Our check in was quick and we were offered a choice of rooms which was appreciated. We chose one with a balcony with great views over the river. The bed was the largest we have ever seen and very comfortable but it did rather dominate the room leaving little space for anything else! The furniture was, overall, a little tired and the sofa was stained. The bathroom was adequate but slightly awkward as the door opened in front of the shower door. The pool was lovely but there were very few beds. Staff would get extra deck chairs when the beds were taken but they were a little uncomfortable. For two of the three days we were there it was quiet but a large group descended on the pool one day with lots of screaming children but overall it was a lovely place to while away the time. The breakfast was very poor we thought with watery juice, undrinkable coffee, sliced bread and a poorly run egg station. The hygiene standards did not look great either. However, we ate in the restaurant every night (eating outside). Staff members were very obliging, the Vietnamese food was great and the beer ridiculously cheap! There was a birthday party whilst we were there and we were concerned when the PA system was being tested the day before as it was deafening but the party itself started at 9am and seemed to be over by 10.30! Noisy whilst it lasted but then peace returned. There is a variety of handicrafts on sale at the hotel at very good prices. My husband took a bike into town, we also took a taxi in and walked back along the river. There isn’t much to see but we went to the temple and the eclectic museum and sampled a couple of bars including the floating ship which we enjoyed. We also took a Mekong trip with Dinh Ho Echo tours which was good. Overall, we enjoyed our trip. Everyone was helpful and obliging and the location is lovely. With a few improvements this could be a very fine hotel.

Title: Schizophrenic hotel
Review: There seem to be two separate parts to this hotel: the accommodation / pool and then the dining / bar area. The accommodation is four star. Comfortable room, good bathroom. Great riverside location and a nice pool. The internal communal areas are ok but a bit soulless as not much is going on. But it’s an ok place for international tourists. However the restaurant / bar area seems to be run by a different outfit and/or for a different clientele - perhaps because Ben Tre is a bit off the tourist trail. The restaurant was being cleaned up while we had our dinner and the staff seemed rather untrained by international standards. There was no chilled white wine. The breakfast has a mainly local focus (fair enough) although there was an egg station. The tablecloths were very stained and should have been thrown away years ago. Overall the dining area seemed under-invested in. The food was ok but is unlikely to be a highlight of your trip. So overall this was a strange experience - four star accommodation and pool but with a two star restaurant attached. We were part of a group so I don’t know if this is reflected in a good price. You may be able to eat elsewhere of course and still enjoy the room, pool and location. Perhaps this place is ‘work in progress’!

Title: Looks great from the outside
Review: Ben Tre as a city has little enough to recommend it, we found, though the views of the Mekong Delta are excellent. First impressions of the hotel are on the "wow!" side of things - it's big and imposing and quietly situated on the banks of the Mekong. On checking in we were told we'd been upgraded to a River View Room (thank you, Ben Tre) and sure enough the room was very nice, on the fourth floor. Huge bathroom, great covered balcony area for the view, good storage for clothing etc. The hotel was very quiet. There's a very large dining room / outside covered bar adjacent to the hotel and this, I think, demonstrates the hotel's main business. Ben Tre not being a tourist haven, we concluded the main business of the hotel was local weddings (an entire outdoor covered area set up for a wedding which had happened a few days prior) and business / conferences (which seemed to be borne out when a dozen or two Vietnamese salarymen appeared at mealtimes in suits and shirts, and later that evening started up on the most horrendous off-key karaoke. Fortunately, none of this is audible from the hotel proper :-) . By the way, while we're on the subject of the dining room, don't let your attention wander to the lightshades on the restaurant ceiling lights; they're filthy and worn out. Food is OK, breakfast could be lots better. Service in the bar in the evening is slow if there are more than half a dozen customers - there's a tendency for the staff to stand around watching one doing all the work. Some of their cocktail mixes are dubious, to say the least; I had a Long Island Tea one evening which arrived in a martini glass and I'm sure was a big shot of gin with some cold green tea in it. Very strange. On the plus side, most of the hotel staff try hard but simply don't have the English for the job. Helpful people on the desk, rooms good, hotel clean, pool good (but only 3 sunloungers??). I think their problem is that there aren't any competing hotels nearby. They trade on weddings and conferences and the tourist trade just isn't enough.

Title: Comfortable 3-night stay with river view
Review: We had a suite with river view, which was very nice. The room has a small balcony and a very big bathroom with both a bathtub and a rain shower. The hotel is modern and clean, staff is friendly. The only downside is that apparently the hotel is used for wedding parties frequently, and on Saturday evening from 18h till 22h there was extremely loud music and live singing (by the wedding guests), which you could here everywhere at the hotel premises, so you cannot enjoy a nice dinner on the terrace or even in your room, which was a bit unpleasant, but luckily it did not go on all night. Breakfast is ok, mainly catered to Vietnamese guests, so no western food options except for white bread and fruit, and ends quite early also at the weekend (09h). We booked a boat trip through the hotel with Nambo Tours, which was very nice and very great value for money.

Title: Not a resort! Sad pool and poorly managed
Review: When we arrived we were surprised at how small the hotel was. There were no other customers in the lobby, no greeting by the 2 staff members, they didn't even acknowledge me, except my daughter and I had to use the bathroom so bad after the 2 hour trip from Saigon that we stormed the reception to find out where the restroom was. The bellboy, dropped my suitcase down so hard that it broke the outer casing of both of my wheels. The beds are in this terrible box frame made of plastic Formica, that was peeling, both husband and daughter got cut on their legs by it, we had to keep a towel and blanket over it for protection. The grounds are terrible, the landscape not trimmed, weeds all over the pool area, there are only FIVE lounging chairs at this so called "resort". The wooden deck that they are on is rotting and ready to collapse. You can get slivers on your feet from it, God forbid you walk from your chair to the pool. When I asked for more lounge chairs, because the 5 were taken and there was a huge bus load of tourists coming in, they brought me a metal folding chair to sit, not lounge, totally laughable. The pool was dirty, full of debris. By the way the pool is small, think small condo complex pool, not resort size. There were like 30 people in it from the tour group, it was full. The ladder climbing out of the pool, was slippery, no traction on the metal rungs. Tile around the hotel was coming out and the huge 5 feet wide pothole in the main entrance of hotel has been there for months according to an employee. The safe in the room, is not bolted down, you can pick up the light metal box safe and walk out of the room with it!!! So we chose not to use it, and carried all devices, cameras and cash on us every where we went. Elevator smelled like a mechanic shop with the grease. It was very noisy in the hallway, you can hear everything going on, especially when the tour group comes back, very unruly. The breakfast buffet, not great but will give you some sustenance. Don't look up at the IKEA lamp shades right above your table, they are full of dead bugs and black dust ready to add some seasoning to your plate! Also the buffet, has 7 or 8 employees just standing around at the front reception socializing, not attending to our dishes or restocking the buffet. This "resort" is a joke, more like a Best Western or Motel 6. It looks like the management does not care about this property.

Title: Does any one else stay here?
Review: We stayed here as part of our scooter tour. Upon first impressions it's very nice. We pulled into the drive way on our scooters and there is a couple of nice Lexus four wheel drives parked out the front and a myriad of bus boys and parking attendants. We walked in and there were 4 people standing behind the front desk. As we looked around it seemed bare, were there no other hotel guests ? None in the pool, none in the restaurant or garden area? Where is everyone? We check in and hand over our passports? Wait what? Why do they keep our passports? Why do they need them? My off sider likened it to a hotel in North Korea. It is very sterile. We were escorted to our double room with what I would call 2 king single beds - apparently this was the king room that had been requested. By this time it was 5pm and we were looking for somewhere to eat so, with the assistance from a bus boy we ordered a taxi to the night markets a mere kilometer away but we were tired and sore. After not having any success at the night market, we return a short time later. We ordered a ice coffee from the coffee shop at the resort and sat under the leafy pergola things on the side of the river. This part was nice but that's about all there is to do here - drink coffee, smoke cigarettes and watch the endless stream of boats chug past. By this time other guests started arriving, must be a tour group because you wouldn't stay here on your own accord. I'd say about 30-40 German tourists at this point. After some time we decided to order dinner. The waitress who speaks two words of English takes our order. The sign at the hotel says European food. Well... by that they mean French fries, after 5 minutes and 3 staff we still couldn't tell what was in the spring rolls so we ordered them any way. Very disappointing menu selection. We then had another ice coffee and watched more boats. After a while we retired to bed. Morning comes and it's breakfast time. This is yet, another, disappointing dining experience for this "resort". No thank you miss, I don't want steamed veggies and corn on the cob for brekky. As I walked through the buffet line becoming more and more disappointed, I ended up at the toaster. Where I put in two pieces of toast and ordered fried eggs. This is not what I expect from a 4 star resort. I've stayed in $20aud motels in Bue Vien street with a better selection for breakfast. All in all I would not return here. It's empty with minimal guests. Sterile and there's nothing to do. The staff seem happy enough to help you, well as much as their limited English allows them to.

Only complaint- this resort is also called 'the Coconut Hotel' and they didn't sell Piña Coladas in a coconut!! There were actually only 2 cocktails on their menu 😉 Would return to this place.

Title: lovely hotel overlooking the Mekong delta
Review: This was probably the best place that the two of us stayed in based on comfort and value for money. The one negative that I must mention is that they hold weddings here and although the one that was below our window was low-key and finished at 10pm, it was annoying as I wanted to sit in peace and not listen to music below our window even though we were on the third floor.This was the main drawback of this hotel. It would be wise to check that there are no weddings taking place before you book. The staff do not speak much English (except one lady at reception). The breakfast was very good but the coffee cold. There is nowhere to eat nearby so you must depend on the restaurant which was soulless and they do not even have a wine menu. The bar downstairs is not really stocked and lies redundant. It should really have a bar person there with a large stock of alcohol as you are in the middle of the sticks, really. We cycled to town for a carry out pizza to the new shopping mall which is great.Altogether, if they sort out the little problems like sun beds and a bar it could be even better.

Title: An Oasis: Amazing for the price

Title: Satisfied overall
Review: Ben Tre city is one place where you have to go past to get to Mekong Delta so great future potential. It is a good getaway from Ho Chi Minh City for a few days but no beach here only Mekong River. It is only 1.5hr-2hr drive dependent on travel. Cost about 50USD on Taxi from Ho Chi Minh City. There are only a couple of reason to come here from my perspective as it is not really a tourist draw. The city is quiet and out of the way, not much to offer to tourist wise so everything had to be with the resort. Riverside resort is proud to label itself 4 stars so I judge it against what I experience and expect from a typical 4* property. Service - 4* This was very surprising and I know from other experiences in Vietnam that 4* service is hard to find. To found it in this resort in a remote and non touristy city it was a pleasant surprise. Staff from Front office to house keeping and maintenance were all friendly and happy to serve. They were keen to recommend genuine places to go without trying to promote you expensive places that were mediocre. (This was very common in Danang for example).The English level from some staff could improve but I suspect that they are alreay some of the best there is to offer in Ben Tre City so I feel I cannot be critical on that front. In general the service rival most 4* places in Vietnam and almost match the best beachside resorts in Danang area. Room -3* The room was very good. Everything was what you would expect from a good 3* property to 4*. I gave it 3* because it did not have a bath tub, only a nice shower. This was not much of a problem to me but most travellers would expect that a bath tub is fairly standard to a 4* property. We had a great view facing the pool and the Mekong river behind it. It was just great seeing fishing boats going past throughout the day and a sunset to go with it. Nothing to complain about. If you could add the bath tub and get rid of the occasional ants then 4* for sure. Facility -3* Their facility that is most relevant to a guest was the swimming pool and I would give them easily 4* for the pool. Very simply put if the pool was not there I would not have gone to stay at the resort and their pool is as good as one can get. Water clean, temperature right, shallow area for youngsters and up to 1.5m deep on the other end. life vest and towels provided. I went everyday and it is surely one of their biggest asset. Their gym needs some love and care. It's not their forte. I would say firstly invest in a few large mirrors in there, sort the treadmill out as it is one of the basic equipment. Get a few dumbbells in there and finally get air conditioning in there. Wall fans aren't really sufficient for gym on this side of the planet....The hotel has a nice little path around so great for some jogging. They also provide bicycles and tandem bicycle which were popular for young children, couples and family. They unfortunately don't have a spa. That would have made it complete. The outside cafe area by the river is good and the resort may be able to utilize that a bit more in the future. Food and Beverage - 2* This is where the resort is let down. I have only had their breakfast but based on that I was not keen to try anything else. If they sort their breakfast out it would be great as most guests will want to eat the breakfast. The chefs need to be completely retrained on all western food. When the French Fries and bacon are chewy and old then no wonder they end up sitting there. The lady who makes eggs and omelette can't even properly fried eggs or make omelette. Someone who is more critical will ask for a poach egg at a 4* resort to test their capability but these guys in no way will be capable of knowing what one is. When I see another guest go and buy a frying pan and asked to fry their own egg/omelette (are was allowed!), I think that paints the picture. The problem was that there was not much on offer on Vietnamese food side and they were not particularly great either. Bun Bo Hue was way too spicy even without putting any additional chilli and Mien Ga was not cooked enough so the noodles was chewy. They had 2 juices and water which was sufficient but you would expect them to offer 2 other juices on a different day...not so. In fact the food was pretty much identical everyday we were there so that needs addressing. Toast butter and Jam came to the rescue. They didn't offer croissant so can't exactly say they have a continental breakfast option either. Their Bo Kho was reasonably good. Mi Xao was reasonable. I would suggest firstly get the eggs, bacon, fries right. Then without too much additional budget you can add american pancakes and syrup on there, maybe some standard Banh Mi options. Get some croissants and maybe apple and orange juices on a different day to mix it up. Do all those you may just clear 3*. I think it is doable for sure. There is a bar not far from reception but there was never anyone there as if it was never open so I hope they utilize that more in the future. Needless to say I never thought about their in room dining service if they had any....Their outside cafe seemed reasonable but as mentioned before it needs to be utilize more. miscellaneous -They offer a shuttle boat service which I failed to find out near the end so did not take advantage of that. That seems quite an interesting thing to do. -I hope they sort out their outdoor wedding karaoke thing. I understand that it seems a great idea but for the resort guests it isn't really acceptable. If they really are 4* quality then they need to stop that outdoor karaoke from their wedding bookings. Find an alternative please. Overall It is a good choice if you end up in Ben Tre city or just want to have some serenity from Ho Chi Minh City. Happy to stay again if I end up in Ben Tre in the future.

(It's tough to really say city-center with Ben Tre, as there are a couple of significant nodes that are separate from each other, but essentially, the hotel is a long walk from the action or a short drive.) The location was fine, though I wouldn't have minded having it a bit closer. They do have some bikes for rent, which we did, but they're a little heavy (and fixed gear), so it was hard work! The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the air-conditioning worked well. The property as a whole was also very clean, but almost too much so. It was very sterile - and we had come to Ben Tre to get away from that kind of feel in Ho Chi Minh. I really can't point to any specific thing that was wrong with the hotel, but just the same, I can't say I'd recommend it for a friend visiting Ben Tre. It would be a good change of pace if you've been doing homestays and are missing the amenities of modern life, like a really nice shower, but otherwise, I'd look elsewhere.

Title: 静かできれいなホテル
Review: ベンチェー市場から3キロほど離れた川沿いにあるホテルです。周りには民家があるのみで、その民家も裏手は広大なココナツ林です。 出来たばかりの建物という事もあり、どこもかしこも奇麗です。宿泊棟とレストラン棟はそれそれ3階建てで分かれて作られています。 昔のフェリー発着場をそのまま取り込んでホテルの敷地にしており、面白い空間になっています。（フェリーはもう動かす事は無いようです。） 1階にこじんまりとしながらも奇麗なプール、2階に簡単なフィットネス設備があります。 部屋はこじんまりとしており、必要な設備はすべて整っています。清潔できれいな内装です。 周りに歩いて行ける距離には特段何もないので、ベンチェー市場やCoopMartなどに行きたい場合はタクシーをホテルに手配してもらってから行くことになります。ただしホテルで各種ツアーを実施しているので、特段街の中心部に行く用事もないかもしれません。

Title: Reposant, agréable.
Review: L'accueil est des plus charmants, le patron et sa soeur. En dortoir 4 lits, chambre agréable avec ventilateurs et moustiquaires individuels - jamais piqué par un moustique - et sanitaires à proximité. J'ai du nettoyer moi-même un lavabo. Trois jours plus tard les autres n'avaient jamais été faits et toujours bouchés.Les repas sont dans la grande salle, soit le menu (le même avec une variante, mais équilibré) midi et soir, soit à la carte (là les prix sont un peu élevés). Bon breakfast, boissons chaudes toats confitures oeufs plus vietnamien. Vélos (sympa, tarif identique que ce soit pour 1 ou plusieurs jours), moto ou scooters en location (par jour). Transfert vers Saigon : van de l'hôtel vers le terminal de bus au prix public. Ambiance écolodge toujours sympa. Wifi OK partout. Nombreuses possibilités d'excursion proposées, prix pas forcément attractifs en individuel mais très dégressifs selon le nombre d'inscrits. Le charme c'est aussi d'avoir sa grande liberté dans cette île avec son vélo et découvrir par soi-même dans des chemins sous cocoteraies, quand on part "à l'aventure" (avec carte ou GPS). Ce que j'ai fait pendant 2 jours. Ne rien faire et profiter du petit bar devant le fleuve ou d'une sieste dans les hamacs. Après les visites de sites et autres lieux bruyants, ce havre de paix est des plus appréciés. Je remercie à l'occasion ces deux personnes qui entretiennent et animent ce lieu.

Title: Nơi mát mẻ để ra ngoài và về
Review: Đây là một nơi tuyệt vời để ở, chúng tôi đã ở 2 đêm đó là hoàn hảo. Các nhân viên rất thân thiện và có sức chứa, chúng tôi có một phòng lớn hơn với 2 giường kể từ khi các phòng nhỏ hơn đã đầy. Nó có một phòng tắm riêng đầy đủ và giường thoải mái. Căn phòng hầu hết đã đóng cửa nhưng vẫn còn lưới chống muỗi và chúng tôi đã sử dụng nó. Về cơ bản không có lỗi. Có những con gà trống đã không có đồng hồ nên chúng thức dậy khoảng 3 giờ sáng nhưng chúng tôi cũng vậy, máy bay phản lực, yuck. Thức ăn rất ngon, nước / bia / soda luôn có sẵn, chỉ cần kiểm đếm trên bảng và trả tiền khi bạn rời đi. Họ cung cấp các tour du lịch để kiểm tra một số khu vực địa phương, chúng tôi không phải là người du lịch nhưng quyết định cho nó một cảnh quay thật tuyệt, đáng làm. Chúng tôi cũng đã đi xe đạp đến các đảo qua phà, chìa khóa rất thấp và vui vẻ, tôi khuyên bạn nên làm điều này chỉ cần đi kiểm tra nó. Internet chậm và tẻ nhạt nhưng nếu bạn dành nhiều thời gian ở Việt Nam, bạn sẽ thấy điều này là hoàn toàn bình thường. Chúng tôi bay vào thành phố Hồ Chí Minh và thuê một chiếc xe đạp để đến sông Mê Kông, nơi Bến Tre, nếu bạn biết điều này, vì một điều, giao thông rất tệ, bạn trai tôi đã đi xe máy hơn 20 năm qua thế giới và ông thậm chí còn nói rằng nó vượt khỏi tầm kiểm soát. Có vẻ như một chuyến đi nhanh chóng nhưng phải mất một lúc, khoảng 2 giờ. Mua mặt nạ, càng sớm càng tốt, hoặc bạn sẽ ho trong nhiều ngày. Ngoài ra, hãy theo dõi các biển báo trên đường cao tốc, nó sẽ chia thành 2 loại khác nhau và nếu bạn trên một chiếc xe máy, bạn chỉ được phép sử dụng một trong số chúng.

Title: Gentilezza e tipicità
Review: Sono stata al Ben Tre Farm Stay per due notti ed è stato un ottimo modo per ricaricare le batterie dalla confusione di Saigon. L'Homestay è in mezzo alla natura, per cui la zona è molto silenziosa. Le camere sono sparse in mezzo ad un frutteto di banani, palme da cocco, pompelmi e altri alberi tropicali, posizionate come palafitte sopra i piccoli canali dove nuotano pesci e lucertole. La location è un po' selvaggia, ma perfettamente in tema con la zona, quindi lo vedo come un punto di forza. Colazione gratuita e abbondante, mentre gli altri pasti sono a pagamento (ma non hanno comunque un prezzo altissimo, cosa che ci si aspetterebbe da un posto così lontano da tutto) ma comunque squisiti e preparati con ingredienti locali dallo staff. Consiglio i piatti a base di pesce e i fiori di banano fritti. Lo staff è stato veramente gentile, il padrone parla un buon inglese ed è super disponibile ad indicare percorsi da fare in bici, in barca o a dare indicazioni su come spostarsi in autobus all'interno del Vietnam. L'hotel è disponibile ad organizzare un tour in barca (ottimo rapporto qualità/prezzo) che porta, lungo il delta del Mekong, a visitare alcune attività tipiche della zona: una piantagione di cocco e produzione di dolci di cocco, miele, una fabbrica di mattoni e un'attività che produce stuoie e altri prodotti di un materiale simile al vimini. Anche in questo caso la guida è molto disponibile e parla un buon inglese. In generale consiglio Ben Tre Farm Stay, sia per un paio di giorni di relax, sia per una avventura sul Mekong e i piccoli suoi villaggi sul fiume. L'unica cosa che non capisco è: perchè mettere nei letti delle coperte così pesanti col caldo che fa.

Title: Perfect stay in Ben Tre!
Review: Peaceful, beautiful surroundings with birds, creeks and fruit trees everywhere. Hammocks to relax in on warm days. We had two nights at the farmstay and we LOVED it. My partner had fallen sick just days before our scheduled departure to Vietnam, so we had to cancel our bookings and postpone the trip. Duc Thai cancelled immediately with no questions asked, even though they had a no-refund policy, and wished him a speedy recovery. A week later, when we could finally travel again, Duc Thai and the Farmstay was the first thing we booked again! We booked our tours through the farmstay as well and had a great time exploring the Mekong. BONUS! We took the Vietnamese language class at the Farmstay and it was a highlight of our tour (Along with the newborn puppies at the farm). Thank you guys so much for having us, we enjoyed every minute of it! The highest of recommendations from us.

Het vogelreservaat was niet zo veel maar de boottocht brengt je naar een stuk van de mekong delta waar je nauwelijks touristen ziet en met redelijk veel vogels te zien (bijeneters, twee soorten zwaluwen, diverse soorten reigers). De uileg van de broer van het guesthouse is een uitstekende gids. Het eten is heerlijk. Sự thanh thản của căn cứ tổ tiên, bữa ăn nấu tại nhà, đi xe đạp hộ tống qua làng và giúp bản thân bạn uống nước lạnh, (nơi bạn theo dõi bao nhiêu đồ uống bạn có, bởi vì họ tin tưởng bạn!). Chúng tôi không thể cảm ơn ông Đức và nhân viên của ông đã đủ cho một kỳ nghỉ khó quên ở Bến Tre và đồng bằng sông Cửu Long. Tất cả mọi thứ chúng tôi hy vọng và nhiều hơn nữa! PS: Nếu bạn cần hỗ trợ lập kế hoạch chuyến đi đích thực qua Đồng bằng sông Cửu Long, hãy nói chuyện với ông Đức.

Title: Great setting, good tours, mediocre service
Review: We had mixed feelings about this place. The positive: The setting is excellent. It's a short (10 minute bike ride to town) and the farm rents bikes for 50,000 vnd for the length of your entire stay. There are lots of common areas, hammocks, and nice garden paths for relaxing. As we were looking for relaxation and exploring the country side, it was nice to stay here rather than the city center. The property also offers reasonably priced activities. We took a one hour boat trip (150,000 vnd) and the tour of the brick factory, coconut candy, and country bike ride (the standard offering on toys from Ho Chi Minh but without the transport). The cost on the latter varies depending on the number of people, but we paid approximately $10/person for 4 participants. The guide was good. We especially enjoyed the lovely bike ride at the end (about 1 hour, but can be more or less depending on the group's preference). The downsides were as follows: The standard double bungalows are really small, especially the bathroom. We were not expecting luxury, but it was hard to move around the room or sit normally on the toilet. In the low season there were often no English-speaking staff on site. This made it complicated to try to book tours or bus tickets or ask questions about bike rentals etc. The Wi-Fi stopped working in our room (though it worked elsewhere on the property) and we were told it couldn't be fixed until after we left. Things happen, but the staff made no attempt to make it up. For $17/ night in a very small, rustic room I appreciate it what what amenities there are work. Even a $1-2 discount as a gesture of goodwill would have gone a long way. Finally, a staff member quoted us the wrong price on the drinks. When we objected to the final bill, we were told that the other employee had been wrong and charged full price all the same. This drove home the lack of service.

Nous avons péchés, fait une balade à vélo super sympa dans les petits chemins des bords de Mékong (génial ! en pleine nature), rendu visite à un villageois qui nous a offert une noix de coco fraichement coupé, montré comment on montait en haut d'un cocotier à la force des bras... Puis nous avons diner (copieusement) sur la terrasse de la maison et nous avons été invité à partager le dessert et un (puis deux, trois....puis 10...) verres avec les hôtes et leurs amis venus passés le we. Ils nous ont offert du whisky local et des bières, nous avons chanté et joué de la guitare toute la nuit c'était incroyable! Des gens ouverts, accueillants, bienveillants tout simplement dans le partage et bons. Nous avons pris le bateau le lendemain pour visiter une fabrique de produits à base de noix de coco, une fabrique de brique et pleins de surprises! Souvenirs mémorables, un grand merci à Tam pour sa générosité et son accueil si précieux! Nous recommandons bien entendu cette maison d'hôtes, rien de mieux pour découvrir le pays, la culture, rencontrer et échanger avec des locaux. Nous espérons vous voir en France un jour!

Title: Lunch stop for our private tour
Review: My wife and I stopped here for our lunch stop on the way to Can Tho from Saigon with our guide. It made a nice change from the city restaurants, and the food was good overall. We ordered a couple of beers (as usual) to go with our lunch and then tucked into some crispy Banana hearts (at least, I think they were?), followed by Pumpkin Soup (which was greatly improved by a little chilli sauce, but very tasty), and then the Elephant Ear fish, which is a sight to behold! Fortunately, a waitress came and dissected it for us, taking the best flesh (from the back of the fish) and wrapping it in rice paper to form a fish roll. It looks great, it appears to be deep fried with its scales still on (whole), so they form an interesting appearance as they peel off the cooked fish. However, it was overcooked and on the dry side, which was a pity. It's also very bony, the first fillet dissected by the waitress is fine, but attempt to pull any more fish from the body and you will end up with a mouthful of bones! Still, we had plenty of other dishes to eat, and all together the lunch was quite pleasant and it was lovely to eat out in the country with chickens, puppies and birdsong surrounding us and the Mekong river within sight!

Title: Tolle Gastgeber...!
Review: Das Ba Danh Home ist wirklich nicht für jeden geeignet. Wir haben uns vor allem wegen der guten Bewertungen für diese Unterkunft entschieden. Unser Zimmer war leider wirklich sehr sehr dreckig. Bei diesem Klima ist es nicht ungewöhnlich, dass man Schimmel im Badezimmer oder auch im Zimmer hat, damit muss man einfach rechnen. Wer drauf absolut keine Lust hat sollte sich vielleicht für andere Reisen entscheiden. Nicht desto trotzdem war unser Zimmer absolut dreckig, das Bettgestell, die Matratze, Kissen, Decke... der Kissenbezug und auch das Kissen waren voller Schimmelflecken. Das die Bettwäsche nicht so sauber ist wie daheim okay, aber leider sah die Bettwäsche aus als hätten dort schon einige vorher genächtigt. Meine Negative Bewertung bezieht sich wirklich nur auf das Zimmer. Die Sanitären Anlagen und das drum herum war total in Ordnung und gepflegt. Vielleicht hatten wir einfach nur Pech mit dem Zimmer. Nun zum positiven. Die Besitzer/Gastgeber waren total nett und hilfsbereit. Wer nicht genau weiß wie er am besten zur Unterkunft kommt, kann auf die Hilfe der Besitzer zählen. Herzensgute Menschen. Wenn es um Ausflugsmöglichkeiten und sonstige Aktivitäten geht kann man sich sehr gut beraten lassen. Ein Fahrradverleih, sowie die Möglichkeit eine Tour mit dem Boot durch den anliegenden Kanal zu machen sind vor Ort möglich. Die Lage des Ba Danh Home ist wunderbar direkt am Kanal des Mekong gelegen. Einfach mitten in der Natur. Moskitospray nicht vergessen. Wer eine Fahrradtour auf eigene Faust macht, sollte sich den Weg sehr gut merken, es ist etwas wie im Labyrinth, aber es finden sich immer wieder Anhaltspunkte um sich den Weg doch irgendwie zu merken. Bis man auf die Ortsdurchfahrt kommt ist es ein kleines Stück mit dem Fahrrad. Wir haben daher den Abend im Ba Danh Home verbracht und das Essen war wirklich total super, es gibt gar keinen Grund mehr wo anders zu essen, gleiches gilt für Frühstück und Mittagessen. Was ich sehr schön fand, es gibt keine Karte aus der man wählen kann. Es werden lokale Gerichte gezaubert mit dem was in der Küche vorhanden ist. Einfach toll und lecker... Es tut mir wirklich leider. Gerne hätte ich auch 5 Punkte gegeben, aber unser Zimmer war einfach nur dreckig. Mit der tollen Hängematte (die Hängematten wagen wirklich super) draußen wären wir vielleicht besser dran gewesen.

Title: Reposant mais un peu décevant
Review: Nous sommes arrivés dans l'après midi et avons péniblement fini par trouver l'hôtel à l'aide de Google map (qui ne connaissait pas la route) et des habitants. L'hôtel est vraiment au milieu d'un magnifique jardin, avec une longue terrasse pourvue d'hamacs et de tables. La chambre ne fermait pas à clé, n'étais pas très propre et n'était pas isolée (elle était ouverte par le plafond, donc pas énormément intimité). Les sanitaires se trouvaient à 20m mais le passage pour y arriver n'est pas couvert donc il fallait attendre qu'il arrête de pleuvoir. Heureusement que l'endroit est joli car c'est tellement isolé qu'il n'y a pas grand chose d'autre à faire que de rester à l'hôtel. On y a pris un repas à 70000pp qui était assez sommaire et sans beaucoup de goût, mais la propriétaire nous a gentiment cuisiné autre chose de meilleur. Le propriétaire nous a conseillé un tour en bateau de 3h qui était surtout un piège à touristes, à 350000pp. Il y a des vélos à disposition mais pas de kayak comme on avait lu dans d'autres commentaires. Notre séjour ne s'est pas très bien terminé car on voulait prendre le bus pour Can Tho. Le propriétaire nous a dit qu'il y en avait 2, un à 6h30 et l'autre à 12h30 et qu'on devait prendre un tuk-tuk 30 min avant. On pensait donc prendre le tuk-tuk à 12h. A 11h, celui-ci arrive alors qu'evidemment nous n'avions pas encore fait notre sac. Nous apprenons que cela coûte 150 000. Quand nous arrivons finalement à la gare des bus, nous y apprenons que le bus est à 13h30. Soit 2h d'attente dans une gare au lieu d'un hamac au bord de l'eau. Nous avons un doute sur le fait que c'était volontaire car ils avaient beaucoup d'invités prévus, voilà pourquoi je trouve cela utile de le mentionner même si ce n'est pas bien grave.

Title: Vị trí đẹp, trải nghiệm nông thôn, chủ sở hữu đẹp- Nơi lánh mình ở nông thôn.
Review: Đây là một tìm kiếm tuyệt vời, chỉ khi bạn cố gắng tìm nó! Vị trí: Vẻ đẹp, thanh bình và môi trường xung quanh có giá; nơi này khó tìm. Tuy nhiên, nơi này thực sự chỉ có 15 - 20 phút bằng xe máy từ thành phố, một khi bạn tìm ra địa lý. Chủ sở hữu đã giúp chúng tôi điều hướng sau khi chúng tôi vào thị trấn và gửi phương tiện đi lại để giúp chúng tôi tiếp cận địa điểm của họ. Các lái xe đến nơi này là dọc theo con đường làng nhỏ, tạo cảm giác quyến rũ cho chuyến đi ngắn. Nơi nép mình trong vùng nông thôn, trong một khung cảnh rất yên bình và thanh bình. Phòng: Là cơ bản: giường, khăn trải giường sạch sẽ và gối, màn chống muỗi và khăn sạch. Các nhà vệ sinh là phổ biến nhưng sạch sẽ. Vòi sen riêng biệt (vòi hoa sen lạnh) và nhà vệ sinh. Một vài điểm cắm và ngăn kéo nhỏ. Khu vực ăn uống chung, một lần nữa cơ bản nhưng tốt. Võng xung quanh khu vực ăn uống, hoàn hảo để nghỉ ngơi và đắm mình trong sự tĩnh lặng. Chủ sở hữu: Rất đẹp và ngọt ngào. Luôn cố gắng giữ cho khách thoải mái theo bất cứ cách nào họ có thể. Làm cho kỳ nghỉ của chúng tôi đáng nhớ. Hoạt động: Người ta có thể tham gia các lớp học nấu ăn từ các chủ sở hữu, nếu quan tâm. Chúng tôi đã đi tour du lịch đồng bằng mà họ sắp xếp, tốt đẹp và hợp lý. Xe đạp được cung cấp miễn phí cho khách. Chúng tôi đạp xe quanh vùng nông thôn, mặc dù việc tìm đường của bạn có thể khó khăn (không, Google Maps không hoạt động!) Thực phẩm: Các chủ sở hữu nấu ăn cho khách dựa trên sở thích. Hãy chắc chắn để thông báo cho họ trước về sở thích bữa ăn của bạn nếu bạn muốn thưởng thức các món ngon của nông thôn Việt Nam. Bia lạnh cũng có sẵn. Nhìn chung, một trải nghiệm thực tế của vùng nông thôn Việt Nam, trong một khung cảnh thoải mái. Chắc chắn sẽ giới thiệu nó cho vị trí và sự hiếu khách của chủ sở hữu. Một số điểm cần xem xét: 1) Phòng không có phân cách rắn. Sự tách biệt, trong khi tạo ra các rào cản trực quan, không giữ âm thanh từ các phòng gần đó. Nếu bạn có những khách hàng ồn ào bên cạnh (như chúng tôi đã có), nó có thể gặp khó khăn. 2) Vấn đề đặt trước quá mức như được đưa ra bởi các đánh giá khác: Chưa bao giờ trải nghiệm nó, nhưng đó có thể là vì chúng tôi đã đi du lịch vào tháng Ba. 3) Các cấu trúc được làm bằng gỗ và với một mái nhà tranh, do đó, không mong đợi spotlessly sàn sạch sẽ trong phòng của bạn. 4) Phòng nhỏ, với giường chiếm hầu hết không gian. 5) Ngoài một vài con thằn lằn và tắc kè ở đây và ở đó, không có gì đáng sợ.

Title: Meh.
Review: I didn’t really love our stay here. The family is very kind and the food is delicious, but our room was overrun with mosquitos and there wasn’t really anything interesting to do nearby. All of the gorgeous and exciting things to do are all quite far away. The boat tour (we opted for the short version because we were low on time) was pretty underwhelming - the floating fish farms are interesting to see but the scenery is definitely not beautiful and the river near the homestay is full of litter. Unless you have lots of time to spend traveling to the boat tours, fruit orchards, and floating markets that are more worth your sightseeing time, I recommend staying at a place that’s closer in proximity to those attractions.

Title: Beautiful property friendly family
Review: My wife and I stayed here 2 nights after travelling south through Vietnam for a month. Friendly family, the host speaks great English, his wife is a great cook and is very gracious. It’s a beautiful and quiet riverside property. We took bicycles from the property for a morning tour and they worked fine, I would suggest using google maps to find your way off of some of the busier (really not that busy for SEA standards) roads to explore some dirt roads and small communities. We then took up the owner on the river cruise for 2 hrs to catch the sunset on his motorized tour boat. It was nice, it’s not a quiet little rowboat though. We still enjoyed it. Very comfortable river side room, clean, good shower. Recommend you contact him after or when booking to arrange bus as one bus company (Futa) will drive you right up to his door with a shuttle free of charge.

Le déjeuné qui coûte 70000d est passé à 100000d dès qu'on la signalé, il n'a pas chipoté pour baisser le prix..idem pour le scoot, je doute que la course ai coûté 70000d mais je n'en suis pas sur. Dans l'ensemble c'est quelqu'un de gentil.

Title: Quirky, cosy and has the best COLD pool !
Review: After many hours of research, we settled on the Oasis Hotel. On arrival, we realised our expectations were way too high BUT ... after 3 nights, we would happily have stayed another night. We settled in and enjoyed what WAS on offer! The rooms are VERY basic so prepare yourself for that. Aircon worked really well. Beds were comfortable. A shower curtain separating the shower and the toilet would have been good but, oh well! Cleanliness was satisfactory. Our room had a small fridge but no tea/coffee making facilities. A thermos of hot water was given to us on request which was great. The very clean, deep, cool pool was wonderful! We were in and out of it all the time. We were glad we chose a room on the ground floor, near to the pool. Kids will love it. Smoking was allowed by the pool which was great for those who smoke! We don't. LOCATION: we estimated a 30 minute walk in to town. It was an easy 10mins on the bikes. It will be much better if you are prepared to get on a bike. They were more than okay. They had gears. The street is quiet and runs parallel to the river. There's a 'beauty' salon 2 mins walk away. It was nice to enjoy a manicure and hair wash. We took the tour that previous reviewers recommended. We've done many tours in Vietnam and this was one of the best. The tour guide, Hong has very good English and this made a big difference as she was easy to understand. If you end up staying somewhere else, I'd recommend trying to get on one of her tours. She indicated that this might be possible. It's surprising that a tourist company hasn't snapped her up! We saw no other tourists whilst riding around Ben Tre. It's not touristy and that's why we liked it. In summary, if you want matching sheets and fluffy towels, keep doing your research but if you are looking for genuine hospitality and want to experience rural Vietnam, this is a good choice. Fish farm was 20km return bike ride. 3D Cafe is very close by and served great food. Always a good idea to eat where the school kids go!

Tôi sẽ không ngần ngại giới thiệu Oasis và sẽ ở lại đó một lần nữa. Giá trị lớn.

Title: Người tuyệt vời, không khí dễ thương
Review: Chúng tôi đã thực hiện một đường vòng đến Bến Tre và rất mong chờ điều đó. Sidenote: khi đi đến Bến Tre từ Hồ Chí Minh, tìm kiếm Thịnh Phát, họ có một chiếc xe buýt, chủ yếu được người dân địa phương sử dụng, cứ 30 phút lại có giá 70 k mỗi người, kể cả chuyển từ điểm thả xuống khách sạn. Đừng mong đợi nhiều sự xa xỉ, nhưng có airco và wifi! Khi đến nơi, chúng tôi được chào đón bởi một trong những người chủ đã giải thích chi tiết về những việc cần làm trong khu vực. Cô ấy khuyên chúng tôi nên đến nhà hàng số 17 (một cái gì đó trong vườn) nhưng chúng tôi đã nhiệt tình hơn nhiều về số 2, nơi chúng tôi đã đi vào ngày hôm sau. Hương vị phương tây của chúng tôi không thể thực sự đối phó với thực đơn tại nhà hàng sân vườn, nhưng nếu bạn cảm thấy phiêu lưu và trong tâm trạng cho một số con rắn, ếch hoặc bồ câu đi đến đây. Họ có một thực đơn tốt cho những người ít phiêu lưu, vì vậy đừng quá sợ hãi. : -) Các phòng hơi lỗi thời, nhưng đủ phù hợp cho những người không cần sự sang trọng. Rốt cuộc, có rất nhiều việc phải làm và thấy ở Bến Tre chúng tôi chỉ sử dụng phòng để ngủ. Vào ban ngày có một nơi tốt đẹp để thư giãn ở tầng dưới với võng và hồ bơi. Chúng tôi chắc chắn khuyên bạn nên sắp xếp tour du lịch riêng qua sông Mê Kông với khách sạn này. Đó là 30 USD mỗi người cho hai chúng tôi và thật tuyệt vời! Khi đặt phòng ở đây, họ chắc chắn sẽ cho bạn biết thêm về nó và có thể đề nghị rời đi lúc 8 giờ sáng, như chúng tôi đã làm. Chúng tôi hầu như không gặp bất kỳ khách du lịch nào khác, làm cho các tour du lịch rất thoải mái và yên bình. Mỗi khách sẽ ở trong khách sạn này có thể sẽ gặp Ken. Ông là một trong những chủ sở hữu của khách sạn này và có rất nhiều câu chuyện để kể về cuộc đời ông. Anh ấy là một diễn giả tuyệt vời và tôi thực sự thích trò chuyện với anh ấy. Anh ấy cũng đã viết một cuốn sách về cuộc đời mình, mà tôi không thể chờ để bắt đầu đọc! Một lời cảm ơn rất lớn dành cho Hong, người mà chúng tôi đã liên lạc sau khi đặt phòng và cũng là hướng dẫn viên du lịch của chúng tôi. Cô ấy thực sự làm cho ngày của chúng tôi trong chuyến lưu diễn và cho chúng tôi cái nhìn sâu sắc về cuộc sống của cô ấy ở Bến Tre. Họ cũng có xe đạp cho thuê, đó là một cách hoàn hảo để khám phá khu vực. Một cái nhìn sâu sắc về cuộc sống hàng ngày của những người sống ở đây. Chắc chắn ngồi xuống một nơi nào đó để uống một tách cà phê và tận hưởng những nụ cười của dân làng chào đón bạn! Cuối cùng, món trứng tráng cho bữa sáng thật tuyệt vời. Hồng rất vui khi cho chúng tôi thấy cách cô ấy làm những thứ này và tôi chắc chắn sẽ thử và tạo ra những quả trứng ngon tuyệt này ở nhà! Vì vậy, đừng ngần ngại đặt kỳ nghỉ của bạn ở đây nếu bạn, như tôi đã đề cập, không đặt ra sự xa xỉ mà thay vào đó hãy coi trọng nụ cười ấm áp và sự quan tâm của mọi người. Nếu chúng tôi có cơ hội quay trở lại Bến Tre, tôi chắc chắn sẽ ở lại đây một lần nữa!

Title: Mixed feelings
Review: I find this a difficult review to write as I have very mixed feelings about our stay there. I must say that I feel the lovely Hong is the glue that holds it all together - she is charming and so helpful (with a great sense of humour!). Her local knowledge is exceptional & she made our morning tour extremely enjoyable and interesting. The other staff are very pleasant and helpful but I found the owner's wife to be more interested in selling us a tour than anything else. As soon as we arrived, before showing us to our rooms or even offering us a welcome drink (which was standard in all other hotels we stayed in), she was talking about the tour they offer. I did not find her to be a very hospitable host, but Hong and the other staff definitely were. The rooms are very basic and the towels were paper-thin and fraying. I know it's a budget hotel, but one would hope for a decent towel, at least. There is a nice pool and what was very handy was a drying area to hang out our laundry. They have basic bikes for rent, which we made use of and had a nice ride in the countryside. It saddens me to report that the owner actually asked us to tip Hong, which I find unacceptable. We tipped Hong because she certainly deserved it and didn't appreciate being asked to do so by her employer!

Title: Những người đáng yêu, nhưng một chút tồi tàn
Review: Vợ tôi và tôi ở lại 2 đêm. Đây là một đánh giá thực sự khó khăn bởi vì trong khi những người đáng yêu và không thể hữu ích hơn và bữa sáng thật tuyệt vời, sự sạch sẽ của các phòng đều kém. Có vẻ như việc dọn dẹp đã được giới hạn ở các tầng thấp hơn của phòng (từ chiều cao mắt Việt Nam xuống?). 2 của nó. 5 sao có thể là một chút thấp cho các cơ sở trên cung cấp. Ken (Kiwi) chủ nhân là một nhân vật thực sự với trái tim vàng. Nhân viên của ông đặc biệt là Hồng (tour du lịch) và ông An (quản lý) là rất tốt. Người bạn đời của Ken, một anh chàng người Thụy Điển lớn tuổi, là một quý ông thực sự. Có một hồ bơi nhỏ được che bằng một tấm chắn để mát mẻ. Khách sạn là khá xa từ bất kỳ lựa chọn nhà hàng (khoảng 1. 5 km) nhưng họ có xe đạp và motos có sẵn. Cách đó 10 phút đi bộ có một cửa hàng bán kem đáng yêu. Có một nhà hàng gần cửa hàng kem nhưng nó không có gì đặc biệt và tương đối đắt tiền theo tiêu chuẩn Việt Nam. Nếu bạn đang tìm kiếm một nơi thú vị để ở và tận hưởng một câu thần chú tinh thần, thì điều này sẽ không làm bạn thất vọng. Với một chút nỗ lực thêm vào làm sạch nó có thể là tuyệt vời.

Tôi sẽ nhớ ba ngày của tôi tại khách sạn Oasis ở Bến Tre suốt quãng đời còn lại của tôi. Điểm nổi bật của tháng của tôi ở Việt Nam. Cuộc sống là về con người và kinh nghiệm. Title: A true adventure in Ben Tre
Review: Like other reviews for this hotel, this is a real taste of the Mekong Delta area of South Vietnam. A true adventure and unforgettable experience. We were greeted at first by Hong who then became our tour guide. She showed us all the great areas to explore with the detailed map painted on the wall in the hotel. We rode motorbikes to the islands nearby and saw the rural life on the Mekong delta. The roads were safe as long as you paid attention to traffic. This was a real taste of adventure that not everyone gets when they travel. We could have rode the bikes forever. We went into town to the local mall/supermarket. Although as Westerners we stood out, the people there were absolutely friendly and wanted to practice their English and speak to us. The next day, Hong accompanied us as we rode the Mekong river delta all the way to Can Tho. Out of our whole trip to SE Asia in 3 weeks, this was by far the biggest highlight and most adventurous. The trip took 9 hours with various stops at fish farms, floating markets, and a quick stop to eat lunch. Hong's knowledge of the her country and Mekong life was truly inspiring and unforgettable. She showed us the true ways of Mekong river life. We really felt like we got to know her and her country. We exchanged great conversation the whole time. She prepared snacks and water for us during our journey. As we rode through the delta, we waved at everyone working and playing near the water. This was a long journey for not only us but the driver Yeoung and Hong too. They immediately went back to Ben Tre after dropping us off right in front of our hotel in Can Tho. We were extremely grateful for the whole experience in Ben Tre. Although we only stayed one night at the hotel, we instantly felt like family. We wish Hong and her twin baby girls the absolute best as well as the whole staff at the Oasis Hotel. Thank you so much for the great experience. We will definitely recommend Ben Tre to anyone going to South Vietnam to get a genuine adventure in Vietnam. Much love, Chase and Dylan from Seattle, Washington

Title: A taste of real Vietnam
Review: If you would rather stay in a soulless hotel in the main town then fair enough, but you're missing out. Missing out on local knowledge, food, stories and an excellent boat tour that takes you to some interesting places. Firstly, we got some advice from the amazing Hong about how to get to Oasis – we took the Thinh Phat bus from Saigon to Ben Tre then the bus company transferred to a minibus and dropped us off right in the courtyard at Oasis. Just show the bus company your hotel details and they'll organise it for you. We let Hong know our estimated arrival time and she was there to greet us and show us the room. She then showed us the useful wall map/mural which I recommend photographing and using when you are out and about. First afternoon, we walked along to the Garden Restaurant (Mai and Tiem) for some great food and drink, then stopped for coffee at Cafe Làng Văn 2 with the lovely gardens. Next day, we booked up with Hong for the boat tour and she took us to the coconut candy factory, weavers, lunch and the rowing boat journey. It was excellent and Hong is lovely, a real inspiration! Second day, we did the cycling loop in the countryside which was knackering but so so interesting. Especially the wee ferry over to the island. The island is gorgeous, I'd have been happy enough to cycle around there all morning. We relaxed on the hammocks all afternoon, having beer and reading. Breakfast each day (included) was super – eggs and fruit, enough to set you up for the day. And the dog is so cute, if you're nice he'll come over and sit under the hammock :) We mentioned to Ken about going to the local cafe (3D Coffee) and he offered me a lift on his homemade bike. If you are asked, go for it! Its so much fun to pootle along on a patio chair! On leaving, Hong was so helpful and arranged a taxi to the bus station for us. Our bus to Can Tho was the local bus and she even asked the driver to take us directly to the bus in the bus station. From start to finish, our experience getting to Ben Tre and being around the town were positive. Its not a touristy place, that's a real bonus. And the local kids who speak a bit of English are so enthused about seeing you, they constantly wave and say Hello! On our cycle back to Oasis, about 200 kids from the school cycled along waving and smiling at us. One thing to avoid though is the floating restaurant which is just a weird, uncomfortable experience. The sight of two staff fighting with each other over you is just bizarre, a kind of Vietnamese Fawlty Towers.

Title: Hong does a brilliant tour
Review: Would highly recommend this hotel to those who want to get a bit off the tourist trail and get a feel for village life in the Mekong Delta – the tour run by Hong made it 5 stars. This is a small hotel with a laid-back atmosphere; the pool and communal areas with hammocks were great for relaxing and chatting to the other guests and the owners. Our family room was spacious and clean with one double and two twin beds (in our experience this was unusual in Vietnam and the kids appreciated having their own beds). However, the hotel is not as modern as some. Hong (who also manages the hotel) is lovely and so helpful. She gave us lots of info about the local area and we could hire bikes too. She also emailed us before we arrived with details of the Thinh Phat bus from Ho Chi Minh City which has a shuttle bus that will take you directly to the hotel. Breakfast was fine but the hotel does not do food throughout the day and restaurants around the area are not the best in Vietnam. The best thing about our stay was the half-day tour run by Hong – perhaps the best tour we did out of half a dozen or so in our 3 week trip in Vietnam. She took us off the beaten-track on two boats and a tuk tuk and was great to chat to about her life and the locality; lunch was delicious in a fairly remote part of a nearby village. With only the four of us and two others on the trip it made it a great experience.

Title: Fabulous stay

Title: Riverside escape, a true oasis
Review: We stayed in this hotel for one night after catching the local bus from Ho Chi Minh City to Ben Tre and finding no hotels in the main part of town. Oasis was featured in the Lonely Planet guide book as one of the few English speaking hotels in the area, which is why we chose it. The room was nice and quiet with a TV, air conditioning, but no hairdryer or fridge. There's a pretty, shaded poolside area with hammocks and the front of the hotel faces onto the river, so it's very quiet. The owners are (I think) an Aussie and Vietnamese couple, but our main interaction was with receptionist, Hong. Her English is very good, she explained the attractions in the local area to us and recommended coffee shops and places to eat. We had a dip in the pool (unheated, but a relief from the heat of the day) and rented bikes from the hotel to explore the local area. It's not a very touristy area, so westerners appear to be quite a novelty - everyone we passed on the bikes waved and called "hello" to us and were delighted when we waved and called back. We took Hong's recommendation to have a massage at a local place staffed by blind women. Hong also helped us arrange a private cruise the next morning at sunrise back up the river to the floating markets at Can Be and dropping us off at our next destination, including a picnic breakfast on the boat ($50 USD each for the 4h trip) The staff here were very friendly and helpful, with a particular mention to Hong, who kept in touch with our boat captain by phone and translated for us after we'd left the hotel. An excellent stay, and I'd definitely stay here again.

Title: Good Overall Experience

The other plusses for staying here and the bike rentals, the scooter rentals, the free breakfast, the pool, cold beers, pickup at the dock for the cargo boat to Tra Vinh (a wow experience but it's not for everyone - 5 hours on the slo boat with no rest room, no cold drinks, no communication from the crew - we loved it) and it's fairly close to downtown (not walkable, but bike able). Honestly, if we go to Vietnam again I will skip Ben Tre, there isn't too much here except this is where we picked up the cargo boat. So the Oasis was a good experience, we met some other travelers who were fun, there was lots of shade, helpful staff. Only negative is that the kiwi side of the couple that owns the place has like a workshop annex right in the middle of everything, including oily towels that are a HUGE turnoff and he sits at his computer like he's in his private living room. (Note to owner: you're running a hotel, you're not renting rooms in your house, move your man cave crap into your garage and be a little more attentive to your paying guests). Other than that we had a lovely experience.

Title: A real oasis away from HCMC.
Review: I decided to visit Ben Tre on a bit of a whim as I had a friend visiting me in HCMC and I didn't have the time to go all the way to Can Tho. I'm really glad I decided on Ben Tre as in many ways it was a much more pleasant experience. We arrived at lunch time and after some easy to follow instructions from Mrs Lieu we took a motorbike out for a few hours to explore the area, which is picturesque and easy to navigate. We had an early night and after enjoying a decent breakfast (something of a rarity in Vietnamese hotels) we went on a private boat trip with Hong. This was the real highlight of our short trip. Hong is knowledgeable, extremely friendly and her English is very good. She obviously cares a great deal about the people in her home town (see the way her face lights up when she talks) and has designed a tour that attempts to at least follow a route away from the bigger tours where possible. We visited the coconut farmers (who had actually finished for the morning, but still let us look around and gave us a quick demonstration) went to see coconut candy being made (admittedly part of most tours but we got there early before the place was over run with tourists). After that we went for lunch at a lovely spot in the village. We felt bad that we couldn't buy any souvenirs here (stupidly hadn't brought enough cash, so I advise anyone to budget a couple of hundred thousand to be able to contribute to the local community). After riding our bikes around the village a little we got on a small boat where we were able to get the classic 'jungle shots' reminiscent of many a war movie, before getting the boat back to the Oasis's private jetty. We then had a chance for a ride on Ken's crazy bike cum chair contraption and a quick chat before our arranged free transfer for the bus back to HCMC. I will certainly be recommending this place to friends here in HCMC and hope to bring any other visitors along in the future.

Title: Great base to explore the region

They also arranged for us to get a ride on a cargo boat to Tra Vinh which picked us up from the pier outside Oasis. One note of caution, if you're trying to find it on Maps.me it appears twice. The one at the end of the bridge is wrong. When you cross the bridge from Ben Tre you need to turn back below the bridge then turn left as you are facing the river and continue for about 1k. Best bet is to ring them when you arrive in Ben Tre town

Title: Our Favourite Kind of Place - Perfect Getaway From HCMC
Review: We have just returned from a wonderful long weekend in Ben Tre and an amazing stay at the Oasis Hotel. It is one of those special kind of hotels that is run by friendly staff and owners who make everyone feel welcome. From the minute we walked in, we knew we had chosen well. A map of the surrounding area is on a wall and it is explained with all those tidbits of information that travellers like... a good local restaurant and coffee shop close by, a hair wash place, the day and night markets etc. We immediately rented bicycles from them (they have motos as well) and explored the side of the river where the hotel is located (just across from Ben Tre) which is quaint, friendly and all those charming describing words you can think of. We had been worried that it was too far to get to Ben Tre but it is not at all. At night, we walked across the bridge and went to the night market and walked backed easily. We took our bikes to a ferry crossing as well to explore a near by island one morning as well. Watching the Vietnamese people make rice paper and work on the fish farms on the island was a lot of fun. This can be done easily and independently. The hotel has a refreshing pool and yummy breakfasts as well that are included. Don't think twice about it... a perfect affordable retreat from HCMC and a taste of rural life in Vietnam that is not overrun by tourism. We will be returning for sure. When you email to book, ask for a recommendation on what bus line to take etc. They recommended a bus company from HCMC that included a direct service to the hotel, no extra charge (Thinh Phat line out of Q. 5)

Title: Great for the price, nice staff
Review: Oasis is a great hotel situated a bit outside of the "downtown" area of Ben Tre. We arrived during the off season, so for most of our stay we were basically the only people there! The owners (a married couple -wife from Vietnam and husband from New Zealand) were really nice and helpful. with their usual helpers off for the day, they allowed us to use their washing machine free of charge (this was about halfway through our trip and we desperately needed to do a wash). The owners nephew was also kind enough to show me the surrounding neighborhood on the back of his bike (though I think the point was to practice a bit of English with me. I'm an English teacher, so I didn't mind!) They were also kind enough to schedule and setup a tour for us around the Mekong. Since it was off season it was just the 4 of us and our guide, but I imagine during peak months they pack the boats as much as they can. Either way, the tour was totally worth it! Highly recommended. PS Be advised: they don't accept credit cards for the tours (or for rooms, I believe?) and you will want to buy some stuff on the tour as well so bring plenty of cash! The tour guide will bring you to an ATM in town if you run short (as we did), but don't expect easy access to money changers.
