Title: Better than Anticipated
Review: Ham Luong Hotel Review - 02-06-14 Dates of Stay 01-31-14 to 02-06-14 Hotel (200C Hung Vuong, T.P. Ben Tre,  ) GPS coordinates: N10º 14 044, E106º 22 138 The hotel is located about a half mile west of Quoc lo 60 street on Hung Vuong street. Cho Ben Tre is at the corner of Hung Vuong and Quoc lo 60. The hotel faces the Ben Tre River (Song Ben Tre). Checking In As I had booked the room directly, with price agreed to earlier, there were no formalities when we arrived. Our bags were taken directly to the room. All that was required was our passports, which in Vietnam is pretty much guaranteed payment. The Agoda.com price was the same as the hotels direct rate almost to the dollar. But as we booked direct, the hotel later gave us one night free for a six-day stay. Room We stayed in room 301, which I should have known was one previously reviewed and criticized for the noise coming from the bar area directly above. Second floor rooms are probably far better insulated from the noise I’m sure. I first heard the chair shuffling from above when I was soaking in the tub around 5:30 PM. Would it continue for long and how long? The room labeled a suite, is quite large. It was one of the largest that I’ve stayed in SEA for the price paid. Then again, this isn’t Sai Gon, Ha Noi, or some beach fancy beach resort. It’s the Delta. Flooring in the room was all tile, very clean and cool. I don’t mind walking barefoot on tile floors but not carpeting, even though the the hotel supplied sandals. Lighting in the room was typically dim. I’m all for any energy-saving devices and fixtures but some areas of a room or bathroom require brighter lighting. So the lighting in this particular room was not bright enough for me. This particular room had an upright refrigerator with internal freezer compartment and was of sufficient space to store perhaps 35-50 12 oz. cans of beverages or a combination of food and drink. It wasn’t running when we opened the room (to save power), so I had to turn it up to its maximum setting to make it chill down quick for beverage and food storage. Because I suspected it had not been running for awhile it had a slight odor (musty). I wasn’t worried as I was only storing cans for now. After about five hours, my beverages were near freezing, perfect if the weather turns really hot. So far, the weather has been quite mild. (Oh dear! Acoustic guitar and singing just started above our room at 7:50 PM!) I would certainly avoid rooms on the third floor (especially room 301) if you cannot handle loud music and chairs being dragged across the tile floor above you. The sound literally echoes through the room and lasts well past 10 PM, when staff are still moving chairs probably back to their original placement. How would one describe the outfitting of the room, late government provincial? The suite has a fair amount of furniture, which looks like most other furniture in Vietnam. It’s that dark-stained wood with 27 coats of varnish. With all the protection, I’m sure it is resilient as floor tiles and concrete. SEA is not kind on buildings. The warm or hot, humid weather is a perfect catalyst for mold, mildew, and rot. So the beautiful set of wooden chairs in the room are hard as a rock and not inviting for a long sit-down. Everything is cement, tile, more tile, heavily varnished wood. The TV is still the old fashion, one hundred pound monstrosity. Quite frankly, I haven’t seen one in SEA for years. I thought everything was flat screens by now. Our room had a king size bed with a high density foam mattress. It was quite firm but wasn’t like sleeping on a concrete slab. At least there were no springs pushing against one’s body at night. The room also has an electric water cooker for making coffee or tea. Free tea was available but we took the Vietnamese coffee with condensed milk down at the restaurant with breakfast. The room also has a blow dryer for one’s hair. (I don’t have enough to dry.) Speaking of TV, there will be dozens of Vietnamese and Chinese stations. I did manage to find five English channels, including Cinemax, HBO, Animal Planet, National Geographic, and Discovery Channel, which is not bad for a hotel in a rural town. The WiFi is good throughout the building from what I can see. The network is not protected (it’s open) so protect your computer as best you can (turn on computer firewall and don’t allow file sharing for starters). Bandwidth was adequate enough to support several quality Facetime sessions (video-conferencing). Facebook not locked out at this hotel, so enjoy. A dysfunctional rooster next door started crowing around 3 - 3:30 AM daily. Breakfast Breakfast turned out to be much better than I had anticipated. Most mornings, we arrived between 7 - 7:30 AM. The number of foods offered were quite varied. Bowls of Udon soup with various meats, vegetables had been prepared in advance. This was the first day and morning’s menu changed daily (see below). They were all excellent! All one had to do was ladle some broth into the bowl and eat. Here’s a list of items we encountered for the breakfast buffet during our six-day stay: Udon noodle soup (Banh Canh) Pho - Bun Bo Hue Bun Moc (noodle soup) with pork or pork ball Chau ca - (Congee with Thac Lac fish) Congee with duck egg Chau (Congee - plain) Congee with oyster mushrooms (my favorite) Congee with yellow squash Bo Kho (beef stew) Sui Mai (pork) braised in a tomato type base (Different soups, congees and other foods not served everyday) Sliced bread Baguette bread pieces Fried eggs Mini egg omelets Fried, small chicken pieces Stir fried rice Stir fried rice with seafood Stir fried rice with crab Stir fried noodles Stir fried greens (sort of a spinach) Stir fried cabbage Stir fried mustard greens Stir fried bokchoy Shrimp dumplings Glutinous rice cakes Hot dog (sausages shape like nuggets) Pork roll slices Sliced tomatoes Sliced cucumbers Condiments of various sorts Jams Jellies Butter Vietnamese coffee with condensed milk Hot water Tea Passion fruit juice (diluted) Fresh watermelon slices Fresh dragon fruit slicesFresh pineapple slices Again, foods above appeared on different days. One kind of soup daily along with one congee (plain) and one other congee with another ingredient like seafood, mushroom, squash or something else. If you must get your salt, try placing a couple pieces of salted egg in your soup or congee. It’s delicious! (Take the sliver of shell off the egg before dumping it in you soup.) Bath The first impression that I got with the bath was that it was spacious, white, all tiled floor to ceiling, and most important, clean. The tub was large and had a built-in jacuzzi. After a long twenty-four hours of transpacific travel, including a two hour layover in Hong Kong, I decided on a hot soaking. I turned on the hot water to fill the tub but after accumulating about three inches of water, the delivery system had turned cold. Alas, my share of the hot water had been exhausted from the over the sink electric hot water heater. Make sure the switch on the wall is turned on. When the hot water is used up, the heater starts heating up another batch. It’s certainly enough to take a nice hot shower of five to seven or eight minutes. Sufficiently relaxed and wet, I decided it was time to towel down and have a cool beverage. I turned the handle to open the drain but the mechanical bath stopper would not rise to drain the water. Heck with it for now. Later called the front desk, who sent up a person directly to fix it within five minutes. There was no separate shower stall. The tub itself has one of those long stainless steel hoses with shower handle on the end. It’s mounted at around five feet, so one stands under it or pulls the device off the wall and uses it manually or stationary if you’re short. The only problem is that a large amount of water falls outside the tub and lands on the tile floor, which in the scope of things isn’t all that bad either. Vietnamese bathroom floors are laid on a slope to route the water to a drain in the corner of the room. Floor tiles dry quickly in the warm weather. The bath towels were in very good condition if not nearly new, soft and fresh smelling. Pool There is a small pool on the side and toward the back of the hotel. It’s pretty well shaded by the hotel and adjoining buildings. The water water felt cool but I am sure it would be inviting. The tiles near the pool’s coping looked like they needed a good scrubbing as algae was staring to appear. Cafe/Bar There is a cafe/bar on the fourth floor that faces the river. It’s fairly large taking up the entire width of the hotel. Good breezes under a covered patio-like structure. Offers beverages of all sorts and ice creams. Sai Gon Red was 18,000d, 333 was 21,000d, mixed drinks 50,000d and up., etc. On our last day, we noticed they gave us one night free for staying six, an added surprise. Pros Price - Good value for what you get Clean - Can’t fault the room and bath cleanliness, at least for room 301 Spacious - More than adequate room size for price Location - Facing the river and about a half mile west of the central market, Cho Ben Tre. Easy 10-minute walk along the river Breakfast - More than adequate inclusive breakfast. Sorry westerners, no Whoppers or Big Macs here. Strong A/C in the room A fruit plate every night Cons Noisy cafe/bar above third floor rooms. The cacophony doesn’t subside until after 10 PM. If you only speak English, having a conversation will be frustrating at times. Low wattage lighting in the room, especially nightstands by bed, too weak to read at night. Cafe/Bar staff could be more attentive. As a westerner and hotel resident, I wasn’t served promptly, as those coming off the street, which was quite irritating. ============================================================== Between My Tho and Ben Tre, this is was the fourth hotel sampled and arguably the best stay in this area during the last 10 years.

Title: The best of Ben Tre
Review: We very much enjoyed our stay at Ham Luong. Staff were very accommodating and friendly. Our first room was nice, at the front of the hotel facing the river, with a balcony (although the air conditioner's back end was blowing out onto the balcony). The second room was cheaper and absolutely *enormous* with three beds, a small dining area and bathroom. This room opened onto the back of the hotel--no balcony but nice big windows, and the view had its own more down-to-earth charm, looking out onto neighborhoods and backyards. I'd recommend asking to see the rooms before choosing. The hotel has a pool, small spa and decent restaurant with pretty good free breakfast. On the top floor there is a bar/cafe, which was a nice place to have coffee in the late morning or hang out at night. They have a large menu of specialty cocktails as well, some featuring local fruits. We had a decent lunch in the hotel restaurant one day as well. There are certainly better spots in the city, but sometimes it's nice to have something so close by.

Title: Tour đạp xe mini ở Đồng Bằng Sông Cửu Long
Review: Sau khi nghiên cứu nhiều thứ trước khi chọn Garden Homestay này, vị trí của nó đã thắng tay. Yên tĩnh, ngoài đường chính, nhưng cũng dễ dàng đi đến các thị trấn Mỹ Tho và Bến Tre bằng đường cao tốc chính. Hang, người điều hành Homestay, gửi cho tôi thêm hướng dẫn để giúp xác định vị trí và mặc dù tôi đến sớm, hãy để tôi đặt hành lý nhẹ của mình trong phòng trước khi lên xe đạp. Phòng của tôi được trang bị tốt cho nhu cầu của tôi, tủ lạnh với nước, bia và không gian để đặt chai nước của tôi trong ngăn tủ đông để sử dụng trong tương lai. Tất cả mọi thứ đã làm việc khi cần thiết và tôi không có vấn đề gì trong thời gian tôi ở lại. Bữa ăn tối ngon, tươi và truyền thống và nếu muốn, một lựa chọn các loại rượu vang đã có sẵn. Bữa ăn tối có thể được phục vụ bất cứ khi nào phù hợp với bạn, liên lạc tốt đẹp, ăn sáng quá. Như với bất kỳ chỗ ở Homestay nào, các điểm tham quan địa phương, âm thanh và sinh vật của đêm đều tốt hơn rất nhiều so với ô nhiễm tiếng ồn của Hồ Chí Minh, tôi ngủ ngon cả đêm trên chiếc giường thoải mái của mình. Đây là nơi nghỉ dưỡng tuyệt vời nhất mà tôi đã ở lại khi sống ở Việt Nam và rất muốn giới thiệu một chuyến thăm khám phá, một phần đẹp đẽ của đồng bằng sông Cửu Long là gì. Không có gì là quá nhiều rắc rối cho Hang, taxi vào thị trấn, đi chợ với cô ấy, tổ chức tour du lịch, thuê xe đạp và cũng biết nơi tôi có thể lấy xe đạp leo núi của tôi rửa sạch sau 2 ngày trên những con đường lầy lội. Chắc chắn sẽ trở lại với bạn bè và tour du lịch một số chi tiết.

Title: Sharon Foskett

Họ thậm chí không thể đặt đồ uống của tôi trước mặt tôi, họ chỉ đặt nó ở đầu kia của bàn để tôi lấy. Họ thậm chí còn loại bỏ tất cả các gia vị ra khỏi bàn. Một cô phục vụ đang uống với bàn kế bên. Cô sẽ rót bia của họ lấy một ly và uống từ ly sau đó đưa nó cho một trong những người đàn ông. Khi tôi phàn nàn về bữa ăn của họ, họ yêu cầu tôi thanh toán hóa đơn. Nó có giá 214, 000 đồng tôi đã cho 220, 000 và họ không đề nghị thay đổi. Tôi luôn đưa ra một lời khuyên cho dịch vụ tốt nhưng tôi không sẵn sàng trả tiền boa cho dịch vụ kém nhưng dù sao họ cũng tự cho mình một mẹo dù là rất nhỏ. Tôi sẽ không giới thiệu khách sạn này cho người phương Tây nếu bạn là người Việt Nam của bạn.

Title: Was great, until it was bad...
Review: I started out the morning after my stay wanting to give this hotel a 5 star review, primarily because of its location. It’s location is the best! Right next to the river and market (market is one block away) with tons of street vendors around the market come evening time. Breakfast was just alright. Didn’t care for the fried rice but their egg rolls and purple sticky rice were delish. Eggs and omelets available made to order. It suffices before another long day in the Mekong. I can forget the outside noise, the breakfast that’s just alright, the shower head that looks like it’s from the 1960s, and the age of this hotel (the facilities are very old). But I don’t want to get past the morning surprise in the bathroom (see the dead cockroach in the picture, what I woke up to) and, worst of all, when I came down at 5:30am to take a short walk the person whom I assume was the front desk attendant had ALL of the main foyer lights off and was asleep on one of the couches, fan pointed his way, with the front hotel door propped wide open!?!?! Front door security? There basically was none. I found a seat (in the dark, which by itself didn’t bother me) and made a little noise trying to find a working power outlet to finish charging my phone. Not a single move from the sleeping employee... it was evident that I didn’t disturb him. While Ben Tre is seemingly a safe place, I think sleeping night time desk clerks and propped open hotel doors at night isn’t a place I’d prefer to stay, which is sad given its amazing location in the city.

Title: Good hotel, excellent location
Review: We have just spent one night at the Viet Uc hotel and found it very pleasant. The most important thing to stress is the eager friendliness of the staff on the front desk, in the bar and in the restaurant. From information on bus timetables for travel further into the Delta, through producing a pen when the waiter noticed we needed to mark something in our travel guide to another waiter offering to heat up the coffee if we didn't find it hot enough. There was also the waitress keen to improve her English and taking her serving duties so seriously and the door man who gave much helpful information. Our room was bright, fresh, spacious and comfortable and, being on a high floor overlooking the river, we had wonderful views of the river craft and the coconut plantation beyond. There are no English language news programmes on the television, but we have found that elsewhere in the Delta, even in a city with far more foreign tourists. The wifi only works in the public areas on the ground floor and, even there, it was a bit sporadic. We had a good dinner in the restaurant, squid, steamed with ginger and prawns deep fried in coconut batter were the highlights, together with a reasonable bottle of Dalat wine. Breakfast was a little short on fresh fruits, juice or fresh bread, but the Vietnamese offerings were varied and there were good omelettes The hotel is right beside the main market, which is well worth a visit.

Title: Very nice
Review: Had an overnite stay in a superior room overlooking the river.The hotel is brand new,and in a great position.Ben Tre is probably the cleanest Vietnamese city I have visited, and in the day and a half we were there saw maybe 4 foreign tourists. Air con was great, and hotel has fast free wifi and breakfast included. We paid 600.000 dong for a twin room=$27.50 Aud. Very nice relaxing bar on the ground floor where we sampled the cocktail list, the drinks were 50.000 dong=$2.30 Aud The bonus was we booked a tour through the front desk.This tour took 5 hours, included a great lunch with standing Elephant Ear fish, prawns,coconut prawns and iced tea. We visited a brick factory,coconut candy factory, travelled in a boat, canoe, and had a great bicycle ride through villages, all flat easy riding. Morning tea was fresh fruits and honey tea with a musical performance by a small local group,great fun. Cost for the tour including lunch/morning tea and a coconut drink stop was $25 each, bargain. A nice untouristy part of the Mekong Delta.

Title: Great hotel. Great price.
Review: The Viet Uc hotel opened two months ago, so it is brand new and not yet on the map for travelers. We made the reservation through the hotel's own website. The first thing you notice when you walk into the hotel is that it is probably the fanciest building in Ben Tre. In fact, if the hotel would be in the US/Canada, it would be the equivalent of a Marriott or Sheraton -- huge rooms, king size beds, big flat screen TVs, a really hot shower, room service, mini bar, and a strong AC. In addition there are two bars (one on the roof), a restaurant, and even a small gym. Back home this would cost more than $150/night. Here, however, it costs $25/night for the "standard room," which is far more than standard for rooms in South East Asia at this price range. The rate also came with a buffet breakfast which was made up of Vietnamese dishes and omelets made to order. There are some kinks that need to be worked out, given that this is a new hotel. For example, only the front desk staff speaks English. Also, there were some ants in our room. Overall, given the price and quality of other hotels in Ben Tre, this is a great find!

Title: Vẫn đang tìm thấy niche của nó?
Review: Tôi ở lại đây qua đêm như một phần của một nhóm du lịch, sau một chuyến đi trong ngày ở đồng bằng sông Cửu Long, và trước khi quay trở lại TP HCM vào sáng hôm sau (khoảng 1. 5 - 2 giờ lái xe). Tôi cảm thấy rằng khu nghỉ mát này vẫn đang tìm được chỗ đứng của mình. Nó được đặt trên một tài sản rất lớn, và các phòng bao gồm các tòa nhà riêng lẻ, gần giống như một cabin. Phòng sạch sẽ mặc dù một chút vô trùng với sàn gạch, và các phòng chia sẻ đội đã có giường đôi nhưng họ đã rất vững chắc. Hồ bơi khá đẹp và một con sông nhỏ chạy dọc theo hồ bơi và khu vực lễ tân. Nhược điểm của nơi này là có rất ít tiếng Anh trong số các nhân viên và không có nơi nào trong khoảng cách đi bộ để đi đến. Nhà hàng của khách sạn không mở cửa như vậy, mặc dù cuối cùng đã đồng ý làm một số bữa ăn. Các khu vực ăn sáng là khó tìm, vì nó là tôi là một khu vực khác nhau để mô tả trong thư mục khách sạn trong phòng. Các bữa ăn sáng là nhỏ, nhưng có trái cây tươi, bánh mì, sữa chua cùng với các trạm pho và trứng. Có vẻ như không có nhiều khách, nhưng đó có thể là giữa tuần. Tôi cảm thấy rằng khu nghỉ mát này có rất nhiều tiềm năng nếu nó có thể tìm thấy thích hợp của nó. Tôi nghĩ rằng nếu bạn là một người dân địa phương ở TP HCM thì đây sẽ là một nơi thư giãn và ấm cúng để nghỉ ngơi cuối tuần, tuy nhiên nó chưa thực sự được phục vụ cho một thị trường du lịch phương Tây.

Title: Experience a real Vietnamese hotel
Review: We stayed for 4 nights and had a huge, spotlessly clean room with a veranda overlooking the gardens. The bathroom was well equipped and huge too. This hotel is popular with the Vietnamese and so things are not necessarily to Western tastes (although the staff will do everything they can to be accommodating) but we prefer to be somewhere with local influence. The meals in the vast dining room were excellent. Again, truly Vietnamese. The cost was reasonable (and for drinks and outings). A "small" food portion does for 2 people. The breakfasts again reflected Vietnamese taste, so the juices were a bit sugary for us. I expect if we had asked our excellent waiter he would have arranged freshly squeezed. However, the Vietnamese options (soup, cold meats, etc) were delicious. The management worked really hard to make our stay enjoyable and some speak good English. We enjoyed boat trips out to see fire flies at night, an evening trip to watch the kingfishers and taxi rides to Ben Tre market (about £10 to get into town). If you want a standard international resort this is not for you. As a previous writer said, it is a little rough around the edges but it offers a real Vietnamese experience. Once the swimming pool is built (currently under construction) it will offer more appeal as the rooms are not full. Beautiful new bungalows are being constructed on the Mekong itself. We would stay here again and wish the managers success.

Title: Diamond in the Rough
Review: My wife and I have traveled to Vietnam frequently the last few years. I visit family in Ben Tre and usually stay at the Viet Uc. We skipped last year and returned this year and traveled with some of our closest friends. We needed several rooms and the Viet Uc could not accommodate our party. We found this resort online and elected to give it try, and my review is as titled. Here are the "rough edges". The resort advertised a pool, sorry no pool, but one will be coming in 2016 and the resort is remote. The check-in process was a fiasco, but I will say that we had four (4) groups trying to check-in and our group was tired, exhausted, and hot (from a day long bike tour). Regardless, all of the reservations were incorrect (booked online through Agoda). In addition, there was a severe language barrier that added to the confusion. Here are the moments of "shining brilliance". The rooms were clean, roomy, and nicely equipped to be cool. The food and food service was really good especially the rice porridge and Pho. The karaoke bar was amazing and the bikes with their pedaling generating lights were cool in the evening. The concrete paths were nice to walk or ride a bike. The resort was well maintained and well manicured. Overall, the resort had its challenges, but in the end we enjoyed the resort and we are planning to return next year.

Title: Pretty setting, remote location, severe service issues
Review: The good stuff: rooms are large and clean, and the garden setting is nice and peaceful, if a bit smoky from the proprietors burning coconut shells to keep the mosquitoes away. If you are looking for a more remote setting, this is nice place to relax in peace and quiet. Beware, there is NOTHING to eat around here but a big Pho place on the side of a major highway. The guest does house offer dinner, but it's a menu they choose and seemed pricey for Vietnam (price $5-8pp). The bad stuff: we booked on Agoda, and when we arrived, the owner refused to honor the rate. She claimed that Agoda didn't have her rates correct, and that we would have to pay $5 more for the room we booked, which had AC. Given that she had our passports, that we'd already paid Agoda, and that there weren't any other options around due to the remote location, we felt very uncomfortable, with no choice but to accept. Frankly, if Agoda has her rates wrong, that is up to her to fix with Agoda and is not the customer's problem. I am also fairly certain this violates the contractual obligations she has to us and Agoda. Second issue was that we were kicked out of our room so that they could hang a mirror in there. They just showed up at the door and said, "you need to get out so we can hang this mirror." They didn't even give us a minute to change, use the restroom, or grab some stuff before barging in. I have no idea why that couldn't have been done before we arrived, or after we checked out. Finally, the breakfast: there was fruit (some of it not ripe), cheese, butter, jam ... and no bread. We had to wait almost 20 minutes for bread to arrive. There were also ants all over the can of condensed milk served with coffee. The breakfast issues were rather small on their own and not worthy of a bad score, but taken with the big issues, there is much room for improvement here. The owner seems like nice lady and is proud to have visitors from all over the world, but I can't in good faith give a good score here when we've had so many other truly wonderful experiences in Vietnam that far surpass this place.

Title: Excellent homestay in authentic Vietnam
Review: The Mekong Cycle Rest is a wonderful place for an excellent price. If you want to be part of an authentic piece of Vietnam, you should really go there. It is not only a wonderful homestay, it's the family that makes your stay really special and unique! Lovely people, amazing nature, delicious traditional food. Highly recommended if you want to visit the Mekong Delta on your own! ----- (For more information, read below) ----- Mekong Cycle Rest is very easy to get to. It's an hour busdrive from Ben Tre (which is a 2hour bus drive from HCMC). We took the bus from HCM City with bus company Minh Tâm (AC and WiFi). In Ben Tre we decided to leave our luggage at the company and visit the city centre of Ben Tre. If you come from HCM city, their is nothing really new to find here, except for the experience that Western people seem to be rather uncommon here. The locals were suprised and happy to see us, which encouraged us in our joy of having found a spot that is not coverred with tourism. You also witness the fact that the markets with all the clothes, electronics, etc., in short, the markets with all the stuff, exist independently from tourists. From Ben Tre you can take the public bus, line number 8 (it's a white bus with yellow and red) that goes to the Cho Lac region (where the homestay is located). Don't waste time on searching for a bus stop. Just make sure to be on a good and visible spot on the side of the road and when your bus approaches, start waving, cheering and jumping until the bus comes in your direction. Don't expect Western public transportation. We loved the seemingly chaotic but actually well-managed world inside the (what Vietnamese call) 'chickenbus'. Bicycles, bags with food, us as Western backpackers, elderly, young families, everybody and everything was stuffed on that bus. Oh and don't worry, just sit down and wait until the 'bus-manager' comes to you and shows you how much you should pay. On our first ride we paid 20.000 VND per person, our second ride 40.000 VND (the bus manager charged extra for our luggage). Enjoy your view as you drive further and further into the Mekong Delta. Tan, our contact of the homestay, talked to the busdriver (through our telephone) so he could drop us of at the right spot. Two motorbikes were already waiting for us to pick us up. We arrived, had a warm welcome, took a shower and were guided to a feast of traditional Vietnamese food! The mother of the family kept bringing new dishes, all well balanced in taste, all prepared with care. As hungry as we were after our trip, we could not possibly eat it all! And just when you thought no more dishes would follow, some fresh and sweet pineapple was brought to loosen up our stomaches. WOW! Next day we borrowed two Vietnamese bicycles and just got lost in the Mekong Delta. What we already witnessed in Ben Tre was intensified here. Every motorbike that passed us looked back, smiled, waved, children called their parents, and we could only laugh, smile back and fall deeper and deeper in love with Vietnam. We biked and biked, through palm trees, lime trees, banana trees, every road brought new senses. Suddenly you stumble upon a catholic church, then again you hit the main road that enables you to shortly orientate before diving under again in the narrow streets and Vietnamese houses. There are plenty of small shops that are glad to sell you food and water, so you should not worry about that. Moreover, our host wrote a small note for us, that we treasured in our pocket for when we would like to return home. Everybody in the neighborhood knows the proud, noble and gentle former farmer that he is. A bit past noon, when the rising temperature started to weigh on us, we returned home, only to find the entire family united. We played foot-shuttlecock, tried to learn some Vietnamese, played cards, laughed together, ate together and drank together. Our days in heaven were complete! When we left, Tan made sure we could continue our trip safely. He called Minh Tâm for us and told them where to pick us up so we could get to HCM City on schedule. Also during the trip he stayed in touch, to make sure everything was going well.

Title: Great homestay in rural Vietnam
Review: This is a great homestay that is located off the beaten tourist path. I think most people say there as part of a cycle tour. I got there after checking the online reviews - though I didn't realised how far it was from Ben Tre (the town I wanted to visit). I was slightly shocked when I realised it, but in the end I was glad I found this place instead. It really is a place to explore rural Vietnam. - The room is simple (bed, desk, chair and fan), but the bed is very comfortable. - Shared toilets and showers are outside the rooms. - The food is great - the potions for lunch and dinners were big, and very tasty. The surrounding area is lovely, and a great way to explore the real rural Vietnam, without being touristy. Either walk the little path or ask for a bike - I got one of their bikes to cycle around. It was fun and a great experience. Finally, the family who owns the homestay is just so friendly. I felt welcome, and while no one spoke English as their son Tan was away, we still managed to communicate using phones. After my first dinner we were trying to teach each other some English and Vietnamese. It was a great experience, and loved my stay. In the end I was lucky to get there - without contacting them to book the place I would have never ever stopped in this beautiful area. Saying that, if you take the bus from Ben Tre make sure the conductor speaks to Tan so you can get off the bus at the right stop (approximate an hour from Ben Tre).

Title: Great Mekong Home Stay
Review: We stayed at Mekong Cycle Rest over night, whilst on a 3 day bicycle tour of the Mekong region. This area is very pretty and interesting with lots of small canals and irrigation channels growing loads of coconuts, rice, and local fruits. The family who own and run the place are extemely friendly (but thankfully not constantly in your face), and provide some wonderful local food and hospitality. Its a great authentic, and friendly feeling home stay with a few of the simple comforts you may not get off the beaten track. organised by Indochina Countryside Travel.

Các thành viên gia đình làm việc ở đó và họ rất lịch sự và tốt đẹp. Chỉ một người nói tiếng Anh. Thức ăn rất ngon và giá cả tốt, và chủ nhân, người rất tốt, sẽ giúp bạn cho mọi thứ bạn cần và thậm chí có thể bán cho bạn chuyến du lịch tuyệt vời mà không có khách du lịch nhưng bạn (55 U $ cho 2 người). Tất cả các xung quanh bạn có thể đi bộ hoặc xe đạp hoặc xe máy trong con đường nhỏ trong rừng dừa, jack ba, rừng ngập mặn và như vậy. Đối với chúng tôi nó rất đẹp.

Nó có thể được sạch hơn (mạng nhện, thanh toán bù trừ kính ra khỏi bảng cùng ngày) và chăm sóc tốt hơn cho nói chung (lỗ hổng trong lưới muỗi và trong các tờ). Chỉ có hai điểm dừng kể từ khi chúng tôi đã nhìn thấy thứ ba, nhưng không có thay thế cho điều này. Ngoài ra nó ngắn hơn rất nhiều so với thông báo ngay cả khi bỏ qua điểm dừng thứ ba. Trên hết, anh đã thất vọng vì chúng tôi không muốn đi tour du lịch bằng xe đạp sau đó vì anh vẫn tiếp tục vui vẻ với chúng tôi vì muốn thư giãn. Tóm lại, tiềm năng là có nhưng họ đã có một số việc phải làm. Làm cho nơi này đẹp hơn một chút và nâng cấp dịch vụ lên những kỳ vọng bạn định hình. Nếu bạn nói khách hàng là vua, đứng theo lời của bạn, tôn trọng hiển thị và cung cấp cho số tiền bạn yêu cầu.

Title: Most authentic Ben Tre experience

Title: Awesome place for an authentic experience in the Mekong Delta
Review: This is really a family-owned business - we got to meet the 3 generations and they were all so genuinely kind and helpful, always smiling. The grandma cooked us the best meals (so much food!), the Mom (who's a tour guide) took us on the most beautiful and interesting boat and bike tours. The place is not easy to find (small village 6km south from Ben Tre) - the best is to book in advance or call the host when you arrive in Ben Tre (tel: 0945619395 or 0982816752) and they'll come get you in moto bike. The rooms/bungalows are basic but it's all you need for a few days in nature - and you pay less than $15 per night per person for the room, dinner and breakfast! We had the whole place for ourselves and just loved it - it's just so peaceful and the family so sweet. Highly recommended - way better than staying in the city center and probably our most authentic experience in the Mekong Delta.

Title: Ben Tre Boat Tour
Review: We haven't stayed in this house, but met the family during our 3-hour boat tour around Ben Tre. We randomly met the father around the night market, who offered us a boat tour for the next day, led by his daughter. The tour was great, she was super nice and informative. We sailed along the main canal for a while, then visited a coconut factory, where she explained how people work there. Later we entered a smaller canal and done a 15min walk on the shore along small canals, gardens and coconut trees. It was really beautiful. That's when we visited this homestay on our way, where we got a coconut drink for refreshment (we were offered lunch as well at the booking, but we didn't want to eat that early). It turned out that our tour guide's mother served us and this was their house. They were both super nice and the home looked awesome too! After the break, we walked back to an even smaller little canal, where we were picked up by paddling boats and cruised along the tiny canal, back to our boat on the bigger one. It was really beautiful and peaceful, no other tourists, just local fishermen and lots of coconut trees. The tour ended where we started, next to the main bridge in the city. We all loved the tour and recommend it to anyone who wants to discover Ben Tre in private. (Their contacts: Ms Duyen 0945.619.395 or Ms Dung 0982.816.752)

Title: Großartig!! Die hilfsbereitersten Menschen, die ich Vietnam getroffen habe.

Ich bin hier seit drei Tagen und wollte eigentlich nur eine Nacht bleiben und am nächsten Tag die Bootstour machen, bin aber dann sehr krank geworden. Und ich kenne niemanden, der sich mit mehr Hingabe um mich gekümmert hätte, als dieses Familie. Sie fragen mich, ob ich etwas brauche, bringen mir Tee ans Bett, holen von den Nachbarn Eis zum Kühlen, haben mir meine motorbike abgekauft, und transportiert mich jetzt noch nach Ho-Chi-Minh zurück, damit ich meinen Flug nach Hause kriege. Überall sind Palmen, durch die das Sonnenlicht scheint. Der Raum ist sehr einfach, aber sauber. Morgens, mittags und abends habe ich ein ganzes Gänge Menü aufgetischt bekommen: mit Flussfisch, selbstgemachten Kokosnusssüßigkeiten, Meeresfrüchten, Frühlingsrollen, Bananenblütenkuchen und vielem drum und dran. ich habe nicht auch nur einmal die Hälfte geschafft, aber das was ich gegessen habe, war super lecker. Die Mutter der Familie spricht sehr gut Englisch und die kleine 5 jährige Tochter ist super süß und kontaktoffen. Ich kann jedem nur empfehlen hierherzukommen, auch wenn es bei Tripadvisor bisher nicht so viele Infos drüber gibt! Liebe Grüße - Lili

Title: Great experience
Review: My boyfriend and I stayed at the floating houses for 3 nights. During our stay in June we were the only guests which was nice in a way but quite isolating too. The huts themselves are really set in beautiful surrounding away from the hustle and bustle of my tho. They are pretty basic but have some space to sit outside and watch the sunset. The bed seemed a little dirty at times but all in all we were expecting quite a simple room so were happy. Next we decided to organise some tours and the hotel manager put us in touch with a recommended tour guide. We then set about bartering a price for trips to the floating markets and exploring the mekong. Having travelled around a lot of south east Asia we were to haggling for a good price but being in such an isolated setting without any alternative means of transport we were forced to accept. There was a bad feeling about the whole deal. My boyfriend also requested to try snake traditionally prepared as part of our tour deal but this request was completely ignored and instead we were taken to a zoo to see snaked kept in very small cages.. Something neither of us enjoyed in the slightest! The tour took place on motorbike and fortunately my boyfriend had some experience of this as the trips were rather long passing through very busy towns which were not warned of. The guide spoke little to no English and despite being promised excellent food we were taken to a cheap local restaurant where meals cost a couple of dollars (we wouldn't mind this normally but given the amount of money paid we expected more). As part of the tour price we were arrange a bus to our next stop in mui ne. That morning the guide arrived late and separated my boyfriend and I on different bikes along with our massive bags and we were driven several km to the side of a motorway. Earlier in the morning our hotel owner served us no breakfast promising us that our guide would provide it. This never materialised. We were put on a public bus for hours next to a bag of chickens. In the end the bus only took us to phan thiet and we made a very frustrating journey to mui ne. All in all this would be a great stay for one night but avoid the tours and organise you own transport to leave!

The owner decides the menu (tastes mostly all right though). He only tell you what it is when he is asked. All in all we can't recommend the place.

Title: Not worth the (even small) money
Review: The Mekong Floating House is the nice idea to stay in huts on the river and there might have been good times for that venture. The interior is good enough and might be enough, but it was dirty and neglected. When we arrived there was still garbage from other guests in the bin. Title: Unforgettable experience on the Mekong river!
Review: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Mekong floating house for two nights in December during our trip in South Vietnam. The place consists of 5 bamboo houses with bedroom, bathroom, shower and terrace, away from the chaotic traffic and the noise of the city of My Tho. You'll need a boat to take you from My Tho's pier and the transfer takes just about 15 minutes. As some other reviews say, there are not many comforts or things to do there but that's exactly the concept behind a place so peaceful and secluded. The host is great and can help you arrange trips on the main land as well as give you good advice on your itinerary. We suggest you ask for a motorbike trip to Tra Vihn: the scenery is wonderful and you won't meet other tourists along the road. The host is also so kind he would bargain the price for you when booking boats or trips and you pay directly to him thus reducing the chances of a rip off. Breakfast and dinner are served on the terrace: the food is very good and plenty while the sunset on the River gives you the best background you could ask for. The landscape is stunning and if you go for a walk on the island you'll have the chance to see real life. The price is a bit higher when compared to other accommodations but it's totally worth it and we both agree we would definitely recommend it to everyone!

Title: indimenticabile!!!!!!!
Review: Location a dir poco stupenda, sul Mekong. La casa è interamente fatta di legno e bamboo, persino il mobilio. Ogni casetta ha un terrazzino con tavolo e sedie dove poter mangiare godendosi il panorama. Cibo: abbiamo avuto un'ottima cena, la migliore fra le nostre tappe nel Mekong, con tre antipasti (gamberi, pollo e ravioli di gamberi al vapore), un piatto di pesce gatto caramellato, verdure saltate in padella, riso e frutta. Non essendo un albergo nè tantomeno un ristorante, il menu è fisso e il proprietario va personalmente a comprare il cibo, per cui non è possibile improvvisare una cena. Credo però sia comprensibile e accettabile, visto che si tratta di una floating house su un'isola quasi disabitata e molto piccola. Per colazione abbiamo mangiato pane e uova strapazzate con il bacon, e un succo di mela con caffè. Tutto super squisito! Personale: il proprietario parla un ottimo inglese (cosa pressoché inesistente nel resto del Mekong), è molto cordiale, gentile e premuroso nel dare ottimi consigli. Per il nostro viaggio è stato fondamentale. Questo luogo è adatto per chi cerca un soggiorno di totale relax e pace lontano da folle di turisti. Se si vogliono organizzare delle escursioni, si può parlare direttamente con il proprietario oppure, come abbiamo fatto noi, organizzarle preventivamente con altre persone prima di arrivare alla floating house. Dovessimo ritornare nel Mekong, sicuramente torneremo in questo luogo fantastico. Si può parlare di prezzi, di comodità o di altre cose, ma quello che è fuori discussione è che dormire sul Mekong è un'esperienza unica che non ha prezzo, e non abbiamo trovato nulla di vagamente simile a questo.

Title: Une prison en bambou
Review: Hormis le concept original de maison flottante en bambou, la tranquilité qu'offre cet hébergement, et les 2 excursions proposées, il existe plusieurs inconvénients qui ont troublés notre séjour de 2 nuits... Tout d'abord, sachez qu'il n'y a pas d'eau chaude. Ensuite, l'hôtel est extrêmement isolé. Pour vous y rendre et en partir vous aurez obligation d'adhérer au transfert proposé par l'établissement pour un prix exorbitant (800.000 VND aller retour, pour 10 minutes de moto taxi et 4 minutes de bateau, sans compter le transfert HCM/Ben Tre par bus). Tenez-en compte dans votre budget, car cela dissimule en réalité une nuit supplémentaire à payer... Une fois dans votre chambre il n'y a absolument rien à faire : vous êtes loin de toute civilisation, loin des restaurants et bar (donc obligation de manger à l'hôtel, les repas sont peu copieux avec un mauvais rapport qualité/prix), pas de distributeurs et l'hôtel n'accepte pas les cartes bleues (donc prévoyez le budget car nous avons dû repayer un transfert pour aller en ville retirer). Nous avons souffert d'un cruel manque de communication avec l'équipe (personne ne parlait français, et anglais très difficilement) d'où des temps d'attente très longs, à ne rien faire dans le bungalow, peu d'explications sur les 2 excursions proposées. Le repos n'était donc même pas très appréciable car nous avions l'impression d'être "en prison" sur cette petite île sans rien à faire. Les excursions durent 2 heures chacune donc le temps est long... D'autre part, contrairement à ce qui est inscrit sur le site booking.com : pas de navette pour l'aéroport, pas de possibilité de locations de vélo par "l'hôtel". Quant à la tranquillité, certes vous êtes (trop) loin de la civilisation, mais vous serez réveillés toute la nuit par les bateaux, les coqs, les chiens. Bref, c'est le seul hôtel de notre séjour d'1 mois au Vietnam que nous ne recommandons pas.

Title: Charmant mais piège financier !!!!! Attention....
Review: Une précision au sujet de cet hôtel cumulant du positif et du négatif ! Nous avions été attirés par la description ( site AGODA) d'un "petit paradis" à Ben Tre, donc à 70 km environ de la folie de Ho Chi Minh City: 5 "radeaux-maisons" sur le fleuve, construites en matériaux naturels, respect de la nature, calme, dépaysement. Les réservations ont été payées d'avance, prix correct avec petit-déjeuner. Les surprises viennent après avec pas mal de "non compris obligatoires dans le prix" à rajouter !!! 1- Hôtel sur une petite ile, accessible uniquement par bateau-taxi, envoyé (mais pas gratuitement, ce n'est pas une navette!) par le propriétaire (pensez à avoir son téléphone sinon c'est la galère pour trouver quelqu'un qui connait). Ce taxi est donc PAYANT et CHER (on n'a pas le choix!). Pour le retour, pareil. 2- Repas imposé car il n'y a rien d'autre dans le coin -ni sur la petite ile du tout- je pense :assez cher selon les normes locales: 10$ plus les boissons, qui elles sont hors de prix pour le Vietnam. Repas peu copieux (même léger) mais bon et agréablement servi sur la terrasse privative par un serveur adorable. Aux dires du patron, ce serait un repas extraordinaire comprenant les spécialités du Mekong, nous n'en avons pas eu vraiment l'impression, c'était bon mais peu original. Points positifs à souligner: l'ambiance magique sur le fleuve, c'est vrai ! Le calme (sauf au petit jour avec les moteurs des marchands qui partent au marché, mais c'est la vie locale), un concept innovant, bien conçu, privilégiant l'écologie, de très jolies maisons en bambou, des jacinthe d'eau en fleurs séparant les maisons-radeaux, la gentillesse du personnel. Un monde hors du monde. C'est très beau. Patron francophone. Points négatifs: Sur une ile inaccessible, un hôtel inconnu des gens de la ville (et de l'office du tourisme aussi). Accessible uniquement par bateau-taxi, Suspicion de la part du patron (frisant la paranoïa) au sujet de nos passeports (nous n'avions que des photocopies et pas le numéro de visa). C'est la 1è fois au Vietnam que l'on nous fait peur avec la police qui parait-il vérifie tout. Mais miracle, tout s'arrange (grâce au propriétaire qui nous dit-il, connait bien l'officier etc...) Rien à faire que de profiter du coucher de soleil (magnifique) et de la beauté du site: une nuit suffit sauf si on a une envie de farniente terrible ! Dernier point, plus personnel: en rentrant de vacances, de retour à Bora Bora, nous avons par l’intermédiaire du site Agoda, offert à nos enfants, vivant à Ho Chi Minh City, un week-end quelques semaines plus tard. L'amie de mon fils avait oublié son passeport. Elle est Allemande mais d'origine Vietnamienne: est-ce pour ça que eux -un Français avec un physique d'étranger et une Allemande avec un physique de Vietnamienne- ont été refoulés alors que nous -deux Français avec des têtes bien occidentales donc de "vrais touristes"- pourtant sans passeport (nous avions juste une photocopie) et sans numéro de visa, nous avions pu rester ? Résultat, ils sont repartis en pleine nuit et en mobylette chez eux à 70km... Aucune proposition du propriétaire de remettre à plus tard ce beau week-end raté. Bon, admettons, c'est une erreur de leur part. Mais plusieurs courriers au propriétaire pour lui demander de reporter ce week-end sont restés sans réponse et ça, c'est inadmissible. Nous avons payé à l'avance, une réponse à nos courriers aurait été la moindre courtoisie. Cet hôtel est rayé de mes tablettes, nous trouverons d'autres lieux aussi beaux au Vietnam !

Title: Not at all like the lovely photos
Review: Based on the great reviews and photos, we booked into this place. Only once we got there, we were informed of all the limitations/restrictions: - Hot water only from 8am to 5pm (forget about a quick shower before bed after a hot day - this is the Mekong and it gets hot...) - once you are in the cabin, you are basically confined there - forget about going for a walk other than about 2 minutes to the restaurant, which probably will not be open anyway. The path which goes along the water edge of the island is less than 1m/3ft wide and you'll be constantly running into barking dogs and people watching you from their yards which are right beside the trail. - As for water sports, the only thing you can do is swim in the brown water... - If you want to sleep, bring along ear plugs AND sound reduction ear protectors as the river boats run all night long, and they are VERY LOUD, often with shouting and banging happening right outside your floating cabin. You'll need double hearing protection if you want to sleep. - Confirm in advance that the special (and rather over-priced) food is actually available. You may discover that they did not stock up enough and the menu is limited to some instant noodles. And, bring your own water unless you enjoy paying 3x the normal price for hotel bottled water. It looks lovely, but you really need to know what you are getting into...

Les lessives sont chères, ici on paye à la pièce et non au kilo, ca revient presque 2x plus cher que dans la plupart des autres hôtels. Pas de restaurant à l'hôtel mais il y en a aux alentours. Petit détail, il y a des travaux juste à côté en ce moment, donc réveil à 7h quasi certain (mais pas avant). Très bon rapport qualité / prix. Quite good location, not so far from the Mekong river. Staff speaks quite poor English but ok for basic stuff (check-in, check-out, drinks, laundry...). Clean room, sheets and towels. Bathroom ok, hot water and good pressure. AC ok. Laundry quite expansive. No restaurant in the hotel but some just near of it. Construction work in progress just in front of the hotel, so wake up at 7 AM guaranteed (but not earlier). Good value for money.

Title: Mittagsstop mitten im Mekong-Delta
Review: Im Rahmen eines Tagesausfluges im Mekong-Deltas machten wir nach einiger Bootstouren über den Mekong und seinen Seitenkanälen zum Mittag halt in dem Restaurant dieses Hotels. Wir erreichten diesen Ort per Jeep. Andere Tagesgäste waren und kamen auch in dieses Restaurant. Es wurde der Reisegruppe gezeigt wie man auf vietnamesischer Art Fische aus kleinen Bächen bzw. Kanälen schnell fischt. Dieser wurde dann zubereitet und als einer Hauptgänge zum Mittag serviert. Wir hatten hier in einem offenen, aber überdachten Restaurant, ein mehrgängiges Mittagessen: - Zunächst wurde vor unseren Augen frische vietnamesische Crepes gefüllt mit frischen Gemüse und Saucen zubereitet. - Danach gab es eine vietnamesische Gemüsesuppe und Frühlingsrollen. - Dann der zubereitete, gegrillte Fisch - Tempora - fritiertes Gemüse, Reis, Nudeln, verschiedene Fleisch- und Gemüsezubereitungen als Beilage - Rohe,vietnamesische Frühlingsrolle, die ebenfalls für uns frisch zubereitet wurde. - Sowie regionales Obst als Nachtisch Nach dem Mittag ging es über weitere Kanäle weiter bis zur großen Stadt Ben Tre, wo unser Reisebus uns bis zum nächsten Hotel weiterfuhr. Die Umgebung hier im Mekong-Delta ist noch sehr Naturbelassen. Also Mücken- und Sonnenschutz erforderlich. Gelegentlich kann es hier auch regnen, d. h. eine Regenjacke sollte ebenfalls mitgenommen werden. Mir hat das Mittagessen hier sehr gut gefallen, und obwohl ich Rohkost gegessen hatte, gab es keine körperlichen Probleme nach dem Essen.

Title: Tolles - echtes Homestay

Title: Very nice and enjoyable
Review: I've stayed at a handful of hotels in Vietnam and sometimes in the smaller cities it's hard to find a place that shares the same comforts of home. The Hoang Ngoc hotel has been one of the nicer places I've stayed. When I arrived I had reserved a cheaper room which I wanted a bigger bed so got a different room with no hassle. The manager Ngoc was very helpful and a pleasure. The cafe had free breakfast included and was very tasty. The sitting area and kitchen were very clean. The room I stayed in was the deluxe king bed which was fabulous. It had a small sitting area and a very large bed with extra pillows and large duvet. The bathroom was very clean and the shower worked perfect. I have found in other hotels the shower not working easily and after a long day of riding I feel the shower is the most important thing at the end of the day. Overall i had a great 2 day stay and will definitely be staying here on my next trek! Thank you Ngoc!

Title: Acceptable - good base to visit the beautiful area
Review: We stayed there one night as part of a tour in the area. We had no expectations and were neither disappointed nor thrilled. Location: good - on main road in town (unfortunate if your room faces the street) Service: Staff speak almost no English (nor French) but try their best to communicate. Room: spacious, reasonably clean. Beds are hard (as in most places). A/C, WI-FI and a fridge. Old-fashioned. Bathroom: basic but enough hot water for both of us to shower...warning: as in most places we went to in the area:just a shower head and no receiver so expect to flood the whole bathroom. The sink has no drain tube - everything goes directly to the floor... No meals served. There is a restaurant across the street that serves "hot pot" a typical and popular dish. For breakfast there is a "bakery" right next door and coffee shops close to the market. There are also a number of simple restaurant serving vietnamese breakfast within walking distance. Definitely not a "nice" hotel but acceptable in northern Vietnam standards. Serves its purpose if you only plan to stay in the room to sleep and shower.

Title: Hotels a Dong Van
Review: Contrairement à ce qui écrit sur ce forum (j'ai meme lu un titre du forum "Désolé, pas d'hotels à Dong Van" mais je ne sais pas comment corrigé ça), il y a de plus en plus d'hotels dans ce bourg de plus en plus visité ; il est vrai qu'aucun ne sort de l'ordinaire. En plus du Hoang Ngoc et du Cao Nguyen Da, il y a le charmant Hai Hien, presqu'en face du Hoang Ngoc, et le très simple mais propre Kieu Hoan, sur la meme rue principale. A noter que ce forum liste quelque part des "hotels à coté de Dong Van" comme le Trong Xuan à Ha Giang ; je n'appellerais pas "à coté" la ville de Ha Giang, qui est à 5 heures de route de Dong Van ! Si vous voulez bien "à coté", alors c'est la belle Auberge de Meo Vac à Meo Vac (voir critiques sur ce forum), 30 km à l'est de Dong Van (mais cette petite ville n'a pas le charme de Dong Van, dont le marché du dimanche est exceptionnel (plus la vue fantastique de toute la région du haut du pic derrìere le marché,au sommet duquel se trouve le vieux fort français de Pho Lu)

Title: Start looking here
Review: Welcome to Ha Giang province folks.You'll be glad you made the effort. You don't need a guide for the walks around Dong Van! Read below. This hotel had the best, friendliest, knowledgeable and helpful staff in the whole town. For trekking information they have maps on the wall which explain everything so you can self guide and explore without a local 'guide'. All information is in the entrance. This hotel is a fantastic place to start. Back to the guides in the town. If you meet one and think that the fees are higher than a guide in your own country - you are probably right. So, you can self guide. Try this revolutionary process... 1. Googlle maps 2. Type Dong Van, Ha Giang 3. Zoom in. 4. Print. Now you can enjoy 2 great walks. Anyone can EASILY walk either in a day. The circle track to the north is a wide and open path through 5-6 villages, more if you deviate. You'll see incredible views, i really mean incredible. The canyonous gorge on China.s border is quite spectacular. There are lots of locals around to point the way and interact with. It's safe, interesting and rewarding. You could try to 'homestay' but we had zero regrets sleeping back in Dong Van. You'll see. The second walk is to the south west of Dong Van. Walk the main road toward Ha Giang town, turn left after 2 or 3 k's at the small lake/dam up the hill. Use your map. This walk passes a surreal valley and village at the end. You can double back or loops if you follow the workers mountain train.Enjoy your hikes. Dong Van is booming and won't be the retreat it is for long. This hotel was often booked. We also stayed in a private house. There are many in town but we got lucky and scored our own full house. On the street to THE coffee shop there was a CHEAP!! dorm like place above a clothes shop. You get what you pay for. The motorbike - scooter ride to Meo Vac was glorious. The Hmong palace is unique stop. The Sunday markets in Dong Van and MeoVac.... wow!

Title: Clean and comfortable

Title: Khách sạn cơ bản và đơn giản
Review: Ưu điểm: phòng khách sạn là cơ bản và đơn giản, với giường đẹp, sạch sẽ và thoải mái. Đó là quan trọng. Vị trí thuận tiện, nhà hàng tốt gần kề. Nhược điểm: khách sạn nằm trên tầng 2 nên chúng tôi phải leo lên một tầng cầu thang. Không phải là một vấn đề nhưng một thành viên trong gia đình chúng tôi bị chấn thương đầu gối nên đó là một vấn đề đối với anh ấy. Khi chúng tôi đăng ký, được thông báo rằng chúng tôi phải trả lệ phí giấy phép có giá 15 USD mỗi người để đi bộ quanh thị trấn cho người nước ngoài. Điều này thật nực cười và khi chúng tôi từ chối, họ đe dọa chúng tôi sẽ bị cảnh sát ngăn chặn và thẩm vấn. Chúng tôi hỏi xung quanh, và mọi người nói với chúng tôi rằng giấy phép không còn cần thiết cho người nước ngoài vì nó đã được gỡ bỏ. Cuối cùng, phòng khách sạn của chúng tôi đã được đặt với bữa sáng và họ nói với chúng tôi bữa sáng được phục vụ từ 6 giờ sáng vì chúng tôi phải rời đi sớm, chúng tôi có mặt lúc 630 giờ và người chuẩn bị bữa sáng vẫn chưa bắt đầu làm việc. Chúng tôi hỏi lễ tân và anh ấy nói bắt đầu lúc 7 giờ sáng. Dù sao, khá nhiều vấn đề giao tiếp với quầy lễ tân. Nhìn chung, đừng mong đợi nhiều ở quận này, miễn là phòng và giường sạch sẽ và thoải mái, chúng tôi đều ổn.

Title: Giường thoải mái và máy lạnh

Anh ấy đã giúp chúng tôi, là khách của anh ấy, với phương tiện giao thông cá nhân từ Hà Giang về Hà Nội với một mức giá rất phải chăng.

Title: Attention aux punaises de lit !
Review: Nous avons été conseillés, mon copain et moi, par l’entremise de l’agence avec laquelle nous avons réservés nos scooters pour faire la boucle de Ha Giang de rester à cet hôtel lors de notre passage à Dong van. Bel accueil et bel emplacement (a deux pas du marché) et on nous donne le choix pour la chambre (350 000 vnd pour chambre double avec air climatisé) tout en nous conseillant une chambre aux étages supérieurs. C’est donc la chambre 602 qui nous est attribuée. Ayant eu une mauvaise expérience de punaises de lit dans un précédent voyage, nous prenons toujours nos précautions en arrivant dans les homestay ou hôtels. On vérifie toujours les matelas en soulevant les housses et couvre matelas pour être certains qu’il n’y a aucunes traces de ces indésirables ... quelle fut notre surprise lorsque nous avons aperçu un matelas répugnant tacheté de sang et de traces noires qui correspondent à des excréments de punaises de lit. Nous avons tout de suite avertis le personnel de l’hôtel qui ne semblait pas pas savoir ce qu’était des bedbugs jusqu’à temps que nous leur montrions des photos . Ils ont retiré le matelas de la chambre et en ont amené un autre, mais ces bestioles peuvent se loger dans le mobilier de chambre, alors ne prenant pas de chances nous sommes vite partis et sommes plutôt restés à un autre hôtel, juste de l’autre côté de la rue, très bien placé également à deux pas du marché pour moins cher. À vous de voir et de bien vérifier les matelas si vous voulez rester à cet endroit, qui semblait vraiment bien et propre à première vue !

Title: Hơn thế nữa
Review: Tôi không thể nói đủ điều tốt về khách sạn Lâm Tùng, đặc biệt là các nhân viên. Các phòng đều rộng rãi, rộng rãi, sạch sẽ, thoải mái, máy lạnh tuyệt vời và tầm nhìn ra ban công. Nhưng, điều làm cho nơi này trở nên đặc biệt là những người làm việc ở đây. Hãy để tôi giải thích. Bạn của tôi bị ngộ độc thực phẩm nghiêm trọng ngay sau khi chúng tôi đến (từ thức ăn được ăn trước khi đến). Rõ ràng là anh cần phải đến bệnh viện càng sớm càng tốt. Các nhân viên khách sạn nhanh chóng tìm thấy chúng tôi một chiếc xe và đã cho chúng tôi có một cách an toàn. Sau đó, họ ở lại hàng giờ khuya để giúp chúng tôi dịch với đội ngũ chăm sóc sức khỏe. Trong thời gian bạn bè của tôi 24 giờ ở lại bệnh viện, Tiệp và Toàn (nhân viên khách sạn) đến bệnh viện vài giờ một lần để kiểm tra tiến độ, dịch, và thậm chí mang thức ăn và đồ uống cho bạn tôi. Nếu không có sự giúp đỡ của họ, cuộc sống của bạn tôi sẽ gặp nguy hiểm (tôi là chuyên gia chăm sóc sức khỏe). Sau khi rời bệnh viện, họ tiếp tục kiểm tra chúng tôi và đảm bảo rằng anh ấy cảm thấy thoải mái và hồi phục tốt. Tôi cảm ơn Tiệp và Toàn và toàn thể nhân viên Lâm Tùng từ tận đáy lòng. Cảm ơn bạn đã giúp chúng tôi trong một tình huống rất mãnh liệt. Bạn thật tuyệt! !

Title: The most silent sleep in whole Vietnam
Review: Traveling through Vietnam for 2 months, the utmost challenge was constant noise that disrupted our sleep - from roosters crowing way before sunrise through all day long honking sound from the road then to karaoke singing in public at night. We stayed for two nights on 6th fl of this hotel and had zero noise in the room. The air-conditioning was good and silent. All noise from outside was completely blocked. We had great sleep and rested well for onward motorbike travel. Wifi in the room and lobby was strong. Elevator is large and quick to up and down from 6th fl to 2nd fl where the lobby was. The owner and staff speak good English. When we arrived the hotel, we just had had a motorbike accident where one of my knees were banged up pretty bad. The owner observed our state and offered hands to clean up the wound. She brought an ex-nurse who is the owner of Green Karst restaurant across the street, to our room to help us with wrapping up the wound. Dong Van is a small town and cared much about travelers especially who are in need. I felt like being home surrounded by relatives.

Title: Un hôtel dans la rue principale
Review: Hôtel récent, situé sur la place du village à proximité du marché du dimanche matin. Plusieurs restaurants à proximité. Le choix des hôtels à Dong Van est limité, comme partout dans l’extrême nord du Vietnam où le tourisme est encore balbutiant, le Lam Tung semble être le meilleur choix. Très bon rapport qualité/prix.

Title: Smiley staff who do their best
Review: Some things seems to be constant about the hotels in Ha Giang. Hard beds, dirty kettles and the occasional blackout. When I asked if I could change my kettle to a clean one, the hapless staff realised that all their kettles were plagued with the same layer of unknown white muck. After which they suggested me to get my hot water from the lobby drink directly. The lobby was just a short walk from my room so I did just that a couple of times. During my stay in Dong Van, the power went out two times in quick succession. Both times, I heard some shouts in the lobby and the sound of a generator starting up, a good sign that at least the hotel is on top of blackout situations. Even though they speak little English, the staff are always ready to smile and ready to help. The hotel is actually situated on top of a mini mart so you have to go up some stairs to reach the hotel lobby. Sharing shopfront space with a shop on the first floor, bike parking tends to get a bit squeezy at times. For snacks, just walk out to the main road and turn right to find some good BBQ street food! My room is big and have a heat insulated bathroom, although it can get noise from any commotion in the lobby, a nearby ktv at night and a construction site in the morning. Okay, that is actually not as bad as it sounds XD

Title: Best in Dong Van
Review: This is a small modern hotel in the center of Dong Van just steps from the market. If you are a westerner and want to stay there you probably came to visit the colorful market with all the ethnic minorities. I can assure you it is worth the trip. The hotel serves the purpose and is clean. Dong Van is high on the mountains at about 1,000m and it can get very cold during the night. Most rooms do not have glass windows, but wooden panels instead. We had a VIP room for 19$ :) and I was amazed that there were no windows. I asked for another room and I've been teached that wooden panels instead of windows is considered luxury. They have a few rooms with windows too, but they also have the wooden panels to a balcony, so you end up with the same problem that the thermal insulation does not work. Anyways, the A/C in the room was really quiet and they also gave us a radiator so we could balance a little the cold air coming from outside. In the end it has been a good night, even though we could not see what happens outside. The rooms are clean and so is the bathroom. There is no restaurant.

Title: Getting better and better

Title: Đừng để bị đánh lừa bởi các đánh giá - Có nhiều lựa chọn tốt hơn
Review: Đầu tiên là những mặt tích cực: chủ yếu là nhân viên thân thiện, ngay cả khi họ dường như không quan tâm nhiều như các khách sạn còn lại trong vòng lặp. Nhưng tôi phải đặt câu hỏi rằng những đánh giá tuyệt vời cho khách sạn này đến từ đâu. 4 1/2 sao trung bình? Phải nói đùa! Họ lén lút liệt kê vị trí của họ trên bản đồ gần với quảng trường chính trong thị trấn, nhưng khi chúng tôi đến, họ nói với chúng tôi vị trí thực sự là nhà hàng, và khách sạn ở xa hơn. OK chỉ cần thêm 5 phút đi bộ nhưng dù sao vẫn khó chịu. Khi chúng tôi đến, anh chàng làm việc ở đó đã đi lên để kiểm tra phòng. Khi anh ta xuống, anh ta nói với chúng tôi rằng anh ta đang "nâng cấp" chúng tôi lên một căn phòng tốt hơn - hóa ra đó là một căn phòng tồi tệ hơn nhiều so với phòng chúng tôi đã đặt. Phòng tắm rất nhỏ, bẩn và đôi khi không có nước (xem ảnh). Ở lại trong 2 đêm và tất nhiên căn phòng không bao giờ được dọn dẹp, giải thích bởi thực tế là chúng tôi thấy người dọn dẹp nằm trên giường trong căn phòng mà anh ta định dọn dẹp. Trên đầu nó có hai cái lỗ dài mỏng ở cửa phòng chúng tôi, nơi bạn có thể nhìn thấy trực tiếp trên giường (xem ảnh). Cũng không nói rằng họ khóa cửa khách sạn vào ban đêm, vì vậy đã bị kẹt bên ngoài gõ cửa cho đến khi chúng tôi thấy cửa phụ mở. Nhìn chung không phải là một chuyến thăm tuyệt vời. Chúng tôi trả phòng và ở lại Lam Tung trên con đường tốt hơn nhiều.

Title: Great place for a base in ĐV
Review: I've been to Vietnam a few times and my time at Green Karst definitely ranks among the top experiences. Many bike the 'loop' swiftly, but I would recommend making Đồng Văn your base for a few days instead, and visiting the copious breathtaking destinations on and around the loop from there. That way, you can pick and choose when to visit what, wait for good weather, revisit places you really loved, and so on. Tân and his wife Dịu are hosts of the highest distinction, clearly willing to go the extra mile for their guests. I witnessed Dịu disinfecting the wound of an unlucky biker, for example, and Tân took me to the market to buy clothes and negotiate on my behalf after I merely mentioned that I was looking for a new top. In sum: Stay a few days here, you won't regret it! (Also, the receptionist, Tho, is very pleasant and I recommend asking him to teach you a few phrases in Hmong before you head out on your bike; this will drastically improve your chances of a smiling welcome from the mountain dwellers outside the town!) I believe the premises in town may be changing next month, but everything I have said here should still apply.

Đó là một trong những trải nghiệm yêu thích của tôi ở Việt Nam. Tôi đã gặp rất nhiều người tuyệt vời đi qua vòng lặp. Title: Chúng tôi không khuyến nghị
Review: Chúng tôi ở tại nhà khách Xuân Thu trong hai đêm vào tháng 3 năm 2017 và thật khủng khiếp. Chúng tôi chuyển đến một khách sạn tốt hơn, Hoàng Ngọc Hotel (nhân viên mới được cải tạo, sạch sẽ, dễ chịu), chỉ kiếm thêm một ít tiền cho đêm thứ ba ở Đồng Văn. Chúng tôi đánh giá cao, rất khuyên các khách sạn Hoàng Ngọc. Ban đầu chúng tôi đã đặt chỗ cho ba đêm tại khách sạn Xuân Thu Guesthouse nhưng nó rất tệ đến mức chúng tôi, và những người bạn đi cùng, chuyển đến một khách sạn khác. Khi chúng tôi đến Xuân Thu, chúng tôi lần đầu tiên được cung cấp một phòng bên trong với hai giường đơn với nệm cực kỳ ẩm ướt. Theo yêu cầu của chúng tôi, cuối cùng họ đã đồng ý thay đổi phòng của chúng tôi đến một căn phòng với một cửa sổ bên ngoài nơi nệm không ẩm ướt. Sau đêm và ngày đầu tiên ở đó, chúng tôi trở về phòng và nó không được lau chùi và khăn tắm hoàn toàn ướt (từ khi tắm vào buổi sáng) đã không được thay bằng khăn sạch, khô. Sau khi phàn nàn với nhân viên, chúng tôi được thông báo rằng họ không vào phòng vì chúng tôi có thể phàn nàn rằng có điều gì đó được lấy từ chúng tôi. Đồng thời khi chúng tôi nói chuyện với nhân viên, hai vị khách khác phàn nàn rằng nhân viên khách sạn đã vào phòng của họ và một số thứ đã được thực hiện. Dường như trong một số trường hợp, nhân viên vào phòng và trong một số trường hợp họ không làm như vậy. Có một câu chuyện khác nhau mỗi khi khách phàn nàn. Chúng tôi đi du lịch với một cặp vợ chồng khác và họ không thể sử dụng vòi hoa sen trong phòng của họ bởi vì nó nằm ngay trên bồn rửa và không thể được gỡ bỏ khỏi tường để tắm. Chúng tôi biết rằng giá khách sạn khá rẻ, nhưng nó thậm chí không đáng giá! Chúng tôi (cả bốn chúng tôi) đã đặt một chuyến đi leo núi một ngày với ông Hùng. Chúng tôi hỏi chúng tôi có đi thăm những ngôi làng trên đồi và được bảo rằng chúng tôi sẽ đến thăm ba ngôi làng. Chúng tôi có nhiều kinh nghiệm leo núi ở miền bắc Thái Lan và Myanmar. Chuyến đi leo núi này quá đắt ($ 20 mỗi người với tổng số $ 80!) Và chúng tôi không đến thăm ba ngôi làng. Chúng tôi có hai người hướng dẫn trẻ và họ giải thích cho chúng tôi rằng họ là học viên. Một hướng dẫn chưa bao giờ thực hiện chuyến đi và hướng dẫn khác đã thực hiện nó một lần. Chúng tôi may mắn khi chúng tôi thấy một số người dân trên đồi khi chúng tôi đi bộ và họ mời chúng tôi đến nhà họ, đó là một ngôi nhà riêng lẻ, không nằm trong một ngôi làng. Chúng tôi đã không ghé thăm bất kỳ ngôi làng đồi núi nào mặc dù chúng tôi được thông báo rằng chúng tôi sẽ đến thăm ba. Các hướng dẫn viên rất đẹp và chuẩn bị một bữa ăn trưa đáng yêu cho chúng tôi, nhưng họ không có kinh nghiệm về leo núi. Chúng tôi chắc chắn không khuyên bạn nên đến Xuân Thu Guesthouse cũng như chúng tôi không giới thiệu các dịch vụ leo núi của ông Hùng.

Title: What makes this hotel special, and warrants a five star rating, is the staff.
Review: The Xuan Thu Guesthouse, sometimes incorrectly referred to as a hostel, is in fact a typical Vietnamese two star budget hotel. Nothing special about the hotel itself, but for 200,000 VND it is perfectly acceptable choice travelers on a budget. What makes this hotel special, and warrants a five star rating, is the staff. They are the nicest and friendliest group of people that you would ever want to meet. In addition to being incredibly helpful, the staff all speaks English to some degree, some of them quite fluently. Trust me; you will not meet very many English speaking people in Ha Giang province, particularly outside of Dong Va. Then there is Mr. Hung; a fluent English speaker, restaurateur and tour guide. Mr. Hung is extremely helpful, can organize all means of transportation and tours and promptly replies to e-mails. To travel independently in Ha Giang province, visitors who do not speak Vietnamese will need some help from time to time organizing transportation. On my recent 16 day tour of the province Mr. Hung helped me out on a number of occasions and I would not hesitate to recommend his services.

Title: This is not Rocky Plateau Hotel
Review: The title of this hotel is misleading - the name of this hotel is "Hoa Cuong Hotel" and not "Rocky Plateau Hotel". Hoa Cuong Hotel is the most modern hotel in Dong Van and was opened earlier in 2016. "Rocky Plateau Hotel" - on the other side - is a crappy place in Dong Van with terrible comments in other travel guides. Despite the fact that Hoa Cuong Hotel and Rocky Plateau Hotel are based at the same street, they should not be mixed up. Hoa Cuong Hotel offers very spacious rooms. However, the atmospehre is rather "cold" - the architecture of the hotel would better fit into a big city like Hanoi (but not the old town!) or Saigon but not to a rural place like Dong Van. Not sure what the architect thought while planning this hotel The quality of the rooms was good. The personnel spoke a little bit of English. There is a restaurant offering dinner and breakfast. However, I would rather go out to eat in town which is only a 5 - 10 minute walk away. Hoa Cuong Hotel is definitely a place to spend a night, especially since Dong Van is not offering a large selection of hotels. However, backpackers may prefer to stay at a homestay in order to see the traditional atmosphere of this beautiful place in northern Vietnam.

Title: A real "local" experience
Review: While the other newer hotels in Dong Van are run by Viets from down on the plains, this hotel is run by mountain people. It is more traditional and better reflects the time warp town that you are staying in. The bed was the softest we have ever experienced in 8 years and 5 trips to Viet Nam - it was a "memory foam" mattress exactly the same as we have at home! It would have made for the best night sleep in our 4 weeks on the road except that the construction site next door started at sun up! A highlight was the wakening to the loud speakers in the street telling us to plant trees, don't harm your children pick up litter and try to grow more corn! (or something like that) WiFi was good in the foyer lounge If you are seeking a true cultural experience then this hotel is the place to stay - the others could be in any town in Viet Nam

Title: BUI Homestay, gia đình bạn ở Việt Nam
Review: Tôi đã qua đêm tại BUI Homestay vào giữa tháng 8 năm 2017. Tôi có cảm giác đó khiến tôi dừng lại ở đó. Tôi đã được chào đón bởi một đội ngũ nhân viên nhỏ của 3 và gặp 3 khách du lịch khác. Hầu hết chúng tôi đi một mình, và nhân viên làm cho tất cả chúng ta đều cảm thấy như một gia đình. Trong thực tế, chúng tôi đã kết thúc ăn tối với nhau và sau đó chia sẻ một số loại bia. Giải thưởng ban đêm là 5, 5 € (khoảng 6, 5 $) một đêm. Thêm bữa tối, bia, mojito và bữa sáng chỉ với 10 € (11 $). Các khu vực ngủ là phổ biến, nhưng đủ lớn cho một số sự riêng tư. Giường và chăn lớn, sạch sẽ và ấm áp. Tôi đã rất ngạc nhiên. Giá cả tuyệt vời, môi trường tuyệt vời, những người tuyệt vời, và khu vực tuyệt vời để đi xe máy thuê. Tuy nhiên, thay vì 2 ngày, tôi khuyên bạn nên dành 3 ngày để làm toàn bộ vòng lặp (Hà Giang, Lổ Cú, Đồng Văn, Mèo Vạc, Nà Kê, Bác Mê, Ba. Nà Yên, Hà Giang). Tôi mất 8 h một ngày trên xe máy, đôi khi có mưa to. Và tôi thường lái xe máy về nhà. Thưởng thức!

Title: Below-average two/three star Vietnamese hotel, to be avoided.
Review: My wife and I stayed here one night as part of a group of 20 on a three day geological field trip to the Dong Van Stone Plateau. A relatively modern hotel. We were told by the trip organizers that this was the best hotel in town. Perhaps it is the only one that could accommodate a group of our size. An average room with a reasonable bed, AC that worked, but a poorly maintained bathroom - shower controls did not work properly and water on the floor after flushing the toilet. We had a mediocre group dinner with mostly cold food. Only the fish (quite good) and the soup were hot. The restaurant has amazingly noisy acoustics due to a tiled floor and bare walls. Our room (303) was directly up the stairs from the lobby and restaurant (level 2) and was noisy as a consequence. Like a lot of rooms in smaller Vietnamese hotels, our room had no external window, but at least it had a window onto the corridor. I don't know what the room price was so I cannot comment on value. Recommendation: Only stay there if there is no other choice. Would I stay there again? No.

Title: Dịch vụ spa không tốt lắm
Review: Sau 4 ngày trên xe máy, chúng tôi rất cần được mát-xa. Chúng tôi đã hỏi khách sạn và được đề nghị đến khu nghỉ dưỡng Đồng Văn vì họ sở hữu spa duy nhất trong thị trấn. Xe đưa đón của họ nhanh chóng đến và đón chúng tôi tại khách sạn của chúng tôi. Khu nghỉ mát trông khá yên bình vào ban đêm nên chúng tôi rất hào hứng cho việc mát xa. Phòng tắm thảo dược và phòng tắm hơi là tốt đẹp. Bạn có thể ở lại và ngâm miễn là bạn muốn. Massage chúng tôi rất mong chờ, thật đáng buồn là massage tồi tệ nhất ở Việt Nam. Lúc đầu, họ không sử dụng dầu thích hợp, vì vậy nhân viên mát xa không thể xoa bóp đúng cách. Tôi hỏi cô ấy những gì cô ấy đặt trên cơ thể tôi và đó là dầu - cô ấy cười và bảo tôi cho tôi 1 phút - và chạy ra ngoài - sau đó cô ấy quay lại với một chai khác - có mùi như dầu rẻ tiền nhưng bây giờ nó đủ mịn Mát xa. Tôi hỏi cô ấy đang thực hiện kiểu massage nào bởi vì cô ấy đang đánh vào cơ thể tôi rất nhiều bằng nắm đấm của cô ấy và làm áp lực ở những nơi trên đầu và cơ thể tôi mà không có nhân viên mát xa nào từng ép. Cô ấy nói cô ấy không có ý kiến gì, chủ sở hữu đã đưa ai đó từ thị trấn lớn hơn và dạy cô ấy một thời gian ngắn. Tôi khá chắc chắn rằng cô ấy không biết mình đang làm gì nhưng tôi tự an ủi rằng nó đủ thư giãn có lẽ tôi có thể ngủ. Không, karaoke bắt đầu nổ tung từ khách sạn và tôi phải chịu đựng âm nhạc karaoke khủng khiếp cho đến khi việc massage khủng khiếp kết thúc. Massage đối tác của tôi không khác - mặc dù thực tế là chúng tôi đã yêu cầu nhân viên mát xa có kinh nghiệm và được cho biết rằng chúng tôi có nhân viên mát xa tốt nhất trong nhà. Ồ vâng, khi chúng tôi hỏi về karaoke, họ tự hào nói rằng họ chơi nó mỗi tối. . . Và mặc dù chúng tôi đã nói với chủ sở hữu rằng massage không ngang bằng, chúng tôi chỉ bị bỏ qua và gửi về nhà. Chắc chắn không nên.

Title: Very basic. Not great if you
Review: This is a motel, not hotel and accommodation is very basic. But for the little money that we paid, we got a decent sized room with twin king sized beds and an en suite bath and toilet. Rooms have a kettle, meagre toiletry ammeties, but is clean and in good state of upkeep. We came in the depths of the winter and on one particularly cold night when temperatures plunged to 2 degrees C, heating was woefully inadequate leaving us frozen to the bone. Property itself is quiet since it is located off the main thoroughfare, and facing the fields, so a very decent view of mountains and paddy fields through the windows.

Title: Phòng thoải mái
Review: Tôi đã ở tại khách sạn này nhiều lần. Các giường cực kỳ thoải mái cho người phương Tây, không phải là giường cứng xi măng bạn thường thấy ở phần này của thế giới. Phòng và phòng tắm được sạch sẽ. Ngoài ra còn có bàn làm việc, ghế và đèn bàn trong phòng và Internet được cung cấp miễn phí. Cửa sổ lớn ở một đầu của phòng ngủ cho phép nhiều ánh sáng. Mức độ tiếng ồn bên ngoài đã được tối thiểu trong thời gian lưu trú của tôi. Bữa sáng được bao gồm trong giá phòng và cung cấp nhiều lựa chọn ăn uống. Các tiện nghi ăn uống nằm trên tầng cao nhất với tầm nhìn đẹp ra thành phố / khu vực xung quanh và có bàn trong nhà cũng như ngoài trời. Lưu ý: phòng ăn có thể rất bận rộn / đầy đủ vào cuối tuần và ngày lễ, vì vậy tốt nhất là nên ăn sớm. Phòng ăn đóng cửa thức ăn lúc 9 giờ tối. Các nhân viên là rất tốt đẹp và thân thiện và đã đến đây nhiều lần, các nhân viên luôn chào đón tôi và chào đón tôi trở lại. Quá trình kiểm tra là không có rắc rối. Sảnh đợi của khách sạn có quầy bar và khu vực tập trung tuyệt đẹp. AC là tốt. Hạn chế nhỏ duy nhất là ánh sáng trong phòng. . . đèn cạnh giường ngủ cần 2 bóng đèn, nhưng khách sạn chỉ đặt 1 bóng đèn cho mỗi bóng đèn. Tôi luôn luôn đặt 2 bóng đèn vào một bóng đèn để có ánh sáng bên giường ngủ thích hợp vào ban đêm.

Title: dịch vụ nghèo nàn không xứng đáng một xu
