Dù sao, vì TV đêm đầu tiên trong phòng của tôi không thể xem có thể không có tín hiệu, tôi gọi cho trung tâm dịch vụ khách thời gian 1 đường, nhân viên chỉ trả lời "um - hum" và "alright" tôi thậm chí không biết anh ta là ai vì không có lời chào lúc đầu, nó giữ tôi đợi 30 phút. sau đó tôi thực hiện cuộc gọi thứ hai với giọng không hài lòng, nhân viên trợ giúp đặc biệt chỉ trong vòng 1 phút để TEACH anh trai tôi và tôi cách đặt TV trong 30 giây, và tôi tin rằng tôi thậm chí không cần lãng phí thời gian nếu khách sạn đặt TV trước khi chúng tôi đến. Title: Good Hotel but not for families wanting to Tour.
Review: This hotel is by no means a five star hotel. The rooms have a TV but there is no aerial reception to get the TV working. There is no room clock anywhere to be seen, which we had to rely on our mobile phones to tell the time. Next there is no tour desk or any information of finding local attractions. We had to rely on the doorman to give us tips. There is no shuttle bus to Ho Chi Min City. The hotel is actually located roughly 40 minutes outside of the city. The cost of commuting to the city via taxi quickly starts to add up. Passports were taken on checkin or they will charge to a credit card around 150 US dollars per guest. Could be an issue for some but we gave them our passports. No issues as such when checking out and the Hotel Staff handed them over. There was a discrepsency when we were checking in that my son was an extra unpaid guest but that was resolved when I showed them my reservation. Now that we got the negatives aside. The good points of the hotel is that the staff were extremely curteous to our family of 5. The buffet which is located on the 14 floor is excellent and we had no problems with the food being served which is Western, Vietnamese and Chinese cuisine. Its a credit to the Restaurant Manager Xoan who was extremely attentive in explaining the local cuisine and customs. The rooms were comfortable and clean but lacking in a few areas mentioned above. By staying in this Hotel you will be supporting the local community as all the staff live locally. On Saturday nights there is a bbq seafood buffet for 4400 dong ($27.00 Australian) which also includes unlimited beer and wine which was great but could have included a better selection of seafood such as squid/calamari and scallops which on our occasion was missing. Overall I am all for supporting the locals and the Vietnamese people are a peaceful race given their past history. This hotels major clientele are businessman as its located in the business district. However having said that I would recommend a city hotel for families considering on touring or getting better access to tour operators as the The Mira Hotel just does not make it convenient at all to get to where you want. Overall it was a pleasant stay but needs more facilities to get to five star standards. Take not that there is no Airport pickup service offered by this hotel. Only a drop off which cost our family around 1 million Vietnamese Dong.

Title: Wasn't really feeling it...

Title: Not 5-Star Hotel - Yet
Review: The Mira Hotel advertises itself as a 5-star hotel and in many respects, it could be. But it is not there yet. I have stayed here several times while visiting a factory nearby. The rooms are huge and comfortable. The bathrooms are large with separate shower and tub. Water pressure is excellent. The A/C works GREAT! Seriously great! Which one needs while in Vietnam. ;-) As mentioned by others, corridors are dark and there is no signage to places like the pool and gym. You have to stumble along until you find what you're looking for. However, the pool is very nice if you can get it at a time when people aren't partying in it. ;-) The room has a separate desk area, which I really like. The free WiFi is very fast. However, there is only one outlet available in which to plug a laptop. It is already being used by the desk lamp. So one must unplug the lamp to plug in the laptop, which is very annoying. I would like to see the hotel add another outlet over there - it only makes sense. Room rates are very reasonable and breakfast is included. However, I found the food to be a little bland. The staff at the front desk is very friendly and tries hard. Their English gets a little better each time I come. The beds are incredibly soft and comfortable. I have always slept well when I've been here. Until this last time and this is my big complaint: The pillows for the beds are HUGE and firm. You cannot lie on them (even one of them) without your neck being at almost a 90 degree angle from your back. Very uncomfortable. The hotel offers a soft, foam lumbar pillow upon request. These pillows are wonderful and provide a good night's sleep. We always request them upon check in. However, this last visit (3 nights) they had run out of available pillows before we checked in. We asked every day. They never had any available. Clearly they either don't have many or a lot of other people want them because their regular pillows are SO UNCOMFORTABLY AWFUL! A 5-Star Hotel (which they want to be) does not have this issue. They need to either get more of these "soft pillows" or replace their horrifically huge pillows with something more comfortable. I know this may seem like a silly complaint but my favorite thing about The Mira up until this visit has been their incredible beds and having a good night's sleep, which is important when you're traveling. My colleague and I were extremely disappointed about the pillow situation and neither of us slept well our entire visit. I have only given them three stars for this visit because of the pillow debacle. I hope they rectify the situation before my next visit.

Title: Form is better than Substance
Review: If you are staying for many days to service a client in this in the industrial part of HCM city, then read on. The rooms facing the main road should be avoided. The traffic noise will keep you up with horns that can blast like a artillery shell, often suddently. Right up to 2am and then it starts again at 5 am. Enter the lobby, be mindful that the clocks showing the times in different city are not working. For some reason they are all at 6.45 AM. The only restaurant is on the 4th floor. You may have trouble finding the Bar that is supposed to be on 12B floor. Go up there and you see a quiet corridor, with exits to nowhere. No sign posts. Let me know if you ever find the 12B Bar. Gym is on the 5th floor that is sparse. No cups for drinking water. Bring Your Own. Breakfast is decent but coffee lovers have to settle for the common coffee. The coffee machine that makes actual coffee latter, cappuchino etc is broke (I don't know since when). Dinner items - keep clear of fried stuff includinh noodles because they are bathed in oil. Probably best to go next door where a shopping centre fast food outlet will do better. Corridors of floors is dimly lit and may offer a romantic feel. But bright corridors leading to my rfoom is what offers me a sense of security. Let's not forget the swimming pool and the sauna that needs to be searched - again no sign posts. They are on the 5th floor and you need to get through an obscure metal door, then let your nose guide you to the gym and swimming pool. It seems that this the best hotel in the vicinity - so you have to settle for this or take an hour commute to and from HCM city. By the way change the pillows as you come in. They do have a strange odour.

Title: I slept like a baby! :-)
Review: This is a very new hotel and as such, it has much room for improvement. But first, the good things: my room was quite large and comfortable with a separate desk area, which I liked. There was fruit in the room when I arrived which I appreciated because I checked in between meal times and I was hungry! :-) The free WiFi worked very well and the shower had great water pressure. The A/C worked perfectly all day and night. Best of all, the bed was amazing, with a pillow top mattress. I got the best sleep here that I got in my three weeks in Asia. TIP: the pillows that come with the bed are too large and too firm. Ask the front desk to send up a "smaller soft pillow". They will bring up a smaller, squishier, foam-like pillow (but not hot like foam). It is really comfortable. Breakfast was decent and the service in the breakfast room was excellent. Now for the things that need improvement: No guest directory in the room explaining where anything is, what the hours for breakfast, pool, and gym are. No signage to guide guests to the pool and gym. No shower mat to stand on and the shower floor is very smooth and slick marble. I had to throw a towel on the shower floor to keep from slipping when the floor was wet. The only hangers in my closet were shirt/jacket hangers. In other rooms, the only hangers were skirt/pant hangers. They need to get this organized. I supposedly got a room on a non smoking floor but whenever the A/C ran, it smelled like I was on a smoking floor. Chairs and couch in the room are not very comfortable. The only place you can use their hair dryer is at the desk. Fortunately, they have installed a big mirror there so the desk becomes a dressing table. But it's not where I like to dry my hair. And finally, while they tried very hard to give good service, their staff had very little English-speaking ability. I think that is the biggest drawback to this hotel for English-speaking guests. Overall, the price was excellent and I will go back, if only for the bed! In my opinion, they have a ways to go to get up to a three or four star status but I do think they're working on it.

Title: New hotel, but not quite up to 100% yet
Review: It's all new and rooms are big and clean. There were a lot of design flaws that they need to weed out. One was the table and the chair. I had 2 chairs with a table in my room, perfect for my computer, I thought at first. But the table had a very big drawer underneath, so my legs could not get under the table. Even with the chair in the lowest position, it was not possible to sit at the table and work. The light switches took a lot of getting used to. Normally when you put the room card in the holder, the lights will turn on. Here i had to not just torn on the light, but first turn it off and then on, before the lights went on. It turned off in the bathroom automatically, which is good for power saving. But it would be more logical to just push the light switch once, to turn the light back on. Not much to choose from in the restaurant, it was also mostly empty. Only some sandwiches, if you wanted Vietnamese food, you had to ask for the additional menu. Quite in the middle of nowhere. but good if you are in the industrial area. Really nothing happening around the hotel, except from a few restaurants and luckily a family mart. Funny thing at the pool. They don't have a lifeguard, but they have staff all the time, to make sure you sign your name on a paper, before you use the pool. It's a really nice pool, but they had a party one day at the pool, and there was loud music and drunk people, when i just wanted a quiet swim.

There are restaurants in hotel's vicinity, so you could go and dine out after work. I've stayed in this hotel several times in last 2 years. This is a no nonsense hotel, with simple modern design. If you're looking for sophistication, certainly you couldn't find there. Check in is always handled professionally, quick and efficient, although sometimes there was a misunderstanding caused by language barrier. I think their lifts are slow for a business hotel. This hotel has a restaurant which is used as breakfast place with a large patio, which is quite enjoyable with nice weather. There is also a swimming pool, but unfortunately I never had a chance to use. They have 2 room category, but I usually stay in the entry level. Actually, there is not much difference between the two. Each has a bedroom, bathroom and living quarter with kitchen set and a folded bed. The folded bed's mattress is really hard and firm. Room design is functional without touch of sophistication. TV selection is quite good, with plenty of international channels. Wifi connection is reliable and fast. Room is kept clean, but not in its sparkling condition. I think its modern furniture will look tired in next 5 years without proper maintenance. Breakfast buffet is adequate, with quite good quality. It has a few Western food (bacon, egg, bread), some Vietnamese/ Asian dishes like pho, congee, fried rice/ noodle and stir fried items. Overall, it is a dependable business hotel in Binh Duong, one hour away from HCMC.

The bigger apartment has a bigger living room and bathroom and a foldable queen bed in the livving room. Sự sụp đổ lớn của khu nghỉ mát này là khoảng cách đến trung tâm thành phố. Không có gì xảy ra cho khách du lịch bên ngoài khu nghỉ mát này, chỉ là một ngày địa phương bình thường. Taxi đến Sài Gòn sẽ có giá 500 k một chiều. Vì vậy, mặc dù chúng tôi đặt 3 đêm tại khu nghỉ mát Sài Gòn Park, chúng tôi đã kết thúc trả phòng sau 1 đêm!

Title: Ups and downs
Review: So I stayed at this hotel for 2.5 months so I feel I have a lot to say. Since I stayed a long time they gave me a very good discount on the room. Once they charged me less one month just to be nice. Staff extremely helpful. Rooms were nice in a nice area. Lets talk about the many cons. 1. The cleaning ladies are absolutely worthless at their jobs. After every cleaning day I stood baffled at how terrible of a job they have done. Even laundry was often returned to me so wrinkled I couldn't even iron it and had to return items to laundry bin(probably left in washing machine overnight). After one cleaning day my tie clip and little pocket pen(wasn't cheap AND it was a gift) went missing after the once a week cleaning. I have an undressing ritual where everything goes in the same place, I didn't misplace it. I went and got another tie clip but could not find a fancy new pen. Next cleaning day that tie clip also went missing. I also had some personal towels I didnt use since the hotel supplied towels. Those went missing too. No chance they mixed them up with the hotel towels, the hotel towels have the hotel name on them... mine didnt. My girlfriend also claimed some of her more fashionable blouses went missing. Sometimes we got clothes that wasn't ours. Laundry was free... but I would have preferred to pay if it meant they would do half a decent job. So the cleaning ladies were banned from my room. Front desk guys are awesome, super friendly and nice, however if you need something you have to ask numerous times because they forget or are too lazy. Location is only good if you have personal transport, its REALLY on the city outer limits so you need a motorbike. Being on built on the edge of the wilderness there is an abundance of insects, I moved up one floor from ground level and it solved the problem for the most part. After 5 days on ground level I eradicated 100 centipedes, 2 cockroaches and a few flyers. No problems after going to second floor.. except for ants which I dealt with. They have a mini fridge but it was rarely stocked appropriately so on the rare occasions I needed something, they didn't have it or it wasn't cold. Last thing, AC took a long time to cool down the room, even when it had been running all day I slept with blankets at ankles. It was a close call between 2 and 3 stars. For the price I paid for the room I got, Id say it was a good deal. Just don't let cleaning ladies in unattended and don't be afraid to tell them they forgot to change towels... again or you didn't even sweep... again.... or they left the trash... again or any other variety of things they are bound to forget. Wow was this a rant or a review?

Từ chất lượng phòng ốc đến cung cách phục vụ của nhân viên nơi đây đều rất tốt, với chất lượng như vậy thì khá là tương xứng với số tiền mà tôi đã bỏ ra. Khách sạn nằm ngay trung tâm, thuận tiện di chuyển đến mọi địa điểm du lịch trong thành phố.

Title: Du lịch Bảo Lộc
Review: Đi dịp này thì KS vừa sửa xong, thay đổi hoàn toàn phong cách lun, hiện đại nhưng bình dị và mộc mạc. Lúc lên nhận phòng mình tưởng vô nhầm ks chứ (Vì lần nào đến Bảo Lộc mình cũng ở ks này). Phòng mới toe, đẹp với toàn bộ nội thất mộc mang cảm giác ấm cúng, đầy đủ đồ dùng, sàn lát gỗ, cửa sổ vách kính rộng, view công viên, núi nên rất thik. KS mới với phong cách mới, nhân viên nhiệt tình, bà chủ chu đáo....nói chung là thik, lần sau mình sẽ rủ thêm nhiều đồng bọn quay lại đây...hehe.

Title: Avarage

Title: Khách sạn tuyệt vời và sự lựa chọn tốt nhất ở Bảo Lộc
Review: Khách sạn Minh Nhung, - Tọa lạc tại số 27 đường Hồng Bàng, phường 1, thành phố Bảo Lộc. Khách sạn này có vị trí đẹp (gần công viên - rất yên tĩnh, 28/3 vuông, trung tâm hành chính & chợ Bảo Lộc ...). - Khách sạn này đang được tân trang lại và mở cửa trở lại vào năm 2018. Tất cả mọi thứ đều tốt, phòng sạch sẽ, đầy đủ tiện nghi, thiết bị đẹp, thiết bị làm việc tốt và giá cả tốt. . . . - Lễ tân rất thân thiện. Luôn luôn mỉm cười và chào đón, hỗ trợ chúng tôi mọi lúc chúng ta cần. Đây là điều khiến tôi ấn tượng nhất về khách sạn này. - Ngoại lệ duy nhất là phòng tương đối nhỏ (đặc biệt là phòng dành cho 4 người). Nó có vẻ chật chội với bạn bè của tôi. - Khách sạn có thể cung cấp thêm dịch vụ: ăn sáng, du lịch, lưu niệm và đặc sản địa phương.

Title: Khách sạn mới, vị trí và dịch vụ tốt.
Review: Căn phòng nhỏ nhưng đồ nội thất mới. Nhân viên thân thiện và hữu ích. Ăn sáng mà không có sẵn là một điểm yếu, nhưng bạn có thể tìm thấy một số nhà hàng nhỏ hoặc thị trường địa phương tại 500 m chu vi. Phí dịch vụ cho quần áo giặt là rất rẻ.

Title: Khách sạn lịch sự mới với chất lượng inproving tại Bảo Lộc
Review: Tỷ lệ ban đầu của tôi là 4 ☆, tỷ lệ cuối cùng 5 ☆ là để khuyến khích khách sạn. Khách sạn này dường như được xây dựng rất gần đây, sảnh đợi với trang trí của ngôi nhà gia đình Việt Nam trong những năm 1950 s - 1980 s, trang thiết bị và trang trí trong phòng khá hợp lý (đến mức độ của nó). Nhân viên rất hữu ích, thân thiện và nhiệt tình. Chỉ những ghi chú rất nhỏ để cải thiện chất lượng khách sạn: 1. khăn tắm trông xuống cấp so với các thiết bị khác, nên được thay thế. 1 carper đã có ở lối vào, tốt hơn để có một cái khác cho tắm shelt 2. Tôi ở lại phòng 205, tắm vòi sen là ok nhưng rất nhiều đánh giá cao nếu áp lực nước là tốt hơn 3. Chúng tôi nhìn khắp mọi nơi trong phòng nhưng không tìm thấy số tiếp tân, nên viết xuống một số nơi. 4 . Có thể thêm các thiết bị khác (máy sấy tóc, cân bằng trọng lượng, sơn, máy tính với internet tại sảnh, dịch vụ ăn uống ...) theo ý định của chủ sở hữu và đầu tư của khách sạn.

Title: 1 đêm ngắn ở Bảo Lộc tại khách sạn Memories
Review: - Khách sạn nằm trên trục đường chính QL20, cách trung tâm TP Bảo Lộc khoảng 3 km, thuận tiện cho việc đi lại. - Khách sạn rộng rãi (đặc biệt là bãi đậu xe khá rộng và bắt mắt), phòng ốc rộng, sạch sẽ, đầy đủ trang thiết bị - phòng mình ở có quạt. - Phòng

Title: 2 ngày nghỉ dưỡng tại Bảo Lộc
Review: 2 ngày nghỉ ngơi tại Bảo Lộc một cách trọn vẹn với Khách sạn Memories. Ngay từ lúc đặt phòng qua điện thoại đã cảm thấy sự chuyên nghiệp trong cách làm việc và phục vụ khách hàng. Mình đặt 1 đêm để nghỉ chân trong chuyến phượt dài ngày, nhưng sau đó cảm thấy thích không khí ở Bảo Lộc nên hôm sau ở lại thêm 1 đêm nữa và nhân viên lễ tân đã nhanh chóng sắp xếp phòng cho mình để không phải chuyển phòng khác. Không khí ở Bảo Lộc mát mẻ, không quá lạnh như ở Đà Lạt nên khách sạn có 2 loại phòng: có quạt và có điều hòa. Mình ở phòng có điều hòa nhưng cũng ít khi sử dụng đến. Không gian phòng rộng rãi, thoáng mát, đầy đủ tiện nghi, nhà vệ sinh sạch sẽ và luôn có nước nóng nhìn ra cửa sổ là hướng đồi núi bình yên xanh mát. Xung quanh luôn yên tĩnh cả ngày và đêm. Khách sạn có nhà hàng phục vụ ăn sáng, nếu muốn thì có thể đăng ký ăn sáng với nhân viên lễ tân vào lúc check in, giá chấp nhận được với một phần ăn và cafe, nước uống. Khách sạn cách trung tâm thành phố khoảng 3km, thuận lợi đi dạo mát và ăn uống.

Title: Ok
Review: Unlike the description says, the hotel staff is not able to communicate well in English. At least, I don't count a few attempts with a translation device as well. They were nice however. Title: Friendly and convenient
Review: We stayed 2 nights here, in a room at the rear of the hotel with a window over looking the hills. The staff are friendly and helpful, especially at reception and have a good command of English. Our room was very spacious and clean, with toiletries, coffee/tea. Our included breakfast was limited to two meals, but ok for us. Coffee was extra, which was a bit odd. The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance from the Thanh Buoi bus station, although they do offer a free shuttle. Behind the hotel is a large function centre, so perhaps stay in a room at the front, just in case it's karaoke night. The hotel sits a good distance away from the main road, so it should be quiet. I'd stay again.

Title: Some good, some ugly
Review: We arrived at the hotel as a part of our tour down through towards Ho Chi Minh City. Our first impression was that the public areas were nicely kept and the staff were quite professional. We stayed in a standard King room on the same floor as the restaurant. The room was spacious and reasonably equipped - the showers worked quite well as another reviewer mentioned. The ugly came out fairly quickly in the form of 3cm long roaches around the shower drains and bed area. There were also many dozens of smaller roach carcasses at the base of the headboard. I chose not to peek under the bed. Restaurant service was also unusually slow (45min-60min wait), though breakfast was quick. Seemingly clean but actually crawling.. I would hesitate to stay again.

We were pleasantly surprised, it had a lovely big room, comfortable beds, great shower pressure and temperature (unlike previous reviews) and friendly staff. There was basically no English spoken, we were lucky as had a guide that sorted it for us. There was no air conditioning but we luckily didn't need it while here. Centrally located in the town and was well kept.

Title: Clean, Modern, Good Location
Review: I am giving this hotel 4 stars because of what the hotel is - not what it isn't. No, there is no restaurant. This chain of hotels is a bit odd in that they are generally the most up-scale in their market (I've now stayed in two-both in Lam Dong province). And yet they don't offer food (no breakfast, no restaurant). Another review mentioned a 55k voucher you can buy or get for breakfast. I didn't know about that option. Perhaps it's a special deal for certain room rates. While the rooms are modern, they are not all bright. Your best option is a room off the back of the hotel. The rooms on the side don't get a lot of light. Rooms in the front suffer from road noise (LOTS of trucks loudly blaring their horns as they roll through town). But I would absolutely stay here again if I find myself once again in Bao Loc.

Title: Sẽ không vui đến thế, nếu chuyến đi của chúng tôi thiếu Charm&Chic Homestay
Review: Homestay nằm cách xa trung tâm thành phố Bảo lộc khoảng 7km, nằm trên triền dốc nhìn về hướng Tây. Từ trên ban công, bạn sẽ thấy một màu xanh của rừng cây, xa xa thấp thoáng ngọn tháp của một nhà thờ nào đó. Nhóm chúng tôi đến nơi vào lúc sáng sớm nên may mắn đã có thể bắt gặp khung cảnh rừng già còn mơ màng trong làn sương sớm. Phòng tập thể dành cho nhóm 6 người được thiết kế rộng rãi, với những chi tiết trang trí nhẹ nhàng, cổ điển nhưng cũng rất ấn tượng và thu hút ánh nhìn. Ở trong căn phòng này, mỗi người sẽ có cảm giác hoàn toàn thư giản bởi màu chủ đạo là màu trắng xám, ngoài ra mặt trước là một bứt tường bằng cửa kính giúp ánh sáng có thể len lỏi vào từng ngóc ngách trong phòng. Ngồi trong phòng cũng có thể nhìn ngắm cảnh vật thiên nhiên bên ngoài một cách rất chill. Tuy chỉ là homestay thôi, nhưng chủ nhà chăm sóc rất kĩ càng. Phòng tắm có đầy đủ kem đánh răng, xà phòng, dầu gội, máy sấy tóc. Nước lọc cũng được phục vụ free. Cần gì chỉ cần chạy xuống nhà dưới, gọi cô chú í ới vài tiếng là cô chú liền vui vẻ giúp đỡ. Một trong những điều khiến nhóm chúng tôi thích thú chính là khuôn viên gồm thảm cỏ xanh mướt được chăm sóc kĩ càng, rất nhiều các loại - hoa - quả khác nhau như mận, chôm chôm, bơ, cà chua, xoài, chanh, hoa giấy, hoa lan cùng một bầy mèo xinh xắn đáng yêu. Ở đây ngoài thoải mái tận hưởng không gian, nhóm mình còn được cô chủ tư vấn cho rất nhiều món ăn ngon, tự tay chuẩn bị, nêm ném cả một bữa tiệc BBQ cho cả nhóm. Lúc ra về, cả nhóm muốn mua bơ mang về làm quà (Ở Bảo Lộc có rất nhiều nhà vườn trồng bơ 034), cô cũng liền chạy đi tới tận vườn mua giúp, cô bảo bơ này ăn an tâm, không sợ thuốc. Một lưu ý nhỏ cho những ai ghiền và thích thưởng thức cà phê, Charm&Chic có phục vụ cà phê chế phin với cà phê được hái từ chính rẫy ở nhà, vị cà phê thơm, nhẹ nhàng, rất ngon và không bị ám mùi khét như các loại cà phê ran xay thường thấy. Cảm ơn Charm&Chic đã mang đến cho nhóm tụi con một chuyến đi vui tròn đến vậy!

Title: Một nửa của 200 nghìn là 120 nghìn ???
Review: Bọn mình lên đến Bảo Lộc từ sáng sớm, nhưng do khách sạn mình book trước đó 12PM mới có phòng trống nên mình đã đến ở khách sạn Minh Quân (Sandals Hotel) theo advise của anh nhân viên công ty Thành Bưởi. Mình vô nhận phòng lúc 4AM, có hỏi bạn nhân viên lễ tân ở từ 4AM ngày thứ 7 đến 8PM chủ nhật thì tính thế nào, bạn đó nhiệt tình báo “Dạ vâng em tính chị 2 đêm ạ”. Nhưng do kế hoạch thay đổi mình phải lên Đà Lạt nên 3PM thứ 7 mình trả phòng, bạn nhân viên lễ tân charge mình full 1 đêm cộng thêm với 80% của đêm thứ 2, nghĩa là gần như mình bị full charge 2 đêm. Bạn lễ tân giải thích quy định của khách sạn sau 3PM full charge, mà thật sự đó giờ mình chỉ biết khách sạn sẽ full charge sau 6PM. Bạn lễ tân vừa giải thích và vừa thể hiện thái độ khó chịu với mình. Chắc là ở Sandals các bạn ý được training “giá phòng tỉ lệ thuận với thái độ phục vụ của nhân viên” Lúc bọn mình thuê xe máy, bạn báo 200 nghìn 1 ngày. Mình thuê lúc 9AM và 3PM về mình trả thì bạn báo với mình charge 1 nửa. Đến khi nhận hóa đơn thanh toán, mình thấy phí thuê xe là 120 nghìn, hơi thắc mắc mình có hỏi lại thì lễ tân đã giải thích " Em nói với chị charge 1 nửa chứ em không nói 1 nửa của 200 nghìn là 100 nghìn". Oh, nhờ nhân viên của Sandals mình mới học được 1 nửa của 200 nghìn mà bạn các được đào tạo là 120 nghìn chứ không là 100 nghìn như mình được học. Vậy là mình vừa đi du lịch và vừa được học miễn phí, toàn nhứng kiến thức mới và ngoài tầm hiểu biết của bọn mình :((((

Title: Quiet place for family, good choice
Review: Located in a small alley on Vo Van Tan street, Bao Loc city. About 250m from Highway 20, Vu Gia is a villa (not really a hotel) with extremely quiet space and spacious campus, covered motorbike parking area. In the yard, there are many kinds of flowers and trees (roses, avocado trees ...). The receptionist (also the owner of the villa) is very enthusiastic and friendly, providing necessary information as well as sharing interesting things for visitors to stay. Check-in procedure is quite simple and fast (takes less than 2 minutes). Spacious, new, clean, bright, equipment works very well, the air conditioner only takes about 5 minutes to cool the room over 30 square meters, hot water works very well (be careful when adjusting) . The bed is spacious and the mattress very soft for a good night's sleep. There is a balcony area for relaxing or smoking on the edge of the corridor with nice views. In short, this is a great place with family if you want to relax and have a good sleep with very reasonable prices.

Title: Great Value for Money
Review: The Khach San Seri Seri Hotel is well-located near the center of Bao Loc. For the price of the room, approximately US$21 equivalent, the hotel offers excellent value. The room was clean and comfortable, the air conditioner worked well and was quiet, there was plenty of hot water in the shower. Each floor is serviced by two elevators. Check-in was easy, with the desk attendant able to speak English. Note that the staff does need to keep your ID card or passport, and in the case of foreigners, to take it to the police for registration. Wifi was included in the price and worked very well, though the its strength was much better in the hall than in my room. Breakfast, included in the price of the room, was a fairly basic choice of Vietnamese soup-like food (excuse my lack of cultural knowledge on this one), eggs cooked to order, and tasty fresh bread. I was in a rush, but assume tea and coffee would have been available. All things considered, Khach San Seri Seri Hotel offers very comfortable accommodation, particularly in relation to its cost. If you dine out, then I would recommend Quan an Bach Hy An restaurant, located at 147-149 Tran Quoc Toan street in Bao Loc. Tel: 063 386 8668. It offers excellent foods in a cozy, airy atmosphere. It is located perhaps 400 meters up a dirt street from the main road passing through Bao Loc.

Но не ходите в ресторан на 21 этаже! Это единственный минус! Зашли туда, потому что весь день гуляли и устали, к тому же пошел ливень. Очень пожалели, выброшенных денег. Все морепродукты и мясо там тупо бросают в кастрюли отваривают, получается безвкусно абсолютно( супчик тайский был неплохой и йогурты, которые и утром на завтраках дают, да и устрицы свежие тоже хорошие. Все. На счет пляжа. Для меня большой плюс наличие своих лежаков, поскольку я ходила рано на море, проблем с нехваткой лежака не возникало. Расположение отеля очень удобное, рядом самая лучшая точка с фруктами и соками, а также пошив сандалей на заказ. В первый же день заказала сандали, стоимость 300 донгов, натуральная кожа, ходила в них весь отдых и радовалась. Ну и рядом с отелем есть все необходимое, впрочем как и во всем европейском квартале. Также интернет, как и везде в Нячанге, отличный. Спасибо данному отелю и гостеприимному вьетнамскому народу.

Title: Green World
Review: Я отдыхала с друзьями в отеле Грин Ворд-отличный отель. Персонал всегда приветливые и отзывчивые. Хочу отметить очень добрую девушку на резепшене Хань. Человек с большой буквы. Title: Уютный городской отель
Review: Отель уютный, соответствует своим 4 звездам. В номере есть все необходимое, холодильник, телефон, фен, гигиенические принадлежности, симпатичная обстановка с мебелью из ротанга. Жили высоко, почти под крышей. Казалось бы, самый вид из окна....Только вот номер нам достался не очень, он был угловой. А это значит, что окно в нем было, но в углу и размером....40 х 50. Из обещанного вида только соседний балкон делюкса и кусочек далекостоящего отеля, только потому, что он был в 45 этажей. Про эти номера на сайте отеля и у туроператора не слова нет!!! Имейте ввиду. Номера с окончанием на 01 не берите, сразу отказывайтесь! Также над балконом делюкса стояла коробка кондиционера, которая периодически включалась и гудела так, что спать было не возможно. Мы даже засекали через какое время она снова загудит, это происходило с периодичностью сначала в 5, а потом в 3 минуты. Было ощущение, что звонят в дверь. Пару дней подождали и сообщили о данной неполадке на ресепшен. Но так как был вьетнамский новый год, никого из техников на месте не было. Через пару дней снова пообещали починить, ничего не вышло и почти перед отъездом за 2 дня предложили переехать в другой номер, но с очень большими сложностями сбора и переноса вещей, что мы отказались. Но за беспокойство принесли извинения и презент-бутылку вина. Но мы все равно рады что мы там остановились, завтраки отличные, особенно яичница, фрукты и йогурты собственного производства. Еды много для любого возраста, голодными никогда не останетесь. Есь бассейн на 4 этаже, но мы были один раз, ведь приехали на море. Там же есть массаж и другие спа-услуги. Дороговато, но массаж классный!!! Около ресепшена есть кафе, в самом отеле, кофе там потрясающий, а с пироженками так еще лучше! Продают фрукты справа от отеля на углу. Деньги меняли в ювелирном или аптеке Сапфир, в отеле курс ниже. Кафешек рядом полно, на любой вкус и кошелек. Экскурсии брали у гида, цена примерно одинаковая с уличными.Да еще, в залог забирают паспорта в отеле, пред выездом тщательно проверяют номер. Фрукты везли в корзинке 10 кг, все долетело,даже не помялось. В самолете есть специальный контейнер. В общем отдыхать в этом отеле рекомендую,несмотря на некоторые погрешности!

Thật ra để có 1 bộ ảnh đẹp có thể đến đây vào nhà hàng ăn và xuống bể bơi chụp ảnh, việc nghỉ đêm thật sự phải cân nhắc ở lần sau.

Title: リノベーションしたら素敵なリゾート
Review: Tam Daoで唯一(？)のリゾートホテルです。 私達が宿泊した時はベトナム人の宿泊客しかいませんでした。 従業員によって英語レベルはマチマチな印象ですが、不便は感じませんでした。 リゾート内のレストランのメニューには英語表記もあります。 このリゾートはなんといっても景色が最高です！ 車で山を登ったところにあり、ロビーや客室のベランダからの眺望が良かったです。 また、プールがあり、山の中に浮かんでいるような造りになっていて、宿泊客達の撮影スポットになっていました。 ちなみに7月下旬に行きましたが、雨が降ったり止んだりしていて気温も高くなく、プールに入っている人は2～3人しか見かけませんでした。 客室もヴィラタイプで素敵なのですが、客室に限らずリゾート全体的に古いのが残念だなと思いました。 多少は仕方のないことでしょうが、客室の中にアリなどの小さな虫が結構いて不快でした…… また湿気がたまっており、布団もバスタオルも湿っぽかったです…… リノベーションしたら本当に素敵なリゾートホテルなんだろうなと思いました。

Title: Full service resort with English speaking & polite staff, nice setting

Be sure to hire a taxi (250k vnd round trip) up to the town center, and sample the open air cafes where grilled foods are the specialty (these have tables with chairs beneath roofs, great for the damp weather)... the sticky rice cooked inside a hollow bamboo tube = yummy!! Title: Great View, Great Potential,...But Poor Management, Maintenance and Service
Review: Stayed there one night 08-09/08/15 with small family of 3. Based in Hanoi, we were looking for a short upscale weekend summer escape from the city. Knew the hotel and checked out the comments. Booked a Deluxe Mountain View Room with sales office Hanoi for around 90 US$ per night. Staff asked for 100% pre-payment, which we rejected, since we had given credit card to secure the booking. Overall, the best lodging option in Tam Dao, especially for foreigners. All other hotels in Tam Dao are local guest houses. Good points first. Resort is well appointed and designed, with main building and semi-detached villas assembled around a large courtyard and garden. Directly located at a mountain range with spectacular views over wooded hills and valley, certainly the biggest and one of the few outstanding assets of the resort. Small, but great infinity pool overlooking the valley. Now the down sides. Overall, the resort is an unfortunate and typical example of a locally owned and operated place, where much is invested in the beginning, but once open, not much else is done or cared for. A competent management was visibly absent. Staff's English is poor, no feeling of welcome, and hardly any smiles anywhere. The facilities may have looked good some years ago, but not much thought is given to maintenance. Rooms are clean and spacious, but lack furnishing and decor. Large restaurant menu, but food quality not good, service slow, waited 25 minutes for an ice coffee. Breakfast late, variety local, quality so so. Pool, kid's play, fitness room area are unattended, not in the best shape, or empty. No activities or entertainment in the resort. No shuttle to town. Could be a much better place if owners would know how to do or if they would care for.

Title: Breathtaking view resort

Title: An excellent 2.5 hotel in Tam Dao
Review: Everything the hotel served during my family stay was perfect. I'd like to return again, and again in the coming time. Location is just 200m from the town market. Tam Dao is a small town, and no worry you don't need walking far to find interesting attractions. This is my ideal hotel because you can walk to Silver waterfall in 10 minutes, and to the town swimming pool in 10 minutes, too. How lovely the town swimming pool was ! It was nice located beside the stream. To me, it marks the downtown instead of the town market. My room is on the 6th floor with a very good view. You can see the flying clouds and fog beside the room window. Breakfast is NOT included in the room price (like other hotels in Tam Dao), but surely you can order this and pay this extra upon checking-in. Ask the help from hotel receptionists. It's a simple breakfast, but hot and tasty noodle. Staff speaks English rather bad, but I didn't mind. This hotel can reach 3-star in service because it's a modern hotel and very good service.

Title: Dịch vụ tuyệt vời
Review: Nhóm mình đi 3 người (5-7/7). Đặt xong có thay đổi lịch đi Tam Đảo, được các bạn hỗ trợ rất nhiệt tình để lùi ngày Check in lại mà không mất thêm phí. Ngoài ra bọn mình cũng nhờ khách sạn để nhờ đồ trong tủ lạnh, thuê hộ bọn mình chỗ ngồi, các bạn đều nhiệt tình giúp đỡ và làm việc rất nhanh, không để bọn mình phải chờ đợi lâu. Giờ nhận phòng là 2h chiều, nhưng bọn mình đến khá sớm, làm thủ tục xong ra ngoài chơi rồi về sảnh khách sạn ngồi đợi. Đến 12h trưa, cô Hường- cô chủ khách sạn thấy bọn mình vẫn đợi nhận phòng, cô đã giúp bọn mình được nhận phòng nhanh nhất, cô upgrade lên phòng rộng hơn, có view cho bọn mình nhưng bọn mình không mất thêm gì cả. Cô bảo bọn mình như con cháu trong nhà nên cô thấy ngồi đợi lâu thế cô thương. Cô Hường còn giúp bọn mình bê thùng đồ to để nhờ tủ lạnh khách sạn, dặn khách sạn có mắm muối, bồn rửa đây, nếu còn gì cứ lấy mà dùng; mì tôm nước nóng có sẵn, đói thì xuống lấy ăn. Ngoài ra, bạn Hưng và chị Linh lễ tân cũng nhiệt tình chỉ dẫn bọn mình đi đâu, chơi gì. Mọi người trong khách sạn như người thân của chúng mình vậy. Cảm giác rất gần gũi. Cảm ơn Chân Mây Hotel đã cho chùng mình những trải nghiệm tuyệt vời trong chuyến đi Tam Đảo này

Title: Nhà hàng trên mái đẹp (nhà hàng Ruby)
Review: Theo tôi, đáng lẽ nó phải là một trong những nhà hàng hấp dẫn nhất ở Tam Đảo. Đầu tiên, tôi không mong đợi nhiều về nơi này nhưng tôi đã thay đổi suy nghĩ khi lần đầu tiên bước chân vào nhà hàng của họ, thiết kế hiện đại nhưng sự lãng mạn, tự nhiên vẫn còn. Thứ hai, như thường lệ, tôi muốn xem xét nhà hàng này trong bốn phần: Chất lượng thực phẩm, Xem dịch vụ và chi phí. 1 - Chất lượng bữa trưa: Một bất ngờ lớn đối với tôi và trên tất cả Tôi thực sự hài lòng với kỹ năng Đầu bếp: + Thịt bò với hạt tiêu đen (B s? T ti u? En) tươi, mềm và ngon ngọt, ý tôi là hương vị bùng nổ của hạt tiêu đen và độ mềm của thịt bò - Thật là một món ăn gây choáng! + Món tiếp theo tôi gọi là gà nướng Trung Quốc (G quay Qu? Ng? Ng): Tôi khuyên bạn nên dùng món này cho khách hàng foreiner, vì da gà giòn kiểu Trung Quốc và thịt gà mềm có thể đánh vào vị trí. Lý do là gà luộc truyền thống Việt Nam khá khó xử, người nước ngoài có thể trả cho chúng tôi một lời khen lịch sự nếu bạn hỏi họ nhưng sự thật là gà luộc rất khó cho họ ăn. + Cá tầm chiên muối (C t? M rang mu? I): Tôi nghĩ đó không phải là ý hay 'vì món chiên sẽ tạo ra một thành phần ngon như cá tầm chuyển sang một món ăn bình thường, lần sau tôi sẽ gọi món Cá tầm nóng Nồi và cá tầm nướng + Rượu ngô cao nguyên truyền thống của Việt Nam cũng là một điểm đáng chú ý: dễ uống và dễ uống. 2 - Giá trị ngắm núi: Sau khi ăn trưa, chúng tôi ngồi bên ban công, nhâm nhi tách cà phê ngắm đám mây đi ngang qua và vào sâu trong thung lũng núi đẹp như tranh vẽ, trải nghiệm này khá đặc biệt. 3 - Dịch vụ: Nhân viên ở đây ấm áp và chu đáo, từ tiếp viên, nhân viên thu ngân đến quản lý khách sạn. Anh ấy đã đến bàn của chúng tôi để có một ít rượu với chúng tôi. 4 - Chi phí: So với một số nhà hàng neaby, giá là tầm trung, (gần 400, 000 VN? ~ 17 $ cho một người) Để kết luận, tôi sẽ giới thiệu nhà hàng này cho các đối tác của mình nếu họ có ý định đến Tam Đảo vào lần tới.

Chúng tôi phải đợi 15p để được ông ấy liên lạc lấy phòng. Khi nhận phòng thì căn phòng tối mờ ảo do thiếu bóng đèn do bị cháy bóng gần hết, ga chăn thì ẩm mốc bẩn thỉu, tóc vẫn còn vương vãi của những người trước, nhà vệ sinh thì cũng vậy rất bẩn, thiết bị trong phòng thì cũ nát mùi nấm mốc. Chúng tôi đã yêu cầu đổi sang phòng khác thì chất lượng cũng không được cải thiện là bao. Khi chuyển sang phòng cao cấp hơn thì nhân viên yêu cầu thu thêm phụ phí 500.000 đ cho mồi ngày. Chúng tôi không thể ở được với tình trạng tồi tệ ma phải trả thêm phí nhiều như vậy . Nên gia dinh chúng tôi phải thu dọn hành lý di chuyển sang một nơi ở khác. Khi ngày hôm sau chúng tôi quay lại để lấy CMT để quên khach san cung khong co bat ky mot nhan vien phuc vu nao ngoai ong bao ve hom truoc thì người bảo vệ gây khó khăn không trả cho chúng tôi . Yêu cầu chúng tôi phải tự liên hệ với quản lý khách sạn mới trả lại giấy tờ cho chúng tôi. Khi chung toi phan anh lai voi Traveloka thi khach san lai noi sai su that khong thu them bat ky khoan phu phi nao voi chung toi. Đây là một khách sạn cũ kỹ rất lâu khong nâng cấp cải tạo. Bẩn thỉu tồi tàn. Nhân viên không có trách nhiệm làm ăn gian dối. Không bao giờ gia đình tôi quay lại khách sạn này và chúng tôi sẽ thông báo với bạn bè người thân của chúng tôi về thông tin khách sạn để tránh bị tiền mất tật mang như chúng tôi.

Title: Thật sự rất tệ
Review: Tối thứ 7 tuần trước ngày 13/8/2016 mình có đặt một phòng standard ở khách sạn với giá 1triệu6 2 người ở. Khi mình nhận phòng thì cảm giác đầu tiên khi bước vào phòng là sàn nhà bẩn, tủ cũ , giường cũ mùi hôi hám bốc lên quả thật như nó cả thế kỉ chưa có người sử dụng. Title: A huge disappointment - definitely do not recommend staying here

The only 2 positives I have is that the bed was comfortable and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. If you have unlimited time - spending a few days just blending in with the life here would be good - otherwise I would skip this - there is so much to see in Vietnam.

Title: Could be Better
Review: Mekong My Tho Hotel Review No 1A, Tết Mậu Thân Street, Ward 4 Mỹ Tho City, Tien Giang, Vietnam Tel: +84 0733 88 7777 Dates of Stay: 02-14-17 to 02-23-17 and 03-19-17 to 03-23-17 (two different stays) Room:  Location: My Tho is located about 70 kilometers south, southwest of Sai Gon (HCM). The 70 kilometer trip from Ho Chi Minh City takes about 75 minutes via the expressway. My Tho town sits on the banks of the Song Tien Giang (Tien River), the northern branch of two river branches, the other being the Hau Giang (Hau River) the lower branch of the Mekong that splits up by the Cambodian border before reaching the sea. The hotel is about a 100 meters from the river. Why Come Here? But for aging relatives that still live in My Tho Town, my Vietnamese wife and I would have little reason to visit My Tho year after year. Yes, there are a lot of the one or two-night delta tours that come and go through My Tho, but that in itself is not why I would stay here. My Tho Town (pop. about 225,000) has a port not far from the MeKong Hotel, where seven to 10-day Mekong River cruise ships dock, embark and disembark passengers going either up river or down (from Siem Reap or Phnom Penh). IMO, the bulk of all one, two and three-day tours are poor. However, some say they enjoyed them. We have stayed in most of the larger hotels in town and one in nearby Ben Tre. This will be our seventh different stay at a hotel in this area, most of which are less than average in my opinion. The Mekong My Tho hotel labels itself as a 4-Star hotel but I’d say that’s stretching it a fair bit. This hotel is definitely the best of all the hotels we have stayed at in My Tho. In Viet Nam I always say hotels give themselves at least one more star than they’re worth. Yes, it has a pool, elevators, tennis court, exercise room and more, but it has some short-comings discussed below. Checking In Our driver picked us up near Ben Thanh market in HCM and delivered us to My Tho in around 75 minutes via the Expressway. We had a large Toyota Land Cruiser and the cost for the trip was 700,000 dong or about $31 USD at the time of this review. Uber also will drive you down here for about the same price in their Economy Uber, which most likely will be smaller than a Toyota Land Cruiser. Official check-in time is 2 PM but we arrived at noon and it wasn’t a problem. We handed over our passports, which were copied and returned to us immediately. We handed over a copy of our Agoda booking voucher (not sure if required), and we were handed two electronic keycards for our room with two breakfast vouchers good for the entire stay. The whole process took less than five minutes. Elevators The eight or nine hotel floors are served by a bank of three elevators. Access to guest floors require a card key. There are two sets of buttons to access floors, one for guests that can see and another for those who are sight disabled (the first configuration I’ve seen). The elevator buttons for the blind have raise braille by each floor button. It was not clear to me how a blind person could use his card key to activate access to a guest floor. I’m sure there is an explanation. There are also many wheel chair ramps around the hotel. The Room When the hotel first opened about two years ago, I believe the double deluxe room was over $100/night with no breakfast. This town cannot justify charging that much for a room, even a more up-to-date room. There are a good number of mediocre hotels in town charging less than $20/night, all offering something to eat in the morning along with a clean bed and hot shower. The Minh Kieu comes to mind. Last year, I walked off the street and offered the hotel $60/night for a week’s stay (no breakfast) but they would not budge on the higher rate. Times change I guess. When I was getting ready to book a hotel in My Tho this year, I noticed the double deluxe rooms at the Mekong Hotel being offered at a much more reasonable rate with breakfast ($46/night including service charges and tax). I think the price is fair, all things considered. In the room, the queen size bed was nothing like your typical Vietnamese slab of concrete. It was semi-soft and provided good support. It had immaculate sheets, comforter, and four large and soft pillows. The linens still looked new. One morning I was lazy and stayed in the room to read. I allowed housekeeping to do their daily room cleaning, and they were in and out in a matter of minutes. An army of four people entered the room, all with different assigned tasks, and were finished in no time. Exiting the warm elevators on the sixth floor, we entered the floor hallway, which was very warm, even hot and humid. However, the room’s air-con worked well. We had to turn the thermostat up to a higher temperature in the evening because the room was too cold. The only closet in the room was a double-door, floor to ceiling affair about 4’ wide by 8’ high. It had sufficient shelving and an area for hanging clothes supplied with five hangers. Later, my wife asked for another 10 hangers and it wasn’t a problem. The standard in-room safe was located on a lower, desk cabinet shelf and was not attached to anything. So instead of breaking into the safe immediately, a thief could just take the entire safe and work on it later at his leisure at another location. While the bathroom was tiled floor to ceiling The bedroom and closet areas were carpeted. While the carpeting might have been less expensive than good quality tile initially, it doesn’t last long in a SEA environment. Our room carpet, which was probably less than two years old already had a couple small stains and what appeared to be a cigarette burn hole covered with the room’s sitting chair ottoman. The entire carpet will be a mess in three or four years. The small refrigerator was inadequate for the purpose of keeping snack foods or beverages really cold. Our first refrigerator was DOA (dead on arrival), so another was brought in. We complained that the second refrigerator didn’t cool beverages and we were told “they’re all like that.” Other guests I spoke to said the in-room refrigerator didn’t work as well. I suspect it was one of those energy-saving jobs. Yes, saves energy but doesn’t get cold. It also didn’t contain a small freezer shelf to make ice cubes, so it was probably never designed to get very cold in the first place. The hotel also included a hot water kettle and a couple tea bags and glasses for making hot tea. At the end of our second stay, my wife boiled some water for making a glass of tea. When the kettle stopped percolating she poured some hot water in the glass with the teabag and a small crack developed on the bottom of the cup. The hotel said we had to pay for a new glass, which we refused. They supplied two glasses, tea and a kettle to boil water. What were we to use to make the tea if not the glasses the hotel provided? The front-desk manager remained silent. Then he said; “it’s the rule.” I asked him where the rule was written that we pay for the hotel’s stupidity but he could not provide a source or document. In the end, our room was paid for but not whatever they were going to charge for a new glass. Two separate stays totaling 10 days over five weeks and this is how guests get treated. Bathroom The bathroom is tiled floor to ceiling. I agree with other reviews (not on this site) that the bath hot water is not hot. Water will not be hot in the morning and not much better in the afternoon, so bathe or shower in the early evening, when the water might be a couple degrees warmer but it will not be hot. This hotel, like many others in SEA, have solar hot water tanks on the roof. When the temperature drops at night, so does the temperature of the water in the tanks. A clean room, bedding and plenty of hot water are the most important things to me when booking a room. On one occasion, I wasted quite a bit of water, letting it run to see if the water would ever become hot. After five to seven minutes, it grew appreciably warmer. This made bathing more tolerable but still not hot. It seems that most Vietnamese hotel bathrooms, except for the very, very best hotels, are susceptible to water leaking or draining on the floor, either from the sink, toilet, bidet, bath or shower. That’s why they slope the floor and install a drain in every bathroom during construction. I noticed a trail of water from our bidet or toilet to the drain about five feet away. The bath tub was quite large, even for a person of 6’3”. There was a shower head handle installed on the surface of the bath tub, which might be fine for some. Ours didn’t work, so we called the front desk. A guy came up and flushed sand out of the line. Personally, I like to stand under a shower head. With a hand shower head one generally has to hold the unit with one hand while washing with the other hand. I suppose you could “soap up” with two hands and later rinse with one. As I approach 70, I am keenly aware of my physical shortcomings. Getting out of a tub is a challenge for me at 70, especially without handrails or grabs of some sort. I’m constantly aware of falling, and that’s one reason why I prefer showers, so I can stand to bathe, exit and dry safely. There was a duplex electrical outlet next to the sink, but I am not sure if it could accommodate an electric shaver because it had no markings. My electric shaver works with 120/220v, both 50/60 cycles, so no worries there. I generally charge mine before leaving home, and the charge will last for almost the entire trip. Bath amenities included two razor kits, two toothbrush kits, two combs, shower cap, cotton buds, sewing kit, soap, shampoos, conditioners, and bath gels, are more supplies than one will generally use. I should also mention there was an electric hair dryer in the drawer of the nightstand next to the bed. There were two hand towels, one medium towel and two bath towels, all with the hotel’s named raised in the towel knitting, probably to discourage theft. They appeared new and in excellent condition. There were no odors coming from any of the bathroom drains that I could detect. Bathroom odors were a very common problem in Vietnam but now seem to be on the decline with more and more new construction. When using the pool during our first stay in February, we got our towels from the front desk. By the time of our second visit in March, they decided they had to be delivered to you at the pool area. Either way, it worked. Minibar The room was supplied with 2 - 355 ml bottles of Aquafina water daily. There were no other beverages or snacks in the room. The room refrigerator contained two 500 ml of Aquafina water each 15,000d if you consumed. A bottle of branded water on the street is one-third that. The refrigerator did not get cold. Internet and Cable TV The internet at this hotel works but without a VPN I would not use it for anything but casual browsing. The internet at this hotel is wide open (no password required). Internet throughput and speed was not good. In fact, it was abysmal. It could not load Speedtest on the first attempt, and it would time out. The bandwidth tests I preformed, most during prime time resulted in fairly poor results of less than 3 Mb/s. The stream to the LED TV was also pretty bad. Quite frequently, the screen would freeze or otherwise display terrible pixilation. There must have been a couple hundred channels, mostly Vietnamese. Oddly enough, I found many popular U.S. channels, like HBO and Cinemax being broadcast with Vietnamese over English, making viewing unusable for English only speaking hotel guests. There were a couple Australian channels being broadcast in English. There was no channel card listing in the room, so one had to step slowly through each channel to see instant content. I settled on a couple good football games being broadcast in English. Top Floor The top floor (the floor above the 8th floor) is divided in to indoor and outdoor sections. I guessed its main purpose is to serve as an entertainment and lounge area. The few times I went up there was to relax, read and take in the expanse of the northern tributary of the Mekong. The top floor lounge area offered lunches ranging from steamed rice at 10,000d, bowls of soup for 20,000d to stir fry dishes of squid, pork, or chicken generally from 60,000d to 80,000d. The lunch menu is served at both lunch and dinner hours with no price changes. One early evening, I had ordered the Seafood Hai San, mixed shrimp, squid, mushrooms, vegetables, sprouts for 70,000d. The presentation was great and food was quite good. It was even better than a similar dish I had at a local eatery up the street for the same price. Earlier in the day, I saw an expat family of five eating lunch off the same menu. After they had eaten I asked them how they liked it. They also agreed the food was good and had obviously ordered more dishes for their group. Generally speaking, I would opt to eat at a place outside the hotel, where there are many locals dining. One day I went up to the top floor and ordered a cold beer off the menu and noticed the price was 25,000d a can. A day earlier, I had ordered the same beer for 23,000d, another day it was 24,000d. Now really, 1,000d - 2,000d is hardly worth mentioning but some menus have prices lower than others. So consistency gets negative marks. Go figure. Pool For many years, I had hoped a hotel of this caliber would be built with a nice pool. I am guessing the pool is about 30’ X 70’ in breath and width. At the shallow end the water is about 3’ deep and a little over 5’ at the deep end. It has a raised circular spa that is about 12’ across and a couple feet deep. There were 10 jacuzzi style water jets. The water seemed to be the same temperature as the pool. Connected to the main pool and separated by a wall under the waterline was a 2’ splash pool for children. The pool and the area surrounding the pool is not without problems. First, there is a massive deck around the pool but there is little shade for guests to sit under. There are only two umbrellas with two loungers under each and hardly enough covered loungers for potentially dozens of bathers. There were many wicker tables and chairs but they were all in the sun. The ultraviolet radiation is terrible in these parts, and the wicker chairs, tables, and loungers were all starting to break apart from UV exposure eating up the plastic vinyl wicker. Once in the refreshing pool water, I noticed a lot of black algae growing in the seams of tile mosaics below water level. Having owned a pool for many years, I learned that black algae is a condition that exists on surfaces and in water that is not maintained with a proper pH level (chemical balance level). I suspect this pool is NOT properly maintained with proper levels of chlorination and use of an algaecide, nor is it brushed daily to further prevent the spread of algae and keep grout lines clean. This lovely pool will fall into disrepair if the problem is not address quickly and effectively. Breakfast Breakfast is served daily from 6:30 AM to 9 AM on the second floor. The dining area is a large room, seating perhaps 75 guests. There is also outdoor seating under umbrella tables. Tables were spacious and placed well apart from each other in a very clean and shiny tiled dining room. The first few days we took breakfast a little after 8 AM. Even though there were only a few people eating, we notice many of the food trays were depleted or empty. The next morning we arrived around 7:30 AM and the place was bedlam, which may have been an aberration caused by the hotel hosting a seminar or some other event. The local event, if that what is was, left little food for guests actually staying at the hotel. However, we noted that food trays and chaffers did not get refilled much after 8:00 AM everyday during our stay. For our second visit of four days in March, there were fewer people than in February. One morning at breakfast, my wife and I were a two of five diners between 8:15 AM and 9 AM. This is not nearly a 4-star hotel in my opinion. Here is a list of foods and beverages that were being served during both stays: Egg Station - Boiled, Fried, Scrambled, and Omelettes Pho - Noodle soup Bacon Sausages (more like American hot dogs cut on a bias) Plain congee Pork congee Steamed dumplings (previously frozen) Spaghetti Stir-fried Vermicelli noodles with vegetables Fried rice Bo Kho - Beef stew Banh Cuon Nong - Stuffed, flat noodle rolls Ham roll - sliced Lettuce Grape tomatoes Cucumber slices Watermelon slices Pineapple slices Jack fruit Dragon fruit Bread rolls - circular and smaller cigar-shaped rolls but not the big baguettes typically available on the street Dry chocolate looking cereal in a dispenser (for kids?) Tiramisu (saw only one time in over a week) Flan (served most days) Longan/Lotus berry dessert (saw only one time in over a week) Fresh Watermelon juice Fresh Pineapple juice Orange juice highly diluted with water Purified water Ice Tea Milk for coffee Coffee Tea Butter Jam Honey for sweetening if you didn’t prefer refined sugar Don’t except to see all the foods served daily. More than half of the above items were served on different days. However, wee left breakfast every morning satisfied with what was served. We met some vegetarians while staying at the hotel, and they had a hard time finding enough food to eat in the morning that met their dietary needs. We also invited two other friends over to the hotel for breakfast, and we paid 100,000d each for their breakfast. Positives: Good size room Good room air-conditioning Comfortable mattress with clean sheets, comforter, and soft pillows A reasonable number of electrical outlets to charge gadgets. We had two outlets each on both sides of our queen bed above the nightstand, and there was one other wall mounted wall outlet behind the cushioned chair. If you discounted the lamp behind the chair, that would leave six free outlets for charging and connecting Decent variety of foods for breakfast if you get to the restaurant early Lunch or light dinner items on the top floor are okay and reasonably priced Except for the bath tub, the hotel is disability-friendly $46/night for the best hotel in My Tho to date Saw families with kids, so probably kid-friendly when you consider the splash pool attached to larger pool Adequate fire escapes. Learn where they are Negatives: Lack of really good hot water in the bathroom. However, I will reserve final judgment pending my theory if you leave the water running for five - seven minutes, it will become warmer but not hot Short shower head handle installed on bath surface was clogged with sand; shower head handle should have been wall-mounted Room’s refrigerator could not keep beverage cans or plastic bottles of water cold Food in chafers at breakfast not being kept hot $46/night will get you a better hotel in Ho Chi Minh City, even near Ben Thanh market Pool area needs more shade and loungers with umbrellas Lots of black algae growing on the pool tile Beautiful view of the Song Tien River and islands obscured by dirty exterior room windows Room safe free standing and not attached to furniture or wall (thief can throw safe into a laundry cart) Internet and TV mostly unusable and unable to stream or even load images quickly Poor implementation of wifi security (open network with no password required). Use at your own risk No dead bolt or swing lock on the room door Management bickering over a 35-cent glass they supplied for making hot coffee or tea, which cracked but did not break when we filled it with hot water Summary: 3 marks and 4 if they fix all of the above problems and not hassle customers over a 35-cent glass that cracked due to the hotel management stupidity. TIP: Eat between 06:30 - 07:30 for the best variety of food and selection of table (open seating). Breakfast closes promptly at 9 AM. TIP: If a swimming pool, and more variety at breakfast, isn’t important, consider the Minh Kieu hotel up the street. My review of the Minh Kieu hotel last year was moved to the Minh Tai hotel. How that happened is a mystery to me. I have never stayed at the Minh Tai hotel and my review specifically states the review was for the Minh Kieu.

Title: Vietnamese Roots
Review: LODGE ROOM; The Island Lodge is in a class of their own. The Lodge does not disappoint when it comes to spaciousness, beauty, pool, sauna and most importantly peace and quiet. Our interactions with all the children and adult locals excitedly yelling “Hello” was quite enjoyable. We also got to know Michel and his family’s deep rooted connection to Vietnam. Scattered throughout the atrium of the property are photos and artifacts that give you a glimpse of his family’s early time in Vietnam. All and all, our experience at The Island Lodge was very pleasurable and we would recommend it to any couple or small group trying to get away from the hustle and bustle of city life. A perfect quiet weekend getaway location. Thank you Michel y François for your hospitality and making our stay an enjoyable one.

Nếu đi xe đạp là rất quan trọng đối với trải nghiệm của bạn, hãy gọi trước để xác nhận cấu hình sẽ hoạt động cho bạn nhưng cũng đáng để giết vài giờ. Tóm lại, khu nghỉ mát này là một nơi nghỉ ngơi tuyệt vời từ thành phố Hồ Chí Minh (2 giờ) dễ dàng và một lối thoát rất thư giãn, trang nhã.

Title: Les kings du Mekong
Review: De souche bretonne mais né à Strasbourg il y a 60 ans, Michel a le Mekong qui coule dans les veines : une particularité génétique héritée de ses grands-parents paternels, Édouard et Marthe, qui ont longtemps travaillé dans ce qui s'appelait alors l'Indochine, et de son papa, Joël, qui y est né. Le parfum des frangipaniers, le chuintement des barques glissant sur les arroyos, le spectacle sans pareil du soleil s'endormant sur le delta, Michel les a d'abord retrouvés en produisant et commercialisant au Vietnam de la bonne volaille de qualité française. Une aventure à laquelle l'épidémie de grippe aviaire a, croit-on comprendre, mis un terme. Mais qu'importe, l'appel du Mekong était trop fort : avec son épouse Françoise, Michel a, il y a quelques années, jeté son dévolu sur un terrain de l'île de My Tho, au bord d'un des bras du delta. Ils y ont fait bâtir un lodge de 12 chambres d'un raffinement et d'un confort rarement vus ailleurs. L'accueil, tant de Michel que de la trentaine d'employés, est lui aussi source d'incommensurables moments de bonheur.

Title: Dịch vụ tuyệt vời và nơi đẹp, yên bình cho gia đình rút lui!
Review: Tôi vô tình phát hiện ra khu nghỉ dưỡng này khi cố gắng tìm một nơi (khác với bãi biển) để giải trí cho con trai tôi vào mùa hè. Kế hoạch ban đầu của chúng tôi là ở đây có lẽ một hoặc hai đêm, để có thời gian khám phá đồng bằng sông Cửu Long, nhưng cuối cùng, sau khi xem xét và kiểm tra với bạn bè, chúng tôi quyết định dành kỳ nghỉ 3 đêm tại đây và nhà nghỉ The Island không làm chúng tôi thất vọng. Khu nghỉ mát nhỏ nhưng đẹp và được chăm sóc tốt. Một cảm giác ấm áp mặc dù tôi đến vào một buổi chiều mưa. Nó nằm ở cuối con đường nhỏ nên rất yên tĩnh. Khung cảnh đẹp bên trong, căn phòng rộng rãi (phòng cao cấp, cạnh vườn), giường lớn và một chiếc giường trẻ em miễn phí riêng cho con trai tôi (suy nghĩ rất tốt). Hồ bơi đẹp và bên sông. Dịch vụ ở đây là đặc biệt tốt. Đặc biệt cảm ơn ông Minh tại nhà hàng đã thực sự giúp đỡ gia đình tôi trong những ngày chúng tôi ở đây. Tất cả các nhân viên đều tốt đẹp. Con trai tôi và tôi yêu cô gái nhỏ, người hướng dẫn viên du lịch trong tất cả các tour du lịch của chúng tôi. Con trai tôi thích nhất là đi xe đạp vì nó có thể đi quanh làng, ngay cả trong mưa (một trải nghiệm rất tốt) để khám phá đồng bằng sông Cửu Long. Tất cả các tour du lịch đã được tùy chỉnh và thú vị. Hai thứ duy nhất mà tôi không thích lắm là bồn tắm (tôi định đặt phòng với bồn tắm nhưng áp lực nước rất yếu nên không thể sử dụng bồn nhiều. Chúng tôi đợi trong vài giờ mà vẫn không thể nó thậm chí còn đầy một nửa) và rất nhiều muỗi trong nhà hàng trong bữa tối. Nói chung, chúng tôi đã có kinh nghiệm rất tốt và ở lại The Island Lodge. Con trai tôi siêu thích nó và liên tục yêu cầu tôi để nó trở lại. Vì vậy, cảm ơn bạn cho tất cả những nỗ lực của bạn để làm tất cả những gì tốt nhất cho chúng tôi như là khách. Mong được trở lại sớm! Chúc mừng Mai

Và cà phê là tuyệt vời! Vì vậy, nếu bạn phải tránh xa những tiếng huýt sáo ở Sài Gòn hoặc chỉ cần thư giãn hoàn toàn, chúng tôi rất có thể giới thiệu Island Lodge.

The breakfast was lovely with freshly baked pastries and fruit plus anything else you wanted from the menu. The menu for lunch and dinner was extensive and we enjoyed the freshness of the food. We feel privileged to have stayed somewhere as special and unique as The Island Lodge .

Title: Relaxing by the Mekong
Review: We stayed here for three nights relaxation during a busy tour of South Vietnam. It was very pleasant to be in a small boutique hotel right on the river. We had a river view but the rooms with a view of the very nice gardens looked good too. You really do want to just switch off and chill out at the lodge because there isn’t much else within easy reach. We took a boat trip one afternoon just to chug slowly round the island and get our bearings. We were told, rather apologetically, that this tour had no guide and no stops. That was absolutely fine by us - we just wanted peace & quiet, and had no real wish to get off the boat to buy more crafts. Breakfasts were made to order which made a nice change from two weeks of buffets. To be honest, we weren’t quite so impressed with the rest of the food, particularly as we couldn’t easily go anywhere else to eat. Perhaps the French menu wasn’t quite French enough, and the Vietnamese not Vietnamese enough. However we were impressed with one bit of service. We asked whether they had any morning glory (a favourite of ours). It wasn’t on the menu (“It’s Northern food”) but they managed to find some for us, and cooked it beautifully with garlic. There’s a warm welcome from the owners, Michel & Francoise, and as we left a small gift of Vietnamese chocolate. A nice touch.

Truy cập từ Sài Gòn thực sự nhanh chóng và thoải mái chỉ với 1/2 giờ đi xe được sắp xếp bởi Michel, chủ sở hữu và nhà điều hành của Khu nghỉ mát. Khung cảnh trên nhánh sông mekong, thư giãn trên hồ bơi với khung cảnh quyến rũ thuộc địa nhất định chỉ là siêu phẩm. Các phòng, lớn và được thiết lập độc đáo - chúng tôi đã chọn chế độ xem sông - có cùng quan điểm đó. Bữa sáng, bữa trưa và bữa tối khá ngon, thực phẩm tươi và nguyên liệu được chuẩn bị tốt. Nhân viên amd thân thiện mỉm cười. Một nơi thực sự tuyệt vời để thư giãn vài ngày - mang theo sách và đọc ngay cả khi thư viện trong nhà được trang bị tốt với okd nhưng cũng có sách mới (chủ yếu bằng tiếng Pháp). Michel và vợ là những người chủ tuyệt vời - họ xứng đáng được bạn trải nghiệm vị trí của họ.

Certains diront que les prix sont un peu élevés pour le Vietnam. C'est vrai mais c'est tout à fait justifié . Un tel niveau de qualité coûte forcément un peu plus cher . Allez y, vous ne le regretterez pas !

Title: Tuần trăng mật và sinh nhật
Review: Chúng tôi ở lại cho 2 đêm vào cuối tuần trăng mật của chúng tôi tại Việt Nam và để kỷ niệm sinh nhật của tôi. Nhà nghỉ là một tài sản đáng yêu ở một nơi hẻo lánh, chúng tôi có một căn phòng tuyệt đẹp nhìn ra sông và hồ bơi. Các nhân viên đều đáng yêu, xinh đẹp mặc quần áo và tất cả rất chu đáo, để có chủ sở hữu không chỉ chào đón chúng tôi, nhưng để nói bye là đặc biệt thêm. Các món ăn được xuất sắc từ bánh mì nhà làm, chúng tôi lấy mẫu từ cả Pháp và Việt a la carte cả tuyệt vời. Chúng tôi đã thực hiện 2 chuyến tham quan với hướng dẫn viên Kai, anh ấy rất hữu ích và có nhiều thông tin. Các tour du lịch xe đạp đến đồn điền Cacao, chúng tôi yêu thích đặc biệt là có trà hoa nhài với một gia đình địa phương. Các tour du lịch trên một chiếc thuyền quanh đảo và một chuyến viếng thăm một hòn đảo khác đã được truyền thống du lịch và chúng tôi đã không được hưởng rất nhiều nhưng là thú vị. Chúng tôi rất thích thuê xe đạp từ nhà nghỉ và gặp gỡ nhiều người dân địa phương khi bị lạc đường! Cảm ơn bạn đã 2 ngày yên tĩnh đã giúp tuần trăng mật của chúng tôi trở nên đặc biệt.

Title: a welcome restful place
Review: we stayed at Island Lodge half way through our 3 week trip. It was the perfect place to unwind and relax for a few days. Our river view room looked out over the Mekong and sitting on the balcony with a glass of wine watching the boats sail by was delightful. The staff are a joy. So friendly, nothing is too much trouble. The fact that there is no traffic you can only get there by a golf buggy type vehicle makes sure it is peaceful and quiet. A lovely pool, again looking out over the Mekong. The restaurant serves exceptional food. We ate from the French menu twice and really enjoyed the break from Vietnamese food, I had a manicure in the spa and it was as good as anything I have in the UK. The rooms are spacious and comfortable with coffee making facilities but no fridge. That would have been a real bonus as the temperature was 30-32 degrees. Also take some additional hangers. There are 3 for two people which we found a little strange as most guests stay for a few days. Nothing but praise for this place

Title: BEL ETABLISSEMENT
Review: Situé sur une île à quelques kilomètres de My Tho, l'établissement est niché au bord de la rivière. Il est constitué d'une vingtaine de chambres dont une partie donnent sur la rivière, l'autre sur les jardins. La vue sur le Mékong n'a pas un énorme intérêt si ce n'est le passage des bateaux (la vie quoi) Mentions spéciales pour la qualité du jardin (nous avons préféré la vue jardin à la vue Mékong) et la piscine à débordement qui donne sur le Mékong (Jacuzzi fonctionne sur demande à cause du bruit mais la pression est trop light). L'ambiance général se veut un peu colonial et c'est réussi. Seul bémol, la qualité de la restauration. Celle ci se veut semi-gastro (à la française) et c'est franchement raté. La cuisine asiatique est francisée et la cuisine française est vietnamisée. Au prix pratiqués (3 à 4 fois les prix extérieurs), c'est dommage voir ridicule. Cela n'entache en rien la qualité et la gentillesse du personnel. Mention spéciale pour la chef de salle. Préférer un taxi et aller manger en ville, les taxi ne coutent rien.

Title: Absolute gem only 2 hours from Saigon airport
Review: We just spent 3 fantastic nights at this hotel, relaxing, exploring the island, and eating fresh, delicious food. Can't rate this highly enough, and it's easily accessible from Saigon and the airport. Having said that, we were a bit disappointed as we passed over the huge bridge to Thoi Son island. In my mind, we were heading to a rural idyll, and I didn't see how the island could be rural when it has a motorway passing through one end of it! But 10kms later, after driving through the fruit trees down the one road suitable for cars, we arrived at the Lodge. And the setting is beautiful and quiet, surrounded by lanes through the fruit plantations and houses, and with a view of the ever-changing Mekong. Everybody we interacted with at the Lodge was friendly and helpful, and service was always with a smile. Some of the staff didn't have great English, but there was always someone around who did. The staff make the place, and we were really charmed by them! A special thank you to Giao, one of the waitresses, who remembered our orders from previous days and was always kind and friendly. The Lodge itself is wonderfully designed, with a huge open communal area which is subtly divided into bar and dining areas. The whole place is beautifully furnished and oozes style - I would like to transplant everything from the bar area into my house! We loved that there were so many different seating areas around the grounds, including a couple of pagodas, sofas, riverfront tables and a table right out on the pier for watching the sunset. The pool is warm, long, and spotlessly clean, with plenty of loungers and huge fresh towels. Bedrooms are clean and comfortable, and as stylish as the downstairs area. There were so many other places to sit and enjoy the view that we didn't really use the balcony, but it is a relaxing place to be. The food was unexpectedly good. There is a French and a Vietnamese menu, and food is fresh and well presented. They bake their own bread and croissants on site, and the smell of it in the morning and before dinner was a treat. It's an odd thing to recommend when you're in Vietnam, but the quiche lorraine was one of the most delicious things we ate on the whole trip! It's on the starter menu, but is big enough and rich enough to enjoy for lunch with some of the fresh bread. We also enjoyed the duck, and the tuna. And breakfasts were sublime, with everything made to order. There is a comprehensive wine list, and we also appreciated the fact that the house wine was very reasonably priced and very drinkable - thanks Michel! The Lodge offers tours, which we didn't do, but instead we took bikes out on two afternoons and explored the lanes and bridges of the island on our own. It's hard to believe that the big city of My Tho is only a few kms away when you're cycling around under the shade of the trees, over bridges that are 2 feet wide. At the very far end of the island, as far as the road goes, we stopped and had a drink at Mr Thanh's little waterfront bar and chatted to him about tourism on the island. He was an interesting man with superb English, and his wife makes a delicious cold lemon juice on a hot day. The only negatives: At a Lodge with eco credentials, I would have liked to see drinking water available as refills, rather than endless 500ml plastic bottles. And just be aware that the Mekong view is of a busy waterway full of commercial and industrial traffic, with industrial buildings across the water. In actual fact we really enjoyed watching the traffic and the change of the tides so this wasn't a problem at all, but we hadn't realised it wasn't looking out on to countryside. Thanks to all the staff at the Island Lodge. This really is a gem, and we were so pleased that we stayed for 3 nights rather than rushing through.

Title: Shangri-La on the Mekong
Review: This hotel enjoys an idyllic location on the banks of the Mekong & everything about it is right. We were then able to move to the balcony & watch the sun rise. Our spotlessly clean room was spacious & comfortable with copious quantities of bamboo in keeping with the location. The bed was large & comfortable with an attached shower room & separate toilet. The food at both dinner & breakfast was superb & my wife commented that her quiche & salad was one of the best she had ever eaten. I still remember the exquisite chocolate fondant. Breakfast was cooked to order so we could have as much as we wanted & nothing was wasted. Service throughout our visit was exemplary. Outside, the hotel has a good-sized swimming pool & sauna with ample sun loungers, complete with parasols, towels & sun hats, for all the guests so there is no need to arrive early & reserve one. We recommend this hotel unreservedly for all ages.

Title: Perfect....except for the kids
Review: From the moment you arrive until you leave you will be delighted with your stay here. We had a river view double which has a great view of both the pool and the river. By far the highlight has to be the food. It is exceptional and very reasonably priced considering the isolated nature of the hotel. The hotel offers it's own various boat trips on the river for a variety of lengths and budgets and the your guide provided is very good. We had a massage on our last night which was by far the best we had during our holiday in Vietnam. Our only issue was that this sort of tranquil place should be adults only. There were a few kids staying during our stay who were quite annoying. In my opinion it's just not the sort of place where you expect to get hit by a ball from the pool when trying to relax. If children are of the age where all they want to do is play with a ball in the pool I don't understand why a parent would insist on dragging them around the world to do that when Benidorm or Tenerfie would be more suitable. It's not exactly as if they are taking in the local culture. The staff did approach the parents which calmed them down for a bit. I understand it must be difficult to turn away custom but I think the hotel would benefit long term by having a minimum age limit. Regardless, we loved this hotel and the owners and all the staff are great and I would recommend the hotel to anyone visiting South Vietnam and the Mekong Delta.

Title: Best way to ‘do the Mekong Delta’

A few things could be improved or corrected: * Pool water was cloudy, may need more filter time. * Neighbor dogs were barking very loud in early morning. * The front door of the room, made of bamboo, has gaps letting noises in from hallway. * Mosquito net hung too high thus could not be tugged in to prevent mosquitoes coming inside the net.
