Title: A haven of peace in the Mekong Delta OK
Review: This is a beautifully conceived boutique resort of 12 rooms, whose hosts and staff couldn't be more accommodating, warm and gracious. It is right on the Mekong River just 1-1/2 hours from the bustle and chaos of Saigon. Michel, the French owner and creative force behind this idyllic lodge, and his wife, Francoise, go above and beyond to cater to your every need. It is managed in a professional and gracious manner. The lodge arranged our transport from Saigon and back to the airport which went without a hitch. In fact I left my cellphone in the car. The driver found it; there wasn't enough time to retrieve it before my flight, but the lodge assured me they would get it to me and I received it at my next destination well packaged and Michel refused our offers to reimburse them for the postage and handling, saying it was their pleasure. What a lovely gesture. Fabulous pool overlooking the river, wonderful open dining room, tastefully decorated to a high standard. Rooms are beautiful, comfortable and beautifully situated. Ours was in the garden (we chose to have a bathtub rather than the river view) and the setting among the ponds, water lillies, little bridges was perfect. We took a half day trip on the river, designed for tourists, but our guide was knowledgeable and interesting and even the kitschy coconut candy making, ride on a Vietnamese rowboat down.a small tree canopied canal, paddled by two Vietnamese women (occasionally men), honey tea service was fun and educational. (No pressure to buy anything). I had two massage sessions (one an herbal with balls) and both were fabulous -- and very reasonably priced. Couldn't ask for a nicer couple of days.

Title: Simply awesome! Website does NOT do it justice!
Review: On arrival our whole family were like "wow!" - the fact you arrive by golf buggy as now cars can get down the track is amazing. You arrive in reception - open air, jetty to the river and the outside pool, it's simply gorgeous. We had a beautiful garden bungalow with plenty of space and nice verandah. The pool is fabulous, overlooking the delay with plenty of sun and shade and comfortable loungers. The staff here are all very friendly, very accommodating and the pool man "Mr lollipop' so kind and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble for anyone here. The owners make themselves known and are very personable. The food is a mix of vietnamese and french, all very tasty and reasonably priced house wine which was unusual - this being our 7th and final stop in Vietnam. Breakfast is plentiful. They have bikes to use locally with a very basic map and a few trips on boats / bikes to offer. We did a boat trip around the island stopping where honey and coconut candy was made, it was lovely. We mainly relaxed here and could have spent longer here. OK, so this was all BEFORE my daughter had a nasty accident on a bicycle. We were in the middle of nowhere, had no idea what to do so I rang the hotel and explained she had her ankle trapped, blood everywhere.... they immediately sent the golf buggy and the owner Michael and Assistant Manager Aimee rapidly followed and took us straight to the nearest hospital. Without boring you with the detail, they were simply fabulous and took charge, translated, arranged a transfer to Saigon, and back and kept in touch to see we were all ok. They went over and above what I would have expected any hotelier to do, but made it as best as possible for us. We returned the next day for a swim, late check out and a lovely last meal - we would all love to return. My 5 star rating is based on the setting, the view, the service, rooms, food, pool and everything, and is not biased because of our mishap. But we will return here as it's simply beautiful and the staff were some of the nicest we'd experienced on our trip. I cannot believe they only have 3 stars, but I imagine it's because they only have 12 rooms. The website doesn't do this place justice. Prepare to be wowed!

Very narrow road leading to a car parking. Good or bad news, cars cannot reach the resort. An electric golf cart picked us up. They had a room for driver at the car parking for cheap including a meal. We arrived in this green resort and got welcomed by the owner. Lobby and restaurant were nice, spacey and very well ventilated. We never felt too hot. Wind helped too. Decoration was simple but very nice with a family historical touch amd view on the Mekong. We went to our bungalow. Again, simple but very nice. Very green environment. Quite. No noisy tourists. Definitely another class of tourists. Human size. Nice pool, again, simple. Nice staff too. Very caring. And best of the best? The food. For 8USD you get what would be a “bread and butter” Beef carrot dish turned into a delicacy. We will back. No doubt about it. Nous en avions assez d'aller a' la mer depuis 20 ans. Foules, bruit, embouteillages,... J'ai décidé de viser dans une autre direction mais a' portée de Saigon, et dans un autre carde. Nous avons atterris au Island Lodge Resort. Une route étroite amène au parking. Le resort n'est ensuite qu'accessible en auto électrique. Il y avait une chambre pour le chauffeur au niveau du parking avec un repas a' un prix très abordable; Nous sommes arrivés dans un resort très verdoyant et avons étés reçus par le proprio. Le lobby et restaurant sont spacieux, très charmants et bien ventilés. Nous n'avons jamais ressenti la chaleur. La décoration est simple avec une touche d'histoire familiale au Vietnam et le resto offre une large vue sur le Mékong. Le bungalow, aussi dans un cadre très verdoyant était simple mais très élégant.. Calme, pas de touristes bruyants. Une toute autre classe d’hôtel a' taille humaine. La piscine est simple et jolie. Title: Wow!!!
Review: We started our day with a jolt. We had asked for a bicycle tour in the Mekong area, and started on 1A, one of the busiest roads in Vietnam. After that, to end the day at The Island Lodge was like a bit of Heaven. The hotel was small, unexpected, welcoming and a haven of calm. I don't get the rating systems. This hotel is rated three star. I would rate it much higher. The next day we stayed at a three star in Vinh Long. What a dump that was. Going from Heaven to Hell. And kudos to owner Michel. We like wine with our meals. Good and reasonably priced wine is hard to find in Asia. Leave it to a Frenchman like Michel to have an excellent house wine that is both good tasting and reasonably priced. And the meals were very very good. We only stayed one night. We wanted to stay more (you have no idea; near death experiences engender an appreciation for the finer things in life) and will be back. If you have the opportunity, do stay here.

Title: Escapade hors du temps
Review: Nous avons passé un long week-end à My Tho, en venant de Singapour. En trois jours, mon mari a eu l'impression d'avoir pris une semaine de vacances, tant le dépaysement, le repos, la quiétude offerts par The Island Lodge étaient complets. Nous avons apprécié la dimension humaine de l'endroit, le service attentionné et très gentil de tout le personnel, la présence et l'écoute du propriétaire Michel et sa femme, la décoration élégante et sobre en même temps, le soucis de l'environnement qui se traduit notamment dans les produits de toilette et du SPA, ainsi que dans les matériaux utilisés pour construire le bâtiment. Notre chambre avait vue sur le Mékong, avec une grande terrasse propice à la contemplation de l'eau. La salle de restaurant, toute ouverte sur la piscine et le jardin, est magnifique et invite à flemmarder en lisant un livre et en sirotant un smoothie à la noix de coco (j'en rêve encore) tout en écoutant de la musique un peu rétro. L'hôtel offre un SPA très agréable avec un large choix de soins. Seul bémol, le personnel qui y travaille parle très peu anglais. Dans une situation précise, l'esthéticienne a dû faire appel à une collègue hors du SPA pour venir lui traduire ce que j'essayais de lui expliquer. Tout est vite rentré dans l'ordre mais c'est un peu frustrant de ne pas pouvoir communiquer directement. Enfin, l'hôtel offre aussi une palette d'excursions sur le Mékong ou dans la campagne avoisinante. Nous avons fait un tour en bateau puis vélo dans la campagne au milieu des cocotiers. Nous avons eu le plaisir d'être accompagnés par le propriétaire lui-même qui nous a guidés à travers la campagne. Nous avons très bien mangé à tout moment de la journée. La carte offre un choix entre la cuisine française et la cuisine vietnamienne. Je conseille d'essayer bien sûr les recettes locales ! Bref, un excellent séjour des plus ressourçants.

Title: Relax in luxury, get insights into life on the Mekong
Review: The view from the bedroom terrace, swimming pool and restaurant is fascinating, watching all manner of river traffic passing by, and ideal for boat trips on the Mekong river. The staff were very welcoming, friendly and helpful, and booked trips and transfers for us. The restaurant food was really excellent for both lunch and dinner - both the Vietnamese and French menus offered good choice and portions were good, although the wine is very expensive (typically £25-40 per bottle, although a £18-20 one was fine). Breakfast is 'unlimited', with hot and cold choices, coffee, juices etc. plenty of fresh fruit and breads. The room was large and comfortable, with a good shower with plenty of space. The coffee machine was a pleasant touch, as was complementary water, and the terrace a great place to sit in the evening (mosquitos permitting). The pool is big enough for lengths, or just keeping cool. There are plenty of places in the gardens and restaurant/bar areas to sit and read quietly or for quiet conversation. The hotel is two hours' drive from Ho Chi Minh City airport (a bit less from the city centre). As we arrived late (10pm) we pre-ordered dinner and the restaurant was kept open for us. On the (slightly) downside: The bar/restaurant took last orders at 9.30pm and all the lights were generally off by 10pm, which took some getting used to. We tended to order a bottle of wine at the end of the meal and take it to our terrace. The hotel is fairly isolated, ie not particularly close to a village where you could walk or go for a meal as an alternative, although perhaps this could have been arranged if we'd asked. As we were there for just three days this didn't matter, but if you were here for longer you might want to get out more. The boat tours offered (with a guide) were good, although each stopping point involved people trying to sell local products, some at quite high prices. Overall though these were a good opportunity to see more of the delta. There were only three coat hangers in the room (though we could probably have asked for more) although plenty of shelf space for clothes and suitcases.

Title: A rare boutique resort in My Tho only 1.5 hours away from Saigon
Review: When compared to other boutique resorts throughout Vietnam of the same price range, The Island Lodge fails to offer much of an uniqueness in the ever competitive market. However, being probably the only boutique resort in My Tho automatically makes The Island Lodge a tucked away secret paradise with no equal competitors in the region. Pros: - Extremely friendly and caring staff, from the manager Ngoc to each and every single staff working at the pool, parking and restaurant. - Relaxing ambient. Standard clean boutique decor that offers peaceful view to the Tien river. - Dinner: the duck dish is a must try. - Complimentary goods come in constant waves: welcome appetizers and drinks, pool cookies, room snacks! Cons: - Poor insulation: for both noise and air-con. Thin room wall, non-glass door and open bathroom ventilation mean you hear every single thing that happens right outside your room. This totally removes any sense of privacy staying in your own room. I'm a light sleeper so I was woken up by other guests' voices in the early morning. - Mediocre breakfast. - No mini-fridge. Notes: - Car parking is limited, make sure to inform the staff if you're driving one. - Lack of things to do on your own: I love resorts whose locations offer a wide range of free opportunities to explore the area on your own. Unfortunately The Lodge only has paid tours and rental bikes.

Title: Superb!

This was a great idea and was a lovely start to our 3 night stay at this hotel, and was our first insight as to the thoughtfulness, service and high quality that was typical at this hotel. The food here was consistently excellent (as to be expected from Michel and Françoise who hail from France's gastronomy capital - Lyon) and was a highlight of our stay. The wine selection was also excellent and on reflection was great value for Vietnam. Breakfast was a treat to look forward to every morning, with the Eggs Benedict a particular favourite. Also, I was delighted to find that good european style coffee is served! The hotel itself is beautiful, and decorated with an Indochine theme. We stayed in a River View room, which was lovely with a nice comfortable balcony to sit on and watch the activity on the river, however the garden rooms also looked very nice and I would have been happy in either room type (FYI river room views are on first floor and so persons with mobility issues may prefer garden view room). The staff at the hotel are excellent - friendly, attentive and obviously well trained and professional in their service. The overall highly positive experience of our stay here allowed us to relax, get over our jet lag and energise us for a great holiday in Vietnam. The only negative about staying here as our first hotel in Vietnam is that we found ourselves comparing all subsequent hotel stays against this one, and they all fell short! For a stay in the Mekong Delta area I would absolutely recommend that you don't look any further than The Island Lodge.

I definitely recommend this property if you have the opportunity to stay in the Mekong Delta.

It’s worth noting that when we arrived from Saigon both myself and my partner were ill due to something we’d eaten in the city; not only did the owners and staff do all they could to make us comfortable (gave us medicines and specially cooked meals to aide our recovery) but they also checked on us several times to make sure we were getting better and to check if there was anything else they could do to help. Title: Fantastic, but I have several nitpicky
Review: Amazing place. Very clean, comfortable, and beautiful. Excellent staff is so many ways. The owners are always and asking how things are. The breakfast was fantastic. The food I had from the Vietnamese menu was great, the French food I ordered I did not particularly enjoy. Instead of listing all the good, I do want to write about a few of the negatives/suggestions for improvement, as I think the lodge can easily take another step to be even better -the pool. The lodge has a ton of staff standing around during the midday when everyone is at the pool. They need to dedicate someone to (1) come around to take drink orders at the pool, (2) clean up used dishes around the pool area, and (3) remove used towels on pool chairs and replace them with new ones. In my several hours at the pool, I did not see anyone come around to take drink orders (which would have made owners more money) or cleanup used dishes others had left out, and despite a limited number of pool chairs, abandoned chairs with used towels were not cleaned up so someone else could come use the chair. This is a pretty simple fix that would greatly enhance the lodge. Similarly, sitting in the bar area, no one will come take your drink order, you need to go directly to the bar to do so -the room. It would be nice to have a clothes line to hang wet bathing suits on. The bathroom is amazing, but you cannot fill the bathtub. There simply isn't enough water pressure. Obviously not something that can be fixed, but it was disappointing considering how beautiful the tubs are -dinner. I love the dining room. As a humorous point, the tables were too short for me to fit my legs under, which was awkward. But more seriously, I'm not sure why the drink/wine menu isn't offered with dinner. Instead I drank beer which was on the menu. The full drink menu needs to be brought out with the dinner menus, I definitely would have spent more money on wine had it been -there was music playing all day from a neighboring area. Not sure if this was normal or just part of Tet. With how often the owners came by to say hi, it would have been nice for them to have acknowledged the situation and given an idea of when the music would stop (it stopped around 10pm). Obviously they can't stop the music, so not a problem of theirs, but just ignoring the problem is no solution -everything up to here as been nitpicky, and a suggestion for improvement. This is a FANTASTIC lodge. But this comment is my one serious negative point. I booked a Mekong Tour, and my tour guide spoke no English. Not a single word. This was entirely obnoxious and should not happen, or I should at least be told this before hand. If possible, I would have paid extra for a guide that spoke English, or seen if I could have paid a staff member to join us and interpret. But again. This is a great place! Definitely stay here. I just hope the owners are interested in feedback, because this place can be even more incredible than it already is

The place is extremely well designed, well groomed a truly idyllic setting, very modern, very welcoming and an excellent place to get away from it all. It is an intimate setting as they have only 12 rooms, 8 facing the river all on the second floor with views. The one downside is that there are no dining options except the resort. Title: True Exotic
Review: Visited late September 2015 I truly felt that I was at an exotic destination right out of a 1920's film (and actually the destination is exotic). The common area has an amazing floor plan that opens to a pool right on one of the Nine Dragon sections of the Mekong River. I would start my day (after breakfast) by riding a bike through the local villages, and then taking a boat (about $0.68 usd) across the river and into the main town of My Tho. A nice ride along the riverfront where I would then have a mint soda to cool down while watching the world go by. On other days I would ride the length of the island enjoying the little villages along the way. This is the area where I purchased my conical hat! The island is easily reached by bridge. From the bus (Can Tho to HCMC route) take a taxi the remainder of the way (about $6.80 usd). The road from the bridge is nicely paved, and has virtually no traffic. It is about 6 km from the bridge, and there will be a concrete trail from the road to the resort (about a 3 min walk). I feel a sense of relaxation by just reminiscing about my time at The Island Lodge. This was one of my highlights during my month in Vietnam!

Title: One of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed in
Review: We (my wife, 7y/o daughter and I) stayed at the Island Lodge for 3 nights, and it was absolutely fantastic. The hotel is owned by a French couple, who greet you personally and also always enquire if everything is ok during your stay. This as well as all the small details really make the difference of this kind of owner operated boutique hotel to international hotel chains. The whole hotel is a blend of neo French colonial style with South East Asian elements. There are so many small design details which really make the hotel a special place. The staff is also very friendly and again great attention is paid to detail, like always being welcomed with a cold towel and a glass of water after returning from an excursion. Not all staff speak good English, but please remember that this is Vietnam. This also means that one has to relax there and not expect to have a breakfast served and eaten in 10 minutes. There are many things to do there to wind down: relax in the infinity pool overlooking the Mekong river, nap in the deck chairs, have a massage treatment. Also, there is a nice programme of different excursions where one can explore the Mekong river and nearby attractions. These excursions are very individual and are also great for children. The only small room for improvement that I would see is in the Vietnamese food menu. Here a little more diversity would be good. What I don't understand is why this hotel only has an official 3star rating. In my opinion it is definitely worth more. The price value relationship for this hotel and what you get there are excellent. To sum it up, if you want to stay in the Mekong delta away from the tourist masses, relax in style, explore the sights and not get poor doing so, the Island Lodge is the place to choose.

Title: Exquisite hotel, tranquil setting, will definitely go again
Review: We started our trip in Ho Chi Minh city and decided to get a bus to the Mekong Delta, this was simple and painless and cost about $3 each from Mien Tay bus station (just walked up to a counter and asked for My Tho). The bus took about 1hr 30min to My Tho and from there we got a taxi the rest of the way for 260,000 VND Our first impression of the staff who met us on the road and whisked us and our bags down the short road to the hotel in an electric buggy was very good, impeccable attire, good English and excellent service. Arriving at the hotel was breathtaking, we arrived in the evening and the hotel was beautifully lit, showing-off the elegant design of the restaurant area. The owners, Michel and Francoise greeted us personally and we were given welcome drinks and before being shown to our room. We had chosen the kingsize river-view room and were not disappointed. The rooms are beautiful, fully equipped, have a large balcony and are comfortable in every way. A major highlight for us was the food, the quality of the ingredients, taste, presentation and menu choice were all excellent in our opinion. We took one of the tours, a bike ride and river cruise. Michel accompanied us on this leisurely ride through plantations and villages. This was fascinating for us and we would recommend this to anyone able to ride a bike! The facilitates were top-notch, the pool is a good size complete with sauna facing the river, and staff at the on-site spa gave excellent massages. We travel in Asia a lot and the level of service and professionalism of the staff is probably the best we have found so far. We are already planning a return trip and would recommend this hotel to anyone

Title: Paradise on the banks of the mighty Mekong
Review: We had 24 hours at Island Lodge in April and from the moment we were collected at the main road in the Lodge's golf buggy and whisked down the narrow lane to the hotel, we knew we had found something very special. Michel and Francoise have gone to enormous trouble to make sure that every detail is perfect. The staff are charming courteous and discreet. The rooms are large, cool and ours had a terrific balcony overlooking the infinity pool and the Mekong River beyond. We had a very pleasant afternoon boat tour round Unicorn Island before settling down on the terrasse with an ice cold beer to watch the evening light on the river and the boats of every size and shape. Swimming early in the morning in the large 24 m pool with the Mekong just a few metres away was surreal.

Title: Nơi tốt đẹp để ở Mỹ Thơ
Review: Đây là lần đầu tiên tôi đến Mỹ Thơ. Tôi thấy thành phố này rất đẹp và khách sạn Cửu Long nằm ở ven sông. Có công viên giải trí nhỏ dọc bờ sông, vì vậy mọi người có thể tập thể dục, thư giãn và ngồi dọc cửa sông Mê Kông. Các phòng trong khách sạn này là ổn. Cuối cùng là sữa tắm và dầu gội rất dày (độ nhớt quá cao), vì vậy thật khó để lấy dung dịch ra khỏi các chai nhỏ. Tôi nghĩ rằng việc cung cấp như hộp tái chế như trong nhà vệ sinh công cộng (tầng trệt) có thể tốt hơn. Nhìn chung, tôi có thể nói nếu tôi có một cơ hội khác để trở lại Mỹ Tho, khách sạn Cửu Long sẽ lại là khách sạn tôi chọn.

Title: After a Year, Only Average
Review: Cuu Long Hotel, My Tho 81-83 30/4 Street, Ward 1 My Tho, Tien Giang, Viet Nam Tel: +84 (0273) 6 266 666 Email: Date of Stay: 03/05/19 to 03/10/19 Location When searching for this hotel on TA, is appears as a “Specialty Hotel”, when the type of hotel is really no different than any other hotel in My Tho. It should be moved to the general hotel listings so people can find it more easily. The hotel is just over a year old. We stayed here last year, just after soft opening, and I reviewed it then. So how does it fare after one year? Have there been any changes for the good or bad? The hotel is one of the newest in the few that are located around this area. It sits across the street from the Tiền River, the northern branch of the Mekong River. There are many river-facing rooms on the upper floors offering excellent views of the river and life along the river. There is also a park across from the hotel, where night vendors setup their rolling trinket and food carts, selling all sorts of tasty treats. From Sai Gon, it takes about 90 minutes to get here and 700,000d-800,000d (give or take) in private car, more if you want a 5-7 passenger van. We booked a Double Room with Balcony, including breakfast for two, facing the river through an online agent for 4,275,000d for five nights (about $184.26), including all taxes and service fees. This is a fair rate, all things considered. As a reference point, you can buy the room online with or without breakfast. If you buy the room without breakfast, it will cost 75,000d per person or 150,000d ($6.46) for a couple after the fact. While this hotel doesn’t have a pool (few do in this area), I still consider it the best for the money for what you get. We make a pilgrimage to My Tho annually, and we have stayed at various hotels here, including the Chuong Duong, Minh Quan, Minh Kieu, Song Tien, Tien Giang, and Mekong My Tho. Another reason for staying a night or two in My Tho is that most of the upstream and downstream, 7-day, Mekong River cruises start or end here. I’m talking about those luxury river boats that travel between Viet Nam and Siem Reap, Cambodia. So with an extra day or two going or coming, you could also incorporate a more intense day excursion into the delta mangroves, etc. I probably would do the stop on a downstream cruise but not up. Arrival Check-in was not smooth. Front desk staff spoke even less English than we encountered last year. So much of the conversation had to be in Vietnamese, which my wife speaks fluently, as she was born in this town. We immediately had a disagreement over the type of room we had booked and the room they were going to give us. I blame part of this on booking company. The description of the room I booked was, amongst other things, was a "River View" room. Whose definition of "River View"? The hotel wanted to give us a room facing a side street with a partial river view. This was not the same room I booked last year at a lower rate. We argued back-and-forth. I wouldn’t relent and they wouldn’t either. I pulled out my computer, got their WiFi password and logged in to the online booking company’s site, where I found the same size room (albeit with two double beds instead of one queen) for $2 a night less with a river view. At this point, I had them. It was difficult for them to argue. There’s a lesson here, like really bring along the booking confirmation that provides detailed information about the view, which booking companies and hotels always seem to exaggerate or omit. Do note, many booking confirmations do not include the view you purchased along with the room. Beware of tricky room descriptions like Superior beach view and Premium beach view. What does that mean? Many of what I classify as small hoteliers in this country still don’t get it when it comes to customer service and customer satisfaction. Many talk about it but relatively few provide it in my opinion. They really don’t seem to care about you. No thanks for coming back to stay with them, even for a week-long stay. Absolutely no recognition. This seems so typical in this country. At least the big, big chains thank you for coming back because they track that information, and a thanks for coming back to stay with us cost absolutely nothing, zero, no money! Cuu Long, My Tho seemed to care less that we had returned again this year. If fact, the entire front-desk staff, including their new manager, were all hired after we left the hotel last year. This hotel keeps your passport at check in. For some this is an irritant, while others don’t care. By now, most have just made a copy of your mug shot page and hand it back to you. I supposed some smaller hotels are afraid some clients might leave and skip the bill. Our booking was prepaid but we are familiar with the drill. Just don’t check-out of the hotel without your passport! The Room Last year, we stayed in a room one floor above the one they assigned us, 504. The wife and I prefer showers to baths. So ask about the bath when you arrive or make sure it is detailed in the booking. Access to the room is via electronic key. We were given only one key. When we entered the room, it was quite warm. You need to place the electronic key in the slot by the door to activate lights, air-con, TV, and more. I supposed most hotels only want you to have one key is so you don’t use a second key to keep the room cool when you go out. It makes economic sense but doesn’t enhance the customer’s experience while waiting 30 minutes for the room to cool down after being outside most of the day. Consider the room rate. Our room ended up being a Superior Twin of approximately 280 sq ft. It seemed about that size. Part of the space was consumed by a relatively small but and clean bathroom (alas, I didn’t initially see the ants on the sink vanity). On the right, as you entered the room was a large bench for luggage, a tall armoire containing a half dozen clothes hangers a cabinet containing a mini-frig, two mugs, two coffee cups, two spoons, two complimentary bottles of water, two tea bags, two instant coffee packets, and a water cooker. There was also a chargeable cup of noodles and a can of chips. There was a box of tissues on the adjoining table with a tall upright chair. Like last year, the room did not have a safe. Next, there was a flat screen on the wall with a nest of two smaller tables below. Toward the back of the room another table and chair, mirror, table lamp, and hair dryer. The furniture in the room was of average quality and still looking fairly new after a year. The room contained two double beds, both with typical, hard mattresses, my least favorite. It would really be nice if the hotel had a few rooms with thicker and softer mattresses for those unaccustomed to really hard beds. There was only one small pillow on each bed. I asked for and received an extra pillow. There were three places in the room with duplex outlets where I could charge gadgets, including a small nightstand between the two beds.Other amenities in the bedroom included flip-flops. (I find wearing flip-flops that somebody else has worn kind of disgusting.) During this visit, I noticed the mini-frig contained a fewer number of beverages for sale.Outside the room, facing the river, there was a balcony that paralleled the width of the room and offered views of the river and street below. Entry to the balcony was through a sliding door. Almost the entire width of the wall facing the river was windowed and covered with sliding drapes. The Bath We chose a bathroom with a glass enclosed shower and no tub. It was on the small side, containing about 60 square feet. The metal hose shower handle could be used to move the shower manually or just inserted in the wall but it sprayed the water high, perhaps over six feet. The head end of the hand shower exploded on our last morning just as I finished my shower. There were several towels and enough for a couple. The towels were of average wear. Amenities included a small container of bath gel and one of shampoo, a sewing kit, earbuds, two plastic combs, two toothbrushes, a plastic razor, and a small, circular bar of soap. There were also a couple toothbrushes, combs, a razor. My complaints to management were ignored last year as there were no shelves (metal or otherwise) built into the shower walls to hold shampoos and soaps while you were showering. You either did your best to hold the soap while rinsing or just dropped it on the shower floor. Same with shampoo bottles. Outside on the mirrored vanity, we saw ants crawling around all week but they never seemed to leave this area and enter the sleeping area. Coffee Shop The 8th Floor (top of hotel) opened since we were last here. It seems to be operated by an outside company called Viva Star Coffee. It’s a spacious place, offering wide vistas of the Mekong River. There is no outside balcony as everything is enclosed by walls or glass windows. In contrast to the two-story windows of the ground floor lobby area, the windows on the eighth floor were quite dirty and did not appear to have been cleaned in quite a while. What can you get here? First, there is no food here, at least there was none offered in the menu provided. The menu is made up entirely of specialty coffees, traditional coffees, Frappuccinos, smoothies, ice coffees, Italian sodas, and teas, most priced around the 30-35,000d and some up to 50,000d. There was no alcohol in the menus but if you asked, you could get Tiger or Heineken beers in 300 ml cans starting at 30,000d. That was it. On my first day back since we last visited, I decided to visit the coffee shop for a beer. Once ordered it was quickly delivered. After that, nobody came by my table to check to see if I wanted another beer, the bill or something else. Staff were all chatting up by the coffee bar, more interested in other things rather than assisting customers. This is also pretty typical in Viet Nam unless you are staying at a much higher level of hotel. Even then, it’s no guarantee you will get good service. Oh yes, they will offer you peanuts with your beer but be aware they will at another 30,000d to your tab for a very small dish of these nuts. In many places they would be complimentary with the drink. Breakfast Buffet breakfast started at 06:30 and was included in our room rate. Here is a list of most of the foods we encountered: Hủ Tiếu Mỹ Tho Bún riêu (vermicelli noodle soup w/pork) Vietnamese beef stewFried eggs or omeletBánh cuốn cà Fried seafood balls (bland) Fried noodles Curry shrimp Fried rice Steamed yams Baguette slices Bread slices Jam Peanut butter Watermelon slices Guava slices Small Mandarin orange slices Bananas (small variety) Green apples (small variety) Salad of lettuce, onion, tomatoes Vinaigrette dressing Rice congee (plain) Salted egg Sausages (really hot dog slices) Purified water Orange juice (boxed) Coffee Condensed milk for coffee Soy milk Tea (cold and hot) West Lake soup Congee Like most breakfast buffets, many foods were on rotation and not served daily. Oddities at the buffet included the lack of butter, while there was jam and peanut butter but no dairy butter or margarine. There was only one choice of juice, orange juice that comes in big boxes and poured into a container. For juice, one was expected to use the tiny coffee cups. I asked for and received a proper glass, actually a mug, for the juice. In a country where there is so much tropical fruit, it is hard to believe that fresh squeeze juices were not readily available here. Like last year, there was still no dry cereals that children generally eat with milk or soy milk. The best time to take breakfast is before 7:15 am. By 7:30 am, there seemed to be many people coming down for breakfast and the only juice they offered was no longer available and nobody was replenishing it for guests that still continued to arrive. Breakfast would not be over for almost 90 minutes. Again, pretty bad customer service. Internet and Media There were a large number of WiFi appliances installed throughout the hotel, which made it fairly easy to connect to the hotel's open Internet (no SSID password) . Because the hotel had few guests the observed bandwidth was fairly predictable and even throughout our stay of five nights. The best ping time experienced was 190 ms. All tests were performed with my VPN with the proxy located in Hong Kong. 3/6/19 19.05 Mbps down and 9.44 Mbps up at 11:15 am 3/7/19 27.26 Mbps down and 6.29 Mbps up at 13:30 pm 3/8/19 30.02 Mbps down and 6.09 Mbps up at 11:22 am Last year, the rooms did not have TV channel cards. At the time, the General Manager said they were being printed. As of this review, there are still no channel cards for the room. If you want to search channels offering English, you’ll need to scan hundreds of channels to find them. I’ve made a shortlist of channels below broadcasting in English. The vast majority of broadcasting was in Vietnamese. I also found several Chinese, French, and Indian channels. Higher numbered channels appear to be HD quality. The channels broadcasting in English included these: CH 28 Blue Ant Extreme CH 29 Chelsea TV (Football) CH 30 BOX Movies CH 31 FOXlife CH 32 Planet Earth CH 34 FOX MOVIES CH 52 KIX CH 66 f (FTV) CH 72 National Geographic CH 781 VTC (movies) CH 788 FOX Sports CH 855 Planet Earth HD CH 856 National Geographic HD CH 857 Hollywood Classics HD CH 858 FOX MOVIES HD CH 859 KIX HD CH 860 Blue Ant Extreme HD CH 861 BOX Movies HD CH 862 FOXlife HD Also, when using the Internet in Southeast Asia, I always recommend using a VPN. The network at this hotel is open, so it will probably be pretty easy for someone with a bit of skill to hack your computer. Summary It seems the Cuu Long was less enthusiastic about receiving guests this year. The manager we knew from last year had quit. The hotel still offers value but don’t expect great customer service. Rooms are still under $40 a night including breakfast but there are even cheaper lodgings in this neighborhood, including a hotel right next door. It all depends what you are looking for and care about the most.

Title: Khách sạn trên trung bình

Dưới đây là những tiêu cực: giường rất rất khó ngủ (khiến bạn khó ngủ ngon); bản thân các nhân viên chu đáo nhưng tôi không hài lòng với chính sách quản lý của nó. Title: Giá trị tuyệt vời và dịch vụ khách hàng
Review: Khách sạn Cửu Long, Mỹ Tho 81 - 83 đường 30/4, phường 1 Mỹ Tho, Tiền Giang, Việt Nam Điện thoại: + 84 (0273) 6 266 666 Email: cuulonghotel tiengiangtourist. com Ngày lưu trú: 04/09/18 đến 04/15/18 Vị trí Không được nhầm lẫn với các khách sạn Cửu Long khác trong chuỗi, nằm ở Trà Vinh, Vĩnh Long và Cần Thơ, khách sạn này nằm ở Mỹ Tho. Chúng tôi ở lại trong thời gian khai trương mềm, khi không phải tất cả các dịch vụ đều có sẵn. Tôi hy vọng khách sạn có đầy đủ chức năng ngay bây giờ. Khách sạn nằm cạnh con sông trên cùng con đường với Chung Duong Hotel và Minh Quan Hotel (bên cạnh). Chúng tôi đến đây từ Sài Gòn trong một chiếc xe tư nhân, một Toyota Highlander mới. Chi phí là 800, 000 d, bao gồm cả phí cầu đường cho 62 km. Đường cao tốc Trung Lương. Ngoại trừ giao thông đông đúc, chuyến đi đã không ổn định và mất khoảng 90 phút. Đây là khách sạn thứ năm trong nhóm khách sạn Cửu Long. Tôi được thông báo rằng khách sạn này thuộc sở hữu của Tien Giang Tourist, do đó là trong tên miền email. Khách sạn đã được "mở cửa mềm", có nghĩa là họ chấp nhận khách nhưng chỉ có thể cung cấp các dịch vụ hạn chế. Dịch vụ chính mà họ không thể cung cấp thêm một vài ngày nữa là bữa sáng buổi sáng hoặc bất kỳ dịch vụ bữa ăn nào khác. Có một vài nhà hàng nhỏ trong khu vực và một loạt các món ăn đường phố có sẵn vào ban đêm. Buổi sáng đầu tiên của chúng tôi, chúng tôi đã ăn sáng tại nhà hàng khách sạn Chương Dương (cũng thuộc sở hữu của Tiền Giang Tourist) một đoạn đi bộ ngắn xuống phố. Chúng tôi đến khoảng 10 giờ sáng và chúng tôi vẫn có thể nhận được một vài bát súp phở bò (Phở Bò), bánh mì, trứng, và một nắp sua (cà phê đá với sữa đặc có đường) với tổng số là $ 5. 20 (118, 000 d). Nếu bạn đến trước 9 giờ sáng, bạn có thể nhận được món cháo Hu Tiêu Mỹ Tho thực sự (40, 000 d). Sáng hôm sau chúng tôi đặt hàng cùng một bộ nhưng với Hu Tiêu thay vì mì bò và tổng hóa đơn chỉ là 108, 000 d. Hiểu được các điều khoản của việc khai trương mềm, chúng tôi đã đi trước và dành một căn phòng cho giai đoạn nói trên. Mỹ Tho không nổi tiếng vì có khách sạn tuyệt vời, và điều này dường như có khả năng là nơi ở tốt nhất của chúng tôi cho đến nay, mặc dù không có hồ bơi. Vì vậy, đây là một khách sạn 3 sao đàng hoàng. Chúng tôi đã ở trong hơn một nửa tá khách sạn ở Mỹ Tho, bao gồm Chương Dương, Minh Quân, Minh Kiều, Sông Tiền, Tiền Giang, Mekong Mỹ Tho, và đây là một trong những khách sạn mới nhất. Người quản lý khách sạn cho biết lễ khai trương chính thức sẽ diễn ra vào ngày 18 tháng 4, ba ngày sau khi chúng tôi trả phòng. Sảnh đợi của khách sạn rộng lớn, thoáng mát và được chiếu sáng rực rỡ, hầu hết đều có đèn LED. Lễ tân ở bên trái khi bạn bước vào phòng chứa đồ. Một phụ nữ, người có vẻ là một nhân viên tiếp tân cao cấp nói tiếng Anh tốt và có lẽ là các ngôn ngữ khác. Để đổi lấy một chìa khóa điện tử vào phòng, tôi đã giao hộ chiếu của mình, không ký giấy tờ và được dẫn đến phòng đầu tiên của chúng tôi. Căn phòng Chúng tôi được chuyển đến phòng, 501; đó là một phòng tiêu chuẩn 3 sao. Có một phòng tắm với bồn tắm nhưng không có vòi hoa sen, vì vậy chúng tôi yêu cầu nhìn thấy một căn phòng khác. Vì khách sạn có ít khách, chúng tôi đã được xuất hiện và cuối cùng đưa ra một phòng gia đình (phòng 602) với vòi hoa sen thay vì một bồn tắm. Phòng tắm nằm bên trái của bạn khi bạn nhập vào sau khi sử dụng thẻ khóa điện tử của bạn. Nó nhỏ nhưng đầy đủ. Nó có các yếu tố cần thiết, một vòi hoa sen, bồn rửa, và tất cả đều chứa trong khoảng 50 hình vuông. Ft. (nhỏ hơn 7 mét vuông). Sàn và tường được lát gạch hoàn toàn. Có một bộ đồ vệ sinh cá nhân tiêu chuẩn trên bồn rửa chén, bao gồm bàn chải đánh răng, dao cạo râu, bộ may, mũ tắm, tai nghe, lược, xà phòng nhỏ, một ống dầu gội nhỏ và một ống gel tắm nhỏ (đủ cho một người ). Do việc mở mềm, không có khay xà phòng nào được lắp đặt trong phòng tắm, điều đó có nghĩa là bạn đã liên tục rơi xà phòng trong khi tắm. Ở bên phải, khi bạn bước vào phòng là một tủ đồ lớn chứa 10 móc treo quần áo. Tôi đã yêu cầu và nhận thêm 10 móc treo cho kỳ nghỉ sáu ngày của chúng tôi. Căn phòng không an toàn, ít nhất là vào lúc này. Đồ đạc trong phòng có chất lượng trung bình. Một cánh cửa bằng gỗ trên cây cà phê có chứa rìa nhỏ đã được treo ở một góc nhỏ. Bản lề không được siết chặt. Tủ lạnh nhỏ được chứa 10 lon soda và bia và hai chai nước, hai lon Pepsi, hai lon Coke, hai lon bia 333, hai lon bia Tiger và hai lon bia Heineken. Giá là 15, 000 d, 20, 000 d và 25, 000 d tương ứng cho nước, nước ngọt và bia. Đây là một phòng gia đình có một giường cỡ queen và một chiếc giường cỡ nhỏ hơn, cả hai đều có nệm cứng đặc trưng, ​​ít được yêu thích nhất của tôi. Nó sẽ thực sự tốt đẹp nếu khách sạn có một vài phòng với nệm dày hơn và mềm hơn cho người phương Tây thích giường mềm hơn. Điều đó sẽ hoàn hảo. Căn phòng cũng có một chiếc bàn với một tấm gương trên tường phía sau một chiếc bàn nhỏ và một chiếc ghế (có lẽ là ghế) và một chiếc giường đầu giường giữa hai chiếc giường. Một chiếc đèn nhỏ được treo trên tường ngay phía trên giá đỡ trung tâm nhưng bóng đèn bị đốt cháy hoặc công tắc đèn bị lỗi. Ngoài ra trên tường phía sau đầu giường, có một ổ cắm song công để cắm điện tử hoặc các thiết bị của bạn. Ngoài ra còn có điều khiển cho đèn phòng. Nơi tường ốp trần có một điều hòa không khí lớn giữ cho căn phòng mát mẻ. Các tiện nghi khác trong phòng ngủ bao gồm flip-flops mới hoặc khá mới (tôi thấy mặc flip - flops mà ai đó đã mặc loại ghê tởm), ấm đun nước nóng, hai cốc uống và ba ly cà phê, trà miễn phí, cà phê hòa tan miễn phí, và hai chai nước nhỏ miễn phí. Phòng có máy sấy tóc nhưng không có bàn ủi hoặc cầu ủi. Quay trở lại hình vuông 50. phòng tắm chân, tôi đi tắm vào sáng sớm khoảng 8 giờ sáng. Bạn cần để vòi sen chạy một chút để nước nóng. Nó đã làm. Vì vậy, có rất nhiều nước nóng dưới áp lực tốt để tắm. Tuy nhiên, bao vây tắm nhỏ không có bất kỳ loại xà phòng nào, đó là một sự bất tiện nhỏ nếu bạn muốn bỏ xà phòng xuống. Có lẽ nó chi phí hiệu quả hơn để sử dụng các công cụ trong hộp nhưng tươi luôn luôn tốt hơn rất nhiều. Cũng thấy không có ngũ cốc khô rất phổ biến với các gia đình đi du lịch với trẻ em. Trong khi họ có sữa đậu nành, sữa tươi hoặc sữa nguyên chất là thứ gì đó cũng cách đó một tuần. Tôi đã nói với các dịch vụ bánh mì khác cũng sẽ được trong tiệc buffet mở rộng sau khi mở mềm. Nó sẽ là tốt đẹp để xem một số bánh ngọt. Vì vậy, tôi đã không thất vọng với bữa ăn sáng, nhận thức đầy đủ sự đa dạng sẽ tốt hơn cho khách mới sau khi khai trương. Phần lớn phát thanh truyền hình bằng tiếng Việt. Có các kênh tiếng Trung, và tôi cũng thấy một kênh tiếng Pháp. Cũng cần lưu ý rằng vào khoảng ngày 1 tháng 4 năm 2018, hai công ty cáp lớn ở Việt Nam đã bỏ các kênh trước đây ở đất nước này nhưng đã được thay thế bằng các dịch vụ khác, một số ít phổ biến hơn. Dưới đây là danh sách nhỏ các kênh bạn có thể không nhìn thấy trong suốt chuyến đi của bạn thông qua Việt Nam có hiệu lực từ ngày 1 tháng 4 năm 2018: HBO, Discovery, AXN, BBC Earth, Star Movies, National Geographic, Animal Planet, Cartoon Network và Disney Channel. Bên ngoài phòng, đối diện với dòng sông, có một ban công song song với chiều rộng của căn phòng và nhìn ra dòng sông và con đường bên dưới. Lối vào ban công là qua cánh cửa trượt. Toàn bộ chiều rộng của bức tường đối diện với dòng sông bị cửa sổ và được phủ bằng màn trượt. Tóm lược Vì vậy, tại thời điểm này, trong thời gian khai trương mềm, Cửu Long có tất cả những điều cơ bản và hơn thế nữa. Bữa sáng hạn chế đã có sẵn sau một vài ngày và tôi được cho biết sẽ được mở rộng trong những tuần sắp tới. Giá phòng hàng ngày của chúng tôi trong thời gian mở cửa mềm là 600, 000 d (26 đô la. 37) mà không có bữa sáng, rất tốt cho những ai muốn có một khách sạn mới với khăn trải giường sạch sẽ, khăn tắm sạch sẽ, nhiều nước nóng, sàn gạch sạch, Wifi và TV với nhiều loại giải trí đa dạng. Chúng tôi đã nói với tỷ lệ với bữa ăn sáng sẽ là một bổ sung 100, 000 d cho hai khách, làm cho tổng số 700, 000 ($ 30. 77). Với mức giá này, bữa sáng đã bao gồm sẽ làm cho khách sạn này trở thành một đề xuất có giá trị tuyệt vời. Sau khi khai trương, giá có thể sẽ tăng nhưng nếu chỉ 20%, 37 đô la. 00 / đêm phòng sẽ cung cấp giá trị to lớn. Bốn điểm trong số năm khách sạn này có giá trị tuyệt vời và dịch vụ khách hàng. Nhưng đối với những tấm nệm cứng và thiếu ngủ thoải mái, tôi đã đưa ra 5 trong số 5 điểm. Richard

Title: Non adatto a coppie fai-da-te
Review: La struttura non è adatta alle persone che vogliono visitare la zona in autonomia. È molto lontana dal centro abitato ed è necessario usare sempre il taxi. I bungalow sono rustici, non hanno privacy perché le pareti sono aperte in alto. Entrano molti insetti e parecchi rumori. Non c'è l'acqua calda e gli asciugamani mandavano cattivo odore. Non sono incluse le pulizie. La colazione (due uova al padellino, un panino, tè e caffè) non abbiamo capito se fosse inclusa perché l'ultima mattina siamo stati gli unici ospiti a non averla ricevuta. L'accoglienza tipica vietnamita è riservata agli ospiti vietnamiti e agli ospiti che usufruiscono delle attività a pagamento della struttura. Gli altri ospiti sono trattati diversamente. Non è possibile concordare un menù per le cene e non è chiaro il costo dei pasti, fino al momento del check out.

Title: Lovely stay!
Review: We had a great couple of nights at Happy Farm! The hosts were kind and helpful. They helped us arrange a private car to and from HCMC, as well as a whirlwind day tour of the area (including a visit to a rambutan farm!). We ate both dinners there and the food was delicious and plentiful. The rooms were basic but comfortable. The outdoor bathrooms were fun - clean, modern plumbing and the cold showers were welcome given the heat. We were worried about sleeping in the heat (having only stayed in air conditioned places during our previous two weeks of travel) but we were comfortable under our bug nets with the fans on us. Between the fans and the cicadas we had plenty of white noise and our three kids slept soundly. Happily recommend as a great escape from the busy big city.

Thức ăn họ chế biến rất ngon và chân thực, và Minh đã phục vụ chúng tôi những trái cây tươi hàng ngày trong vườn. Trang trại nằm trong một vilage nhỏ với một thị trường hàng ngày và các cửa hàng nhỏ. Vì vậy, chúng tôi tìm thấy mọi thứ chúng tôi cần cho thời gian lưu trú là 6 ngày. Có rất nhiều con đường nhỏ xung quanh ngôi làng nhỏ nơi chúng tôi tìm thấy con đường xuyên qua các kênh rạch của đồng bằng. Hoàn hảo cho một chuyến đi bộ dài hoặc ngắn. Mỹ Tho, thành phố lớn tiếp theo là khoảng 20 phút bằng xe tay ga. Đó là defitnetly khó để lại! ! ! !

Title: Average Hotel
Review: Minh Kieu Hotel Review Period of Stay: 02-23-16 to 02-28-16 Address: Số 2 Thủ Khoa Huân, Phường 1, tp. Mỹ Tho, Tiền Giang, VietnamPhone: 073 626 2288 (in country) GPS Coordinates: Lat: 10° 21.371’, Long: 106° 21.721’ This is a review of the hotel and room  a Double Room We make an obligatory trip to My Tho annually to celebrate New Years with older extended family. We were last in My Tho town almost a year ago, when we stayed at the Tien Giang Hotel. In previous years, we have also stayed at the Song Tien, Minh Quan and Chuong Duong Hotels. Unfortunately, My Tho isn’t full of great hotels in my opinion. There is a new 4-star hotel in town but it doesn’t command the over $100/night prices for a room in a small delta town. The Minh Kieu is probably the best hotel in My Tho we’ve encountered to date. Like many other hotels in Viet Nam, this one is also dimly lighted. As you enter the hotel, you may get the feeling it might be closed or there is a power outage. Common areas and reception appear almost morgue-like. Common areas on the first floor and hallways above need new carpeting or new tiles floors. The worn, torn, stale, old red carpets need to go. As Tet was over, there were plenty of vacant rooms at the Minh Kieu. We chose the least expensive room facing the street on the third floor, a Double Room. The rate was 500,000d per night including breakfast and taxes. That worked out to $22.31 (USD). (Pictures of rooms on most web sites are taken with very wide angle lenses giving one the impression the room is much larger than it is in reality.) Read the number of square feet or meters of the room you are buying to calculate what the true size of the room might be. 20 sq. meters or less for a room is pretty tight when you consider it probably includes the bathroom. The information is typically available on sites like agoda.com under ‘room info’. I think the room we chose was around 25 sq. meters. Room So room  is on the third floor. However, it was actually four floors off street level. The reception area and the area used to serve morning breakfast is up one flight of concrete steps up from street level. Our room contained a few pieces of the standard wooden furniture, probably popular almost 100 years ago, including one small night table, two wooden chairs, a small coffee table, a small dressing table with mirror, a cabinet with a refrigerator inside stocked with canned beverages and a lockable armoire with keys. An LED flat-screen TV sat on top of the cabinet that contained the refrigerator. The refrigerator was stocked with a few beverages and on the lowest setting before it would be turned off. I move it up to the next to highest setting to cool some of my own beverages brought in from the outside. There was a thick build up of ice in the small freezer containing a small ice tray. Here were some of the prices of drinks for cans in the refrigerator: Half liter bottle water - 10,000d (none in refrigerator) 1.5 liter bottle water - 20,000d (none in refrigerator) 333 beer can - 20,000d Heineken can - 30,000d Pepsi, 7-Up, Twister cans - 15,000d Red Bull can - 20,000d The two cans of 333 beer in refrigerator had brew dates that were eight months old and certainly not fresh. I found it odd the hotel does not supply two free bottles of water a day per room but there were none even to be purchased from the refrigerator. The room was cheap but a small, decent bottle of water should cost the hotel no more than 3,000d or 13 cents! The included WiFi was pretty decent at this hotel with consistent 20 Mbps down and up speeds, the best encountered in My Tho to date. Internet speeds can vary if you don’t connect to the right wireless AP in the hallway. Try several and run speedtest.net . Ideally, the one on your floor will offer the best speeds. The room description and features listed on agoda.com for the date of stay were accurate. Bathroom The bathroom is pretty standard for this type of hotel and quite small (see photos). This room only had a shower, which was fine with us. As an added bonus, it had a rain shower head in addition to the hand unit. The bathroom had a standard flush toilet with a bidet hose. Two medium and two large bath towels for two people a day. Amenities included a small tube of shampoo and bath gel, a plastic comb, two toothbrushes, and cheap earbuds. There was also a wall-attached two cup holder for two glasses in the bathroom and one was empty. But most important, the bathroom was spotlessly clean and did not stink. Inclusive Breakfast The room rate included a basic breakfast in the morning. The included breakfast consisted of one entrée from the breakfast menu, like baguette and fried eggs or noodle soup and one drink. Here’s a sampling of the breakfast items with prices if you wanted more than one or extras: 1-Hủ tiếu Mỹ Tho (rice noodle soup, My Tho style), or 2-Banh Canh Suon Heo (noodles with pork rib), or 3-Bánh canh sườn heo (stir fried noodles with beef), or 4-Mì gói xào nấu bò/trung (instant noodles with beef/eggs), or 5-Bánh mì ốp la (fried eggs with bread), or 6-Bánh mì cá mòi (bread with sardines) If you wanted more than one of the above, the extra was priced at 25,000-30,000d. And, one of the following from the beverage list: 1-Black coffee with cream or sugar (Vietnamese style coffee with condensed milk), or 2-Lemonade (something like a soda chanh but without the soda), or 3-Tea (Lipton tea bag and hot water), or 4-Soy milk Alternatively, there was an excellent Cơm tấm place across the street (Quan Com Nam Trieu). For 15,000d or about 67 cents, one can get a take away styrofoam box filled with rice, pork, shredded carrot, cucumber, daikon radish and small packet of fish sauce on the side. Go well before 9 AM or they will likely be sold out. Add a Ca phe da (Vietnamese iced coffee) and for little more than a dollar you have a great breakfast meal! It’s not a buffet, if that what’s you are looking for, but a basic meal to get your day started. Positives: 1-Clean bed linen 2-Clean bathroom and adequate towels 3-Plenty of hot water for bathing 4-Bath amenities including toothbrushes, plastic comb, shampoo, bath gel, very small soap bar, earbuds 5-Adequate LG air-conditioner 6-Hot water cooker, teapot, and small cups 7-Clean, smooth tile floors (no dirty, stained carpets) 8-No sewage smell coming up through bath floor drains 9-Fairly decent room lighting (LED) 10-Cable TV had dozens of local channels (Vietnamese) and selection of western channels including: 25-FOX Sports HD 26-FOX 2 Sports HD 27-HBO (Vietnamese speech over subdued English - irritating) 28-Starworld 29-Discovery 30-CINEMAX 31-Movies HD 32-Cartoon Network (Vietnamese speech over subdued English) 36-VTV 49-AXN HD 62-HTV 7 69-National Geographic 74-Animal Planet 75-MTV 76-f Limited channels in French Negatives: 1-Standard rooms are pretty small but adequate for a few overnight stays (get the triple room if there is more than two of you) 2-Armoire type closet with lockable door but did not function properly 3-No room safe 4-Hotel staff would not provide a second key in the event one person was out and the other was in but sleeping 5-Free bottles of drinking water not offered and none for sale in refrigerator (but liters bottles on the street and bring back to the hotel) 6-Little English spoken here but you can probably get by asking questions during daytime reception desk hours, when somebody get the idea of what you’re asking for Summary Of all the hotels I’ve stayed at in My Tho, this one has been the best so far. It deserves a solid three stars on average and a fourth star for value. Yes, the common areas and hallways have that crappy, dark red, stained, worn out carpet, but that’s trivial to the value proposition. For me, a room needs to have a clean bed with clean sheets. Ideally the room will have tiled floors. (I hate rooms with tired, dirty, moldy, stained carpets!) The bathroom needs to be spotless or as clean as possible. Drains should not stink. It needs to deliver adequate hot water day or night and a minimum of two towels per person per day (one medium and one large per person). A working and reliable internet service is also a must but I stress reliable. This hotel provided all that. If you need something better, the new MeKong My Tho Hotel is waiting for you just around the corner. It’s nice, it’s new, it has a pool. Rooms start at around $115/night with taxes and service. This room, as I said earlier, offered a lot for less than $25/night, net, net. It is probably the best of the five hotels we’ve stayed at thus far. It’s a solid 3-star hotel for this area, and I would stay here again if only based on value for money. As I always say, unless you have some compelling reason to stay in this town, move on to Sai Gon for the evening.

Title: Good location, great rooms

The bathroom has a bathtub that is not really suitable for showering. To avoid that the entire bathroom gets wet it is suggested that at least a shower curtain is installed. In our room hot water did not work and could not be fixed immediately. A change of room was suggested. Breakfast is provided in the main building which is approximately 300 meters away. The breakfast itself is not really worth the effort of the walk with a very limited a la carte offer. Due to the proximity to the river the early morning activities of boats and cars might disturb guest with a light sleep. Helpful and efficient front office staff

Title: Really nice, if you don't expect 4 or 5 star hotel
Review: I was here with a group and stayed two weeks. My roommate and I changed rooms three times; first door didn't lock, second, toilet was clogged. And yes, you may see a roach or two. [I've seen them in nice hotels in Honolulu.] WIFI could be slow in the evening. But, I really enjoyed the hotel. The rooms are spacious; it's nice having a bathtub. Good air-conditioning The views of the river were great. We had b'fast on the rooftop area every day and several special ordered I think, meals. Had the best soup ever there for a dinner. The staff is very accommodating. A short walk to the night market, the regular market, the boat docks.

Title: A very happy and comfortable 11 day stay
Review: I was traveling with a group and we all had a lovely stay. The guestrooms are simple but I loved the hardwood floors vs. carpeting. The rooms were bright and happy. The bed linens were clean but old. The bathroom was a bit challenging; a lovely claw foot tub with a broken foot and no shower curtain and the bathroom door did not fully close. Toilet paper is scarce, and it is advised against putting it in the toilet. It seemed as though were were at the front desk every morning for another roll! and the front desk staff was always lovely and accommodating. The air conditioning worked well. We never turned on the TV but the wifi worked very well. We did have a few little crawly visitors in the bathroom (not a huge deal) and some tiny geckos every once in a while. All of these things could be overlooked as the staff was very pleasant. We ate breakfast as a group each morning on the 6th floor rooptop with lovely views of the river and the city. The breakfasts were hearty and delicious and the coffee was good. We also had some dinners at the hotel and they were very good. The hotels overlooks the river which is quite dirty but just seeing the water and the lovely buildings made us happy. The location was great. We could walk to the market, get delicious street food at any time of day and walk to other sights. I took a cab from the hotel to the Catholic Church for Sunday mass and the cab fare was .79 (yes, under $1.00 USD). There is a lovely man who can be found in the hotel area who will give city tours or take you anywhere in his rickshaw. So much fun! He has been in the city for 40 years and can give a wonderful tour. All in all - we loved the hotel.

Title: Good budget hotel fantastic views
Review: Bear in mind that this is a budget hotel and you will be very happy with it. The views of the river and the market from the balcony are very good. The staff are very friendly and as helpful as they could be but they spoke no English and certainly were not as helpful as in other budget hotels we stayed in. Service is not their strongest point, but if you can cope with that you will still find it a good hotel to stay in. We were there on the lead up to TET (new year) and the street noise was loud - non stop music, market throng etc, but that might have been because of TET. The location and the view ( and frankly the cost) made up for its "blind spots"! Worth considering.

Title: Décevant
Review: Chambre au 5° étage avec vue agréable sur le fleuve depuis le balcon commun, beaux meubles mais un déficit criant de maintenance : porte extérieure " à claire voie" fuite dans la salle d'eau donc pied du lavabo ( en fer !!! ) rouillé, clim gouttant sur le plancher ....Dommage Petit déjeuner inclus dans le prix de la chambre mais pas terrible : beurre au goût de rance, confiture 100% chimique, pain ultra sec pour ce qui est du salé tout baignait dans l'huile ! Pour notre départ à Saîgon nous demandons à la réception un pick up à l'hotel et un dépot à HCMV : coup de téléphone 140 000 dongs par personne . ( Nous payons mais pas de reçu pas de tickets nous les aurons plus tard ! ) Le mini van doit être là à 11h , le jour du départ M.Truc qui semble également gérer le personnel d l'hotel nous annonce que le mini van est en retard, arrive un taxi qui nous embarque ( toujours pas de ticket nous les aurons plus tard ) et nous dépose à la gare des bus locaux où il nous ramène un billet pour chacun d'un montant de 33000 dongs!!!!!!Nous lui payons bien évidemment sa cours e et commençons à réaliser que ce M.Truc nous a roulé dans la farine , il a du vouloir récupére le prix de la sortie que nous lui avons refusé !!!!Nous arrivons à HCMV sans encombres après un voyage un peu folklorique et là pour rejoindre notre guesthouse en taxi nous ouvrons encore le porte monnaie !!!!Merci M.Truc ( nous avons photographié le billets et nous lui avons demandé une explication !)

Title: I will stay again
Review: This is a great budget hotel. The staff are great and helpful. They don't have safes in the rooms so you can leave valuables for short periods at the front desk (like a laptop) if you're going out of the hotel. We stayed in the Superior Double Room and it was huge. For the price charged a very real bargain. Standard were the bed (nice mattress though), tv, and standard furniture. Also was a desk and chairs, two bedside tables, plenty of working plugs for recharging the phones and laptop, new and clean bar fridge. Most surprising was the bathroom. Huge by vietnamese standards. Tiled throughout. Western styled, marble style counter and counter top. Water efficient toilet. New faucets and fixtures, clean throughout, hotel supplied shampoos, toothbrush, and other items in Song Tien red and white boxes. Laminate floors throughout the room. The only negative comment I have is the front door. The frame and deadbolts are obviously damaged from attempts by people to break in. The entrance to the room is on the 5th floor, the access to the 5th floor is through the lobby so security must be lacking sometimes. They have a complimentary breakfast at the Song Tien Restaurant. It is a great breakfast.

Title: Comfortable; Central Location

Title: Great location, good view and honest staff
Review: First time guest at the hotel and my first impression was "another state run". The front yard and the balcony was flooded after a heavy rain that I had to call hotel staff to get cleaner to drain it off. However, I was impressed with the honesty the staff of both the "Cafe Union" and the receptionist show. In the former case, the waitress return the 200k note when I mistook it for a 50k note. OK, now the reason why this hotel should get my 4* is its location - across the road to the river/restaurant/river boat port... and also the quality mattresses and bed linens used. Title: The Cong Doan's staff made my trips worth every penny.
Review: I have stayed at the Cong Doan on each of my eight trips to Vietnam and, unlike almost every other hotel, the staff was incredibly friendly, helpful, knowledgeable, honest and trustworthy. I am lucky enough to have made several very good friends there and My Tho is my favorite vacation spot for life. It is not the newest or cleanest hotel in My Tho, though it is the cheapest option if privacy and security are your priorities. Other hotels in the area have fancy rooms but come with a premium and less trustworthy staff. Most of the Cong Doan's employees have spent many years working there and petty theft is non existent, which was a problem almost everywhere I stayed in Vietnam. If you are passing through My Tho and want a safe and friendly place to stay, the Cong Doan is your very best choice.

Title: leider eine negative Erfahrung
Review: Wir hatten das superior Zimmer gebucht, doch zuerst gab man uns ein Standard Zimmer. Begründung: es ist ja kein Kind dabei. Das Zimmer war schmutzig, der Teppichboden hatte Wasserflecken und das Fenster seit dem letzten Monsun kein Wasser mehr gesehen. Nach meiner Reklamation erhielten wir ein anderes Zimmer, groß und für 3 Personen, allerdings ohne Fenster. Das Zimmer war vor kurzem renoviert worden, das Badezimmer war sehr geräumig. Unter der Dusche war ein ehemaliges Abflussrohr, was so einige Zentimeter aus dem Boden ragte und im zuge der Renovierung zubetoniert wurde. Die Sauberkeit ließ auch hier zu wünschen übrig, die Ecken wurden so langsam rund und die Reinigungsdame putzte offensichtlich immer nur bei geöffneter Tür. Man konnte hinter der Tür den Schmutzrand sehen der täglich stehen blieb. Das Hotel hat ein Restaurant mit Karaoke und als Essensangebot gab es Pizza. Wir gingen daher in ein Gartenlokal gegenüber, was zu dem Hotel gehörte. Das von uns bestellt Hähnchen mit Zirtonengrass und Chilli kam nach ca 2 Stunden. Geschmacklich gut gewürzt, allerdings so hartes Fleisch, dass es leider nicht essbar war. Dem Huhn fehlte offensichtlich noch eine Weile Garzeit. Ein anderes Essen als Ersatz nach der langen Wartezeit wurde nicht angeboten. Am nächsten Morgen wurde in dem gleichen Restaurant das Frühstück serviert. Wir bekamen eine Karte mit Auswahl an Omelett, gebackenen Eiern, Porridge und Toast mit Marmelade. Nicht lange nach unserer Bestellung kam die Bedienung und informierte uns, dass es zum Frühstück nur Suppe gibt. Und NEIN, auch ein einfacher Toast mit Butter ist nicht möglich. Es war während meiner Rundfahrt in Vietnam das einzige Hotel in dem ich schlechten Service und schmutzige Zimmer vorgefunden habe.

Title: Don't support them by staying there.
Review: Considering our other stays in the Mekongdelta, this hotel was a bad experience. Definitely not worth its 2 stars. While not asking/choosing for it, a taxi dropped us at their entrance - normally we think that's fishy, but since we've only been meeting really kind people around here we thought we'ld go for it. We could save 100k by excluding breakfast, and payed 350k per night for a room. The room was quite spacious although not facing the river. Day 2. Woke up at 8 because someone tried to enter our room, it was locked from the inside, but they tried to use a key anyway, and started knocking us out of bed after that. It was the cleaning crew, while our sign to have the room cleaned was not out. Not nice since we had to catch up some sleep. Next, red ants started showing up in the bathroom, around our backpacks, and in our bed (I even had some antbites). The wifi didn't work properly, although the staff promised they would fix it. Day 3. We decided to go for the breakfast. Unfriendly staff there, and very expensive for what it was. I even didn't get what I ordered. Breakfast in the streets is way better value. Then we checked out, and ordered a taxi to the local bus station - explained three times where we wanted to go, but they fixed us a taxi to another place, where busses cost double as much (talking to a local we've found out that people who bring costumers here get some money too). We called the hotel, and they where extremely unhelpful and unfriendly. They wouldn't even want to call a taxi again, and kept hanging up the phone during conversation. So to conclude: don't support this hotel by staying there!

Title: Nice Room; Claw Foot Bathtub
Review: I stayed for ten (10) days in a double room (two twin beds) on the fourth floor of the Song Tien Hotel Annex in March 2014. This is a block or two south of the Song Tien Hotel. The room was modern, clean: the A/C worked great; comfortable bed--I slept very well. No sounds from other rooms. The bath had a claw foot bathtub with a hand held shower, all ceramic tile floor and walls, and marble counter. This was very nice. The rooms are accessed via an exterior walkway, overlooking the branch of the Mekong river and tributary. I sat out on the walkway and watched the busy river boat traffic and the sun setting. Very pleasant. We had breakfast on the rooftop veranda. This included boiling hot Tang, which I found very good, if strange. If I am ever lucky enough to return to My Tho, this is where I will gladly stay.

Title: Clean, big rooms, good service.
Review: Location: Song Tien is located along the riverside, close to the centre. Restaurants, night market and shops are within walking distance. Activities/entertainment: I only stayed for one night on the way to Can Tho so am not sure of activities in the area. I believe boat tours of floating markets nearby are accessible. There is a cute little cafe downstairs which serves mainly coffees, smoothies and cocktails. Room: we selected a standard double room and were super impressed. Big, new bed, large room, television, newish and clean bathroom, A/C and wardrobe. Breakfast was included in the price but leaves little to be desired but is satisfying enough. Service: the service was faultless, they were helpful and spoke good English. Recommend: yes, for the price $20 it was worth it.
