Title: Cockroaches and tour/transport scam
Review: It was one of our worst experiences in a hotel. The room was large size but without a window, OK for one night. When we woke up in the morning while I was having a shower, I saw a few cockroaches running out of the toilet to the room, we also saw them under the bed and around our bags. Then we went to visit the little islands on the Mekong and while we were on the boat, I opened my bag and there was a cockroach inside! We also were scammed by the guy selling tours in the hotel. We wanted to visit the Mekong Delta and we agreed with him to pay 30$ each (he was asking for $38) for the tour, lunch and private transport back to HCMC that it was supposed to be a van from the hotel. He promised us that he will take us in a little boat and that will go to certain places. Instead, we went to the pier, and when we were in the boat he said that we will go with his wife and will meet him on the other side of the river because he was going by motorbike. We didn't see him again, we did the tour with the lady but we didn't visit some of the places he offered us, and we couldn't tell her that because she didn't speak English at all. After the tour, went back to the hotel to wait for the van to HCMC, these two motorbike drivers came to pick us up, instead of taking us to the van we went to the local bus station and they want us to take a local bus. Once again, they didn't speak English and it was impossible to communicate with them. They want us to pay them for the bike ride, when it was already included in the price. We told them that the deal wasn't going on a local bus, so we went to the highway and they stopped a van, they put our bags inside and we start our way to HCMC. After 10 minutes, the two guys in charge of the van, asked us to pay the transport. Obviously, this transport was included in the tour. After 15 minutes stopped on the high way trying to make them understand the situation, we agreed to pay them half of the fare and after two hours we finally arrived to HCMC. If you decided to stay here and share your room with some disgusting little friends, DON'T TRUST THE STAFF AND THE GUYS SELLING TOURS HERE!!

Title: A défaut de mieux à My tho
Review: Le choix d'hotels à My Tho est plutôt limité, disons qu'à défaut de mieux cet hotel n'est pas si mauvais. Chambre assez spacieuse et climatisé, grande salle de bain à la vietnamienne (douche à "débordements"), isolation phonique assez médiocre (on voit clairement un jour lorsqu'on ferme la porte de certaines chambres). Emplacement plutôt bon, au pied du marché aux fleurs en période de Têt. Le petit déj est bon, servi à l'extérieur sur une terrasse spécieuse. Les bouteilles d'eau présentes dans le frigo ne sont pas gratuites comme mentionné sur plusieurs sites de réservation en ligne. Attention : Si vous décidez de vous promener sur le balcon côté ville, faites extrêmement attention à l'escalier de secours. En effet, ce dernier est assez mal protégé et peut s'avérer très dangereux, surtout pour les petits !

Title: Going Downhill
Review: Song Tien Review - 02-16-13 Period of Stay: 02-07-13 to 02-14-13 This is a review of the hotel and Room  My wife and I have stayed at this hotel several times during the last three years, as we visit My Tho town once year to see and visit with relatives. We have previously stayed at the Chuong Duong and Minh Quan. The hotel was renovated a few years ago, and we were anxiously waiting for a hotel offering a better standard of room and service. Sadly, the service and state of the rooms has declined since our first stay. Our room facing the Sông Bảo Định (Bảo Định River) was large (estimated at 25 sq. meters excluding large bath). River facing rooms have a small balcony that is not very functional, as morning sun is hot, and if the air-conditioner is running it will be very uncomfortable being out on the balcony. Unfortunately, the balcony flooring was constructed at the same grade as the room so monsoonal rains have drenched the carpet in the room, seeping in from under the door that separates the room from the exterior balcony. The aluminum framed door leading to the balcony had no ridge on the floor to make a water barrier, so there has been significant water damage to the carpet, including what I suspect is mold. Other parts of the carpets have been stained and not properly maintained since renovation. A better, albeit more expensive choice would have been to tile the entire room. Because we were staying in town for a week, we requested more wire clothes hangers, and a couple additional pillows for our double bed, which was reasonably comfortable and free of bugs. Our room, and I suspect most others, had no soft or hard-backed chairs. You either lay in bed to watch TV or sit on an 18” four-legged stool (two in our room). We had to ask twice for the extra two pillows and one decent sitting chair. After a second request, we received two extra pillows but no comfortable sitting chair. A relative delivered a decent chaise lounge chair to our room. Upon arrival, the small beverage refrigerator in the room was turned off. I opened the door and there was water in a tray that had melted from the small bin used to make ice cubes. The refrigerator contained two small bottles of water that are not included in the daily rate. On arrival, I wanted to store my laptop computer in the safe while we were out and noticed there was no way to lock it. The safe is an odd affair that apparently uses a key along with a push-button lock but there was no key and no instructions of how to activate the box. We called downstairs and were given a number of excuses of why nothing could be done about it, that we should simply leave our valuables at the front desk, where little English is apparently is spoken or conveniently not understood. I enlisted my Vietnamese speaking wife to express our concerns and she received the same uncaring response. That lack of room security perhaps speaks to KhanhHS’s concerns and post of 2-24-12. The next day, I cornered the hotel manager, who gave me his last two keys to the safe along with a simple instruction to key a six sequence of six numbers to close it, and then I could reset to my own set of numbers. This didn’t work and there no further assistance provided to rectify the problem with the room safe. I reverted to using my Pac-Safe backpack, probably a better solution in the first place. I have to plug Pac-Safe here because they make a pretty decent alternative for hotel rooms that do not have safes or functional ones. PM me if you need more info. The attitude of staff toward the visitor speaks to krapper’s post of 7-9-12. On our last morning at the hotel, some family drove down from Thủ Dức and had breakfast with us. After we were finished, our guests went back to our room, while I waited for the check. The bill was much higher than expected. I asked my wife to query them in Vietnamese to understand why we were being charged nearly double the posted prices for food. Their only explanation was something related to the New Year, even though the posted prices were almost less than half. You have to remember that my wife and I have stayed at this hotel no less than four, perhaps five times. This is the attitude and treatment repeat customers receive? The river-facing rooms are the most expensive, offered at 500,000d/night including breakfast ($24/night at this writing) if you book in advance. I spoke to one backpacker on a bike that paid 500,000d but did not get breakfast included. Other rooms on the floor without windows are offered at about $4-$5/night less. I suspect they may also be smaller buy may not have the carpet ‘mold‘ issue. One should make sure breakfast is or is not included in the rate. The included breakfast consists of one item combination from a list of about 10 items, for example rice noodle soup with a cup of coffee. That’s it. If you want a baguette and fried eggs, that will be extra. If you want juice and coffee, you will pay for one or the other. Granted, the extras by western standards are inexpensive. For example, my wife and I each chose a bowl of noodle soup and coffee as our included breakfast meal and then each ordered a baguette and two fried eggs for an extra dollar each. Positives: Large room, albeit balcony rooms probably have more carpet mold than non-river facing rooms Fairly large, clean bathroom with small claw foot tub, wash basin and toilet Typical amenities including two tooth brushes, plastic comb, shaving razor, shower cap, shampoo, bath foam, although we didn’t get the last two items replaced twice during our stay. Apparent, clean bedding (no bug bites and no observed critters in our room during our stay) Good air-conditioner Cable TV Good hot water Free wifi that was strong in room 601 and on the top floor adjacent, dining area (Internet speedtest from this hotel here:  ) Negatives: Dubious and pretentious service, especially for minor requests Over-charging Room upkeep Black, moldy carpets (wear flip-flops or sandals in the room) Security, antiquated keyed door locks and no working in-room safe Poor lighting in bathroom Had the service related to the room safe been addressed, I would give the hotel a 4-star rating for this city. In addition, if the rooms had at least one or two sitting chairs and clean carpets, I would have given it a 5-star rating. Unfortunately, the property deserves no more than a 2-star rating due to staff attitude, over-charging in the hotel restaurant, room security and moldy carpets (a potential health hazard). Hotel service and security are the overriding issues here, which speak to the issues previously posted for this hotel. If there is no compelling reason to stay in My Tho town (my extended relatives live here), I would consider staying at the Ham Luong Hotel in Ben Tre, the adjacent city. The Ham Luong has a swimming pool, which no other hotel in My Tho has to my knowledge. Check out the Tripadvisor reviews before booking. Alternatively, if moldy carpets, and lack of room security are not an issue for you, stay here by all means. Richard

Title: Good hotel in best location in My Tho
Review: We were 2 nights in this hotel. On arrival we got the twin room which is big as described 'Superior Twin', however it does not have any window so we asked for another room with window. We got the room 606 on the 6th floor, but it is not a twin room, it is a room with a double bed. We went straight to bed but due to the noisy airconditioning unit we could not sleep. We complained and then we got another room, a double bedroom next to the lift on the 5th floor with a little river view on the corner of our tiny window. The rooms are relative big and clean, the bed is more like a king-sized bed and not a small double bed. Our room is next to the lift, but fortunately the lift is very quite so we were quite happy with the third bedroom. For breakfast you get a voucher which you present to the cafe next door on the first floor. The choice of breakfast is quite limited, but you can choose the one breakfast you prefer: from noodle soup to bread & jam, etc... The location of the hotel is the best in My Tho as you can walk only 2 minutes to the central market and you can also walk along the Mekong river for sightseeing. This hotel has also a restaurant and a cafe next door. For the scale between 1 and 10 points I can give this hotel 8 points for its location, its good-sized bedrooms, services, etc... Unfortunately I cannot give 9 or 10 points for this hotel due to the lacking of a computer for free internet connection and also due to the smoking policy of the hotel (smell of cigarette smoking in the hotel). Sightseeing/Attractions Tip: The location of this hotel is perfect for the visit of My Tho: Go to the market, take boat trips to the islands, sightseeing along the Mekong river, Enjoy the noodle soup 'Hu-Tieu My-Tho' which is special noodle soup of this town MyTho... By the way, don't forget the food 'Ca Tai Tuong' (in English: Elephant Ear Fish) and 'keo dua' (Coconut sweet bonbon) and 'ruou dua' (coconut wine).

Title: Great hotel with great prices
Review: We went to Song Tien Hotel to look for a cheaper alternative to another hotel along 30/4 street, and thank god for that. We stayed in a double-bed room for 350 000 dong for a night, which included breakfast for both of us. The rooms were luxurious-looking, and they offered a full suite of conveniences, such as a hot water boiler, coffee cups, sanitised glasses, toothbrushes, combs, etc. The beds were large and comfortable, similar to those you can find in a 3 or 4 star hotel (depends on which country you're in). The bathroom was big and clean, with a bathtub set in one side. There were even bathrobes in the wardrobe. There is a great view of the river from the corridor and the cafe at level 6, where breakfast and other drinks are served. Breakfast is either a decent bowl of noodles (with some small prawns) or the usual baguette. 350 000 was an excellent price for a hotel of such standard, and I'll recommend it to anyone spending the night in My Tho. However, the hotel brochure available at reception stated its prices to be 30USD and 40USD for the 2 types of rooms they have. If I'm not mistaken, they're having a soft opening, so be sure to grab hold of it while its still available. According to a private tour operator by the river who speaks excellent english, the hotel was recently renovated and reopened.

Title: Truly luxurious rooms at very fair prices
Review: We eventually arrived at the song tien having sampled some of the competition (namely the tradeunion hotel whose rooms looked like those of a recently 'vacated' hospice's.). At this point i must stress we stayed in the newer & smaller song tien, which has more charecter and style (we saw both hotels). The rooms are spacious, very clean and well furnished. I will also mention the two rickshaw cyclers whose names as far as i can recall are nib and car, and-though u could never guess-are 71 and 50 respectively. They are well known to the hotel and will give u a great authentic tour of the local villages where u can explore the farm land and communities. Nib speaks great english and the two know everyone and everything in my tho. Definetly seek them out and avoid agency boat tours, which are overpriced tourist traps that will leave u angry and annoyed!!!

Title: Great Hospitality for Last Minute Arrival (từ chối khách sạn thứ nhất trong thành phố!)
Review: Chúng tôi đã tham gia một tour du lịch 4 ngày được cung cấp bởi khách sạn Sài Gòn của chúng tôi với phụ kiện chuyến đi do công ty du lịch sắp xếp. Họ bỏ chúng tôi tại một khách sạn mà họ đã nói với chúng tôi là tốt đẹp nhưng nó thật khủng khiếp! Họ cho chúng tôi thấy một vài phòng nhưng hoàn toàn không thể chấp nhận được, một làn khói, với nhân viên bàn trông hơi giống phòng của họ! Các hướng dẫn viên đã nhận được trên điện thoại của mình và cung cấp cho chúng tôi một tài sản bên ngoài của thị trấn chính là mới và therfore chỉ 1 * nhưng tốt đẹp. Khi đến nơi, họ cho chúng tôi thấy một căn phòng đáp ứng yêu cầu của chúng tôi và ngửi rất tươi mới và sạch sẽ! Cá nhân, tôi thích có tủ đầu giường cho điện thoại, đồ uống vv mà họ không có nhưng tôi có thể sống với điều đó và chúng tôi đã có 2 chiếc ghế để có thể kéo một trên để cạnh giường ngủ. Phòng tắm đẹp, đồ vệ sinh cá nhân cũng được cung cấp. Họ không cung cấp bữa ăn sáng nhưng đã bị ép buộc bởi các tour du lịch guid để cung cấp cho chúng tôi một số bữa ăn sáng, gợi ý của omlette. Khánh, người nói tiếng Anh rất tốt (và Trung Quốc) hỏi chúng tôi những gì chúng tôi muốn, giải thích họ thường chỉ cung cấp phòng, và chúng tôi xác nhận omlette là OK. Sau đó, cô ấy cung cấp cho chúng tôi một món ăn Việt Nam nhưng chúng tôi nói rằng chúng tôi đã được ok với omlette. Vào buổi sáng, chúng tôi có xúc xích, trứng đầy nắng, bánh mì Pháp và một đĩa trái cây. Khánh & gia đình rất thân thiện và hiếu khách và chúng tôi rất thích trò chuyện với cô ấy. Chúng tôi muốn giới thiệu khách sạn này, có một quán cà phê nằm ngay bên kia đường, nơi bạn có thể dùng bữa sáng và một số cửa hàng vài phút ở cùng một phía. Chúng tôi đã không được khám phá chúng như chỉ có 1 đêm. Khoảng 2 phút bằng taxi hoặc 15 phút đi bộ đến điểm khởi đầu của thành phố chính - 2 nhà thờ tuyệt đẹp và quán cà phê Grasslands tuyệt vời mới! Từ đó bạn có thể đi bộ đến bờ sông trong khoảng 10 phút. Một thị trấn rất sạch sẽ và thân thiện, chúng tôi may mắn được ở đó cho TET và tận hưởng lễ hội hoa và chợ hoa dọc theo dòng sông! Rất nhiều hoa! Chúng tôi sẽ quay trở lại đó và giới thiệu bất kỳ ai đang nghĩ đến việc đến Việt Nam để có mặt trong dịp Tết Nguyên đán (TET), nơi bạn sẽ ngạc nhiên trước những bông hoa ở khắp mọi nơi và đặc biệt là màn trình diễn của thành phố.

Title: Off the beaten path
Review: M Hotel is a bit off the beaten path but is right in the center of life in My Tho. You are a 10 minute walk to the riverfront, a 10 minute walk north to the large pagoda, and you will not see a single tour group in this neighborhood. The city market is just a few steps away which has everything you may need for stocking up on your trip. There are plenty of street food vendors, a good number of local restaurants, and coffee shops right in the area. And again ZERO tourists. The staff consists of the owner and his daughters who are VERY friendly and will help you with anything you need. They even did our laundry at no extra charge! They also helped to arrange our bus travel to Vinh Long. The rooms are simple with the basic necessities including a refrigerator and a tv. One highlight was the large bathroom that had a separate area for the shower which had great water pressure! There is also a closet where you can put your bags but you will need to provide your own lock. If you are looking for a good location at the right price, friendly staff, and no tourists this is the spot for you!

Title: Disappointing and in a poor location
Review: We stayed here for just one night. They didn't have knowledge of our booking (made through booking.com) so it wasn't a great start. Despite not having a window our room looked reasonably new, had a decent shower and appeared clean; Except however the bed, which was pretty hard, was covered in specs of dirt and had hairs on. It appeared to is though it hadn't been washed since it's previous usage. Later in the day I found a very large cockroach clinging to my lonely planet guide which I managed to squash (not sure how it got in, but probably not the hotels fault, just saying the facts) The young guy on reception didn't speak a word of English so had to use a translator App on his phone when we asked for a map (which they couldn't provide) and for our passports back. The location is poor - it's at least a 25min walk to the town centre, and the eateries near by are very local, and don't have English menus. The aircon didn't work very well, but there was a wall mounted fan. We didn't have a good night sleep, partly due to the bed but also because there were loads of big kids running around the hotel screaming and banging doors. My girlfriend twice got up to ask them to keep the noise down but to no avail. I ended up banging on their door at 1am and that seemed to work. I understand that this issue was out of the hotels control, but it still made an impact on our stay. We would have told the hotel of our negative experience before reviewing them, but we weren't asked, and no one that was present spoke any English! Would not recommend!

Title: Another Poor Hotel
Review: Tien Giang Hotel Review - 02-17-15 Period of Stay: 02-07-15 to 02-16-15 Address: 6C, Rach Cam, 1 Ward, My Tho, My Tho GPS Coordinates: Lat: 10° 21' 15.4506", Long: 106° 21' 50.493" This is a review of the hotel and room  We have been visiting relatives that live in My Tho annually for many years. Things change slowly here. The hotels in My Tho are not really up to better hotels in Sai Gon and Ha Noi for the same price. Every year we visit, we try a different hotel but we never come away satisfied. This time was no different. We stayed at the Tien Giang Hotel, and it was one of the worse. Previously, we had stayed at the Song Tien, Chuong Duong, and Minh Quan. Like other hotels in My Tho, this one was not well maintained. I also believe it’s a government hotel, which speaks volumes about the lackadaisical and indifferent staff. As one enters the dimly lit lobby, you get the feeling it might be closed or there is a power outage. Electricity is expensive everywhere in the world, but apparently this place seems to think it doesn’t exist. Upon arrival, the front desk confirmed our booking but suggested the room was small and maybe we would like a larger one in a batter position inside the hotel for $9 more a night. We had originally booked a standard room on Agoda ($27), as they only advertised a standard room or a triple (one double and one single bed). The standard room was small, very small. The walls needed painting and the carpet drastically needed replacement. It was depressing. So I was shown the triple, albeit we didn’t need the extra single bed. (Pictures of rooms on most websites are taken with very wide angle lenses giving one the impression the room is much larger than it is in reality. Read the number of square feet or meters of the room you are buying to calculate what the true size of the room might be. 20 sq. meters or less for a room is pretty tight when you consider it probably includes the bathroom. The triple room, even with the extra space taken up by the single bed, looked larger and more airy. There was more light, probably due to the larger front window facing Hung Vuong Street. Because we were staying in town for 10 days, I chose the larger room -  Frankly, at this point I would have considered looking elsewhere in town for a decent room but the hotel was pre-booked on Agoda (no refund) and this is one of the draw backs of pre-booking a room. Room So room  was obviously on the third floor. It had an expansive view directly up Hung Vuong Street. However, like the first room we were shown, the walls required paint and the carpet was dirty and stained. Like the dimly lit lobby below, this room also had poor lighting, possibly fed with the smallest wattage bulbs available. The room contained a couple pieces of the standard wooden furniture, probably popular almost 100 years ago, including a desk drawer with stool for a chair, a small dresser drawer on top of which sat the ancient, small tube fed TV. There were two upholstered chairs on either side of a small table. A nightstand separated the two beds. Against the wall was an armoire to hang one’s clothes. The armoire lock was broken. There was a key in it but it did not function. As there was no safe in the room, this armoire would be any last hope of locking up anything of value. We asked if somebody could come up and fix the lock. Shortly after, a guy came up, looked at it and played around a bit. After certifying that it was broken, he asked if we would like to make an official ‘complaint’. What!? No, I wanted the lock fixed! It wasn’t going to happen. Also note the back-and-forth conversation was in Vietnamese. There are few English speaking workers in this hotel. The refrigerator was stocked with a few beverages and on the lowest setting. There were plenty of bottles of Aquafina drinking water but none were offered free with the room. I have stayed in many less expensive hotels in Viet Nam that included two free bottles of drinking water a day. How much is water - about 2,000d or 10 cents for a cheap brand? Our three person room had an expansive window that looked up the entire length of Hung Vuong Street, where preparations were being made for New Years. The one-foot ledge in front of the windows was cracked and weathered. It required maintenance and refurbishment years ago but again, nobody seems to care. On top of that, there was half smoke cigarette butt and a dead cockroach lying upside down on the ledge. Not a pleasant site. The included WiFi was pretty much useless in this room. We had to go out into the hallway floor to access the Internet. The wireless access points are installed at either end of the hallway and the range is poor. The circuit to the local ISP (a government ISP?) is extremely slow. I suspected something like ADSL or worse. The few times it seemed there was more bandwidth, a lot of websites appeared to be blocked. In retrospect, I believe the connections were just timing out due to low bandwidth. I tried changing DNS to no avail. The same experience was had in the hotel’s common areas, like the Cafe or lobby. Again, we complained but they said no other room like ours was available for better reception. Bathroom The bathroom was pretty standard for this type of hotel. It had a tub and hand shower above which was an electric water heater that came on when the water was being used. I also presumed this water heater also fed the faucet at the sink, which would only drip water when turned to left (hot) position. Standard flush toilet. Two very thin, standard, bath towels for two people a day and three per day for three-bedded rooms. Amenities included small tube of shampoo, bath foam, comb, ear buds, and toothbrush. Inclusive Breakfast The included breakfast consisted of one item from the following: 1- Broken rice (Com Tam Suon), or 2- Hu Tieu My Tho (local favorite soup), or 3- Beef Pho (Vietnamese standard soup), or \ 3- Omelette (actually two fried eggs with a small baguette) and, one of the following from the beverage list: 1- Black coffee with cream or sugar (Vietnamese style coffee with condensed milk was an extra 3,000 dong), or 2- Lemonade (something like a soda chanh but without the soda), or 3- Tea (Lipton tea bag and hot water), or 4- Soy milk Not a buffet if that what’s you are looking for but a basic meal to get your day started. Positives: 1- Clean bed linen for our stay 2- Fairly clean bathroom 3- Typical bath amenities included tooth brushes, plastic combs, shampoo, bath foam, and a small box of ear buds 4- Clean bedding but foam mattress was fairly hard for someone seeking a little bit more softness 4- Good air-conditioner 5- Hot water cooker, teapot, and loose leaf tea for making hot tea in the morning 6- Cable TV had a couple dozen local channels (Vietnamese) and selection of western channels including HBO, two FOX Sports, HBO HD, Starworld, Discovery, CINEMAX, Star Movies, Cartoon Network, AXN HD, Chinese channels and more Vietnamese channels 7- Resident lizard in the room (I think some sort of Gecko) made short order of flying or crawling critters, an added plus Negatives: 1- Standard rooms pretty small but adequate for an overnight stay 2- Dirty, stained, and torn carpets on hallway flooring and coming out of the elevator 3- Dirty and stained carpets in hotel room (really needed replacement long ago) 4-Armoire type closet with lockable door did not function. Housekeeping unable to help with a broken lock and asked if we wanted to file a complaint 5- No room safe 6- Poor lighting in bedroom and bathroom 7- Bathroom sink did not dispense but only a dribble of hot water 8- No shower curtain in tub to prevent shower water from landing on bathroom tiled floor (fairly typical of 1 or 2-star hotels) 9- Slippery bathtub will pose danger for elderly people trying to exit the tub onto tile floor that might be wet 10- Hotel staff would not provide a second key in the event one person was out and the other was in but sleeping 11- Poorest WiFi connections of any previously visited hotel in the city. Unusable except for text email. Tried changing DNS IP’s and more but nothing really could fix the poor Internet connection, especially in our room ( 12- Free bottles of water not offered 13- Little English spoken here. Best if somebody in your party speaks Vietnamese if you plan to stay at this place As I said last year, unless you have some compelling reason to stay in this town, move on to Sai Gon for the evening. (There is light at the end of the tunnel however. A new hotel that will be called ‘The Mekong’ will be opening allegedly in April 2015. Don’t hold your breath. The hotel is meant to be a 4-star affair, complete with in ground swimming pool. I walked by the construction site on February 7th, and it still has a way to go. The local construction people told us April but it will be a ‘soft opening’ as it is so often referred to in this neck of the woods. ‘Soft opening’ means everything isn’t ready but we’ll rent you a room. (Sorry, the pool isn’t operational yet”, or some other excuse.) Richard

Title: A step above camping
Review: This hotel cost almost as much as 4 star hotels in other cities. The hotel could be lovely, however nothing is taken care of. I stayed there twice during the same trip, at the beginning and at the end. The same trash was in the waste can on the second floor both visits. One night we returned to our room and the bed was covered in bugs, it looked as though someone had taken about a gallon of pepper and spilled it all over. We were told by the from desk that there was nothing that they could do until the next day! The resteraunt is very dirty, rats running through and the cook smokes and looks like he never bathes. Do yourself a favor and spend another $20 a night and stay at the new hotel in My Tho. This is a government run hotel and it really lacks in any type of customer service.

Title: Best Centrally Located hotel in My Tho
Review: Back again after 2 years. Room rates are reasonable and all rooms have balcony with magnificent view of the river. Early morning starting from 5.30 am one can see intrepid swimmers frolicking in the Mekong River. They will swim till 7.30 am . Hence don't forget to wake up early to see this unique sight of My Tho. Do order Hu Tiu My Tho for breakfast. Hu Tiu My Tho is a Rice Noodle specialty of this town consisting of shrimps, pork, liver, squid and ribs. The hotel is also an embarkation point for boat cruise to the nearby island of Con Phung and Con Thoi Son. Both have fruit orchards and one can take photos with Python or feed the caged crocodiles with lumps of decaying meat. A trip worthwhile. Once again relatively this is the boondocks and hotel rooms standard cannot aspired to be that of Ho Chi Minh City.

Title: Chuong Duong Hotel Restaurant Attempts Rip Off
Review: So for our last night in My Tho, Vietnam, my wife and I decided to stroll along the river and find a place to eat outside. We ended up at the Chuong Duong hotel, where they have outside dining, which is great. My wife and I ordered three dishes to share. You have to understand the scheme here. When you order a dish, it may come in three sizes, prices adjusted for small, medium, and large dish. If you have never seen a medium or large dish, you will not know if you are being served the right size for the price you paid. So my Vietnamese wife ordered the smallest size for all three dishes (smart move wife). When the bill came, she notice that we had been charged a higher price for one of the dishes. There was no reasonable explanation since the server acknowledged we had ordered the smallest dishes. The insult came when we paid the bill after it was adjusted and the hotel short-changed us 50,000d for a 130,000d bill! Again, the bill went back to the front desk where it was “adjusted appropriately”. Even in this small town, you need to keep your guard up. If I ever come back to this town, I will never stay at the Chuong Duong or eat at either their inside or outside restaurants. These folks are out to rip you off! Avoid at all cost! Richard

Title: Basic
Review: We stayed here as part of a tour of the Mekong Delta. We were already told that it was a 2star and very basic so we didn't mind all the things about it. The room and bathroom was old but had a good aircon and a balcony looking over the water. The beds were hard which is fine with us as we prefer them. The bathroom was ok. Was old but had a separate shower compartment (which did overflow after each shower). The wifi was free but unfortunately it wasn't very good, kept cutting out. We slept fine as we were exhausted but light sleepers may find it hard as there were lots of families gathering at the restaurant underneath singing karaoke till late. In the morning you get a wake up from the boats starting up too! There also isnt a safe in the room so we took our valuables and padlocked all our luggage. Breakfast at the restaurant downstairs was good, had bread and noodle soup which was tasty.

Title: Inexpensive, clean hotel with good location
Review: On work-related trips to the Mekong Delta, I've stayed in Chuong Duong Hotel several times over the years. Somehow, our research partners would book us here. We just request a room on the right hand side of the second floor. That is to be away from the restaurant noise. The hotel is along the Tien Giang river, one of the two branches the Mekong river, which makes the view from the upstairs bedroom window and balcony quite scenic. The river is a major thoroughfare for both business and tourism. The $24/night room rate is for a large room with a queen-size bed, split-type aircon, TV, refrigerator, an electric kettle, tea set, a small coffee table with two heavy wooden chairs, and an ensuite bathroom. The floor has wall-to-wall carpeting and a balcony. It also comes with breakfast and wifi. I must warn that the wifi can be on and off at times. If you must send an important email or visit an important website, you can bring your laptop to the reception counter near the main router. For anyone going to Mytho, I would recommend this hotel any time. Despite its budget hotel rate, it is comfortable, clean, safe and has a good location.

Title: Friendly!

Title: Best in My Tho probably- I guess
Review: If you have the misfortune to be going to My Tho or are one of those intrepid adventure types then this is the place for you. The city itself offers very little in the way of attractions and is one of the staging posts for those souls going to visit the nearby industrial park or continuing on to further south in the delta. The Chuong Duong hotel is 400,000 per night from what i heard (we didn't pay). It is worth the money, really. Clean sheets that are tucked in with the professionalism of a hospital matron. Clean shower and toilet, soaps and toothbrushes. Plus! tea and an electric kettle - actually this is above what they need to provide in a 2 star. The view onto the Mekong is good, the hotel restaurant is filled with locals who come in - a very good sign. Free wifi, ice cold beers at good prices in the lobby. All in all, good value for the $20.

Title: Best spot in My Tho
Review: There is not much luxury in My Tho nor many hotels to chose from. This one is the biggest hotel in the best location. It also offers boat tours, souvenir shops, etc. The grounds of the hotel are quite expansive, well groomed, and beautiful. We took a lot of pictures there too. The hotel staff was excellent by Vietnamese standards. Laundry service was fast and CHEAP. The rooms are cheap to, around $20US per night and had air conditioning. The key and the fob to activate the air conditioner could be separated to leave the air on. The rooms were not huge but not too small as to be cramped. The bathroom and shower were small and nothing to get excited over but there was plenty of hot water and they refreshed the toiletries daily. There was a dresser and a huge closet to unpack our clothing. I don't think it had an in-room safe. The free breakfast is decent but choices are fairly limited. The restaurant opens to non-guests for lunch and dinner which is much better. Many local as well as tourists also ate there and it was usually busy which is a good sign. The dining room is river view and the front of the hotel also has outdoor tables for lunch and dinner. The outdoor dining is in a beautiful garden area. If you visit My Tho I would say this is your best bet.

Title: A mixed experience...
Review: "My Tho's most luxurious accomodation..." according to the Lonely Planet. I think this says more about the other accomodation on offer in My Tho than it does about the Chuong Duong as it certainly doesn't fall into the luxury category. That said, it does have some redeeming features. First, the not so good: The hotel is dated and in despearte need of some updating. Levels of cleanliness are somewhat suspect and the staff hardly friendly and welcoming. It turns out that this is mainly a business hotel and doesn't cater to that many tourists. In fact very few tourists stop in My Tho at all, preferring to visit in a day trip from HCMC or to continue on to Can Tho. However, the hotel is on the banks of the Mekong and all rooms have balconies and magnificent views over the river. Stunning. Also, although it doesn't look much the food served up in the restaurant is fantastic and very cheap. This is just as well as there aren't many other options within walking distance of the hotel. Dishes can be ordered small, medium or large but even the small portions are massive. Just watch out for the occasional rat or cockroach! Across the road from the hotel and down the the road to the right where the river bends is a really nice bar which has cocktails and live music with English menus (but no food).

Title: Due giorni e mezzo di relax lontano da tutto
Review: Il posto non è semplice da raggiungere ma con un po' di pazienza e spirito di avventura ci si arrangia. Il Bus da Ho Chi Minh ci ha lasciati ad una fermata a circa 1 km dall'isola e a bordo di moto taxi ci hanno portato con un po' di difficolta a destinazione. Sono trascorsi due anni da quando ci siamo stati, magari adesso è più semplice, ma non saprei dire. Il soggiorno è stato molto piacevole, l'isola è collegata alla terra ferma da un ponte, ma è comunque isolata da tutto e dopo le 20 non troverete nulla di aperto, quindi vi conviene o cenare in struttura o cenare presto verso le 19:00 nelle poche strutture che ci sono (in generale in Vietnam si cena verso le 18-19). L'isola è piccola e piacevole da girare sia a piedi che in bicicletta, gentilmente forniteci da Thanh, il gestore della struttura, una splendida persona. Grazie a Thanh abbiamo fatto un bel giro in barca per le isolette del Mekong vicine (seguendo percorsi diversi dai soliti turistici pieni di gente), e grazie al profondo amore che ha per la sua terra abbiamo potuto conoscere e apprezzare appieno la recente storia tragica e meravigliosa del suo popolo, il popolo del Mekong. Non aspettatevi un hotel, ma delle casette in legno molto confortevoli immerse in un bellissimo giardino. Siamo stati 2 giorni e mezzo ed è stato un soggiorno piacevole.

Title: Tất cả đều sai
Review: Khách sạn nằm ở điểm hoàn toàn khác, không phải là bản đồ google hiển thị nó. Trên thực tế nó nằm ở một hòn đảo khác, gần Bến tre, không phải ở Mỹ Tho. Lái xe taxi cũng không thể tìm thấy nó. Sau khi chúng tôi gọi cho chủ nhà, anh ấy đến và đưa chúng tôi đến khách sạn bằng xe máy của anh ấy. Lần đầu tiên anh đưa chúng tôi không đến khách sạn nhưng đến một nơi khác và nói rằng nó tốt hơn vì nó sạch hơn và mới hơn, mặc dù nó xa sông. Khi tôi nhấn mạnh rằng chúng tôi đặc biệt yêu cầu xem sông trong đặt phòng của chúng tôi, các máy chủ đưa chúng tôi đến một nơi khác, gần sông, 2 - 3 km xa các biến thể đầu tiên. Nơi này là những gì bạn có thể nhìn thấy trên fotos, nhưng fotos không cung cấp cho bạn bức tranh đầy đủ. Trên thực tế nó không phải là một khách sạn hoặc một ký túc xá nhưng trông giống như một trạm thuyền, với rất nhiều tòa nhà hỗ trợ, vũng bẩn bẩn ở khắp mọi nơi, và các phòng bẩn thỉu. Chúng tôi cảm thấy như chúng tôi đã bị lừa dối và từ chối ở lại đó. Chúng tôi đồng ý trả 50% giá cho chủ nhà, và anh ta đưa chúng tôi đi xe máy đến một khách sạn khác mà chúng tôi tìm thấy trên internet bằng wifi của anh ấy (Btw, đó là khách sạn 4 sao chỉ đắt hơn một chút nhưng nhiều thoải mái hơn) Đừng làm hỏng kỳ nghỉ của bạn bằng cách lưu trú tại Mekong homestay

Title: Un peu cher pour le service ...!
Review: Nous avons séjourné trois jours dans ce homestay en pleine période de Noël et nous étions les seuls clients. Malgré tout, nous avons trouvé une chambre certes spacieuse, calme et climatisée mais dont la propreté laissait à désirer, notamment les draps. Le homestay se trouve au milieu du Mékong et le cadre y est très agréable, néanmoins il est loin de tout et hors période touristique il n'offrait même pas de service de restauration, un peu dur de trouver à manger donc... heureusement le propriétaire des lieux loue des scooters et de fait, ces derniers sont indispensables si on ne veut pas rester coincés à l'hôtel! Le petit déjeuner était très médiocre (pas de choix) : le premier jour nous avons eu des nouilles aux légumes, le deuxième jour une omelette et du pain et le dernier jour une soupe... Enfin le jour du départ nous avons dû à nouveau payer le propriétaire pour nous amener à la station de bus trop éloignée pour nous y rendre par nos propres moyens et nous avons payé le prix fort : 160000 dôngs alors qu'à l'aller nous avions payé le taxi 140000 dôngs ... Pour toutes ces raisons j'ai trouvé le prix de la nuit bien trop élevé (25$) d'autant plus qu'il faut nécessairement y ajouter le prix du scooter (8$/jour) Malgré tout : nous avons accepté de faire le tour organisé par le propriétaire et nous n'avons pas été déçus (15$/pers) : ce derniers parle bien anglais et n'est pas avare de détails tant historiques que culturels et nous avons beaucoup appris ! Nous avons découvert des savoir faire locaux, des fruits que nous ne connaissions pas et beaucoup d'autres choses... cette expérience a donc permis de remonter le homestay dans notre estime. A savoir que cet établissement est une coopérative locale de l'ensemble du voisinage et que loin d'être des professionnels du tourisme ils sont ouverts à toutes remarques permettant d'améliorer leurs service : Pour le coup on participe à l'économie locale !

Title: Cabaña en en islote Thoi Son
Review: Este alojamiento se encuentra en el islote Thoi Son, alejado de My tho. Sólo es accesible en moto ya que se encuentra en medio de la selva, frente al río, aunque las habitaciones no tienen vistas, es sólo el restaurante el que tiene vistas al río. Cuando llegamos no había nadie disponible para atendernos. El check in es sólo hasta las 20h, así que avisad para que os esperen si llegáis más tarde. Nosotros llegamos sobre las 21h y estaba todo cerrado y oscuro, pero salió un hombre que no hablaba inglés y nos dijo que allí no era. Sufrimos bastante y tuvimos que llamar a BOOKING para intentar contactar con el propietario porque el teléfono de la reserva estava mal indicado. Al final nos pudieron atender y nos dejaron entrar, pero nos dieron una habitación que parecía que no esperaba ningún huésped. Sin toallas y el lavabo sucio. Reservamos por dos noches, y a pesar de estar muy alejados del centro de My Tho, reina mucha tranquilidad. Desde el mismo alojamiento contratamos un tour por las islas por 13 euros por persona y fue toda una experiencia.

Title: Used to be better
Review: Unfortunately, like other reviewers, I have stayed here in the past and been very happy with both the service and the hotel. Now, however, there is room for much improvement. The local government is doing a major revamp of the shore line in My Tho, which has meant the Rang Dong hotel had to sell the land on which their lovely waterside restaurant was on to the government. At present it is half finished and not a very appealing sight. I can understand why the hotel owners are then reluctant to spend money on a the hotel until all works are completed. In two years there will be a street running along the shore line and the hotel will have a new restaurant and one would hope a major renovation. I found out all this info from the manager. After using his telephone to call a friend, he invited me to sit and have tea and sweet his mum had made. Very friendly bloke. If the price was little cheaper (cheapest being 200,000) I think people would be less likely to complain. Check back at this hotel in two and a half years. My guess is it will be beautiful.

Title: Rang Dong 2
Review: Stayed here for a couple of nights as part of a motorbike tour round the Mekong Delta. The hotel is right on the river, with large rooms and a good restaurant attached (English menus - few and far between in My Tho). We found the hotel to be quite a way out of the centre of town where most bars and restaurants are, however there isn't a huge amount to see in My Tho so not a big problem. The rooms are pretty basic, however this goes along with the price. The towels provided were threadbare and didn't look very clean and so we used our own during the stay. We also encountered the travel agent offering the boat trip as below reviewers have. I have to agree that the boat tour is a rip off and you would be better off using a tour not arranged through the hotel. Overall, not a bad place for a cheap stay, but you will probably want to keep your stay short.

Title: Gorgeous Accomodation, beware of dodgy travel agent outside

Title: Great Pearl by the River

Title: Pleasant stay
Review: As mentioned in other review, the hotel is relatively new. The lobby and common spaces are nicely done with a lot of stone and glass. The rooms are large and bathrooms are spacious. The breakfast was fine but we did not eat other meals in the hotel during our two night stay.

Title: Dịch vụ tồi tệ !!!
Review: Tôi tham gia đám cưới của bạn tôi tại khách sạn, lúc đầu, ấn tượng khá tốt và nó thực sự gây ấn tượng với tôi bằng cách trang trí và thiết kế nhưng kể từ khi đám cưới bắt đầu, mọi thứ trở nên tồi tệ, tồi tệ hơn như nó có thể! Cô hầu bàn phục vụ chúng tôi không có nụ cười nào trên khuôn mặt của cô ấy và từ việc ứng cử vào khóa học chính, chúng tôi phải đợi 30 '! ? , chúng ta có thể hiểu rằng học sinh là nguồn tốt nhất cho nhân viên CL, cho tiệc nhưng không theo cách này! Nhưng đó không phải là "tốt nhất", khi chúng tôi đi xuống thang máy dẫn đến bãi đậu xe, có 01 thang máy không hoạt động và tất cả các khách đều phải sử dụng cái còn lại. Người gác chuông - người mà tôi thực sự muốn hỏi tên anh ấy - nói với chúng tôi rằng thang máy khá đầy đủ, và đề nghị chúng tôi đi bộ, nhưng nhóm của chúng tôi là tất cả phụ nữ với đôi giày cao gót nên chúng tôi từ chối đi và chờ thang máy. Nhưng sau đó các thang máy khác sớm ra khỏi dịch vụ là tốt và dường như không ai thừa nhận cho trường hợp đó vì vậy tôi đã đến mà bellman yêu cầu giúp đỡ, tôi yêu cầu ông gọi cho kỹ sư, sau đó ông trả lời có một thang máy và chúng tôi có thể sử dụng người kia, tôi đã cố gắng nói với anh rằng có hai người trong số họ đã đi rồi anh trả lời rằng anh không thể rời khỏi nơi đó vì anh phải chào đón khách (anh đứng ngay cạnh hồ bơi) và yêu cầu tôi nói chuyện trực tiếp với lễ tân, sau đó, anh cố gắng giải thích vì anh không có người đi bộ, điện thoại di động hay bất cứ thứ gì có thể liên lạc ngay cả quầy lễ tân chỉ cách chỗ anh đứng 4-5 bước, anh biết một trong những thang máy đã tắt nhưng không thực hiện bất kỳ hành động nào cho điều đó. Sau khi tôi nói với anh ta 02 trong số họ đã tắt, vì vậy anh ấy đã rời khỏi vị trí đó, nhưng không phải để được giúp đỡ, anh ấy đã không còn ai có thể sử dụng thang máy đó nữa! ! !

Title: Dịch vụ với một nụ cười
Review: Chúng tôi ở lại Aurora Plaza trong 2 đêm để ăn mừng một đám cưới gần đây trong khu vực. Có một quầy trứng, nơi bạn có thể đặt trứng tráng hoặc trứng nếu bạn lựa chọn, id đề nghị này! ! Có một phòng tập thể dục và hồ bơi nằm trên tầng 14, hồ bơi là mở đầu tuy nhiên tôi chỉ có thể nhìn thấy 2 ghế phơi nắng. Vào đêm đầu tiên, chúng tôi đã cố gắng yêu cầu dịch vụ phòng lúc 11 giờ tối để nói với nhà hàng đóng cửa lúc 10 giờ tối, thực đơn trong phòng và thông tin cần cập nhật vì điều này vẫn khuyến khích dịch vụ phòng có sẵn 24 giờ một ngày. Người đàn ông ở quầy lễ tân đưa tôi đến một quầy hàng địa phương hoặc gọi món mì bò và xào và chuyển đến phòng của tôi để thay thế tốt. Nhược điểm duy nhất là không có đĩa trong phòng. Vào ngày cuối cùng, bàn chân của tôi bắt đầu cọ xát nên tôi hỏi nơi tôi có thể tìm một hiệu thuốc cho những người bán kẹo (trợ lý băng) - người trợ giúp lại đi cùng tôi đến một cửa hàng nhỏ để mua những thứ mà tôi nghĩ đã hết! Tất cả trong tất cả - một khách sạn tốt, làm mới sẽ được yêu cầu sớm tuy nhiên các nhân viên là tuyệt vời!

Title: Nice rooms, difficult staff
Review: We stayed here for two nights as part of a family trip to Vietnam in January this year. We were attending a wedding in Bien Hoa so the location was perfect for us. When we arrived the staff requested a $2000USD deposit and they would give back whatever we didn't spend- this didn't go down well! We had five adults and a child in our group in three rooms so this request for such a large amount was completely unreasonable. Luckily my cousins wife is Vietnamese and managed to get us out of this ridiculous situation. They instead kept our passports until we left, despite already taking copies. Be careful with money here, they won't take "old" US notes (whatever they are) and VN Dong that has a slight tear or rip. Don't get me wrong, the staff are very polite but some of the systems in this hotel make simple things very difficult (check in, payment etc). Title: Another face of Vietnam

This is true, you might be disappointed if you start comparing Bien Hoa with Halong Bay. Actually, what you can find in this town and at Sang's place is dramatically different. First, Bien Hoa has a long christian history and has dozens of churches. As a result, its atmosphere is different from the rest of Vietnam. Second, Bien Hoa surroundinds include lovely sightseeing places - such as waterfalls or forest - easy to reach by motorbike. Personnally, I spent 1 nice day fishing on a lake with Sang. Third, about Sang and his family, as I stayed 3 days with them, I can just say they are lovely hosts and strive for making you feel like home. Title: Lu Khach Quan: A Vietnamese Highlight

Title: Hidden treasure just outside of Saigon
Review: We'd heard about this place from other travelers, and decided to take the 1h bus from Saigon to Bien Hoa. When we arrived in the hostel, which is more like a homestay, since you really cook & eat together with the family, we were amazed: Spatious and clean rooms (with AC), off the tourist tracks, and the warmest welcome I'd had in Vietnam. Sang speaks perfect English, and he and his family will do everything they can to make you feel like part of their family. The accomodation is just incredible: rooftop shower & terrace, great rooms and the food you cook together with his family was just delicious! Sang offers personalized trips on the back of a motorbike/scooter: we visited the most beautiful temple complex (honestly the most spectacular one I have seen in Vietnam, although the lonely planet hardly mentiones it), you see the surprize on the faces of the locals since you're the only tourists there. Then we went to see pomelo village, really cosy and once again, great food! As a co-guide, Sang chooses to pick students, to give them a change to improve their English. His lovely niece took us to the local market, his sister showed us how Vietnamese foods are prepared (rooftop barbecue with the entire family!!). So really, if you want to see real Vietnam family life and hospitality, take a couple of days away from busy Saigon, discover places where hardly any other tourists go: go to stay at Lu Khach Quan!!!

Title: Far from the trodden paths

This part of the city must be the most Chistian area in Vietnam, I guess, and it was interesting to talk with Sang about the Vietnamese breed of Catholicism. Title: The real Vietnam
Review: Every traveller goes to Saigon, the tunnels, the museums, then hop on the bus and up to Nha Trang, Dalat, Hue, Hoi An and Hanoi. To do so and skip on by would be a big loss. Bien Hoa is out away from the touristy chaos of Saigon and yet your not out in the country battling hoards of mosquitoes. Bien Hoa is a unique little town about 30 kms out of Saigon with a rich cultural heritage of churchs and temples. The markets are a blast of colour and smells, spices and exotic fruits and fish. And the nicest way to stay in amoungst it is with Sang at Lu Khach Quan. Sang is a lovely bloke and along with his family put on a fun, relaxing, intruiging and eye opening experience. The dorms are very clean and the food they put on is outstanding, genuinly!! Sang offers a rang of activities, I saw the pomello forest, ate lunch on a floating resturant with a fishing pole dangling over the side, checked out the amazing lake and the zoo at dragon world, however due to my schedule I didnt have time to ride the ostriches. Excellent value for money in a calm and friendly environment, plus the rooftop beers and traditional vietnamese munchies make Lu Khach Quan a must for the traveller of an allready beautiful country. All in all I absolutly recommend staying with these beautiful people and getting to experience a little of what most travellers miss out on. Jim, Australia

Title: Một khách sạn trong công viên
Review: Có một con đường độc lập bên cạnh bãi đậu xe ở cổng trước. Khách sạn Tre Xanh có biển báo ở lối vào. Du khách có thể mua vé tại văn phòng bán vé phía trước bao gồm phí tham dự và phí dịch vụ của khách sạn / người. Khi nhận phòng, khách có thể xuất trình vé có thể là một phần của giá phòng. Công viên Thác Giang Điền là một công viên được xây dựng tốt. Con đường chính có thể tiếp cận quốc lộ 51 ở phía bắc và các khu công nghiệp ở phía nam. Không có nhiều khách sạn gần đó. Để có một phòng tại khách sạn này có thể là một không gian riêng tư để thay đổi quần áo cho khách du lịch ban ngày cho thác nước. Nó có thể tiết kiệm một số nỗ lực để đi bộ từ cửa trước. Nếu khách quyết định nghỉ qua đêm, đó là một sự hiếu khách truyền thống của người Việt Nam. Đối với những khách đi xe máy, họ có thể đi thẳng đến trung tâm của công viên. Toàn bộ các phòng của khách sạn nằm trên 1 tầng. Mỗi phòng đều có 2 cửa ra vào, một cửa ra ban công. Kích thước phòng nhỏ gọn. Sau một vài năm khách sạn trông giống như một ký túc xá. Các nhà hàng trong công viên phục vụ khách ban ngày. Do công viên tổ chức nhiều hoạt động xây dựng nhóm và hội nghị, nó có thể có một số âm thanh ca hát trước 9 giờ tối. Nó khá yên bình trong đêm. Mặc dù du khách có thể nhìn thấy khách của các phòng, mỗi phòng đều có rèm che. Du khách có thể đi bộ từ ban công ra thẳng công viên. Đôi khi trời mưa, mỗi phòng đều có một chiếc ô. Khách du lịch ban ngày hiếm khi đến khu vực khách sạn. Những khách đi xe hơi hoặc xe máy có thể sử dụng nhà để xe. Khách sạn cách xa đường phố. Nó đòi hỏi một xe gắn máy nếu khách muốn tìm các nhà hàng trong đêm. Những con đường đang ở trong một quốc gia bị bỏ rơi. Nhiều công ty môi giới bất động sản đứng vào ban ngày. Công ty cũng có một dự án để xây dựng một cộng đồng gần công viên. Đối với những khách bị suy giảm khả năng vận động hạn chế, thuê phòng máy lạnh có điều kiện tại đây có thể là lựa chọn để thoát khỏi ánh mặt trời đang cháy. Nhìn chung, nó có thể là một lựa chọn ngân sách giá trị cho một kỳ nghỉ cuối tuần từ thành phố Hồ Chí Minh. Trên đường trở về, du khách có thể ghé thăm công viên giải trí sữa Long Thành như một lựa chọn dừng chân ngắn.

Title: Basic hotel
Review: We've stayed at this hotel several times, mainly because it's very close for visiting family and friends, and partly because the city of Bien Hoa lacks choice where hotel accommodation is concerned. There is no lift but there are only two floors and the stairs are very wide and shallow. The rooms are large, very clean, but fairly basic; the beds are very comfortable with beautfully clean bed linen. Television reception isn't great, internet connection is usually adequate but does go down quite often. A kettle is usually provided, along with tiny cups and a teapot, but complimentary tea and coffee are not - we usually take a supply of these with us. The main problem with most of the rooms we've stayed in is the lack of electrical outlets, and those that are there are nearly wlways on one side of the room only - that opposite the bed. So, the ancient pre-war bedside lamp is useless as there's nowhere to plug it in! Likewise, the TV has to be unplugged in order for the kettle to be used. It's quite funny really - just one of those little quirks. The bathrooms are large with plenty of hot water for showers, but some of the older bathrooms have only cold water taps at the basins, and sometimes no plug which can make shaving a bit tricky. We've found this to be quite common in Vietnam so now we carry a universal plug. The notion of a Western breakfast hasn't yet reached this city, so the hotel doesn't provide much in the way of a hearty breakfast for us Westerners. The ubiquitous omelette can be made to order, but don't expect toast, or toast making facilities - the fresh bread is good, though. Occasionally you may get fruit. I'm afraid we don't like either the tea, coffee or milk - it's just not to our taste, so again, we take our own downstairs to the dining room and use the hot water supplied. This isn't a complaint, just an observation which may help future guests. This hotel seems to be the Go-To place for weddings and parties, which are loud colourful affairs. As they usually finish by about 9pm we've never been inconvenienced or disturbed by them, as we have in some hotels in other cities. The staff are so friendly and helpful and will go out of their way to make your stay a pleasant one. We have always been made very welcome, and yes, for a basic but clean, comfortable hotel, I would recommend it.

Title: Dịch vụ xấu, phòng bẩn
Review: Thứ nhất, họ cho chúng tôi một căn phòng có mùi hôi, sàn nhà bẩn thỉu và rất nhiều muỗi (có thể vì mùi hôi, họ mở cửa sổ, vì vậy muỗi bay trong phòng). Tôi hỏi họ xem họ có muỗi giết vợt không. Sau đó, họ nói rằng họ sẽ giải quyết vấn đề theo cách của họ. Họ phun hóa chất muỗi vào trong phòng và tôi đã cố gắng ngăn chặn chúng nhưng tôi đã thất bại. Làm thế nào tôi có thể ngủ bên trong một căn phòng vừa phun hóa chất? Rồi chồng tôi giận tôi. Sau đó, anh ta đi hỏi nhân viên tiếp tân cho một phòng lớn hơn và ok nếu họ tính thêm tiền. Điều này họ đã cho phòng tôi mặc dù bất cứ điều gì nó ok, bởi vì tôi cảm thấy buồn ngủ. Bước vào trong phòng tắm, tôi thấy giấy vệ sinh đã bị rách và lan rộng xung quanh, tôi vẫn chấp nhận và dọn dẹp chúng. Sau khi dọn dẹp nhà vệ sinh, tôi phát hiện ra tôi không thể đóng cửa chính vì cánh cửa gỗ lớn hơn một chút so với khung. Tôi lo lắng nếu tôi buộc phải đóng cửa thì có lẽ tôi sẽ bị kẹt. Một lần nữa, tôi đã đi xuống để than phiền với chồng tôi và họ rằng tốt hơn chúng tôi di chuyển đến một khách sạn hoặc tốt hơn tôi ngủ bên trong xe. Nhân viên tiếp tân nghe về những gì tôi nói với chồng tôi sau đó nhân viên tiếp tân hét lên với tôi rằng ông có thể đóng cửa, sau đó ông chạy đến đó, buộc đóng cửa với tiếng ồn đập chỉ để chứng minh rằng cánh cửa là tốt. Vì vậy, nó có nghĩa là nếu tôi đồng ý ngủ trong phòng đó, bất cứ khi nào tôi nhận được trong và ngoài căn phòng đó, mọi cơ thể sẽ thức dậy vì tiếng đập đập? Chồng tôi giận tôi hơn. Tôi muốn di chuyển và anh ấy vẫn muốn ở đó. Anh ấy nói nếu tôi không ở đó thì tôi phải tự tìm đường về nhà. Dù sao đây không phải là lỗi của chồng tôi. Sau khi tất cả, thay đổi một căn phòng khác, vẫn còn một căn phòng bẩn, không được tiết lộ sử dụng mở dầu gội đầu và bathgel chai nhỏ ném ở đây và ở đó. Phòng này nằm ngay phía trên cửa - phòng vấn đề. Và nửa đêm tôi thức dậy vì tiếng ồn lớn của lực lượng cửa ở tầng dưới gần đập. Dịch vụ kém, phòng dơ, kinh khủng.

Title: Przecietnie
Review: W porównaniu z ostatnim homestayem w Can Tho tutaj było przeciętnie, nie wiem, może było to spowodowane świętem Nowy Rok Chiński i czuło się, że duża część rodziny wyjechała. Osoby, które nas przyjmowały, traktowały nas jak gości hotelowych, pokoje czyste, ale łazienki mało zachęcające. Do homestay podwieziono nas motorkiem z promu jednak jak wyjeżdżaliśmy nie było już takiej życzliwości. Zaoferowana nam przejażdżka łódka po Delcie nic porywającego, niski poziom wody pokazywał tylko brud wokoło, płynęliśmy nieraz wokół plastikowych toreb i innych śmieci. Można zaliczyć tę atrakcję tylko dlatego, aby pomoc mieszkańcom Delty, starają się i chcą zarobić. Dla nas Europejczyków nie jest to duży koszt a oni maja za co żyć. Z drugiej strony widzimy faktyczne ich życie a nie przelukrowane takie dla dolarowego turysty. Jedzenie smaczne i niedrogo. Rowery bezpłatne, w dobrym stanie, można pojeździć po wyspie i po mieście Vinh Long. Dojechaliśmy tam z Can Tho taxowką nie był to duży koszt 400.000VD. Podróż trwała niecała godzinę, polecam. W drodze powrotnej skorzystaliśmy z lokalnego autobusu do Can Tho 50.000VD policzono chyba też opłatę za plecaki. Dworzec w Ving Long od homestay nie jest daleko, przeprawa promem 1.000VD za osobę. Polecam najlepiej na jedną lub dwie noce, więcej tylko, gdy chcesz poleniuchować w hamaku, ale znam lepsze miejsca. Night market w Ving Long nic specjalnego, widać, że ludność tutaj jest uboga.

Thức ăn tuyệt vời - món cá Mekong mới bắt được, bạn quấn mình trong chả giò tươi, sườn heo mọng nước, cá da trơn ngon ngọt và Bánh Xèo. Gia đình dạy bạn cách chuẩn bị và ăn món ăn tuyệt vời như chúng tôi vừa mới đến Việt Nam. Họ cũng tổ chức một tour du lịch 6 giờ giá trị mỗi ngày bắt đầu từ 6 giờ sáng, đưa bạn đến vùng đồng bằng sông Cửu Long xung quanh chợ nổi, một nhà máy ngọt ngào, nơi họ làm mọi thứ từ gạo và dừa địa phương, vườn trái cây và mật ong nông trại. A phải nếu bạn muốn chia tay cuộc hành trình từ Phú Quốc đến Thành phố Hồ Chí Minh và cảm thấy như bạn đang đi theo đường bị đánh đập khi bạn thực sự không phải nỗ lực nhiều để rời khỏi con đường chính!

Title: Tuyệt vời homestay!

Louise và Bernard Canada

Title: Relaxation près du Mékong

Vie au calme sur une ile calme. Les vélos sont à votre disposition. Gentille grand mère. Attention à la sortie "marché flottant". Sortie très intéressante pour l'artisanat local mais vous arriverez quand le marché sera terminé. La route est longue le long des canaux; excursion néanmoins intéressante pour le reste et l'argent est à donner directement aux bateliers et non à la guesthouse. C'est agréable de voir qu'ils ne prennent pas leur pourcentage.

Title: The heart of culture and comfort in Vietnam's South
Review: We stayed at a homestay which is affiliated with the Ngoc Sang homestay and right next door to the main house. Our homestay family consisted of the english-speaking daughter, an old always-smiling boat driver, and the most lovely old Vietnamese lady that I have met in my six months living in Vietnam. I stayed with family and friends for two nights, and returned a month later with my partner for a getaway from Ho Chi Minh City. I returned primarily because of flawless service with non-stop fruits, tea, coffee and snacks being delivered to a table next to my hammock. Meanwhile, meal times were different every single time with a hearty Vietnamese dish made fresh from the kitchen. The best thing about this place was the dinners, which always consisted of fresh fish, chicken, pork, vegetables, soups and sometimes some amazing escargot-style snails. I cannot complain about the food and none of us were worried about the safety of the food. The second thing that is attractive about this place is the price is inclusive of everything, which makes everything very stress-free.

Title: It's not for everyone but...
Review: Well, this experience was perfect for me because I just want a lazy holiday, close to nature and doing nothing. Staying in An Binh island is exactly that! Title: Parfait pour profiter du delta du mékong
Review: Il s'agit effectivement plus d'une guesthouse que d'un homestay. En revanche le contact avec la famille est très facile et toujours souriant. Nous y sommes venus par hasard en nous laissant séduire par la proposition de la chef des lieux qui attends les touristes à l'embarcadère. Les chambres sont équipées de moustiquaires et de ventilateur. Propreté des lieux : salle de bain, chambre et pièces communes. Le repas est super (bon et en quantité) c'est un bon moment pour partager avec les autres touristes présents dans la guesthouse. L'excursion proposée est très sympa et dure au moins 6h en revanche pas le meilleur lieu pour le marché flottant, certains dans d'autres villes sont plus impressionnants. Nous sommes finalement restés deux nuits tellement nous nous y sommes sentis bien.

Title: Esperienza Homestay, ma non per tutti.
Review: Abbiamo passato qui una notte, venendo "accalappiati" dal proprietario alla fermata degli autobus di Vinh Long che ci ha spiegato come raggiungere la struttura (mototaxi, traghetto, mototaxi). Ebbene, abbiamo vissuto un'esperienza a stretto contatto con una famiglia vietnamita, i signori, nonostante un approccio un po' freddino si sono rivelati di una gentilezza ed un'accoglienza incredibili, ci hanno messo a disposizione una piccola cameretta dotata di aria condizionata in una casa costruita sulle palafitte su un'isola fluviale. Certo, ci vuole comunque un minimo di spirito di adattamento, il bagno è in comune e situato in "zona cucina", ci sono insetti, rettili che vagano per la casa (d'altra parte si è in mezzo alla foresta) ma sono cose che se affrontate con il giusto spirito renderanno il soggiorno indimenticabile. Si è circondati da animali da cortile, da donne intente a fare legna, pescatori intenti a riparare le reti, insomma, scene di vite rurali vietnamite. Degna di nota poi la cena organizzata per gli ospiti, involtini di riso, zuppa di pollo e l'immancabile pesce "orecchia di elefante" del delta del Mekong. Insomma, per noi è stata un'esperienza indimenticabile che consigliamo a chi ha voglia di passare del tempo a stretto contatto con le culture locali.

Title: Perte de temps et business navrant.
Review: Nous avons réservé sur les conseils d'une amie et après consultation des avis sur TripAdvisor, la chambre au milieu du jardin de ce "homestay" par téléphone une semaine à l'avance. À notre descente de bus à Vinh-Long, nous avons été surpris de rencontrer la personne qui a pris notre réservation. Nous avons compris plus tard qu'une pratique locale consistait à faire du racolage pour certains homestays à l'arrivée des bus. À peine arrivés sur place, dans cette jolie maison, parmi les touristes se balançant dans des hamacs et s'ignorant les uns, les autres (nous compris), nous avons senti comme un malaise. En effet, "notre" chambre était tout simplement déjà louée et on nous inscite fortement à aller dans une maison voisine tenue par la même famille. Une fois rendus, nous constatons qu'il s'agit d'un hangar à touristes, sorte de camps tropical pour blancs. Nous refusons la "chambre" proposée, ils s'étonnent, nous sommes furieux et partons. Rien de friendly dans tout cela.

Title: Very nice place for a short stay
Review: After a chaotic bus trip from Saigon to Vinh Long it was great to arrive at this peaceful homestay. The people are very welcoming. They will meet you up at the ferry which will take you to the island. The rooms are ok (we had one that was 'private' ). The bathrooms are Vietnamese style but very clean. The food was amazing and so much to eat (diner at 6.30 so don't have a snack before) !!! They have bikes you can take to wander around the narrow alleys of the island, I strongly suggest you pick one to have a look at the peaceful life around the Mekong. Their boat trip across the highland is very nice (it'll cost you 200,000dg and start at 6am finishes at around 12pm), worth doing. Overall very good for a couple of nights only (we stayed one night as we thought there was not much to do after bike and boat trip) Ps: keep your mosquito repellent handy !!!

Title: Amazing value for money
Review: We found this little place in our guide and texted the owner to book (you can also email-> details on his Facebook page) and it was exactly what we wanted to finish our 2 weeks in Vietnam. Basic rooms but with mosquito net and fans (we didn't need to use the fans) 2 shower/toilets that are shared (only 5 rooms in this Homestay so never had to queue) rooms were very clean and family was very cute ! The grandma is cooking for us each night some amaaaaazing fishes, chicken, veg, fruits... We felt so good we decided to stay 2 nights. One day we took their bikes (don't expect the last model - Homestay means green tourism where you stay with locals to help them improve their standard of living so investing in bikes for them is like buying a car for you) but it's more than enough to discover the island with its beautiful landscape and colonial houses. Just test the bikes before and if you need adjustment just ask someone will always be willing to help. The next day we just relaxed in the hammock in the morning and at 12.00 we took their boat and they took us around the island for only 200 000 each. They picked us up from the main bus station and dropped us back and organised our trip back to Saigon. We paid 250 000 each (per pers per night) for bed diner and breakfast (bikes are free too and pick up as well) so it as an amazing value for money and we really saw a different part of Vietnam that really made our holidays. Will defo recommend you to visit this little family.

Title: Einfaches Homestay, nette Leute

Easy: an den Kühlschrank gehen, Bier entnehmen, einen Strich an die Tafel machen.... So gefällt's! Auf der Terrasse in der Hängematte abhängen macht Spaß. Die Fahrräder könnten ein wenig besser in Schuss sein, man erwartet den unausweichlichen Achsbruch..... Der Herr des Hauses übernimmt selbst den Moped-Transport zur Fähre. Englischkenntnisse sind sparsam aber ausreichend vorhanden. Zur Bootsfahrt nach Cai Be (haben wir mit einem Freund des Hauses gemacht) 2 Tipps: - Nicht auf die offiziellen Reiseveranstalter hereinfallen, dass nur sie eine Lizenz hätten, alles andere sei illegal und man würde von der Polizei gestoppt werden.... Quatsch!! - Vergesst den "schwimmenden Markt" von Cai Be, der besteht aus einer handvoll größerer Boote; deshalb lohnt sich der Bootstrip nicht. Aber die Fahrt durch die Kanäle und Seitenarme des Mekong macht echt Spaß.

Title: Local homestay in a dirty surrounding
Review: We stayed only one night at Ngoc Sang Homestay. It was offered by the owner of the homestay as he approached us at the regional bus stop. The homestay was oke, nothing special. The dinner and market tour was included in the price of 250.000 dong per person. We took bikes from the homestay and drove around the island which was very poor, full of garbage but with friendly locals. The dinner was good but quite small. We understand that the family tries to make a living but found in the end the price quite high for what was offered. Especially because the morning market tour was very poor. The couple who did the tour took ages to get to some huts were you felt that you had to buy something while it was actually bad quality and service. The floating market was quite a joke, we sailed through the 15 boats without stopping. Only relatively good thing was a local boat which another women paddled through the small canals. Overall, the homestay was oke but the surrounding with market not worth staying. Other places in the Mekong Delta have more to offer.

Review: Ca s'appelle comment déjà...? Un "HomeStay"... ou... chez l'habitant ... C'est ça ? Cela se veut un côté authentique, en contact avec les "vrais gens"... Pour moi… c’est le summum du foutage de gueule ! Eux n’y sont pour rien… mais franchement… quelle horreur ! En guise d’Home stay… les types ont construit une véritable bétaillère à blancs ! Sorte de hangar agricole tout en long avec au moins 16 chambres toutes identiques, alignement de boxes à touristes. Oui c’est bien 12 dollars. Mais … par personne !!!! incluant certes le repas du soir… fort agréable ! C’est vrai. Mais … Mais… quelle horreur ! C’est mon passage médisance… mais là… en gros c’était la caricature ! Que des blancs (français pour la plupart) allongés dans des hamacs profitant du lieu avec une pauvre famille qui fait tourner ça à plein régime et dort à l’arrière dans une immense pièce de fortune. Aucun mélange, les touristes sont bien gardés ! Bien à leur place. Et le truc qui m’a paru fou… ou insensé… c’est que les autres touristes trouvaient ça génial ! « Ouais c’est vachement reposant… etc »… Mais y a rien de moins authentique que ça !!! Au moins dans un hôtel : la couleur est affichée ! Mais là… les apparences sont trompeuses et ca fonctionne ! « Homestay » : Mon Oeil ! Bref… je n’y reviendrai pour rien au monde…

Title: Dodgy Experience
Review: We stayed here as part of a boat-trip and Homestay we arranged with Nam whilst staying at the Phung Hoang Hotel in Vinh Long. It's wasn't a cheap trip, but we were only there for a short time and like most people wanted to pack in a boat trip and take a look around An Binh island, so considered it worthwhile. The boat trip itself was pretty average, no English communication and you are shown the waterways and visit what amounts to a few shops dotted around the islands. The unique atmosphere of An Binh is an attraction however. Afterwards we were dropped at Ngoc Sang Homestay and the trouble started when we where asked what we wanted for lunch and presented with a bill. Nam had given us the sales-patter at the hotel, telling us that the trip fee included everything, boat-trip, homestay and food. We complained that we did not expect to pay extra for food (only drink) and Nam was summoned to the phone. He told me that it was only breakfast that was included in the price. We were really annoyed, and we decided to leave as we felt this was a con. With bags packed we were stopped by a family member and asked to wait as they phoned Nam again. After a quick discussion they changed their mind and all food was now included. We where asked not to mention this to the other guests as they had agreed to pay for their food. We later learned that Nam and his sister sell the tour and homestay at the Phung Hoang Hotel and the neighboring Phuong Hoang hotel on Hung Vuong street. Some other guests who had bought the tour through Nams sister also did not expect to pay for extra for food (lunch, dinner) whilst at the homestay. We feel there is some deceit going on here, as they capitulated when we threatened to leave and then in hushed tones asked us not to mention we were not paying to the other guests. Be careful, if you take this tour be very specific about the food situation as we feel they are taking advantage of people once they are on the Island.

Title: Unser Highlight im Mekong-Delta
Review: Als wir mit dem Local-Bus in Vinh Long ankamen, wurden wir gleich vom Hausherrn Nam abgefangen, der uns Fotos von seinem Homestay zeigte. Im Gegensatz zu vielen anderen "Touristenjägern" war er jedoch von Anfang an auffallend freundlich und unaufdringlich und seine Versprechungen sollten sich als absolut wahr herausstellen. Zwar erschien uns der Preis von 250.000 Dong p.P. (ca 12,5$) erst sehr hoch, da wir meist so viel für zwei Personen im Hotel gezahlt hatten, ließen uns aber darauf ein, als wir hörten, dass Abendessen, Frühstück, Fahrräder und der Transfer mit der Fähre inklusive sind. Nams Haus liegt auf der Insel An Binh, die gar nicht mal so klein ist. Mit der Fähre fährt man nur 5 Minuten über den Mekong. Auf der Insel gibt es nur kleine Sträßchen, so gut wie keine Autos, dafür viele Fahrräder und einige Motorbikes. Wir wurden von Nams Schwester mit dem Motorbike am Fähranleger abgeholt und zum Haus der Familie gebracht, das in einem der Dörfer liegt. Über einen kleinen Weg erreicht man schließlich das Haus, das einen mit einer großen Veranda begrüßt. Zum Teil steht es auf Stelzen in einem kleinen Fluss. Auf der Veranda gibt es einige Hängematten in denen man sehr gemütlich liegen kann... Die Zimmer sind recht klein, und nur durch dünne Holzwände voneinander getrennt. Dafür sind sie aber sehr sauber und mit Moskitonetz und Ventilator ausgestattet. Es gibt zwei Gemeinschaftsbäder mit sauberen Toiletten und Duschen und warmem Wasser. Doch das beste an dem ganzen Homestay - was es auch so viel besser macht als die Übernachtung in einem Hotel - ist die Familie. Es leben drei Generationen zusammen und auch wenn die Großmutter kein Wort Englisch spricht, so verwöhnt sie einen mit frischem Obst und Tee. Und zwischendurch wuselt der dreijährige Sohn, der sich sehr über neue ausländische Freunde freut. Und dann das Essen. Wir sind absolute Genießer und haben in Vietnam alles von Straßenküche bis feinem Restaurant ausprobiert- aber das beste Essen haben wir hier in dieser Familie bekommen. Vom gebackenen Elephant Fish träumen wir heute noch. Den Fisch rollt man in Reispapier mit frischen Kräutern, Gurke, Salat und Reisnudeln... Und danach gab's Hühnchen mit Zitronengras, ebenfalls grandios. Also wir können diesen Homestay nur empfehlen. Natürlich ist die Ausstattung einfach aber das ist eben Vietnam. Morgens krähen die Hähne sehr früh und laut, wer empfindlich ist sollte Ohrstöpsel parat haben. Und auf keinen Fall vergessen sollte man Insect Repellent- man ist mitten im Mekong in einem sehr ländlichen Gebiet, da gibt es einige Stechmücken!

The house is on one of the many canals in the Mekong Delta just over the river from Vinh Long. Dinner and breakfast were included in the price as is bicycles and a boat trip. The rooms were big enough and very clean and the hammocks on the veranda great for lazing around. All for 250,000 dong (around 6 pounds GBP). The family were extremely friendly and the homestay was one of the highlights of our time in Vietnam. I would definately reccommend for a real taste of the Mekong Delta.

Có một khu vực ăn sáng rất đẹp, với tủ lạnh để giúp bạn và ghi lại những gì bạn đã thực hiện. Bạn trả tiền cho thực phẩm và đồ uống của bạn khi bạn kiểm tra. Chỗ nghỉ nhà dân này cung cấp xe đạp miễn phí cho khách sử dụng để đi quanh hòn đảo, nơi không được bảo trì tốt - một chút của thợ làm bánh gỉ! - nhưng dù sao thì cũng vui. Có một thực đơn bữa tối ngon với nhiều lựa chọn bữa ăn với giá khoảng 100, 000 đồng (khoảng £ 4) Nhân viên ở đây rất hữu ích, họ đến phòng của chúng tôi để kiểm tra thời gian chúng tôi muốn rời đi vào buổi sáng để họ có thể đưa chúng tôi trở lại bến phà và sắp xếp ở phía bên kia taxi để đưa chúng tôi đến bến xe buýt. Một kỳ nghỉ tuyệt vời, được khuyến khích kỹ lưỡng.
