Title: Beautiful oasis in the heart of the Mekong
Review: We spent 3 nights at Phuong Thao Homestay and were immediately delighted with our choice - it was the perfect place to relax after a busy few days in Saigon. Phu was extremely helpful when we called the day before, arranging to pick us up by motorbike from the harbour at An Binh. On arrival, we had cold beers in the hammocks on the deck and pre ordered our dinner, which turned out to be a delicious feast every single night, including elephant ear fish, huge tiger prawns, Vietnamese pancakes, spring rolls, rice noodle soup, chicken in lemongrass and a whole array of local fruits. Phu speaks excellent English and all of the staff are polite and helpful. They arranged two boat tours for us: one of the Mekong including a floating market, a local market and a coconut candy/rice paper/rice wine producer (4 hours, 175,000 VND per person) another of local fruit plantations where we gorged on lots of delicious unusual fruits then visited some fish farms (3 hours, private tour, 200,000 VND per person). It was extremely interesting to see the different industries that are thriving in the An Binh area. Our rooms were clean with mosquito nets and a fan. There are plenty of shared showers with hot water and western style toilets. There are also free bikes for rent and we spent a few enjoyable hours exploring the local countryside, stopping to enjoy a bowl of Pho for lunch at a local eatery. Overall, this guesthouse highly recommended for a peaceful and authentic stay in the heart of the Mekong.

Title: Remote location.  No river view.
Review: Motorbike met me at the bus termal from Ben Tre. I was charged 50k dong for the 25 minute ride which was exremely uncomfortable. Possibly the worst ride on a motorbike that I have ever experienced. If you come from Ben Tre, I suggest you don't take this option. When I arrived, I was shown to my room. The room is small, with just a double bed with a simple foam mattress. No other furniture. The room is clean, but open at the top, so therefore no air-con. There is, however, a fan and a mosqueto net. There is a shuttered opening to the outside, but there is no view, just the wall of the accommodation block next door. I had to go and ask for a key, because I wasn't given one when shown to my room. The bathrooms are at the back of the accommodation buildings. The shared wash basins are in public view, but there are lockable shower cubicles, some with a toilet. There is some toilet paper, but no shower gel is provided. The buildings are constructed in the local style using traditional materials. The beer is 25k dong for a bottle. That's more than I paid in Ho Chi Minh. I have just come from Ben Tre, where I was paying 8k dong for a beer. There is no view of the river. There is just a dirt trackway, and beyond that a swamp. However, the river can be seen from further along the trackway. There is a pleasant garden surrounding the property. I asked about going into the town. I was told that it's a 10 minute bicycle ride to the river ferry to get to the town. (bikes can be borrowed at no charge). Actually it's at least 20 minutes to the ferry. The ferry is busy, and you have to wait maybe 15 minutes or so for it to arrive from the other side. Fare is 1000 dong. There is a good market in the town (turn left from the ferry and the market is on the right). Behind the market is the bus station. Buses to Can Tho leave every hour at 19k dong. Take care about returning to the accommodation after dark, because the riverside pathway isn't lit. I slept well. It was very quiet. However, with no ceilings, noise carries easily from the other rooms. Breakfast was a selection of fresh fruit, an omelette, bread and a pot of coffee. It was a good breakfast. Transfer to the ferry by motorbike after check-out is provided free of charge. I'm not clear why this is called a homestay. There is nothing homely about it. It's a hostel in a poor location with rather inflated prices. The staff were pleasant, which is very nice when other things are not to your liking. I had booked to stay another 3 days on my return from Can Tho, but I decided to cancel the booking. I expected the accommodation to have a river view, and to be within walking distance of the ferry.

Si bien las ventanas no tienen cristales, por lo que escuchas en todo momento el sonido ambiente, cada cama tiene su propia mosquitera. La comida es muy abundante y buena, gran variedad de platos locales. El personal es muy atento e intenta ayudarte en todo momento. Tienen servicio de préstamos de bicis, por lo que puedes pasear por los alrededores sin problema.

Title: Un homestay charmant et paisible au milieu des rizières
Review: Un joli homestay complètement typique au beau milieu des rizières et en bord de rivière. La famille qui tient les lieux est adorable et fait tout pour vous rendre votre séjour des plus agréables : vélos à disposition, ils viennent vous chercher au ferry et organisent votre départ, proposent une visite exhaustive du delta du Mékong en bateau, etc ! Le prix des chambres est dérisoire, par contre le confort est plutôt sommaire : matelas très fins, douche et toilettes communes. Et on n'a pas d'autre choix que de manger sur place... or les prix des plats proposés sont chers par rapport à la norme, et la cuisine n'est pas extra.

Title: Fantastic homestay experience in a great area!
Review: The Phuong Thao homestay is a great place to experience life in the Mekong Delta. The island of An Binh, just a 5 min ferry ride from Vinh Long, is a charming and peaceful area, and the homestay is a great way to enjoy it. I met great people at the homestay and we took bikes to explore around the area and loved cycling around on the narrow pathways covered in shade by the leafy banana trees. The food was great - if a little pricey, but well worth it. I definitely recommend staying here at least for several nights!

Title: Nice authentic homestay
Review: Positive - nice environment: surrounded by nature - authentic bamboo building - tranquile, quiet, ... - free bicycles at your disposal - free pick up and drop off with motorcycles at the ferry (what an experience with those bags ...) - Mr Phuong speaks english very well. He is a pleasant and reliable host, always there to help (we booked and payed via Mr Phu 3 days upfront a speedboat from Cau Doc to Phnom Penh, Mr Phu made the boat company deliver the tickets at our hotel in Cau Doc: thx for this impeccable service) Negative - food not bad but we we had better in Vietnam - can be hot in the evening in the room (no airco), in the morning early awake as there is no isolation between the rooms Negative points are neglectible compared to the overall positive experience. Title: Great homestay to explore the Mekong Delta
Review: The rooms in this homestay are basic but clean. There is only one big (shared) roof over all the rooms but the rooms are open from above. This means that you are in some sort of dorm with private compartments. Luckily everyone respects eachother by being quiet at night! Bathrooms are shared but clean! The host is a great guys who booked our bus to Ho Chi Minh City and told us about the fact that Phuong Trang has a free transfer from the busstation to district 1. He also gave us a tour through the Mekong Delta by boat for a very fair price. The food at the homestay is great. For a really fair price you get a lot of food (we haven't been able to finish all the food of 1 menu with two people). If you want to explore the mekong delta, this is the perfect place. The homestay is far from all tourism, giving you a great view on the life of the people living in thisbpart of Vietnam. The homestay is a bit far from the ferry. I would say it's not walking distance. But the owner will come and pick you up from the ferry. He'll also bring you to the ferry when you leave. So even though it's a bit in the middle of nowhere, you'll be fine. Nice extra is that you can rent a bike for free at the homestay. The bike was definitelly a nice way to explore the beautifull area!

Title: A perfect few days
Review: We had such a perfect stay at Mr Phu's homestay. A driver picked us up in HCMC (only about $10 more than the bus for all three of us) and brought us directly to the ferry in Vinh Long, which was super convenient. A short ferry ride brought us to An Binh Island, where Mr Phu's staff picked us up on motorbikes for the short ride to the homestay. The location is incredible, surrounded by fruit trees and right on the river. Beautiful flowers everywhere, and so, so green. Definitely a remote getaway! Mr Phu arranged boat trips for us on the two days that we were there. The first day, we went to the Cai Be Floating Market, the coconut candy factory, and some other more touristy spots. The second day, we wanted to do something different, so we went on a boat (arranged 100% through the homestay) through the countryside. We even brought bikes on the boat with us so we could go for a ride through the winding dirt roads! Breakfast was served on the boat each morning, and both boat rides were very relaxing and lovely. We ate dinner at the homestay both nights, which ended up being a bit pricey but totally worth it. Unfortunately, there aren't many other options for dinner in the area, so the dinners are definitely something to factor in. However, the food was amazing and eating dinner at the homestay was such a wonderful experience. After dinner, we could just relax in the many hammocks before turning in for the night. The overall atmosphere of the place is amazing, and Mr Phu and his staff are all super friendly and helpful. Prepare to not have great phone service or wifi--all for the best, because who needs wifi when you can read a book in a hammock next to an adorable sleeping dog and baby ducks!? Highly, highly recommend this place for anyone looking to escape hectic HCMC and just have a completely peaceful couple of days. Do note that the bathrooms are shared and the rooms are quite basic, so don't expect anything too glamorous. DO make use of the open-roof showers--nothing quite like showering under the stars!

Title: Phuong Thao Homestay in Vinh Long
Review: Located on Binh Island, a couple kilometres from the ferry crossing point it is off the main road along a beaten path set in an idyllic surrounding with exotic plants & hammocks in abundance. The food is good and prepared there by the staff (his wife & helpers) all local produce. There are bikes to use freely and even the moped for emergency's should you need one as cars can not reach the home stay it really is in isolation. 'Phuong' the owner is always there to help and will go to no length to see that your stay is as memorable as possible and any help you need you only have to ask him. He puts on excursions for the visitors and usually not costing more than $5 -$15 depending on the amount of work & time goes into them including lunches. the closest town off the island is Vinh Long, it is home to around 130.000 people but in rush hour it's main streets around the ferry dock can seem a bit more like Oxford street, it hosts a fabulous market where you can buy just about anything and I really urge you to spend a full afternoon/morning there discovering it better late afternoon to early evening just to see the rush hour (well worth it!)

Title: Great place to unwind.
Review: Although I only stayed a night in this homestay, I had one of my most sound sleep on the comfortable bed although the room is pretty basis. The shared bathrooms are decent enough with western style toilet and water heater. Coming from the bustling city of Saigon, it was a good change to be near nature with crickets chirping, lizards calling, rooster crowing and dogs barking. There are never short of an empty hammocks to lie in for a nap or read a book. The food was alright though not super fantastic. The homestay also organises morning and afternoon tours. I attended the morning tour to a nearby floating market & a local land market which was eye-opening. Getting around the island to explore is quite easy since the homestay provide bicycles but do take note that the bicycles have no suspension. The good thing about this homestay is that they charge by the number of pax instead of per room pricing. Hence as a solo traveller, it helps to save abit more money. Owner is flexible with the checking in and checking out timing and he speaks rather good English too. Overall, I really enjoyed my one night stay at the island and the experience was really great but remember your insect repellents after all you are super close to nature!

Title: Atmospheric and quiet, hand built from palm leaves.
Review: We really loved staying in this homestay, mostly because it's right in the middle of nature. Title: The rooms were basic, the restaurant food was terrible
Review: After our tour bike ride of one hour along the canal and back country, we had reservations for lunch here. Upon arrival, we had plenty of time to walk around the property; we checked out a couple of the rooms and relaxed in the chairs and hammocks at the restaurant. The rooms seemed basic, but functional and with mosquito nets though we did not spend the night here. I was a bit surprised when it was time to place our order that there was no menu or at least one presented to anyone in our group. There was no menu and the host/hostess would come around to take your order and they would let you know if they could make a dish you wanted and there was also no mention of the prices. I have never visited a restaurant that did not have a menu card. The first dish I ordered was the fried noodles with chicken. This dish had no flavor and only a few vegetables. I had to add a ton of soy and vinegar sauce and this still did not help the flavor. The second dish was spring rolls. The rolls were terrible. They were filled with the local equivalent of a potato puree. I attempted to eat two of the eight rolls and I had to stop as they were so bad. More than 85% of our group did not like the food (even the soup) and then they hit you with the second surprise which was the high prices they charged for the food. So we were stuck out in the middle of nowhere, with no other options to eat. What a rip-off. Several of us mentioned to our tour guide and to our host/hostess about the poor taste and over-priced food. They both did not know how to respond to the criticism. This was one of three restaurants on my entire Vietnam adventure where the food was simply bad. I do not like to write such a negative review, but there were so many things wrong with the way this restaurant was managed, no menu, bad taste and high prices.

Title: Good for one night

Title: Very relaxing
Review: I stayed here a couple of nights and probably would've been happy staying a bit longer, too. The grounds of the homestay are lovely, it's set in a beautifully lush area of trees and flowers just off the river. There are plenty of hammocks to relax in and if you enjoy nature then you can see all sorts of different types of birds and butterflies fluttering by. The room was a fine, simple wooden barn type of place. The toilets and showers are shared but there are enough of them that was never a problem having to wait for one of them to be free. The free bicycles to take for rides around the island were great and give you a real feeling of freedom. There were a lot of kids running around being a bit noisy one afternoon but after about 10pm the place is really quiet and I slept well. The boat tour (which goes from about 6:30am to 1pm) is really worth doing too, and good value.

Title: Best Homestay ever!

Title: Charmant homestay dans le delta du Mekong

Les déjeuners et les souper inclus étaient très bons, mais un peu redondants pour 3 nuits. C'était très impressionnant d'assister à la pêche pour le souper. La famille a aussi un grand jardin pour avoir des fruits frais pour déjeuner et pour le dessert.

Khi bạn đến nơi chủ nhà sẽ ngồi xuống với một ít trà và nói chuyện với bạn về tài sản, khu vực và các bữa ăn. Điều này là tốt đẹp trong lý thuyết, nhưng nó đã được rút ra quá lâu, đến mức trở nên khó chịu. Đối với bữa ăn tối, bạn có thể chọn một định dạng gọi món nếu bạn bấm cho nó, nhưng nếu không nó là một thực đơn thiết lập của nhiều khóa học. Nó ngon và to lớn, và tôi khuyên bạn nên làm điều này. Đó là một chi phí bổ sung (không bao gồm trong giá phòng) nhưng nó là giá trị nó. Không giống như những gì nhiều đánh giá khác ở đây nói (và trái với những gì các máy chủ sẽ cho bạn biết) không có lớp học nấu ăn. Bạn sẽ giúp cuộn một vài miếng chả giò và nướng một chút cà rốt cho món salad, nhưng đó là mức độ của nó. Tuy nhiên, nó đã được gọn gàng để được bên trong nhà bếp. Tôi chắc chắn khuyên bạn nên lấy một chiếc xe đạp và đi vòng quanh đảo. Có nhiều con đường và mạch điện và đó là điểm nhấn của kỳ nghỉ của chúng tôi. Máy chủ của bạn có thể cung cấp cho bạn một bản đồ và cho bạn biết nơi bạn có thể đi. Những gì chúng tôi đã không đặc biệt thích thú khi có một thành viên trong gia đình của chủ nhà dành gần ba giờ nói chuyện với chúng tôi sau bữa ăn tối. Cô là một người phụ nữ trẻ đáng yêu, người hy vọng sẽ có cơ hội nói chuyện với khách để cải thiện tiếng Anh của mình. Chúng tôi rất vui khi được yêu cầu trong một thời gian, vì đây là một doanh nghiệp gia đình và chúng tôi chỉ ngồi xung quanh. Tuy nhiên vào cuối giờ đầu tiên, chúng tôi khá mệt mỏi, và đến cuối giây, chúng tôi đã kiệt sức vì cố gắng duy trì một cuộc trò chuyện phong nha hàng giờ liền. Chúng tôi không biết làm thế nào để lịch sự giải thoát chính mình (chúng tôi không thể chính xác yêu cầu chúng tôi phải đi ngủ lúc 20:30), vì vậy nó cứ tiếp diễn. Một lần nữa, chúng tôi rất vui khi được giúp đỡ và trò chuyện một thời gian, và chúng tôi chắc chắn đã học được rất nhiều điều từ cô ấy, nhưng nó đã kéo dài quá lâu đến nỗi điều đó là không phù hợp và việc quản lý không nên cho phép điều đó.

Title: Xuất sắc!!

Chúng tôi có một căn phòng tuyệt vời, rất sạch sẽ và rộng rãi hơn nhiều so với những nhà trọ khác mà chúng tôi đã ở lại - một chiếc giường thích hợp với màn chống muỗi, một tủ nhỏ để cất đồ đạc, bàn ghế trên sân ngoài phòng của chúng tôi. Title: One of the best options
Review: The questions isn't if you should stay here, it's more if Vinh Long should be on your itinerary. While its undeniably a beautiful window into the Mekong Delta, I do wonder if exploring one of the islands is a better option. Anyway, this homestay is beautiful and serene. The rooms are spacious. I would recommend that you take the room with all three meals included since there are no good restaurants in the area and the chefs here are truly involved. The only drawback is that no room has attached toilets and the common toilets were not as clean as I'd have liked. This isn't meant to deter travellers, only a warning for the very particular ones out there.

Title: Nice athmosphere
Review: We stayed at the "homestay" for two nights and had a good experience. Title: Beautiful scenery, commercialized homestay
Review: Ba Linh's Homestay is a very beautiful and relaxing place. The rooms are very basic, but the beds are comfortable. Mosquito nets are available and needed. In the common area it is nice to hang out in the hammocks. The free bikes are definitly a plus to explore the lovely surroundings. However, the shared bathroom should have been cleaner for the price you pay for staying. Furthermore, the set diner menu (basically the only option you have nearby) is lovely, but quite expensive for backpackers who live more on a budget, (150 000 VD/p). Very nice accommadation, bit overpriced, and it doesn't qualifies as a real homestay anymore. Watch out for the following scams: 1. On arrival from the ferry from Vinh Long city, motorbike drivers will be waiting for you saying that they are from the Homestay and will bring you for free ('no money, no money'). When you arrive at the homestay, the owner will tell you, you have to pay for the motortaxi. We refused to pay since we had asked repeatedly if it was really free. After a minute or two, the motorbike drivers drove away and we were welcomed in the homestay anyway. 2. Local bus Vinh Long City to Can Tho (every half hour, duration +- 1.45h). According to the owner of the homestay the price is 50 000 VD/p. However in the busstation the price is clearly listed as 19 000 VD/p. Nevertheless, the driver will ask 50 000VD/p claiming this higher price is for your bags (making it 31 000 VD per bag). We refused to pay and we bargained to 60 000 VD for two persons and two bags.

Title: Wonderful traditional Mekong experience
Review: Convinced by Ba Linh's excellent rating on TripAdvisor, we decided to stay here for two days in between Saigon and Chau Doc. We couldn't have wished for for a better place to discover the Mekong Delta tradition. Our host and his family were incredibly hospitable and interested, sharing their family history and chatting away after dinner. We were proposed a boat tour to the floating market in Cai Be and through the little canals surrounding the island. We also learned how to cook Vietnamese with the whole family, which was a lot of fun. The sons came to pick us up at the ferry when we arrived and dropped us off again when we left. Title: Great stay!

Title: Authentic experience with an extremely friendly family
Review: My partner and I stayed at the Ba Linh homestay for three nights in October 2016. The host family is extremely welcoming, and after traveling in Vietnam for three weeks, it was probably our favorite place to stay! The setting is quite rural and peaceful, and it’s a nice place to relax. The homestay is situated across the river from Vinh Long, in the An Binh area. The hosts picked us up at the bus station, and transported us by motorbikes back to the homestay. They also gave a lift to the ferry when it was time to depart. The food was excellent. We were given simple, yummy breakfasts, and delicious feasts for dinner. My partner eats fish and seafood, but not other meats, and the hosts kindly adapted their meal offerings to accommodate her. They also offered us a cooking lesson each night, where we learned how to prepare different traditional dishes. The sleeping accommodations were comfortable, with a rustic feel. The homestay is equipped with a row of private guest rooms that share a common roof and porch. The roof does a perfect job of keeping water out, and there are openings in the walls and windows to let air flow in. We slept on a spacious double bed under mosquito nets and the room was cooled by an oscillating fan on the wall. During our visit, they were constructing a new building, which eventually will contain air conditioned rooms. It's a shame that this kind of luxury has been requested by other tourists, since to us, the whole point of a homestay is to experience the way locals live, and the accommodation we had was more than comfortable. The communal bathrooms are equipped with flush toilets and showers (with warm water). There is also a covered patio area for guests that have tables for eating, and hammocks that are perfect for reading and napping. The homestay lends the use of their bicycles for no charge. My partner and I took the bikes out on each of our two days there. It was tricky to navigate through the An Binh area, but it was fun to explore. But be aware that there are not very many cafes on the island, so lunch options were somewhat limited. It’s possible to arrange tours and such from the homestay, but the area is fairly un-touristy. So don’t go with an expectation of sightseeing all day. However, if you are open-minded and up for a little adventure, you will stumble upon some authentic experiences of life in the Mekong. I would recommend this homestay to anyone interested in seeing an un-touristy part of Mekong Delta, and who is looking for a rustic, authentic experience with an extremely friendly and helpful family.

Title: Excellent Homestay
Review: 2 nuits passé dans cette homestay (09 et 10 avril): Accueil sympa autour d'un thé et de sucreries locales avec les autres clients. Les chambres sont propres et simples (tout comme les sanitaires collectifs, séparées par des panneaux en bois... un peu bruyant la nuit mais on est à la campagne ! Suite à une après-midi des plus reposante dans les hamacs, notre hôte nous invite a un petit cours de cuisine ou nous préparons une soupe de couge et les Bò lá lốt, au menu du soir: -Soupe de couge -Bò lá lốt: beef wrapped in wild betel leaf, rouleau de feuille de bétel sauvage au boeuf -Poisson entier frit, que l'on roule dans des feuilles de riz -Tranche de porc, légumes et riz .... au cas ou vous ayez encore faim ;-) ! -Fruits en dessert Le tout arrosé d'alcool de riz ... bien évidemment !! Le lendemain matin, virée en bateau ou nous visiterons énormément de choses: le marché de Cai Be, un petit shop de miel, une fabrique de sucreries et d'alcool de riz, une "jardinerie", ainsi qu'une balade en barque dans les dédalles de petits canaux. Agréable, d'autant plus que les gens ne vous forcent pas la main pour acheter. A chaque visite: dégustation au programme, thé,sucreries, fruits et .... alcool de riz !! du coup les produits étant bon, on achète volontier !! Le second soir nous avons à nouveau cuisiner une salade de de mangue et des nems avec pour repas: -Soupe de mais/viande -Nems -Poisson entier vapeur et légumes -Tranche de porc et riz .... au cas ou vous ayez encore faim (bis) ;-) !! -Fruit et alcool de riz toujours présent pour agrémenter les repas !! En résumé, la famille qui nous a reçu est super sympa et serviable, notre hôte est toujours prêt a partager et a nous faire découvrir des choses ( le parc à crocodile est sympa),la nourriture est excellente et les prix sont plus que raisonnables, voir défiant toute concurrence: 350.000vnd par personne pour 1 nuit, diner et petit déjeuner inclu, et 150.000vnd pour la sortie bateau (les prix peuvent varier suivant le nombre de personnes). Petit bémol sur l'état des vélos, mais tout le reste compense. En comparaison à ce que nous avons vu sur Can Tho (voir avis sur Green Village Homestay).... c'est vraiment top !! Si vous n'avez que très peu de temps dans le delta du Mékong, ne perdez pas votre temps ailleurs !!

Title: Great place to experience the Mekong delta

Title: Homely delightful experience in the Mekong Delta
Review: What can I say... we booked a 3 nights stay at Mr. Truong´s homestay (officially known as Ba Linh homestay) guided by previous positive reviews of guests we had found on internet forums. I guess it is also posible that you can end up at this place as part of an organised Mekong Delta tour with some tour agency - we (my girlfriend and I) were lucky enough to book on our own and I believe we had the best posible experience about life in the Mekong Delta and a very kind and personal treatment from the whole family. Ba Linh homestay is located on An Binh island, a stretch of land in the southeastern part of the Mekong Delta. You would get easily to the nearest big city - Vinh Long - by one bus of the various companies that operate from Ho Chi Minh City. It is a roughly 3 hrs journey overall. From the city, you will need to cross to the island by ferry. Mr Truong had organised two members of his family to come and pick us up on their motorbikes at our arrival time, and they took us (and our bags) to the river ferry crossing to An Binh island, and from there to the house. They were extremely accommodating, since we arrived into the city at almost 10pm and they were very happy to wait for us, and prepare dinner after our arrival. From the very first moment, we felt very welcomed and they really made sure that our comfort and needs were fulfilled. The accommodation consists on a set of wooden rooms, with thatched roofs, located adjacent to the house. They are very spatious and comfortable. The windows are not glazed, just shaded by curtains inside, which means that you can feel almost like sleeping outdoors. It is a very pleasant experience, and especially considering the mosquito nets which protects us from those unwanted bites, and the fan which provide sufficient air movement to provide a comfortable sleep. The hightlights of the stay were undoubtedly the food, which was absolutely fantastic, with 5 or 6 course dinners of Vietnamese typical dishes, that we were also given the opportunity to learn to cook with them (the spring rolls on the ultra-light rice paper were the best I have ever tried!). The homestay also has bicycles available to take and explore the island, were you will observe and experience the traditional daily life and images, from fruit tres plantations, poultry farming, fishing, local cafes and markets, children coming in and out of schools - and we were always confronted by smiley people who would greet us everywhere we went to. The homestay also offers the possibility of booking a boat trip to visit the nearby floating market, factories of coconut Candy, rice wine, puffed rice, fruit gardens... really for a couple of days, we could not ask for more things to do! If you are coming from Ho Chi Minh City, I am almost sure you would love the quiet rural life that you would be able to experience here. The communication with the family members was easy, since they would all speak English to a certain degree and are used to interact with foreigners. They were never too intrusive and we always felt that we could have space and time for us everytime we wanted to sit on the tables, hammocks, or wander around the grounds and the garden. At the same time, you may appreciate you should also be respectful with them and let them carry on with their normal lives... but they would never be too hassle to help and dedicate time to you for anyof your needs. Mr Truong helped us out with booking our return tickets on the pone (my Vietnamese knowledge does not go farther beyond ´please´and ´thank you´), and of course they were ready to take us back to the city by motorbike to catch the bus at the time we needed to be. There are also some Buddhist and Cao Dai temples in the island that you can visit. If you have a passion for it, you can also do some stargazing (coming from London, it always amazes us being able to see so many stars in the sky), searching for fireflies at night, or visiting the nearby crocodile farm (you can freely come in and out, since they are kept well secured in a concrete walled pool compound). We will always remember this stay as one of the highlights of our Vietnam trip, and perhaps something we would like to repeat at another time in our lives.

Title: Great place to relax

Ours broke down, but the owner brought another one and we could continue our trip. This is a nice service! Title: A fun experience in a beautiful location
Review: We visited this homestay as part of a cycling tour of the Mekong Delta. It was a lovely way to see this region and we were really happy with the quality of accommodation. This place is run by two brothers and their families. It's mostly in one big old house that's divided into different sections, with a number of little buildings around it. The house has a lot of memorabilia from the war on display. Beautiful spot, accessible by boat and with lots of fruit trees around. The room was a pleasant surprise - private room with double bed (we did see four-bed rooms there too though). Looked beautiful, with dark wooden walls, high ceilings and a mosquito net over the bed. No A/C but fan is provided. Toothbrush/tooth paste and soap provided (in the cupboard). Bathrooms are in a separate building, domitory style. They provide all your meals and you can go into the kitchen and sit down with the family to help make the food. It's good fun. Food was perfectly good quailty, set menu style meals. Drinks cost extra, as with everywhere in Vietnam but they had a good selection of beers and non alcoholic drinks. While there was another family there, we were set up at a separate table in a pagoda on the other side of the house. I don't know if it was set up that by the request of our guide or the other family but we thought it might have been nice to eat with the others, instead of totally alone but maybe you can request that. One of the women makes these adorable figures out of cucumber which sit on each plate of food at dinner. A fisherman was on the plate of whole fish with the end of his fishing line attached to the mouth, a figure carrying baskets of rice was on the rice plate, and a man in a row boat was with the spring rolls. A fun and personal touch. They were so cute! For breaksfast, you get a mixed spread - some fruit, some cooked things, bread and spreads, and local coffee. The family who run the place have varying English levels so we muddled through but it was worth getting an explanation for how to make the coffee. We found this a great way to eat local food (they ate the same as us), see it being cooked, meet some local people (we even met the grandparents) and experience something kind of authentic in a slightly rustic but very comfortable setting. A break from the usual tourist trap in many popular spots in Vietnam.

Hãy nhớ rằng chúng tôi đã trả bao nhiêu tiền để ở lại đây và quyền truy cập vào một hồ bơi, tôi phải cho 5 sao, nhưng đó không phải là The Ritz! Chỗ ở là cơ bản thực sự nhưng đầy đủ hơn. Chúng tôi đề nghị ROOM 15 với giường cỡ queen và giường đơn. Chúng tôi đã không sử dụng màn chống muỗi. Điều hòa không khí tuyệt vời cộng với chúng tôi có một cái quạt. Chúng tôi đã có một số ánh sáng tự nhiên và một cái cũi! Thật thuận tiện để treo quần áo của chúng tôi và sạc thiết bị của chúng tôi trên! Đừng lo lắng về những tấm nệm mỏng. De kamers zijn wel echt een stuk minder (klein en muf) en de gezamenlijke badkamer/toilet is niet altijd even schoon. Die twee dingen staan zover van elkaar af dat echt vanaf hangt waar je naar op zoek bent hoe je het kunt beoordelen. Alleen om te slapen is het onvoldoende, als verblijfplek prima. Alhoewel voor de booking.com prijs hadden we het echt bekocht gevoeld.

Title: Vị trí, vị trí, vị trí
Review: Chỗ nghỉ nhà dân này nhìn ra sông Mekong và đó là điều tuyệt vời về nó. Bạn ăn các bữa ăn từ boong tàu nhìn xuống sông; bạn thấy dòng sông trong tất cả tâm trạng của nó - và lưu lượng sông là thôi miên. Gia đình hạnh phúc là nơi để làm chậm & đánh giá cao cuộc sống ở đồng bằng sông Cửu Long. Bạn có thể thực hiện các chuyến đi trên sông và kênh đào trên thuyền của chủ sở hữu, đi bộ hoặc đi xe vòng quanh các ngôi làng gần đó hoặc chỉ laze xung quanh và hít thở trong không khí. Các hồ bơi nhỏ trông tuyệt vời (tôi đã không sử dụng nó) và có những chiếc ghế & võng dễ dàng để thư giãn. Về cơ bản, bạn bị hạn chế ăn tại nhà nghỉ này vì gần đó không có nhà hàng nào; đó là không có vấn đề bởi vì trình đơn đa dạng và giá cả hợp lý. Tôi tìm thấy căn phòng của chúng tôi một chút cơ bản: quạt trần chỉ vừa đủ khi nhiệt độ mùa mưa mát hơn. Các phòng có thể làm với tarting lên, trên thực tế toàn bộ nơi cần một chút cập nhật. Một người đàn ông nói tiếng Anh trẻ tuổi tên là Jow (đó là cách nó được phát âm như thế nào) rất hữu ích trong tất cả mọi thứ chúng tôi đã làm; Gia đình hạnh phúc sẽ ít vui hơn nhiều nếu không có ý kiến ​​của anh. Nơi này là quá khó để tìm thấy trên của riêng bạn. Khi bạn đến Vĩnh Long gọi điện thoại cho nhà khách để được giúp đưa phà đến đảo và vận chuyển đến homestay. Tôi thực sự khuyên bạn nên gia đình hạnh phúc cho những người muốn nhìn thấy cuộc sống ở vùng đồng bằng. Bạn chắc chắn sẽ thấy tại sao khu vực này bị đe dọa nghiêm trọng bởi sự nóng lên toàn cầu.

Title: Mekong Delta

Title: Fantastic place right on the river
Review: Our group of 7 people stayed here for two nights. It's a little difficult to get to, we organized a bus from ho chi minh through the owners of the guest house which cost 100,000 vnd. You actually have to get bus, then a mini van (free) and finally a motorbike taxi (25,000). Once you arrive it is definitely worth the trip and feels a lot like an adventure. The guest house itself is very beautiful, has a nice swimming pool, small gym, pool table and the restaurant on the Mekong river has got to be seen. The rooms are all very clean, no air conditioning just fans. Bathrooms for standard double rooms are shared but close by. Staff were very friendly and they do their own half day and full day boat tour of the Mekong including floating market, rice paper factory and small boat tour through the wilderness for a very reasonable 200,000 vnd. I only have one issue with this place and that is the restaurant service. There is only 1 waiter and on the 1st day of our arrival we waited nearly 3 hours for our food. Fair enough they say in the menu to order at least 40 minutes in advance but the following days even when ordering in advance we waited over an hour and some people had finished their meal by the time others had even got theirs. I don't think they are set up to accommodate large amounts of people in the restaurant. It's a shame because everything else about the place is excellent. Special thanks to the young man working there, he seemed to never stop working in the restaurant and he also is the tour guide everyday. He seems to work from 6am to 11pm every day. He was every helpful and very patient with all the guests.

Title: L'indulgence a ses limites

Mais le plus fâcheux reste l'essence. Partout, et c'est de bonne guerre, on nous donne des motos vides. Comme beaucoup nous faisons en sorte de mettre l'essence dont a besoin pour la journée. Sauf qu'ici, ils exigent le plein !!! Nous comprenons que les touristes sont une aubaine et nous fermons souvent les yeux sur ces petits excès quand ils sont compensées par un bon service, mais ici nous avons vraiment eu le sentiment d'être pris pour des pigeons pour ne pas dire autre chose !!!

Title: Idealic Guesthouse that is truely Happy Family!
Review: Thuy An, Trong and the rest of the family made our stay unforgetable. The guesthouse is located on a remote part of an island close to Ving Long, along the Mekong Delta. Rooms are basic (and clean!), but that is really all you need (a place to sleep). Do as the locals do and spend your time outdoors. The pool is great to cool off in, but when the tide is in, make sure you have a swim in the river! This really is a happy family guesthouse. We were invited to spend time with the family and they were always ready to help us with anything we needed. The location is gorgeous, though keep in mind that it's remote. They will assist in any way possible and arrange pick up from the ferry or the busstop. Just give the phone number to any Vietnamese local and they will be more than happy to help you out. In response to earlier reviews; Yes, food takes a while. This is because everything is made to your order. It doesn't get any fresher than that! Tip: order in advance and let them know what time you wish to eat. Thuy An, Trong, Jarmo and the rest of the family, thank you for an awesome stay!! Mot, Hai, Ba....Yo!!

Title: Great place to stay!
Review: I visited Happy Family in January and it was a highlight of my Vietnam trip. The scenery was lovely, the rooms were clean and inexpensive, and I really felt welcomed by Thuyen and family. We did have a hard time getting there, but aside from that everything was wonderful! We enjoyed relaxing on the patio by the Mekong, we even went swimming in the Mekong from the riverfront cabin, and we loved all the fresh fruit with every meal. Meals were delicious; Thuyen's brother is a great cook and excellent market guide. If you want to experience the slow pace of Mekong life, connect with very friendly people, and see what makes Vietnam so special I would definitely recommend Happy Family.

Title: Clean, cheap and welcoming!
Review: Cheap, clean and welcoming stay - Tong (homestay brother) spoke very good English. He organized a morning tour to Mekong floating markets, land markets, coconut candy factory and honey factory for 300, 000 dong pp. Food was delicious - Happy family pancake highly recommended. Great location - dinner area and hammocks on decking overlooking the Mekong Delta The only downside to our stay was the trouble of getting there; we caught a local bus to Dong Phu (bus driver didn't want to drive all the way to dong phu so we were told to get off the bus and get on his mates motorbike to dong phu bus station). This became quite confusing as nobody spoke English so it was hard to communicate where we were going/staying even though we showed them the address. Not many tourists around the area. Would be easier if you have a mobile phone to call the guest house when you arrive in Dong Phu and they will organize transport from the bus station

Title: Relaxing stay by  the Mekong
Review: We stayed here as a family of four in July. This is a cheap travelling option. The garden and surrounding area is really lovely full of well tended trees and flowers with plenty of space for children to explore. The dining area looks out over the river which is busy and entertaining and offers an incredible view of the sunset. The family and staff are great and will help you even though there is not much English. The pool is the real draw here especially travelling with children. There is also a pool table and plenty of places in the garden to relax. The rooms are very basic though . We had air conditioning although it did not work well, they gave us another fan which improved things slightly. We shared bathrooms with other guests which was fine but there was old shampoo bottles and wrappers which could have been removed. The bicycles are well maintained and we did a loop trip around the small roads/paths near the guesthouse which was good fun and sheltered from the sun by trees. The food is very good but not much choice if you are staying for three days. We had found it difficult to get to the guesthouse although they were very helpful explaining routes etc. We took the ferry from Vinh Long which is a scenic way to arrive although a distance from the guesthouse but it is possible to get there by car (not evident on google maps) so if you need this option get in touch with the guest house.

Title: Incredible View of the Mekong
Review: A cheap and cheerful place to stay; the rooms are very basic, nothing more than a bed, a drawer and a fan (no A/C). Showers were basic (cold water only) and shared but did the job. Pool was nice to cool down in, and there were tons of hammocks around to laze in which was nice. The big highlight for me was the view; breathtaking sunsets over the Mekong. Food was of a really good standard although limited choice. We did the boat trip to the floating markets; if you're not going to any others whilst you're in Vietnam then I'd recommend it, but if you going near the Can Be market then I'd probably pass on this one. The staff were very helpful, and even phoned to make sure we made it onto the bus safely which was a nice touch. WiFi was poor for anything more than basic googling.

Title: Peaceful getaway, amazing food and great value for money
Review: A last minute trip, we didnt know what to expect. We booked the day before and as we were riding motorbikes from HCMC we needed directions and they were more than happy to meet us in Vinh Long and escort us to the Guesthouse location. Such a peaceful getaway on An Binh island - far enough from the hustle and bustle but close enough that its only a 15 min boat ride to the floating markets. We were the only guests in the hotel and treated like family. AMAZING food, some of the best I've had in Vietnam (And I've been living here almost two years), great service from Tong, Thuyan and the entire family. Lovely surroundings, rooms and shared bathrooms are SUPER clean, although the a/c could work a little better and TV to have more stations (but we weren't too bothered by it). Beds comfortable, could be softer but for the price, can't be beat. Bring mosquito repellant.They have their own boat so you don't have to go on the big touristy ones. All needs catered for in terms of food, drinks, tours, massages etc. They farm their own fish in the guesthouse pond - HIGHLY recommend the snapper and elephant fish. Spring rolls to die for. Chicken curry also good. The free breakfasts are simple but satisfying (choose the Hu Tieu, its really good). The best part: THE POOL! Not many places on the river can boast a pool and this was a welcome relief from the humid days. I think we spent half our time in there, drinking beers and eating ice cream. If you are a party person, this place isn't for you. There are no shops or bars close by. But if you want a peaceful getaway, a bit of R&R this is perfect. Would definitely come again. Thanks to Tong and the family for a great stay!!

Title: A good immersion in Vietnam life
Review: Only Toan speaks English when the daughter of the owner is Overseas (she is married with a Fin and only sped 6 months of the year there). The parents are friendly but sign language is the main way of coomunication. They have motorbikes and boats and will take you around to floating markets as required. Toan is caring and will organise stuff for you, he is very resourceful and has good contacts. Use him to organise a return to Saigon for example as he can get a bus to pick you from the village all the way to your hotel saving you the trip to Vin Long. The room have no windows, beds are hard and the A/C struggles a bit but the bamboo restaurant on stilts on the Mekong is a treat.

Title: Nice surroundings far away from evrything
Review: The Guesthouse is located in a very remote area. You take the ferry from Vinh Long to the An Binh Island, then a motor bike taxi about 10 km to the north west corner of the island. The setting right by the river is wonderful, sitting in the open air restaurant right on the water surrounded by the rural landscape with banana, coconut, papaya and mango groves. There is nowhere else to eat, so we felt a bit disappointed with the short menu. Not much to choose from. And even less so as they did not even serve all that was on the list. Probably we were too few guests. The place felt a bit deserted. The food was OK - sometimes great, sometimes just ordinary. Breakfast is not included. There are bikes for rent. A bit too small for a European, but ok. Great fun to go bike riding through the small villages along the canals. The surroundings are great! The rooms and the shared bathrooms are very basic. The pool small, but clean and cool. On the boat tour we ended up at an ordinary market, which was very nice, but never got to see the floating market they told us we were going to. We also stopped at a very touristy place to see the making of honey tea, rice and coconut products. Interesting in a way, but the mission obviously was to sell us stuff we did not want. Rather would have had more time at the ordinary market. All in all a nice place, but I would rather choose a place a little closer to the ferry and a village.

Title: Happy Family Guesthouse saved our lives
Review: Happy Family Guesthouse saved our lives. Sounds dramatic, but who knows it could actually be true. On a recent trip from Cambodia to Vietnam, the Samco bus dropped us off in the dark way outside of the city because they suddenly decided the bus didn’t go into the city even though the ticket said it did. Even though we were hours late on arriving at the wrong destination, Happy Family Guesthouse was there. I don’t think they actually saved us, but it felt like it. Think about it: in a strange country, don’t speak the language, in the dark, surrounded by strange eyes, and no phone. Thankfully Happy Family scooped us up, bought us a refreshing drink, and drove us to one of the most beautiful spots in our recent travels. Imagine sitting on a deck beside the Mekong River in the moonlight, watching the boats slide by, relaxing, surrounded by a swimming pool and beautiful gardens and attentive service. Fantastic. One night they even invited us to share a family dinner along with 5star vietnamese homebrew. Fantastic. Thuyan spoke excellent English, her Finnish husband spoke excellent English, as an ex fisherman their father the boat driver knew the river intimately, their aunt was a fantastic cook, their cousin had a wonderful smile and was an attentive guide. Their little girl was beautiful. When we finally left, Thuyan arranged for the bus ticket, drove us to the pick up spot, and made certain we boarded safely. Even though they made no profit on any of this last part. I give Happy Family Guesthouse 4 and a half stars without question.

Title: Perfect for teens
Review: I read in other reviews that the rooms are basic, and I had to think about that. I kind of agree and kind of don’t. We had two rooms - one with a (Australian/NZ) King bed on the river front, and one with a seperate bedroom (with King) and two double (or maybe king singles) in the living space - this was set back a little and had a pond in front of it. The bigger cabin was definitely more well decked out and less basic. The bathroom in that was something special (open air roof, huge, cool tiles). It also had better locks in the doors (not that I think you’d need the locks at all as it’s a family owned business and very quiet). But the construction of all of them is charming, simple local construction. Each room has free tea, coffee out in the porch along with chairs and hammocks. They offer several day tours - the bike tour of local farms is well worth it and kept the teens all interested. The food was great and the owners took great pride in the beautiful local produce and cooking. The younger teens asked for and were given traditional fishing rods and spent several stints catching (and releasing) fish in the pond. We loved this venue and would highly recommend it. We only spent a night here but you could easily spend two. Photo is of the more simple bathroom.

Cuối buổi chiều, chúng tôi đã thực hiện một chuyến đi vạn đò nhàn nhã qua các nước ngược. Sáng hôm sau, chúng tôi thực hiện một chuyến đi trên sông xuống sông (hoặc là lên sông? Khó có thể nói vì đồng bằng là thủy triều và bạn sẽ thấy dòng sông chảy theo cả hai hướng). Chúng tôi ghé thăm địa phương để tiếp thị và sau đó dừng lại ở nhà máy Dừa trên đường trở về. Hoàn toàn hấp dẫn! Tôi phải thừa nhận là một chút hoài nghi khi nói về giải trí của cuộc sống làng quê tại các điểm du lịch phương Tây và nó thực sự trở về nhà với tôi rằng đây không phải là giải trí. Đây là những người bình thường đi về công việc kinh doanh bình thường của họ và không chú ý đến người xem. Sau thời gian ăn trưa và thư giãn, chúng tôi đi xe đạp để đi dọc theo các con đường nông thôn và dừng lại ở một trang trại ếch và để xem cơm pop (nghĩ rằng bỏng ngô chỉ với gạo) trong quá trình làm. Tất cả dân làng rất thân thiện và chào đón. Chúng tôi đã có một thời gian tuyệt vời và tất cả đều khiến chúng tôi cảm thấy như một trong những gia đình. Rất khuyến khích và đây là một trong những điểm cao trong chuyến đi của chúng tôi đến một đất nước tuyệt vời.

Title: Mekong paradise!
Review: This Lodge is nestled into the side of the Mekong and feels as though it's far from civilisation. There are in fact lots of people and industries in the area that need the Mekong. A leisurely bike ride through the rice fields was so beautiful with all the lush green colours. Also a visit to the local market was interesting. The whole place is kept spotless by the wonderful staff. Do yourself a favour and stay here for something a little different that feels very authentic. Unfortunately we only had one day here, two would have been better. Oh and all the food is home cooked by the staff so it's really healthy and yummy!

Title: Emplacement dingue mais rapport qualité prix pas terrible
Review: Le gros gros plus du Coco riverside c'est clairement son emplacement : dans une très belle partie du Mekong, loin des hordes de touristes,super pour circuler à vélo pendant des heures et leur terrasse sur le Mekong est dingue ! Également le prêt gratuit de vélos en excellent état. En revanche on a passé 3 semaines dans le Mekong et clairement le rapport qualité prix au Coco riverside est le moins bon (comparaison faite avec ce même type d'hébergements c'est à dire isolé, petit bungallows. ...). Les bungalows sont sympas mais pour 70$/nuit on s'attend à qqchose d'un peu plus travaillé (en revanche tout est propre là dessus rien à dire) et surtout la salle de bain est vraiment très décevante c'est du bricolage sans charme. Ensuite les repas sont facturés 12$/personne et ce n'est pas à la hauteur. La norme dans le Mekong pour ce type d'hébergement c'est 200 000vn/personne donc là on est bien au-dessus malheureusement la nourriture servie ne justifie pas la différence : c'est très simple et pas particulièrement mémorable ( la 1/2 tranches d'ananas/personne en dessert alors qu'on est dans le mekong !!!). Les PDJ sont ok mais pas les meilleurs non plus c'est du basique. Le soucis c'est qu'il est servi devant les bungalows : si c'était sur notre terrasse ok mais là on mange devant les bungalows des uns des autres du coup le matin on devait fermer nos rideaux pour est tranquilles parce qu'on avait des personnes en train de manger devant le bungallow. ... dommage. Il semblerait que l'hébergement ait pas mal augmenté ses prix cette année par rapport aux Infos trouvées sur les blogs/forums mais il faut dans ce cas augmenter la qualité : on n'a pas les mêmes attentes quand on paie autour de 50$ et quand on paie 70$!

Title: Sentimientos encontrados
Review: Estuvimos una noche en este homestay y la verdad que tenemos sentimientos encontrados respecto al lugar...la instalación esta muy bien y las vistas de las habitaciones son muy buenas (a uno de los brazos del río Mekong). Además la comida está muy buena, el servicio del desayuno genial!. Pero por otro lado, todavía le falta un punto de desarrollo y mejora. Nos lo vendieron como una experiencia para conocer la desembocadura, y en realidad conoces el entorno de la casa (paisaje bonito) pero con actividades no elaboradas, la única buena el paseo en bici. Te venden poner trampas para pescar y ver a pescadores locales, cuando en realidad, solo pasan barcos cargueros de cocos por el río, nada de pescadores locales. Y lo de colocar la trampa tu mismo para pescar, te la dan para que te busques tu la vida, ni te ayudan ni te dicen dónde ponerla...decepcionante. El espectáculo de la cena, es pasar a casa del vecino que estuvo en la guerra (con las consiguientes heridas visibles) y canta tocando una guitarra canciones... Bastante cuestionable denominarlo espectáculo. La excursión del arroz inflado, te llevan a casa de otro vecino, que pone arroz en un aparato a presión y lo hace explotar...de cuestionable seguridad y salubridad...Son sentimientos encontrados, porque es la vida real de allí, y el dueño seguro que intenta ayudar a su vecindario, pero...es una experiencia un tanto deficiente para alguien occidental. Como punto a mejorar de la habitación, que pongan techo cerrado en el baño también, la habitación está "aislada"por el techo pero el baño no y puede entrar cualquier animal del entorno. Y que los dueños no entren a la habitación a cualquier hora para apagar el aire, o a andar por tu galería... Creo que es un gran proyecto pero con falta de punto de vista occidental y rodaje.

Title: Oase in de Mekong Delta
Review: Deze lodge is een echte oase in de Mekong delta! Vijf traditionele huisjes gelegen in een prachtige tropische tuin, die uitkijken over de rivier. Vanaf je veranda met luie stoelen en hangmat kijk je naar de een na de andere boot, volgeladen met kokosnoten die voorbij komt. Vanuit de lodge kun je de omgeving verkennen op de gratis fietsen, maar er worden ook tourtjes georganiseerd per fiets of boot. Zo kun je de locale markt bezoeken of de kokosfabriek, waar je het hele proces van de kokosnoten kunt zien (kokosmatten). De tours zijn vooral leuk omdat je dicht bij de mensen komt, in ons geval zelfs bij ze thuis! Het eten bij Coco is uitstekend, prijzen liggen uiteraard wat hoger dan je in vietnam gewend bent ($12 pp voor diner), maar wij vonden het redelijk gezien de kwaliteit. Als ik een nadeel zou moeten noemen is het de bereikbaarheid: 3,5u rijden vanaf HCM airport. Coco biedt een transfer per luxe auto, maar dat is door de afstand behoorlijk prijzig. Een andere manier om er te komen is er niet. Voordeel daarvan is weer wel dat wij hier geen enkele andere tourist gezien hebben en je hier daardoor het échte Vietnam kunt ervaren.

Title: Schöne Lodge-leider mit schlechter Erfahrung
Review: Wir haben zusammen mit unseren beiden 20 jährigen Söhnen 3 Übernachtungen im August 2017 in der Lodge gebucht. Leider sind wir sicher, dass uns dort während des Aufenthaltes 50 Dollar gestohlen wurden. Wir haben durch Zufall am Tag zuvor das Geld gezählt, weil wir einen Teil der Kosten dort mit Dollar bezahlen wollten. Es kann nicht von der Wasserseite passiert sein, da wir den Bungalow immer abgeschlossen haben, wenn wir den Rucksack mit den Dollars und Reisepässen im Zimmer haben stehen lassen. Die anderen Wertsachen hatten wir immer am Mann. Das hat unseren Urlaub dort dann doch leider getrübt, und wir waren bei der Bezahlung ausgesprochen überrascht, als die 50 Dollar Note fehlte. Die Coco Riverside Lodge ist trotzdem ein Juwel im Mekong Delta. Die tolle Seite der Lodge haben die anderen Gäste bereits treffend beschrieben. Wir würden lediglich dort empfehlen, auf Wertsachen gut aufzupassen.

Title: A great option for those wanting to see the Mekong
Review: Trung, the manager and host, is unbelievably friendly and knowledgable. You get the sense that everyone in the village knows and likes him, because everyone in the village seems excited to be introduced to you. The rest of his staff is equally attentive. The four bungalows are glamping at its best, sitting in a virtual garden cultivated by Trung himself. Orchirds, fruit trees, and ponds of fish abound. The meals were some of the best I had on my whole trip. The activities planned (biking and visiting in the village) feel authentic. Nothing feels overly set-up, or that anyone is putting on a show. It felt genuine and surprisingly friendly. By the the end of the first night we were drinking with the staff, Trung doing his best to translate jokes. ... And relaxing next to the bank of the river, watching the boats loaded with coconuts motor up and down was one of the highlights of our whole trip to Vietnam. I highly recommend staying here for your Mekong River experience, and wish I had spend more time there myself. (FYI the delta is about 3.5 hour drive from HCMC. Many people will promise day trips. 7 hours on the road, 3 hours at your destination. Your best bet is booking at a lodge, like this one, and arranging transport to the Delta through them.)

Nous avons fait un tour de vélo organisé par l'hotel (10 € les 2 heures), balade dans le Mekong, arrêt chez l'habitant, et belles photos,....Mais il faut savoir avant de partir ce que l'on souhaite faire dans le Mekong. Si tout est super, cet hotel est vraiment au milieu de nul part. Pour arriver d'Ho Chi Min Ville il faut compter 4 h de taxi (115 €). Autour de l'hotel il n'y a rien. Alors certes les déjeuners et diners sont succulents mais il n'est pas possible d'aller manger ailleurs car il n'y a rien autour. Pour faire une excursion il faut absolument passer par l'hotel (pour les marchés flottants à environ 1h30 + tour en bateau pour 54 €). Je recommande cet hotel, mais il faut savoir qu'il est très loin de tout, que cela revient cher d'y arriver et d'y partir, et l'on dépend de l'hotel pour les excursions

Title: Wonderful time but needs some tweaking
Review: The coco riverside lodge is an idyllic small family run home stay in a paradisaical setting. The sitting room in the front was never used as it is open to the elements, has no A/C, hard wooded seating area (charming to look at but not to sit in) and susceptible to bugs. Bedroom was amply air conditioned (after AC in our first room broke after inhaling and de- tailing a salamander!). Mosquito netting was carefully placed around the bed in the evening. No real housekeeping during our stay. Shower only had cold water. Wifi only worked in restaurant until they lent us the wifi connector on our second night when we were the only guests. Outdoor riverside patios are great and relaxing with nice chairs and coffee set up. They should add more hammocks! Roosters will awaken you before 5 am if you don't bring ear plugs. Activities are great with highlights being the local school visit, pop rice making, cooking demonstration, and more. Beware of biking as the bridges are narrow and contain no guardrails. Bikes are mountain bikes without mountain bike tires which make them totally inappropriate for the off road rock laden trails. I flew over the bridge into the canal 10 feet below and suffered scratches and bruises (mostly to my ego)., and also lost my brand new digital camera. Food is incredible and ample except for breakfasts which were fine but not up to the other meals. Owners are so sweet and caring but not really able to communicate with you except for smiles! Grounds and setting are like your own Garden of Eden.

Title: Perfect Paradise
Review: We stayed at the Coco riverside lodge for 2 nights and I can't praise this place enough! As backpackers this place was a little over our regular budget but it is not expensive at all especially for the experience you walk away with. The lodge is located just outside of Vung Liem and to get there the manager Hugh will email you with advice how to get there. The lodge grounds are in the middle of a local countryside community with no western faces or tourism in sight. There are a few local shacks selling drinks, snacks and smokes but if you want anything else you will have to cycle to the main road which can take over 30 mins. To us this was paradise. There are 4 lodges on the grounds and for our first night we were the only guests there. The lodges are large, comfortable and have a rustic feel to them but at the same time providing luxury. The main living space is sealed, there is a large bed, chairs, tables and other decor to make the room feel homely. The room also comes with A/C too. There bathroom is a good size and is covered but has an outdoor feel to it as it is not a sealed room. The bathroom was spotless and they provided a hairdryer and bathroom products. As you walk in the lodge there is a welcome seating area which is decorated lovely. This space holds a wardrobe and a fridge also. At the rear of the property is the river view which is amazing. Double doors from the main living space open up to a patio area which has a table with full tea/coffee making equipment, table and chairs as well as two deck style chairs to relax. The whole lodge is decorated using top quality furniture and all looks and feels brand new. Around the lodges there is a lovely garden at the front with the rear providing a peaceful riverside view. A hammock is providing also so you can watch the locals go by on there boats. Please note this is a river used by locals. The river is not busy, but there will be slight noise from the odd boat that passes. This did not bother us at all as it was nice to see the local people going about there daily life. There are no TVs or WIFI provided. You really are taken to tranquil paradise. The staff at Coco riverside are lovely and welcoming. During your stay you will be looked after by Queen. Although she speaks very little English you will manage to communicate enough to sort meals. Whilst staying at the lodges Hugh who speaks excellent English will call you on the phone and you will be able to arrange any tours or discuss anything you need during your stay. He will then advise Queen or any other members of his family (all the staff are Hugh's family). Hugh is a gentleman and is there for your every need. Although we never met Hugh, as he is not based at the lodge you feel as though he is a good friend who wants to do everything to make your stay the best it can be. It's also great that it is his family who look after you as it gives you that home stay feel. Queen and the woman in the family prepare and cook your food, his uncle is your tour guide and the local community are their friends who make you feel just as welcome as Hugh and his family. The food is delicious, fresh and plenty for just the two of us. We took part in a number of activities during our stay including, a sunset bike tour, watching poprice being made by locals whilst getting to sample and take away some of the produce. We took a boat trip down the streams to get to the poprice factory. We visited the local temple twice which was a great experience both times. Everyone at the temple made us feel so welcome and on our second visit we was invited to eat at the temple with some locals. We also got to visit the local school and interact with their oldest students who were 11 years old. We visited during their English lesson and was able to talk to the children and ask their teacher some questions. Visiting the school has been the best experience during our travel so far. To get around Hugh's uncle will show you the way. Again he speaks hardly any English except the basic hello and a few other words but as always you are able to communicate enough to feel comfortable and make sense of what's going on. We also used the lodges bikes to have a cycle around ourselves too. When you step foot out of the lodge grounds you are made to feel welcome by all the locals. You will get a lot of hello's shouted and sometimes a few children will cycle along side you to get a closer look. It is a obvious reminder that the people in this area are not used to tourism at all and a western face is still a new thing to them. I feel privileged to have been to such a untouched, local community which hasn't been turned into a tourism trap. I hope for the future it gets to stay this way. I can't express how much I loved this place and getting away from the hustle and bustle of Vietnam. Thank you to Hugh, Queen, Hugh's family and the local community for making our stay so special. I hope one day we can return.

Title: The real deal experience of vietnam
Review: There are a few ways to book this lodge, we booked through booking.com, but most visitors book a trip from saigon with a guide who comes with them. The latter is the easy option, the former is the one for those with a sense of adventure! It's not easy to get to....it is miles from anywhere..we were coming from the fabulous mango home stay in Ben tre, and had to get a private car ($60). However, it was SO worth the effort! The car dropped us at the roadside where we were met by the lovely lady, Queen, who led us down a beautiful lane to the lodges. There are 4 lovely bungalows, right on the river, with wrap around verandas. Beautiful! Luckily there was a guide there with 2 ladies, so he was able to tell us how things work, as no one speaks a word of English! Once the guide had left, we were on our own! Food is served in another building, fabulous lunch ($10) and dinner ($14), different each day, real home cooking. We went for a wander on the first afternoon and were immediately blown away by the hospitality of the villagers, there are so few places in the world where you are constantly waved at, invited for coconut, or invited to join a party, and for no other reason than to show you their home and speak a little English. We went for a long cycle one day, around the paddy fields and through tiny lanes. Everyone spoke to us, we felt so safe. We came home with coconuts and bananas! We were taken to a house by the home stay hosts, to see how they make pop rice, a little like pop corn but using rice, it was wonderful to go inside genuine homes, and we went for a sing song evening with some locals. The only thing that would have been helpful would be to have some info in the rooms about what you can do, we had a couple of phone calls with the owner who lives in hcmc to help us communicate. We LOVED this lodge, you won't see another westerner unless anyone else is staying, this is a unique part of vietnam. They will take you to a school normally, but it had finished for tet. I sat in the hammock one afternoon for a couple of hours watching the boats and taking great photos!

Title: Excellent Way to Experience the Mekong Delta
Review: The Coco Riverside Lodge is located in a tiny village in the Vung Liem district of the Mekong Delta. You can only reach it by riverboat or jungle path, so there's no street address. Unlike widely advertised homestays, the Coco Riverside Lodge offers clean and comfortable rooms but with a genuine Mekong Delta experience. In the three days we stayed, we didn't see a single Westerner. The rooms all front up against a wide, but relatively quiet river, with occasional coconut barges and fishing sampans gliding by. Sitting in the deck chairs looking out onto the beautiful river, you feel like you're in a movie or something. Just spectacular. The owner's mother cooks and the food is, simply put, incredible. We used to think Vietnamese food was mostly Pho and stuff like that. It's so much more: elephant ear fish, grilled pork on lemongrass skewers; stuffed pumpkin leaves, and then a whole bunch of dishes that I can't remember the names. The ingredients were all local (and organic of course) -- from the gardens and fields nearby, or the river. This was some of the best food I've eaten in my entire life. Our children got to participate in all kinds of activities run by the lodge -- learning how to make roofing with coconut fronds, making puffed rice cakes, climbing to pick coconuts, riding the lodge's bicycle boat. We also choose the option of visiting a local school, which was loads of fun. The Coco Riverside lodge was a once in a lifetime experience, that I'm just hoping I can make a "twice in a lifetime" experience for my family.

Title: I Traveled For A Year And This Was One Of My Favorite Experiences
Review: I stayed at My Hoa Mekong Homestay in March of 2013 (sorry for the delay writing my review!) and it was absolutely one of the best experiences I had while traveling. The whole story of this homestay is pretty funny, so bear with me: I booked this homestay while staying at a guest house in Can Tho. I presumed that the homestay was in Vinh Long, so I hopped on a bus to Vinh Long with no thought as to how I would find the homestay from there. Five minutes outside Vinh Long, I realized the homestay was located in Can Tho where I had just been. You can imagine the confusion of the locals nearby when I tried to signal with hand motions and maps that I needed to go right back from where I came. I almost cancelled my stay, but Tuan (the English-speaker of the family) talked me into backtracking far enough to a place where he could come get me on his motorbike. And boy am I glad I did. The homestay is located in the middle of little streams that make up the Mekong Delta. The paths along these streams are at most 3 feet wide, but motorbikes and bicycles zoom through them and pass each other like it's no big deal. When I arrived, I was surprised to find that I was the only guest that night, but Tuan introduced me to three neighborhood kids who kept me plenty amused. They lavished me with attention, led me on a bicycle tour of the area, and danced Gangnam Style for me. At dinner time, the women fed me an enormous meal of fresh fish, spring rolls, Vietnamese pancakes, and fried spring rolls. While I was finishing my massive meal, the house next door began to play music and people started flooding into the area. And so it was that I ended up at a Vietnamese wedding in the Mekong Delta, alone in a sea of South Vietnamese. Men crowded around round tables eating rice soup and duck while passing around two shot glasses and tossing back rice wine one after another. On the patio just a few feet away, two mounted disco lights flashed, a fog machine sporadically blasted fog onto the guests, and a man thrusted his hips while dramatically singing a Vietnamese song that sounded the same to me as the one before it. If the song was popular, other men rushed the stage and danced haphazardly, throwing their bodies to and fro to no apparent rhythm. As the person sung, other guests plucked branches from the surrounding shrubs and presented them as gifts to the singer. They sometimes tucked money into the leaves, and other times tried to find the most ridiculous shrubbery to elicit laughs from the fellow onlookers. This continued for hours, starting again the next morning with even more food and more karaoke. Being part of this wedding ceremony was a once-in-a-lifetime experience, but even without it, the homestay would have been wonderful. The area is absolutely beautiful, the house is clean, and the family and neighbors are welcoming and helpful (to the extent that they can be due to language barriers). Don't miss out!

Title: Có thể là một 5 với tỷ lệ hợp lý!
Review: Chúng tôi ở lại hai đêm trong nhà trọ này. Chúng tôi đặt một bungalow được sạch sẽ, được trang bị máy lạnh và một phòng tắm bên ngoài đáng yêu. Giường thật khủng khiếp. Việc điều chỉnh nhiệt độ trong phòng hơi phức tạp: nó quá nóng để tắt máy lạnh nhưng không có chăn, nó quá lạnh trong phòng khi nó ở trên [ngay cả ở 30 ° C ++]. Vì vậy, chúng tôi ngủ với áo và vớ. . . Có rất nhiều muỗi trong khu vực, đó là loại phổ biến: được chuẩn bị để chiến đấu! Họ bị mắc kẹt qua quần áo và phun thuốc xịt muỗi. Phòng được trang bị màn chống muỗi, do đó quý khách sẽ có chút yên bình vào ban đêm. Bữa tối có giá 100, 000 đồng / người và được phục vụ sớm [6: 30 chiều]. Mỗi đêm thức ăn khác nhau, tuyệt vời và rất hào phóng: một khoảnh khắc tuyệt vời để chia sẻ với những người khác. Ăn sáng là tốt với bánh mì, mứt, chuối, trứng chiên và một thức uống. Khi chúng tôi đến bến phà, chúng tôi gặp người phụ nữ đã lái xe trực tiếp đến nhà dân bằng xe máy. Giá vé phà đã được trả cho cả hai chúng tôi để đi từ và đến. Nhiều đánh giá cao ! Chúng tôi đi tham quan bằng thuyền 200, 000 đồng / người. Chúng tôi rời đi lúc 6 giờ sáng và đã trở lại 6 giờ sau đó. Chuyến đi thuyền thật sự rất đẹp với cảnh quan tuyệt vời như vậy. Chúng tôi đã đi đến chợ nổi Cái Bè và thực hiện bốn điểm dừng thú vị. Ngay cả khi chúng tôi dành thời gian vui vẻ và chúng tôi yêu chuyến lưu diễn đó, nó hơi đắt đỏ so với giá trị và kinh nghiệm thực tế. Họ cung cấp xe đạp miễn phí cho phép chúng tôi khám phá khu phố. Họ không phải là rất tốt - duy trì nhưng là tốt cho một chuyến đi ngắn. Wifi rất nhanh. Chúng tôi yêu cầu thông tin để đi Cần Thơ, điểm đến tiếp theo của chúng tôi, và chủ tiệm đã cố gắng bán cho chúng tôi một vé từ Vĩnh Long đến Cần Thơ 110, 000 VND / người [dừng trực tiếp đến khách sạn tiếp theo]. Chúng tôi yêu cầu xe buýt địa phương nhưng cô ấy thực sự không muốn chỉ cho chúng tôi con đường đến đó. Chúng tôi quyết định đi một mình [trạm xe buýt chỉ cách bến phà vài mét] và trả 40.000 đồng cho mỗi người [giá du lịch, bởi vì người dân địa phương chỉ trả 21.000 cho mỗi người]. Tóm lại: nơi thực sự tốt đẹp nhưng hơi đắt đỏ và thiếu sự xác thực "cục bộ". Tuy nhiên, bạn quên những điểm xây dựng ngay sau khi bạn nhận được vào hamak!

Title: Un peu decevant...
Review: Encore une utilisation du caractere 'homestay" qui n'en est pas un. Cela a plus des airs d'hotel bien organise. Vous ne mangez pas avec la famille mais chacun a table et il n'y a aucun reel échange. Les espaces et chambres sont propres et le trajet jusqu'aux transports bien organises. Les deux soeurs sont des personnes gentilles et agréables. La nourriture est bonne mais le prix est assez eleve, 250 000 par personne par nuit, diner et petit-dejeuner, soit 500 000 en couple, si vous remettez le tout a d'autres experiences, vous aurez un logement et la nourriture de meilleure qualité pour ce prix. Le petit-dejeuner n'est quant a lui vraiment pas au top, surtout si vous prenez la balade en bateau (que je ne recommande pas, 200 000 est hors de prix pour ce que vous faites avec un conducteur qui ne peut egalement pas parler anglais et donc etre une voix d'échange avec les habitants du Delta non plus) vous auriez un bout de pain et une vache kiri...Donc je dis oui pour une nuit ou deux pour dépanner mais cote experience et charme je pense qu'on peut trouver mieux pour un sejour plus long. Tout depend ce que vous recherchez. Oui pour le logement, non pour l'experience homestay. Oui pour le dinner, non pour le petit-dejeuner. Oui sans budget, peut trouver mieux si plus petit budget. Pret des velos gratuit. Bon wifi.
